title: Excelente
text: Excelente ubicación, la habitación era muy espaciosa. El Personal muy amable resolviendo cualquier incidencia sobre la marcha. Las camas muy cómodas, tanto las almohadas como los colchones. El baño espacioso y proporcionan artículos de baño.

title: Bon hôtel
text:
+ Personnel accueillant et très aimable. Chambre spacieuse (King deluxe - 2 adultes et un ado) Les lits sont très confortable. Propreté nickel. Pt dèj inclus et correct (pour les USA;). Machine à café encore dispo en après-midi, top!
Excellente situation : 10 min à pied de Time Square et de la station de métro 42str qui mène partout.

- La chambre mériterait une petite rénovation (papier peint et vinyle se décollent).

title: Warm welcome, but unpleasant encounter
text:
I recently stayed at City Club Hotel, recommended by my good friend Stephen under a friends and family rate. The welcome I received was exceptional. 

However, my experience took a sharp downturn when I visited the breakfast room. I encountered Carol, whose behavior was nothing short of appalling. She was extremely rude not only to me but also to other guests, creating a hostile environment for everyone present.

Carol's demeanor made me feel unwelcome and uncomfortable. It seemed like every move I made was scrutinized and criticized, leaving me feeling like a child rather than a valued guest. Her comments and attitude were completely uncalled for and tarnished what could have been an otherwise enjoyable stay.

One incident that particularly stood out was when I inquired about the taste of the milk, to which Carol responded dismissively, suggesting I go elsewhere if I didn't like it. Additionally, her unnecessary remarks about how I handled food items only added to my dismay.

Such behavior is unacceptable in any hospitality setting and greatly detracted from my overall experience at City Club Hotel.  Despite the warm welcome from Manager Jennifer, the negative encounter with Carol left a lasting impression and significantly marred my stay.

I sincerely hope that the management of City Club Hotel takes steps to address issues of staff behavior and ensure that all guests are treated with the respect and courtesy they deserve.

title: Scammers
text: We stayed at the hotel for just one night and apart from the room not being in the best conditions we did not have many complaints. However, when we checked out they did not give the deposit back (initially they said it was $200 but they actually charged us nearly $400). I called them the next day to get the money back and they told me to wait for a week. A week later they do not answer the calls and I have yet to get my money back.

title: FAKE MIRROR
text:
MIRROR IS DOUBLE SIDED, anyone could be on the other side looking at your bed. 
I was just curious and checked it, it is fake! Please consider this!!!! Be careful and check it by yourself if you want to go after this information. 
Hotel is not so good Like in photos. Only god thing is Location.

title: Not a 4 star hotel!  Maybe 2…
text:
So where do I begin….thought I was booking a 4 star hotel, not even close.  Maybe 2 stars at best.
Walked in to check in, lady on phone with obviously the manager or owner for 15 mins while I stood there giving him all the info about the day.
Checked in, room ready on time.  Booked deliver king for 4 people.  Room soooo small and only sleeps 3.  Bed was so old and uncomfortable.  Bathroom entry was so tiny so if you are more then average size, you won’t clear the doorway.
So now we have 1 person who has no place to sleep, we all are in such close corners, and the bed was horrible.  I will say room was clean.  Older hotel so some marks on the walls and imperfections were acceptable.
No outlet in the bathroom for hair dryer to be used.  Mini bar hidden behind picture on the wall so that took some time to find.  Window in bathroom broken and didn’t shut all the way so let in lots of cold air.  No bathroom fan.  Staff was not friendly.  Asked Roberto at front desk for pillows.  He responded he would bring in 2 minutes, we never saw those pillows.  Our wonderful “view” from our room was a brick wall about 10 inches away from our window.
So the good, close to Times Square.  No bugs seen.  Looked clean.  Old carpet throughout rooms and elevators.  Shower was nice and big with good water pressure.  Basic breakfast but nice to have available.
Of course upon our checkout staff seemed caring and wanted a review left.
I would never go back.
Definitely not a room for families.  It was at best a clean place to stay for business for a night if you don’t mind an old crap bed and no where to plug anything in the bathroom.
This is far from a 4 star hotel.  Way overpriced for what we stayed in.  Usually stay at 4 star hotels and this was no where close.

title: TERRIBLE
text: We had several issues with the reservation. First the hotel charge the full amount of both rooms. When we arrive the front desk person ask for the security deposit, which for us was us 300, and for other customers was us 200, which felt a little discriminatory. Then instead of putting the hold he reversed all the charges and try to charge on the other card the rooms. Everyday we tried to fix the charges, and pay the amount that was supposedly were going to get back. The last night when we walked in to the  hotel they had blocked our rooms, even though we have been trying to resolve it every night, and also tried to charge the facility fee  that was included. We even had to call the police cause the person at the front desk wasn’t even listening and the manager didn’t want to talk to us. The police gave us the reason but we have to pay for the third time the amount of the reservation. And the front desk person took a picture of our card cause it was “obligatory” Up to today we still have not receive the amount back, and that has given us a lot of trouble for the whole vacation. We checked out from the hotel at 7:00 am and up to 4 in the afternoon they still are trying to charge something that is already paid in full. The treatment of the personnel from the hotel was very bad. On the other hand, the publicity of the hotel was not all the way accurate; the hotel was not clean, the curtains were dirty, the carpet was stained,  the elevator was dirty, and only one was working, the hotel smelled like marihuana a lot. It was very unfortunate experience in the city and the hotel terrible.

title: Don't Do It
text: Terrible experience. Common areas (hallways, elevators) were not very clean. On the last night of my stay I saw a roach crawl back into a gap in the tile of the shower when I turned the bathroom light on in the middle of the night. Less than an hour later water started coming in from the ceiling. I stood up to turn the lights on by the bed and the carpet was wet and additional roaches ran into the bathroom from the carpet. I immediately went downstairs to stand in the line of people affected to be told they would not rebook us anywhere else and there were no more rooms. After two hours of waiting a manager was finally available and said he would refund that night (as is appropriate). I am still waiting. They will not answer when I call.

title: Good Hotel, Great Location
text: The hotel is very good. The staff is friendly, and the location is beyond perfect. The room is spacious and very clean.  The washroom is clean and hygiene product provided. The hotel may need a little upkeep or paint job, but doesn't affect your stay at all.

title: My Birthday Trip. It Was Amazing 🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂🥰🥰🥰🎂🎂♓️♓️♓️♓️🥰🎂😘🩷❣️🩷🩷
text: The pillows and bed was great the room was clean like the shower 🚿 water A+ wish my shower water came out like that😂 at home over all it was okay. I will definitely go back NEW YORK WAS A VIBE WE REALLY DID ENJOY OURSELVES. Thanks City Club. I Came For My Birthday 🎂

title: You can do better
text: Great location. Good property. Common area needs work. Staff unfriendly. Room was comfortable and very large - rented the “duplex” room which had lots of light and space. Fitness center was closed. Breakfast is very limited. I would Stay at the Iroquois next door instead.

title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
text: Horrible experience! I made my reservation through booking.com. When I got there and checked in I realized they gave me a lower segment room than I paid. I paid for a city view and 2 big beds, however, they gave me no view no WINDOW and one small bed and one sofa. When I got back and told that the situation the front desk “Jilal” acted meanly and stated since I made my reservation through booking.com they couldn't give me a better room and it is NOT THEIR PROBLEM. THEY ONLY HAVE THIS ROOM. if i have problem i should call booking.com not talk with him. It was so mean, definitely not helpful and weird situation and staff. Overall, very bad accommodation. if you make your reservation through 3rd party they give you the worst room then never change or refund. Also 3rd party doesnt refund or help. If i could give 0 stars i would.

title: Well experience in City Club Hotel
text:
The staff Jay is super nice. He freely upgraded us to a bigger room. The room is clean and the bed is comfortable. The light is enough and no smoke smell.

Also, Breakfast is included. The hotel quite near the Times Square. We will come again next time.

title: Don't fall for this.
text: If the hotel advertised itself as a discount hotel,  I would understand the stained and dirty rugs, the crumbling and uneven cheap linoleum floor in the bathroom,  the yellowed and peeling wallpaper.  But it is as expensive as much better hotels, literally next door.  Worse, the staff were rude and unhelpful when I heard other guests complaining and demanding a refund.

title: Wonderful value-priced hotel in the center of Manhattan.
text:
I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel on W 44th St and the City Club looked like it would work for me. It's really great, especially for a solo traveler. Clean, nice rooms, a common area where you can use a computer or get a snack, nice front desk staff members who were polite and efficient. 
While the room had everything I desired (nice TV, hot powerful shower, enough cabinets to stay organized) it was pretty darned small. Basically enough room to maneuver around the twin-bed, and not much more. But, based on how much time i spent in the room, that wasn't an issue. It might have been if I had my wife along with me. 
Two minor issues: the bed is pretty short (not a queen or king) and it "sheeted" so that it's hard to get all the way under the covers. Trust me. I had to sleep diagonally, and it was not great. Second, the breakfast is pretty minimal. Def a "continental" breakfast, but adequate. I think they could be a little more creative.
I would absolutely stay there again.

title: First visit and very comfortable
text:
The next time I go I'll be bringing my girlfriend. This was a business trip, so I was solo.
She was jealous when I showed her photos of the room and it's amenities.
The hotel was very close wo there we had our meeting  2 doors down.
It was perfect for me.

title: Worst stay ever not clean…
text:
Your website shows pictures of your hotel that look Nothing like your website.. THIS HOLTE NEEDS HELP
Conditions are Not fit for even 1 day.  This has been the worst experience ever in my years of travel. Please clean this place up………..would never stay in this hotel again.

title: Location Location Location
text: City Club Hotel was absolutely perfect. Just steps from Grand Central Station Times Square and Bryant Park!!  The Hotel was clean quiet and comfortable. The staff super friendly. I booked it last minute and was so happy with the price!!  Breakfast included

title: Great Manhattan hotel at a great price
text: Great little hotel in the heart of Manhattan! Clean rooms and priced right. We loved the Continental breakfast. The front desk staff was so friendly and very helpful!! It's centrally located near grand central, times square and the theater district.

title: Water bug in my room Tom to the rescue 🛟
text:
Im a reporter with the German daily News I would like to know why a old fashion hotel has these types of issues 😕😔 with the amount of guess in and out of it they gave me a really tacky room toilet 🚽🪠 was screwed up from the gate big hole 🕳️ in the bathroom 😭 omg too many issues with this location I really like the place but after this not to much usually when I go to a hotel I'm not supposed to be a plumber. I'm not supposed to be an exterminator. I'm not supposed to be electrician either. There I go being all three of them
Mack11media on IG has the full video of you want to see the water Bug it was bigger than a 50 cent piece

title: Last minute getaway
text: We had a fabulous stay at City Club Hotel. The room was clean comfortable and spacious. Perfect for our last  minute getaway.  The staff, Jay and Hawa, were helpful and welcoming and the continental breakfast was better than anticipated. We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Perfect location, clean & charming rooms
text: I have stayed here a few times, haven’t ever been disappointed. Perfect location, clean, friendly staff. Rooms are charming with good mini bar selections, cool bathrooms. Always enjoy my stay. I have and expect to continue recommending this hotel as a great place to stay.

title: Decepção
text:
Não fiquem nesse hotel … reservei um quarto com cama maior e com vista para a avenida , me deram um quarto com vista para os fundos ( só se via caos) indaguei o porque, a funcionária alterada, falando alto… disse que se quisesse eu ficaria naquele quarto pq o hotel estava lotado e que não me devolveria o dinheiro a mais pago por um quarto com vista para a avenida e cama maior… disse que eu estava em N.Y e estava pagando pouco( o que não condiz com a verdade)
Não tem uma pessoa para apresentar o quarto… frigobar, armário , embutidos na parede , se vc descobre ok … se não sai de lá se sentindo mais lesado ainda.
Funcionários mau humorados e sem tino com trato com o público . Foi absurdo o que passei. Contatei a Booking.com que me disse que são somente uma plataforma de venda e que não podiam obrigar o hotel me pagar a diferença do quarto que contratei para o quarto que fiquei. Banheiro sem porta( pasmem) e com vazamento por todo lado.

title: NEVER AGAIN! But if crusty is what you’re into…
text:
I booked this hotel because I had a cruise planned the next day, departing from the port of Brooklyn.
It’s right next door to Sofitel so I thought, might not be the same standards but I was sure it would be similar.
Boy was I in for the biggest disappointment. 
I didn’t even take pictures of the room, just the bathroom. I didn’t even want to put my bags on the floor. 
There was a day bed that looked oily and dirty. The internet wasn’t connecting half the time. 
I didn’t touch their mini fridge but looks like I’m going to have to dispute that  charge I saw on my credit card.
The only thing I’ll give thumbs up to is the hot water in the shower. Mind you it was winter time and there was a cold breeze coming from the window in the bathroom.
I was on the 6th floor, it really looks like an apartment building rather than a hotel.
I would never recommend this place to anyone.

title: Meh
text:
Aside from the convenient location, this place is at best a 1 star hotel. Dirty, the entire building smells of must and cigarette smoke, rude employees and so on.
This hotel is not chic boutique hotel w/midcentury decor as described. It’s is run down and dingy w/decor that hasn’t seen an update since the late 80s/early 90s at best.
Also, the elevator feels like a death trap.
If we hadn’t arrived late and planning to stay more than one night, we would have canceled as soon as we walked into the “lobby”

title: theft
text: Don’t book with them they don’t give back the 300 dollars hold and also charge fees that you already paid. The people are also very rude. Very old rooms the elevator takes about 10 minutes to get to the first floor and also you will need to go to the front desk every day because your keycard will simply stop work.

title: Perfect location and friendly staff
text: Nice hotel. The staff is very accommodating and the free luggage storage was wonderful!!! Complimentary breakfast was nice. Bagels, waffles, yogurt, muffins. We are not big breakfast eaters so we thought this was perfect for us. Hotel was clean, warm and located centrally to everywhere we planned to visit. Rockefeller Center, Times SQ. Radio City, Bryant Park. Only suggestion is the mattress was horrible and really needs replaced. After walking miles all day, a saggy, broken down mattress made for a bad night's sleep. Would stay here again!

title: Lovely staff
text: Vitoria was so helpful and patient and kind at the front desk! And the cleaning people were always so kind and accommodating! They even helped me into my room after I forgot my key. 10/10 would come again.

title: Terrible Service
text: Overall, I would not recommend this hotel.  The rooms are old and need refreshing.  Even more problematic, when I had a question about changing my booking the manager, Tom, was extremely rude and impatient.  At one point, Tom, even though I had additional questions, refused to speak to me.  When I called Expedia for help they told me that only the hotel could help me and that the manager had refused to speak with them as well. When I wrote an email to the GM, Steve, to discuss this issue, my email was ignored. Having to deal with these issues took away time from my vacation and created unnecessary stress.

title: Double charge
text:
Im still waiting for a refund since they’ve charged the room 2 times! 
15 days have passed and they dont answers our emails.
The amount for 3 days was about 2500 dollars and they are ignoring us, hope theyre having a nice Christmas with our money but i expect them to refund us after they’ve had their fun

title: Cosmo King!
text: Second time staying here. No surprises except for the fact that we had requested a no smoking room (do they even have "smoking" rooms anymore?). well clearly the prior guest was a big smoker. Very unpleasant. But toughed it out. They should charge the full $200 for "incidentals" to any guest that smokes in their room. and Alert them to that policy up front.

title: Clean, comfortable, great location
text: I would stay again. While some decor, like the wallpaper, is dated, the overall cleanliness and comfort, with the location and rates, was perfect for us. The rooms are small as stated. The free breakfast offered lots of selection. We arrived early and were able to store our bags. Early check in was not available because the hotel was full when we arrived. We were offered check in about 3 hours earlier than normal. Service was great! No frills, no complaints.

title: Not Luxe
text: I booked a Queen Luxe and it was not very luxe nor did the bed seem Queen size - more a full, for the price expected a bit larger. The bathroom caused the room to get hot and we the A/C did not work so we were hot in our room. Finally, the outlets were all loose so our charges struggled to hang in - one under the desk was okay.  The staff was nice and accommodating that was good.

title: Terrible? No Stay again? No
text:
Bad new first. I arrived at 2:00 room not ready dropped off my bag and went shopping. Came back at 5:00 room still not ready. (something about an inspection) The receptionist made a call to housekeeping an mentioned rooms 901 and 902. A few min later she gave us a key for room 604... We went up to 604 and walked in on a couple mid clothing change who told us they checked in an hour ago.  Back downstairs we went only to be eventually given a key to 902 and a promise for a discount (which we never received and i forgot to push for)  902 is a tiny box, we only had carry on size bags. We used the ironing board but then couldn't get the closet door closed when trying to put it back and the light remained on. The closet even so tiny my pants puddled on the refrigerator. Where is the TV?  Oh its behind the floor to ceiling painting which when opened prevents any movement around the room. 
On two separate occasions we returned to find our door ajar once ok maybe our fault but the second time we noticed a cookie with a "turndown service" note on the bed...Nothing was missing but someone had been in our room despite requesting we not have any housekeeping. 
Complimentary breakfast was as basic as it gets but it was free.
Ok now the good!  
Location, location, location! Prime for theatre. Macy's 8 blocks one way, Saks and Rockefeller 4 blocks the other way.
Staff friendly and super helpful.  They recommended and were able to get us reservations at Kellari's a restaurant just a few steps down the street which I highly recommend. The bellman called us a taxi to LaGuardia which ended up being less expensive than the Uber we took on the way in. 
If you want a good location and friendly/helpful staff  but are willing to sacrifice space, privacy and security this is your place.

title: Horrendous Thxgiving stay
text:
The pictures were ten times better than what it actually was. The two queen bedroom with a giant tub looked great except when I arrived i realized the floor underneath the toilet was sinking, and the room was really really outdated. Don’t ve fooled by the pictures!! 

I needed to head out for an appointment and returned to my room. Not only did the entire 8th floor smell like a man who really needed a shower, my room seriously smelt worse. I was suspicious whether someone exhausted actually caught a nap on a bed since there were marks of someone who could’ve laid there and the odor was just horrible. It was past 9:30PM but I packed up and left the hotel at 10PM since I couldn’t handle the smell. The lobby staff did nothing for me. I left a voicemail the next day and got nothing. A waste of several hundred dollars and a real exhausting journey home waiting for transportation in disbelief. 

Do NOT stay at this hotel if you want a decent stay in the city. I would have liked to walked a few blocks on Thxgiving day to see loved ones but was super exhausted and disgusted on Thxgiving eve. Never again!

title: Pessimo hotel, nao se hospedem, nao vale a pena o valor.
text: Um dos piores hoteis de Manhattan, pessimo servico ao cliente, pessoas extremamente rudes, principalmente o rapaz que guarda as malas no storage, fizemos a reserva pelo booking e o hotel nos cobrou 200 dolares a mais, ate hoje nao nos devolveram este valor. O quarto fede mofo, mobilia velha dos anos 60 podre, parece um motel abandonado, as fotos no site sao ilusoes de otica, nao vale a pena o valor para ficar nessa espelunca. A unica coisa que presta e a localizacao, mas mesmo assim e melhor ficar um pouco mais afastado e bem confortavel.

title: Clean, quick and comfortable
text:
Very clean and comfortable.  Easy quick check in /
Check out.   Many amenities in the neighborhood too.  Small TV but adequate.  Great water pressure!  Old city charm.   Breakfast was as expected for a “light” continental breakfast.  I would stay here again.

title: Felt I paid more than worth
text: They forced us to pay 200 usd and asking to keep my card details however I denied that request . But has to pay 200 usd which is security fee however which the rule ia but same for every guest they discriminate. They also mention the booking is not thru Agoda it’s thru Expedia . That’s means Agoda did the booking thru Expedia . From the 200 usd they deducted 28 usd and send me money after three day . The breakfast is terrible they is nothing only dry and cold components. The staff is unwelcoming .

title: Didn't feel safe.
text: I travel to the city often and this is the first hotel that I actually didn't feel safe at. The hotel let people into my room. Those people went through my things, so they knew the room was occupied, and I got the distinct feeling that staff was involved with whatever was going on as they didn't seem to think this situation was cause for concern. All in all it felt very sketchy. Just for safety sake, I would choose another hotel.

title: Favorite hotel!
text:
My friend and I stay here all the time! The room are very clean, the rooms have very comfortable beds and the staff are the best and most attentive! The balcony rooms are my favorite- Can’t wait to stay again!
Nicole S

title: Great hotel with a model staff in an excellent location but a few disappointments
text:
First and foremost, I chose this hotel, because of the lobby presence of the db restaurant, which, upon arrival, hotel staff notified me had been closed for years.  The big problem is this:  Even my extremely recent e-mail confirmation included gushing about the restaurant that doesn't even exist.  This is false advertising of the highest sort.  [There is now no restaurant, but countless delivery options exist.]
My second reason for choosing this was the location.  I always stay across the street at the Royalton (who can get lost finding it with an address of 44 W. 44th?), but I decided to try something different.  55 W. 44th is just as easy to remember, and the location is the exact same when it comes to proximity to Broadway's theatres and restaurants.  I'd rather Times Square not be quite so close, but oh, well.
As for my specific experience, it was, overall, Very Good.
I had taken my mother on the QM2 for two weeks for her birthday, and I decided to add some NYC Magic at the end.  This means that--because passengers disembark early in the morning--the hotel was not ready for us, just as almost any hotel would be.  It proved tedious to wait around all day (my mother has mobility issues), but there is a great diner next door that shouldn't be missed.
The staff was uniformly fantastic from desk to bellman to housekeeping.  In retrospect, the rate for the first two nights--albeit Friday and Saturday but booked far in advance with a non-refundable rate.  We received a great rate when I added a third night, so that was handy.
The room is not too small and very nice--the bed and the daybed both proved comfortable enough, which is particularly important to my arthritic mother.  She praised her rest.  Tip--the closet and minibar are behind hidden doors, so it took a while to find them.  BOTTOM LINE:  This hotel does not have the advertised club-like feel, despite its location amongst some of NYC's most exclusive private clubs, but it is very nice with a great staff and an excellent location.  The hotel is surprisingly quiet, too.  My only caution would be to confirm that the price is truly competitive prior to booking.

title: Not sure how this is a four star hotel
text: I am not sure how this is a 4 star hotel.  It's more like a bad 3 star hotel. Everything in the hotel is worn down and poorly cared for.  That includes the rooms, which may once have been nice, but certainly are not any more.  The mattress was hard, but also slouched in the middle.  (I feel lucky my back didn't end up hurt!) The carpets are so old, that I felt a bit icky walking on them.  The bathroom has a weird mix of linoleum floors, cheap plastic curtains for the shower, and some marble.

title: Enjoyed my stay
text: The hotel staff were very friendly, the room was spacious and clean. There wasn't much to the room (no microwave, coffee, etc) but if you are looking to just stay the night and not hang out in your hotel room, it was a great location and reasonably priced.

title: Great location, underwhelming room
text:
What I liked: The location was great (Theatre district). The staff were friendly. The continental breakfast was as expected. 
What I didn't like: I booked a luxury queen bed suite. What I got was a dated full-bed suite with a very worn mattress. The staff told me the full bed was their definition of a queen bed (unfortunately, they do not advertise based on the industry standard). I'm a tall person so I didn't like this, but there were no other rooms available. With a lumpy worn mattress, it was an uncomfortable sleep with lots of tossing and turning.

title: Cleanliness was very poor, food safety issue
text: Was served a mini muffin with mold on it at the continental breakfast. In addition, the vent / grate above the toilet in the bathroom appeared to be covered in mold as well. I’m asthmatic all this is a health concern.

title: Gedateerd hotel op 5 min. lopen van Times Square
text: We hadden een kamer voor 5, met 2 2-persoons bedden en een slaapbank. Kamer was groot genoeg, maar het hotel was wel aardig gedateerd. De foto’s van de site komen geheel niet overeen met de werkelijkheid. We hebben hier in totaal 4 nachten verbleven. Het ontbijt is simpel maar goed, ook hier zijn de meubels gedateerd en versleten. Als je de hele dag op pad bent en er alleen bent om te slapen is het goed.

title: Cozy Hotel in a great location
text:
It would have been better if there was a gym on the premises, but there is a access to the local Blink gym.  Also, hallways were a little dark, and the place is in need of an update - but so is just about every building in NYC.

On the plus side, rooms were bright and tidy, staff was helpful and attentive, the included breakfast and cookie with the turndown service was a nice touch.

I wouldn't mind staying here again if the opportunity arose.

title: Felt so uncomfortable, I had to leave immediately.
text: I had the worst experience ever at this hotel. I came in on a late flight and was only staying for a layover for 5 hrs but it was so dirty I left immediately after seeing the room. I am generally pretty easy to please, but the pillows were stained, the floors weren’t clean, the chair in the room stained, the wallpaper stripping, everything was old and outdated. I was extremely disappointed as I the pictures online did not reflect what I saw in the room. I left right after check in and booked another hotel down the street as I didn’t feel comfortable laying my head in that dirty bed. I was so appalled I left before taking pictures of it and I wish I did. I am requesting a full refund as I did not stay due to the horrible conditions. I don’t know if I just got the worse room in the hotel or people are not being honest in their reviews, but this was the worst experience I’ve ever had.

title: A Horrible Experience at the City Club Hotel (please read)
text: I reserved a hotel room for a business trip on 10/11/23-10/12/23.  When we arrived, we were given a spiel that it is a historical hotel and older hotel, and it may not be what expecting.  That was an understatement!  The room had a distinct odor, the air was blowing at 62 degrees, the couch had visible stains that looked like human fluids.  We tried to turn off the air conditioning and switched it to heat.  We figured that it would switch over after some time.  Since we arrived after 6:00pm, we went to dinner (over 1 1/2 hours).  We arrived back at our room, the air conditioning was still at 62 degrees.  We contacted the front desk, and the bellboy came up with two old, smelly blankets.  The bellboy eventually fixed the heat, but we were too traumatized by the room to stay.  I immediately called Booking.com to complain and ask for another hotel, and I was told that I had to ask for the refund at the front desk.  I went to the front desk and was told that since it had been some time since we arrived, it would be difficult to provide a refund (we went to dinner and had only been in the room a total of 15 minutes).  As I was at the front desk, another guest arrived, and I noticed the receptionist gave the same spiel to her about the hotel being "historical".  I eventually found another hotel, and City Club Hotel refuses to refund our money.  I strongly urge anyone to avoid this hotel entirely!

title: Cozy place with a room that fits 5! AMAZING 😊
text:
Quick city stay, 5 adults (2 couples, 1 teen)
Location:  Close to Time Square and has a parking right in front of it super convenient to leave our vehicle. 
Amenities: Working WiFi, breakfast included. We loved Clara who kept everything extra clean and was very helpful during the breakfast time. We were able to store our luggage after check out which gave us extra time to walk around the city. 
Room: SUPER CLEAN! It was small but comftable  for 5. It had 2 full beds and a twin bed  by the window.  When wooden shades were closed the room was sound proof which was nice to sleep. It has a safe a mini bar packed with drinks and snacks if you are willing to spend a bit.

title: Nice hotel in the heart of manhattan
text: Very conveniently located. Bed was a little too firm for my liking. Breakfast consisted of a few breads and cereal choices and a few yogurts. The bathroom is great. Even has a bidet. Room is well lit, too.

title: Very Serviceable Pied a Terre
text:
We (a couple of sisters+husband/brotherinlaw) stayed just one night in a king+daybed room.  We were attracted to this hotel because of its proximity to the Harvard Club and this unique room configuration option.

The hotel itself is tiny but makes effective use of space.   No place to sit in the lobby but the second floor landing looks down over the lobby and has plenty of seating and tables (though the lighting was a bit lower than it could have been).  Signage could be added stating availability of second floor lounge.  The elevator is classically slow for an old building but gets you where you need to go - be sure to build in a few extra minutes.  

Minibar AND fridge were both subtly located behind a painting and impressively stocked with good snacks and good quality wine (red, white and champagne).   A cursory glance didn't yield a price list but I am certain one could be obtained in short order.  The front desk/bell staff were very friendly and helpful (and in the later hours, a shade quirky, though not prohibitively so).   We called down twice from the room for extra towels and another blanket, both of which we received within moments and neither of which it turned out we really needed.

The daybed itself was comfortable enough, and unexpectedly warm for the seemingly limited setup of just a fuzzy blanket and a bottom sheet.   It was not *not* an upholstery cushion, which is more intended for sitting for brief periods than it is for long hours of sleep.  It would be an impressive upgrade to swap out the foam padding for memory foam or other mattress-like material.  

Only bit which caused a raised eyebrow was the state of the bathroom floor - the tiles were lifted in several places and the floor around the toilet was noticeably spongey.   Admittedly I neglected to mention its condition to the staff.  Management, if you see this, our room number was 206.  

Our gratitude for the very serviceable accommodations!

title: Great hotel
text: Best bed ever ,   very comfortable. Easy check in as well helpful staff members & I believe they upgraded me from a full to a queen bed very comfortable would recommend 10/10 ……………….they also have a sitting area

title: Great getaway
text: A great hotel, perfect location, close to Times Square and all restaurants and shops. Front desk was very helpfully. Thank you so much to George, Hawa and Kerschel for making my stay so pleasant. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Would go back with a group
text: Perfect location for Broadway plays, Times Square and shopping ! Rooms are huge and lovely bathrooms ! Even a side bed in the end rooms. We loved having queen rooms with extra private door at end of hall. Old wallpaper and room design but we enjoyed it. My room was a bit musty but fine for two nights of sleeping a nice bed. Very very quiet … great heavy walls and windows ! Minimum channels but that’s fine. Breakfast included with fancy coffee machine

title: Perfect Location!
text: Perfect location! The beds and pillows were very comfortable and although the room was small for 5 it was perfect for sleeping. The bathroom was roomy. The only thing that was missing was a coffee maker or kettle with some tea. The grab and go offered was great for a quick coffee and bite as you venture out in the big apple. Highly recommend!

title: Swptember in New York
text: Ottima posizione, personale veramente gentile. Ok la pulizia. Unica nota, non invalidante, la camera per quattro persone poteva essere più spaziosa (3 posti letto). Rapporto qualità/prezo adeguato. Tornerò presto e spero anche in futuro.

title: Good location but in need of major renovations
text: This hotel is in a good location near 5th Avenue and Times Square, however it’s in need of a major renovation. The rooms look very old and beat up, bathroom vinyl floors are peeling everywhere and shower tiles are separating, carpet is old and dirty, beds and pillows are not comfortable. I paid $591 per night after the special 20% promo they had and before all the fees, definitely not worth it. Staff is friendly for the most part…

title: 100/10 recommend
text: Such a great hotel! George and hawa and joe are amazing! We will 100% be coming back! So close to Times Square and food and coffee. The bed was very comfortable and the room got really cold just how I wanted !

title: Une expérience inoubliable à New York
text:
J'ai passé juste 2 jours et demi à New-York et j'ai choisis cet hôtel le "City Club Hôtel" par rapport à sa proximité avec Times Square mais aussi des fameux attractions de New York tels que le Summit, Empire State Building etc... Le personnel qui a fait mon check-in était très avenant et m'a vraiment aider sur tout le plan touristique et des visites à faire absolument à Manhattan, spéciale mention à George qui a pris du temps pour m'aider à booker les attractions souhaitées et qui à été très chaleureux dès le début avec moi. L'hôtel reste quand même assez vieux mais les chambres étaient propres.
A ma plus grande surprise, lors du check out, j'ai reçu la note déjà réglé. J'ai été débité sur ma carte de crédit la totalité du montant du séjour avec taxe incluse sans avoir donné mon consentement, hors de base je voulais payer par en cash au moment du check out .

title: Perfect
text:
The location is fabulous!
I am a senior citizen and solo traveler coming to NY to see shows and go to restaurants. Everything was within 2 blocks. All the employees were very helpful. The room was clean and perfect for my needs. I look forward to returning.

title: Excellent stay
text: My family loves this hotel. The room was clean and spacious with all amenities you could ask for. Customer service was excellent, everyone was super nice and friendly. Better than Four Points by Sheraton in my opinion.

title: A good hotel with minor hiccups
text: The City Club Hotel is in a great location off 6th and 44th streets. The hotel also has a parking garage across the street and it’s surrounded by restaurants and shops. Brunch at Red Fire was delicious! The antique store across from the hotel is beautiful and full of treasure! We traveled with 5 adults and one child. We rented adjoining rooms 507 & 508. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and accommodating. The only problem we experienced was the room keys to our hotel rooms and the hallway entrance to our rooms required recalibrating every time we returned to the hotel, which felt infuriating to get to the rooms, while juggling shopping bags only to find the keys weren’t working properly. After experiencing the hotel key problems I communicated our frustration with the front desk attendant and we received apologies but the problem continued throughout our entire stay at the City Club Hotel.

title: NYC family visit
text: Stayed here with family of 5 (3 children 9, 12 & 14 yo) for 3 nights en-route home from a vacation. Found this to be a fantastic little place to stay in a great location.  Tidy, clean room with great daily cleaning service. Rooms spotless on arrival after a day out. Friendly and helpful staff and check-in/out. Able to leave bags on last day prior to travel to airport.  Good breakfast and enjoyable stay. Nearby gym access included if required. Would aim to stay here again on a return trip.

title: BEWARE!!!
text: Stayed here for a friends birthday. They were very accommodating and staff was relatively friendly. Room was upgraded to a connecting 2 bedroom which I assume was because they didn’t have ours available. Much appreciated since there were 5 of us. The location was close to everything as well. The only issue we had was that no one reached out to us in regard to my friend having bites that could have possibly been from bed bugs. Was told we would receive a refund of the resort fees (no idea how much the resort fees are) have yet to see a refund or a call back after multiple attempts. Also had blood stains on the sheets and what looked like possible bed bug shellings. Will probably be staying somewhere else next visit and wish I had read reviews prior.

title: Great hotel especially a great Concierge!
text: Travelocity made us loose the reservation.   The Concierges Hawa and especially George really accommodated my family of five. They got us in rooms. They were amazing! They arranged car service to the airport and arranged dinner reservations! Great people! Don’t book third party!

title: Not worth
text: No wardrobe, no tv, no coffee machine, breakfast was too basic, no egg station, very basic hotel in NYC. All of the above were still ok and acceptable but the worst thing was they charged luggage storage fee without informing me, at least when i kept my luggage they should have informed there will be a charge, and how much was the fee. But no, they didn’t inform me, i didnt agree to pay, they didnt give me an invoice or receipt, the charges just appeared in my credit card when i received my credit card statement. Very unprofessional. Will not go back. Too expensive for such basic hotel with unprofessional staff.

title: fantastic small hotel
text: This is an elegant gem right on 44th st - near Times Square and Bryant Park.  The room is superb- marble bathroom!  Very comfortable as well as convenient and breakfast to boot!  The staff is most helpful

title: Avoid. Pictures nice - reality terrible.
text:
Absolutely not what the pictures show. The room was in terrible condition. Damp, dirty, walls and ceiling coming down/peeling. Carpet was disgusting. At 6ft 2in I couldn’t lay in the bed straight. The beds are far too small.
The fridge was dirty, shower dirty.
The elevator stank of urine.

title: Nice quiet oasis in the heart of mid-town
text: The room was well-appointed and quite comfortable and the service was welcoming and attentive.  Nice and quiet.  The mid-town location was perfect.  The only big negative was the morning’s “Grab and Go” breakfast which was awful (they probably shouldn’t offer it at all).

title: Two-way mirrors throughout hotel
text: We discovered a 2-way mirror in our room, rm 507.  By holding our phone cameras and flashlights directly on the mirror, we saw a small unfinished room beyond.  The room had wires fastened to the walls, but we did not see a camera, but we couldn't see the entire space.  I reported it to the day, night, and general managers.  All were aware of the 2-way mirrors, told me they are in more than one room.  They told me it's just a bad patch job and that they're fixing them one at a time.  All it would take to fix the problem is to paint over the mirrors until a contractor can be arranged.  I've notified The NY State Dept of Consumer Affairs in hopes of getting the problem resolved.

title: Da evitare
text:
Albergo molto vecchio e molto sporco. 
Colazione inesistente, ci hanno dato da mangiare soltanto delle merendine confezionate.
Personale cordiale ma distaccato, menzione particolare per George, portiere molto simpatico e sempre disponibile.
L'unica nota positiva è la posizione, centrale e molto vicina a Time Square.

title: Great hotel
text: The staff was really beyond nice and helpful with recommendations as well as help with your stay and the bed is real comfortable and the showers are amazing !!    They have breakfast as well and so many places near by would stay again for sure

title: Business Drop-in Gets Fantastic Treatment
text: Have been going to this hotel for some time, as it is very close to my office.    Yesterday was a day when NY hotel prices soared.  Because I was going to a conference in the evening, I just dropped in to ask if a room was available .   I had no reservation.   I was greeted warmly by George and Shafin, who know me.   I was told that one of my favorite rooms was available (the one with the spiral staircase - in the picture), and I was given a surprisingly low price.    Rooms here are always clean and have what you need as a business traveler.   5 stars for these folks.

title: A bit disappointed
text: The room was basic and a lot smaller than expected. It accommodated a double bed with only a small space around it within which to move. The room was clean but not very modern, and the bathroom floor tiles were loose and lifting. It served only as place to sleep for the night, so was probably ok for that purpose.

title: Not recommend
text:
No window or view, very outdated and rough.  Not as described or pictured.  Beds horrible and mattresess had dips and springs poking your back.  
The good able to book last minute and very close to Times Square.
Get an uber not a taxi from this Hotel or you'll be robbed.

title: Worst experience- I was asked to look for another hotel in the area at 2am
text:
This was my worst experience in my life. I made booking using hotel's website and paid through it. I reached hotel around 2am in the night tired and I was told that I don't have a booking. For some reason, booking didn't go through in hotel's system properly. Interesting things is that I was never informed, I only got one confirmation email so I assumed everything is good. 
How is this possible? I avoided third party sites and booked directly from hotel website, so no other third party can be blaimed for this.

I was asked to look for another hotel in the area at 2am

title: Overbooked and sold my room to someone else
text: I was in NYC on business and booked a room about two weeks in advance to stay 3 nights. I showed up around 11pm to find out they had no rooms available. No notice they were cancelling my reservation and did absolutely nothing for me except suggesting “use the hotel tonight app” to find somewhere else to stay. Have never had this happen before and would never book a room here.

title: Cleanliness and George!
text:
Overall the room was clean, but a little small. No closet to hang up any clothes in and slightly dated. The temperature was perfect and A/C was kicking at all times!! However, room aside, George is the stand out of this property. Very accommodating and knowledgeable. He booked us a reservation for a fantastic steak house in minutes. He also offered to book anything else we needed and even drew us a diagram on how to get where we were going! Such a sweet person and really just wants to give you the best stay possible. I would recommend this property to others because of the cleanliness but also because of George!
He really went above and beyond!!

title: Broadway a due passi
text: Albergo centrale. Comodissimo per i teatri di Broadway raggiungibile a piedi. Ottima la posizione per la visita notturna all’osservatorio del grattacielo Vanderbildt. Viste imperdibili di New York. Imperdibili i consigli del concierge George, molto disponibile e gentilissimo.

title: Un faux 4 étoiles
text: J'ai séjourné deux fois dans cet hôtel le même mois. J'ai lu dans les commentaires qu'un client les traitait de voleurs car sa carte bancaire avait été débitée arbitrairement : il m'est arrivé exactement la même mésaventure : deux retraits CB supplémentaires à mon insu pour un montant global de 150 USD, bien entendu sans me prévenir et sans m'en informer, je les ai découverts en consultant mon relevé bancaire à mon retour chez moi. Aucune explication de l'hôtel à ces prélèvements, malgré plusieurs demandes, car cet hôtel ne répond pas aux e-mails de ses clients. C'est du mépris, car une fois parti vous n'avez plus aucun recours. Lors de mon deuxième séjour le dénommé Georges nous a laissés attendre, moi et ma famille, debout devant la réception pendant 50 minutes, sans nous adresser un mot, car il était au téléphone. Je n'ai jamais vu cela de ma vie, même dans les hôtels les plus basiques, alors que le City Club se prétend être un 4 étoiles. Par contre ils prendront le temps de vous "conseiller" des restaurants pour toucher leur commission. Le point fort de cet hôtel est sa situation proche de Times Square, mais avec un peu de recul ce choix n'est pas le meilleur: vous payerez très cher une chambre pour vous rendre à Times Square à pied, mais pour les autres destinations vous prendrez les transports en commun. Près de Times Square tout est très cher, les restaurants, les boutiques, il y a surtout des pièges à touristes. Mieux vaut donc faire l'inverse : réserver un hôtel dans Soho ou Noho par exemple, plus au sud de Manhattan, mais qui sera proche des outlets et des commerces, ce qui vous permettra de trouver des boutiques et des restaurants abordables à pied. Vous irez à Times Square en bus ou en métro. C'est ce que je ferai la prochaine fois que je séjournerai à New York. Mais certainement jamais plus au City Club Hôtel.

title: VERY WELCOMING, GREAT STAY!
text: The staff is what made my stay amazing! Shayshun the receptionist was so nice and helpful. She recommended great attractions & travel directions during our stay which made our trip very exciting. I was very frantic because we needed to print up tickets for a show and she offered to print them at the front desk. During check-out we were able to leave our luggage for a few ours before the flight and she scheduled us a Taxi to JFK. We loved our room and will definitely return to City Club. Thanks so much Shayshun!😊

title: Bad day turned to Sunshine
text: Boutique hotel with a great staff!! George upgraded our room and set up reservation at Chaz Palmenteri restaurant!! The best food and best stay I have had in New York!! Thanks for turning my cancelled flight into the best stay in New York!! The clouds went away and the sun came out and life was good again. George has the biggest heart and is an asset to City Club Hotel. This hotel really cares about you and making you happy!! THANK YOU FOR MAKING NEW YORK GREAT!!😊

title: !!! DES VOLEURS!!! ATTENTION
text: Tout simplement des Voleurs.Je me suis rendu le 19 Avril 2023 dans cette hôtel avec une chambre pour une nuit réservé avec Agoda et payer à Agoda.En arrivent à l’hôtel cet voleurs mon soit disant bloqué 100 dollars pour la Caution,mais en contrôlant ma visa ils m’on bloqué 2 fois 100 dollars et encore 3.45 Dollars.Je me suis com même rendu tout de suite à la réception et ils m’on dit de ne pas m’inquiéter parce c’était des Caution.Trois jours plus tard je contrôle mas visa et là je vois que hôtel à transformer une caution de 100 dollars en 28 dollars qui ont était débité ansi que les 103 dollars.(La chambre 509 avec la réserve 362996523 était déjà payé avec les taxes avant d’arrivé à l’hôtel).J’ai envoyer deux mails pour expliquer mon cas et jusque-là j’ai reçu aucune réponse,Au final pour une chambre à 145 dollars,j’ai payer 280 dollars,ces gens n’ont aucun scrupule à vous volé de l’Argent,passe votre chemin,et pour les prix que j’ai payer à ces voleurs à New York vous pouvez avoir une meilleure hotel.

title: Dreadful experience
text: Dreadful experience, double booked room (which I payed a month in advance) and extremely rude, incompetent and condescending staff. Left us out in the street with some random numbers to call to resolve issues generated by themselves. Stay as far away as possible.

title: Avoid
text: One of the worst places I’ve ever stayed. Disgusting and dilapidated, crumbling walls, dirty carpets, stained furniture, rude reception. I changed the room as the first one had no window. The second one wasn’t better. The view of the wall and dirty inner shaft. Avoid

title: Worst hotel
text: We are VIP/Gold-members on Expedia and Hotels.com and they claimed we were not although we showed them proof. We were entitled to a bottle of wine and a complimentary upgrade and we did not get any. We got the worst room, 705 on 7th floor, smelly room and we heard a lot of noise both from the street and from other rooms although all windows were closed. The staff in the reception was very rude, the worst treatment. Would not recommend

title: STAY AWAY
text:
Filthy, rude staff. Lied about the parking garage situation.
I woke up with bites on my body 
Holes in floors, stains all on bedding
Stains on walls
Dark and depressing
STAY FAR AWAY!! 
The only nice and courtesy person was the gentleman who gave me the keys. Since he was not there in the morning and it was the rude girl from day before who “half checked me in” I refused to speak to them any more then needed. 
This hotel isn’t even a 1 star. I travel very often and this was the worst hotel I’ve ever experienced it should not be on hotel booking websites.

title: It’s ok stay, not so great experience.
text: Accommodation was good. Everything clean and neat worth of what you pay. They charge you for the snacks and water bottle inside room that is very expensive and also snacks and juices that kept in hotel room were expired, I tried throwing out expired stuff , still charged for the expired stuff. Be careful while taking out snacks or drinks from the room, always check dates on them.

title: Over charged
text: I booked through the bookings app and the price was good from the room that I got ! However when I checked in they charged me for the whole room itself , I thought it was the fee but they over charged me and they said it was a mistake. Currently still waiting on my refund.

title: Clean, well located, but overall a supremely mediocre experience.
text: I booked it because it was less expensive than some others at last minute, and as it usually happens, you get what you pay for. The room was clean, the location central and frankly, that was good enough. However, the room lighting was terrible (if you don't have any natural light in a room - which is true apparently of many of the rooms - you really ought to have plenty of lamp light. If you need to charge your phone, you'll find that all the plugs are a tad too big, so its difficult (not impossible) to get them to stay in w/o falling out (this is inconvenient, esp as I had to use a hairdryer and there was no plug in the bathroom - weird but whatever - and I could only use it while keeping it plugged in if I sat on the floor next to the wall. The main thing though is that the staff was unfriendly, unhelpful -- I had the sense that they mostly don't like their clientel and treat everyone with some contempt. I bet its a challenging job, so I don't totally blame them, but I wouldn't stay there again based on how I saw them deal with guests, including myself. But again, the room was clean.

title: BUYER BEWARE
text: A cautionary note. I booked a room for a one night stay through Hotels Tonight ap. When I went to check-in, the manager, GEORGE, asked the person before me if they would like to upgrade for an extra $30, as there was a room with balcony available. The guest declined. When I went to check in, the manager then told me that my reservation was for the day before. I showed him it wasn't. Then he said the rooms were all booked and gave me a number to call to get my money back. This is after trying to get another guest to upgrade to an available room. Then he did the same thing to the ladies after me, who also booked through an ap, thus discounted rate. When Hotels Tonight called him, and spoke to him, (I was there), he said the hotel had a flood and there were no rooms available. It was a holiday weekend so he wanted to sell rooms at full rate and wasn't honoring discount advertised, booked and paid for. I was fortunate that I found another place to stay, but imagine if you are someone who traveled from far away for a big weekend in NYC. Very shady business practice, buyer beware.

title: A WONDERFUL VACATION
text: The hotel was lovely and the manager was amazing. The hotel is centrally located in Manhatten so everything was easy to get to. The best thing about The City Club Hotel was the staff. George, the concierge, was so good. He booked meals for us and then followed up to see how we liked the experience every time. He booked taxis, and even drew maps for us. Our stay was amazing!  We will definitely be back!

title: Bellhop f-bombed guests - and that's not the worst of it
text:
The bellhop f-bombed some guests ahead of me dropping off their bags that didn't tip him at the point they left their bags. "I'll be taking care of them and I won't be there when you get back" - repeated it, then tutted loudly and literally shouted "f- you" towards them, directly in front of me as I waited to drop off my bag too. From their website: "We will store your luggage free of charge on your check-in and check-out days". He definitely didn't get a tip from me after I'd seen him do that. That dayshift bellhop should be fired. It's the rudest thing I've ever seen in a New York customer service environment - and I've seen a lot, given I used to live there.

The hotel room is clean enough, but it's nothing close to what it's oversold as. Imagine "polished rooms and suites with refined, eclectic decor" but if you ordered it from Wish, and you're still not gonna be disappointed enough. It's in fairly desperate need of a refurbishment. The wallpaper that they try to claim represents ancient columns is haggard, stained and falling off the walls. The carpet was grotesquely stained. The chaise has seen better decades. Everything about the room is a bit shabby.

Breakfast is a bit of a joke. First day there was soft cheese and butter - but no bread products to spread it on! Second day there were cheap prepacked bagels - but no way of toasting them. And they might even try to charge you a "resort fee" for it! Resort! Ha! As if!

The bathroom was spacious and great. The toiletries are great. My "queen luxe" (luxe - haha) room was substantially bigger than a lot of New York hotels I've stayed in. This place could be great, if it invested in itself. Because it doesn't, that's why you find it on bargain basement sites at the last minute - because people like you that research reviews carefully realise in advance that it's all just a bit of a mirage.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
My wife and I had to head into the city last minute to take care of an important matter. We found a great deal with City Club. Upon arriving and getting to our queen room we noticed that there wasn’t enough room for our 9 month old daughter to crawl around so they were more than happy to upgrade us to a deluxe king room with plenty of floor space. The bellhops were extremely kind especially after having to move our luggage twice. The front desk staff were more than accommodating and remembered my name, addressing me with each interaction. 

One block away from Times Square and fifth avenue, if I’m ever in the city again I’ll be staying with City Club.

title: Don’t take the deal on City club hotel.
text: Booked last minute for a family trip and thought I was getting a deal because it says it sleeps 6. We were 5 (my elder parents, 2 kids and me). The room smelled like smoke as it’s only 1 of 3 with balconies. They said no one smoked but could be heater. Then they placed a cot which I thought was part of original price they charged $25 per night. My kids usually sleep in a king bed with me and my parents on the sofa bed. Now there’s a $22.96 per night hotel fee on top of booking fee which wasn’t disclosed. Lastly, they charged me for red wine that went missing from the minibar. Unbelievable. Stay elsewhere where the fees are disclosed upfront and cleaner.  Now I Uber why they had a “last minute deal” because no one wanted to stay there.

title: Excellent All Around (Customer Service to the Accommodations)
text: The best thing about the whole stay at the City Club Hotel was the concierge George. He was the most welcoming person and made my stay memorable. George was polite, knowledgeable and professional I really felt welcomed by him. The other staff were also friendly and well-informed. As to the hotel, it was is clean and service is excellent. My room (King suite) had all amenities and was spacious.  I loved the large bathroom. The large bathtub was perfect for a couple to relax in and enjoy nice soothing bubble bath. The most important thing to me is how staff welcomed me from the beginning which affects the trip. Ask for George if you arrive. He’s the best!

title: Reporters point if view
text: Im a reporter with the German daily News i was recently a guest of the Stewart hotel 371 7th 31st it was transformed into a refugee shelter i was left to find another location as my away office so searched for other accommodations in the area ...I searched 3 weeks to find City club 55 west 44st its a bit of a hike from my Pennsylvania station location...I spoke to a older gentleman at this city club hotel location i was told that i would only be charged a flat fee of $100 only for the security deposit which was fine .  today is Wednesday the 3 days the bank holds and returns the balance i only paid 193.47 with security deposit i look at my bank statement it says they charged me a extra $22.47 this was for the resort fee that i was never advised i have to pay ..  What needs to be done is Employees must tell all patrons about this extra fee at the gate ....Fyi this place is wonderful staff is ultra friendly but this takes away from the 5 star rating

title: Exceptioal
text: You can't beat the location 44th St right off 6th Ave, a short walk to Broadway, even shorter to the NY Public Library & Bryant Park.  You're right between the theater district and 5th Avenue.  The room was spacious, well appointed, clean and most comfortable.   Hotels at this price point can be cramped.  And a continental breakfast on top of it all!  And for a jaw dropping reasonable price. I look forward to returning soon.

title: Horrible experience with City Club Hotel, New York
text: Honestly if I can give a 0 star it will be more appropriate. A personal experience - The hotel cancelled our booking and pushed the blame to Agoda by saying that Agoda has cancelled our booking. I suspected that this is due to the good rate that we have secured through Agoda many months in advance as the hotel manager offered us the same type of room at their current rates but told Agoda over the phone that they are fully booked when Agoda tried to resolve the matter by asking them to honor our booking. In the end, we didn’t get the room as we refused to compromise to such ridiculous request and we chose another hotel instead. Not a single word/update from the hotel manager don’t even say an apology from him. In addition, the hotel manager was rude and not at all helpful and refused to let us use their hotel phone when he asked us to coordinate with Agoda. I had to spend god knows how much on international call for more than 30 mins with Agoda and yet I was not given a room. The locality of the hotel is good but  the way they handle matters and customers are not professional in my opinion and I also question their integrity. So, you decide whether you want to take the chance with this hotel.

title: Horrible.  Stay away
text:
Prison cell room for 500 dollars.  . Dysfunctional and oppressive room. .  Elevators look like an old warehouse. Dirty.  Property is dilapidated.  Front desk is useless and could care less.  

A real insult

title: Hotel très bien placé
text:
Petit hôtel très bien placé et très agréable.
Les chambres sont très propres, mais un peu bruyantes  du fait des groupes de Climatisation qui sont omniprésents à NYC.
Un merci particulier à George de l'accueil qui a été prévenant et prêt à se couper en 4 pour nous accompagner dans la découverte et les réservations des musées et autres activités à faire sur Big Apple.
Sa gentillesse et son implication ont été précieux lors de ce séjour.
les taxes de séjour d'environ 10 USD par nuit et par chambre sont également un atout non négligeable pour le choix de votre futur séjour.
merci encore à GEORGE...
Frédéric et Isabelle

title: Amazing time in New York City!
text: City Club Hotel is the perfect place to stay in New York to take advantage of being close to Broadway.  George, at the hotel, could not do enough for us.  He welcomed us graciously and offered several times to schedule excursions to see the sights, providing wonderful tips for future visits.  We will see George on our next trip to the Big Apple!

title: Hotel solo poco recomendable
text: La situación del hotel es estupenda, pero he de decir q es un hotel viejo y descuidado. Las habitaciones son grandes pero están muy destartaladas, el armario es un incómodo y horrible. Las camas y almohadas son buenas. El cuarto de baño es grande y frío; siempre nos dejaban menos toallas de mano de las q debían, el rollo de papel higiénico era escaso, la bañera tiene una alcachofa de ducha fija y no tenia grifo bajo, no tiene mampara solo una cortina de baño de plástico lo q hacía incomodo su utilización, solo había dos vasos en el baño y éramos 4 personas en la habitación. El agua caliente escaseaba, el wifi era muy malo y no había mantas para la cama supletoria.

title: The worst ever
text: One of the worst hotels I ever stayed in. The front desk was so rude and unhelpful, at the end, the main guy was yelling at me when I asked him to give me back my security deposit, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I paid 2 nights 500 USD and I got a small room, without a window and lights. I felt so bad there without any reason. This was a super bad experience and I would never recommend them.

title: Trato nefasto
text:
El peor hotel en el que he estado, lo único bueno la ubicación… Desde el primer momento que entras por la recepción el trato es terrible, éramos 3 y nos dan una habitación con una cama doble y un sofá, que bien, pero sin sábanas ni mantas para la tercera persona, se les pide y prácticamente rogándoles y con mala cara tras mucho esperar lo traen… 
Al siguiente día nos ponen toallas para 2, no reponen el gel de baño que se había acabado, lo decimos en recepción a las 4pm y llegamos a las 9 pm y no estaban nos dicen que es que no han tenido tiempo.. El trato de las personas de recepción es terrible… Incluso llegando a negar alguna de las recepcionistas que trabajaba ahí cuando la vimos desde el primer día
 Sin nombrar el “desayuno continental” de 20 dólares, que se trata de bollería en bolsa, una cafetera Nespresso que no funcionaba
Sinceramente este hotel no se merece ni una estrella de las 4 que tiene

title: Recent stay, great location in midtown Manhattan. Hotel could use some needed updating. Bathroom tiles buckling.
text: Entire hotel needs updating. Looks really tired. Tile floor in bathroom coming up, balcony door very hard to open and it could use a fresh coat of paint everywhere. It’s a shame because it couldn’t be in a better location. Midtown Manhattan.

title: What an unique experience
text:
Definitely not your cookie cutter hotel room and had some old world charm. Super clean and very comfortable bed
The location is perfect to most of the theater and concert venues with only a short walk away. 
The staff was awesome and super friendly!

title: Waste of money
text: Comfortable bed and good location, but definitely not worth the money I paid. I paid extra to get a bathtub which I couldn't get because all of the rooms with tubs were full by the time I went to check in in the evening. Then the TV remote quit working the second day I was there and I was told "I recommend watching Netflix on your phone." Then the shower head fell off in the middle of my shower! Finally, I checked my bank statement the week after checking out and I was overcharged for my stay. Every time I call I am told the manager is out and to call back.

title: Esperienza veramente pessima.
text:
Stanza piccola di circa 9 metri quadri, senza un vero armadio, ma dei ripiani. Letto corto, non più di 180 cm. Qualità del sonno pessima con un vecchio motore (penso dell'aria condizionata) rumoroso nel cortile interno.
Colazione spaventosa: merendine nelle buste di plastica, qualche porzione di corn flakes e di latte. Prezzi completamente folli di circa 400 dollari a notte. Sorpresa finale con 20 dollari a notte aggiuntivi di 'facilities" (wifi).

title: Great location, friendly staff but outdated rooms.
text:
Great location, very central to most areas. We stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. Our flights ended  up being majorly delayed. When I rang the hotel to update we wouldn't be arriving until 3am instead of 7pm, they were lovely about it. 
Doorman is lovely,  always has a smile and opens the door.
The whole hotel is outdated. For us that wasn't a big deal but it wouldn't be our choice to stay again if staying longer then a weekend.

title: CATFISH HOTEL - WORST I HAVE EVER STAYED IN!
text:
DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL.
This hotel (if you can call it a hotel) is the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. 

The rooms are extremely small, even by NYC standards. You could hardly get around the bed. Granted the room was advertised as a Petit room however it is still sold as a two person room. The bed is what I believe to be a queen bed in the US however it was smaller than a UK double which is designed for 2 people. The bed measured 5ft long which for a 6ft person is completely ridiculous. 

The filth and dirt in the room makes me wonder the last time the room was cleaned. I actually wore shoes the entire time I was in the room as to avoid the dirty floor (wipe your feet on the way out!). The walls were dirty, full of black marks, ripped wallpaper and brown stains. The aircon vent continually fell off only to reveal a thick layer of dirt behind it and sticky bug traps that were riddled in lice and insects. 

The bathroom was OK, but by far roomy, there was no where to put washbags or anywhere to hang clean clothes. The towels were clean (that was the only thing about the room that was clean). If the tiles weren't brown they would have no doubt shown the dirt! 

We were offered a complimentary breakfast on check in however I wouldn't let a dog eat in the restaurant. That was very dark, depressing and lacking in any appeal that would make you want to dine in there. And if the room cleanliness is anything to go by god knows what the back of house standards are like.

We had 3 nights booked but only stayed 1. We wouldn't have stayed 1 if we weren't so insanely tired from a long trip over and lack of alternative accommodation. On check out the receptionist was not surprised at all we were checking out and did not offer to refund the cost of the first night - instead she proceed to charge my card in front of me (including the tax) and then said I had to cancel the rest of the stay through booking.com. No compensation or apology was given which leads me to believe this is a regular occurrence.

Do not believe the reviews! My partner pointed out that if you read the good reviews carefully you will notice the language/grammar used and frequent reference to the same member of staff implies the hotel are writing their own.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!

title: Fine place to sleep - but very tired.
text:
In the 1980's, small boutique hotels were in style - usually defined by a designer or a restaurant. The City Club was linked to famous chef, Daniel Boulud, and his Times Square DB Bistro. When it opened, it was a chic, stylish hotel with a moderate price.
 
Those days are long gone. DB Bistro is closed and the hotel has seen better days. You can still spot signs of creative design - the wall lamps are low and the art is still nice. But paint is chipped and wallpaper is peeling.

On the other hand, it has a great location near Times Square, it's clean and acceptable at a low price point. I paid about $200. The room was a fine size and the handicapped bathroom was quite large. It was fine at that price.

My view of NYC hotels is that I only sleep there. I don't care very much where I stay, as long as it's clean and fairly nice. I have stayed at the best hotels - Pierre, Lowell - and paying a lot is just a waste of money to me. (If someone wants to pay for my stay at the Aman Hotel, please contact me.)

I don't regret staying there. I was happy to save the money. But go with lowered expectations.

title: One way mirrors peeping Tom rooms
text: After checking in to City Club Hotel 55 W 44th St New York NY 10036, my children observed that a giant 4 foot by 12 foot mirror in their room was a two way mirror.   My kid had seen a YouTube video that showed you could tell if you put your finger up to the mirror and you see your fingertips touch, it’s a mirror you can see through from the inside.  My kid then proceeded to take the phone flashlight and put it up next to the large 4 foot by 10 foot mirror, and lo and behold, you could see a little area on the other side of the mirror.  So my children were petrified that there could be cameras watching them from behind these mirrors.  I was petrified that this hotel seemed to be made and possibly operated by some sort of Norman Bates-like sociopath.

title: Decent stay in midtown
text:
I wasn't sure what to expect given that this hotel has very mixed reviews and while we ran into some issues with our stay, it was a decent overall experience. Pros: good rates for NYC in a convenient location (especially for the queen luxe room), grab and go snacks in the lobby, comfortable bed, friendly cleaning staff.

Cons: We booked the petit full room and it's just way too small for more than one person. The website states that the room includes a desk, which was not the case. There was space only for the bed and one small nightstand. We switched to a larger room with a queen-sized bed on our second night, which was much better and included all amenities outlined online. Although I paid more for the petit full room than the listed rate online for the larger room, the staff was reluctant to switch us (they initially told us they were sold out when I could see multiple rooms available online). I was also told there was a discounted parking rate across the street, which was not the case. That being said, the standard garage rate is very good for NYC. 

For the price, City Club is a good choice - just be prepared if booking the smaller sized room!

title: great location, fine staff, but needs major maintainance.
text: Stayed overnight for a show. The gentleman at the desk was very nice, and upgraded from a queen to a king room WITH TERRACE at no charge....so far...I'll check my card balance this week. The Room was awesome.....20 years ago....good bed, clean, but all the finishes were terribly worn, sink was cracked, bathroom floor (made of CORK! in a bathroom?) had been very shoddily repaired, as had been many other things in the room.  This place could be great again, but I guess that is why it is offered for such low prices on the discount sites. Not sure I would stay again.

title: Great Spot in Midtown
text:
Stayed at City Club Hotel for 3 nts in Queen-Luxe.  The description on booking.com stated there was 1 queen bed & a twin bed, which was perfect for my daughter and I.  Upon arrival, we found that the room only had one bed.  I went back to front desk to see what they could do and Syeda was so amazing & helpful.  She took a few minutes and then informed me she could give us 2 rooms near each other for the same total price.  Wow - that's customer service!  I was impressed.  The rest of staff was also fantastic and location close to Bryant Park in midtown was perfect.   Also, a big thanks to Amoudie (spelling?), who was also great. All and all, the hotel was very nice and we'll be back.  Thanks for a lovely stay!

~Dan & Chloe Courant

title: A little gem of a hotel in the heart of NYC
text: This hotel is quite the sensation for location, price & quality it deserves generously 10/10. What makes it excellent is the staff, the absolutely wonderful check in services by Syeda and the singing cleaning team lifts the spirits in this unusually lovely hotel. We lived in NY for 15 years, never knew about it until now. Book it if it’s available!

title: Best staff I have ever encountered at a hotel!!
text: The rooms are spacious and they are in very good condition overall. Every single staff member took every small detail into consideration. Edith, George, and Carrol were the best and we’d definitely come back again!

title: Quirky but good location in midtown and very big rooms
text: This is an unusual, interesting hotel in a great location if you want midtown. In between 5th and 6th on 44th is good enough to be good enough for tourists (Times Sq, Empire State etc) and business traveler.  Bu the biggest advantage of this hotel is that the rooms are large. Not one is the same (this is my second time here and I've seen a few rooms) as it's been converted from an old building and the layout and furniture are eclectic and a bit unusual.  This is certainly not the cookie cutter borefest of the standard chains.  It's not modern in any way and feels a bit thrown together, but that's part of its charm.  Bathrooms are well equipped and function very well, if rather dark (black marble everywhere). Service is homely and very friendly people work here. You get a warm, personal welcome every time you walk in the door, which is great. But in a city where tiny rooms are the standard, the biggest advantage here is the rooms are huge.  I mean really big. Not New York sized at all, which is great. Comfy beds, a chair that's slightly too low to type at the table (told you it was quirky), and all the standard amenities (safe, wardrobe, fridge with expensive stuff in it).  If you don't want to spend a fortune but want a good sized room in a a great midtown location, then this could be right for you.

title: It’s near everything!
text: We chose City Club because of its proximity to Times Square and the theater district, but it’s also super close to Bryant Park, and you can get pretty much anywhere else in the city from the nearby subway stations. And Gregory’s coffee across the street is an excellent way to start your day. When we come back to visit NYC, we’ll definitely be staying at City Club again! Syeda and Edith made sure we were well taken care of, and all the staff were super friendly and helpful, we cannot recommend this place enough!

title: Hotel City Club, New York
text: City Club Hotel is a very good choise near Time Square. You can just walk in many places. Clean, good service (especially Georg in reception), silent room, secure. One can recommend, good quality on decent price.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights in one of the family rooms. Plenty of space for 4 with teen age kids. Location is superb and in the heart of Manhattan. Staff is so lovely and helpful. Room was clean with an amazing walk in shower.
Will stay here again.

title: Best Location and Rates in Times Square!
text:
George and Deven at the front desk made us feel so welcome! George went out of his way to help me with a snafu on a Broadway ticket I had purchased. Also, he will recommend a restaurant - and then send you dessert wine when you get there! 
In addition, George will call ahead to any restaurant you have reservations with and make sure your party is taken care of. 
When I would return to the hotel he would greet me by my name. Need a cab or transportation etc. - he gets it there in minutes! My only complaint was there are no coffee makers in the room and the coffee machine in the lobby was broken. But there is a nice coffee shop across the street.

title: séjour incroyable
