text: Mes enfants et moi adorons cet hôtel, belle chambre et syeeda à la réception était très serviable. elle a utilisé google traduction pour comprendre tout ce que j'ai dit et elle a dit. nous reviendrons pour notre prochain voyage.

title: Muy buena opción
text: El hotel esta re bien ubicado, el personal fue muy amable en todo momento siempre bien predispuestos. Tenes desayuno sin cargo, la habitación amplia y limpia . Una buena opción para poder recorrer y descansar

title: Great Experience
text: First time in NYC and the City Club Hotel was the perfect hotel for me. The location was amazing!  Walking distance to the subway, Grand Central, Times Square, Bryant park and much more. Edith was really helpful when I checked in and I was even able to check in early! The other staff was friendly as well. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Gem I discovered in Midtown
text: Location is Amazing. Syeda at check- in accommodated all my request for my business needs which made my stay exceptional. Housekeeping was also very prompt with all my request. I will come back for sure. Thanks to City Club for making this first work trip much better than i expected.

title: Loved my stay!
text: The City Club Hotel was the perfect hotel. It keeps the 'old new York' in its bones, just great. What made my stay even more perfect was Syeda, who welcomed me! She's the best, professional and extremely nice! I got a room with a balcony, an early/late check-in/out, I mean, who can ask for more? :) THANK YOU SYEDA! See you soon, for sure!

title: I found a new gem in NYC!
text:
I never stay in midtown, but for this work trip it made sense. I found the City Club Hotel on a hotel booking website, and took a chance on a hotel I'd never stayed at before -- and I'm glad I did!

First things first -- I was checked in by Syeda, who was an absolute rock star, getting me into a room earlier than the official check-in time, and saving the day because of a Zoom meeting I had to be on. It was even on a high floor! She really went the extra mile for me, THANK YOU Syeda!

And on the room -- I booked a King room that was quite large by NYC standards, and has a perfect table and comfortable chair that I set up as my temporary remote office -- perfect. Solid WiFi and windows that open added to the comfort of my stay. There is also a solid coffee place and decent diner on the same block, so I was very happy to be camped out here for a few nights. I will definitely be back (if I ever return to midtown!).

I've added this hotel to my "Trusted NYC" list. Don't hesitate to book here.

title: Unmatchedddd customer service
text: I stayed at city club for multiple nights. Location is amazing but their customer service is even better. On my departure date, syeda helped so much. She literally guided me with everything i needed to do, including booking covid test and ordering uber for me in my phone and walking me to uber so I don't get into the wrong car. This was my first time in NY and it was beyond amazing.

title: Very Nice Hotel near Times Square
text: This is a quaint hotel in Midtown a few blocks away from Times Square. It is centrally located and is in walking distance to Grand Central, Bryant Park, The Theatre district, etc. The accommodation was roomie and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. This was a good stay for a last minute trip

title: Paying for location and nice staff, not a comfortable stay.
text: I had to fly in for a quick 2-night business trip and chose this hotel as it appeared to be the closest walking distance to my destination. The staff was friendly, location was great, and the soaps/shampoo etc. were great, but the rooms need some major updates. The wallpaper was peeling off, the carpet was coming up in some areas, and there are very limited electrical outlets. The bathroom was nice, but the sink was coming away from the wall so it was off-kilter, the toilets are not ADA height, and the shower head leaked, leaving a scaly build up in the shower. The beds were very hard and the pillows were extremely thin and soft which made it difficult to relax/sleep. The carpet and window bench were stained pretty heavily, and the remote for the TV only functioned for power and volume (we ended up watching Netflix on my phone - fortunately Wi-Fi is included).  As it was only for 2 nights, we stayed, but likely will be booking elsewhere for next time. For me, there are to many other near by options that have comfy beds.

title: Greatest Service Ever in NYC
text: Syeda was the most wonderful welcoming person, she made New Yorkers the highest level of attendance for the Hospitality Industry. Please give her my best recommendation and rating! We will be back!!!!

title: Birthday Trip To NY
text:
After a long research for a good hotel in times square we decided to stay at the City Club. I am so glad I picked City Club. They were very accommodating.  
We got there before check in time and was assisted by sayeda, she rushed the room and got us in within 15 mins. She was also very kind to check up on us to see if we liked the room. Our room was spacious and very clean. Front desk team was very helpful with everything we needed. Sorry did not get everyones name. We will definitely come back in the near future.

title: Amazing Hospitality
text: Was greeted and checked in by Syeeda, she was a great host. She made sure we got a high floor, front view as we requested and also got us a early check-in around 1 pm. Room was nice and spacious for NYC. Overall Service was top notch. Thank you City Club for a memorable stay.

title: Great visit
text: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at City Club.  The people who work there are friendly, helpful, and professional.  The room was clean and attractive.  The location is fantastic.  A short walk to the theater and Central Park.   It’s our go to hotel in New York!

title: Enjoyed my first visit to new york thanks to this great hotel
text:
I found this hotel and it was perfect for me, great location, excelent service at the front the and from all the hotel staff, in particular isabella did an amizing job explaining to me how to get to places amd recomending activities, for shure im gonna recomend this plave to everyone…
The shampoo and bathroom suplies are excelent, the shower also is excelent…. 
The rooms with views are beautiful

title: Pet friendly and convenient
text: City Club isn’t the nicest hotel, but the staff were great and it suited our needs perfectly for this trip. The property is older, not rundown, but well worn. Dim lighting throughout didn’t help, or maybe it did. It is a pet friendly place which is what we needed. Our dog was warmly greeted and well treated the whole time we were there. Tom was particularly sweet to her and she responded in kind. Another plus is that there is a garage right across the street. It’s not part of the hotel, but its Convenience made for easy check in/out. The midtown location was great too as we had plans both uptown and downtown. So while it may not be the glitziest option, City Club is a well run property with some features that make it appealing.

title: El peor hotel, la peor atención.
text: Hice una reserva a través de booking, una habitación doble de lujo de 27 mts, la realidad me dieron una habitación oscura, que estaba muy lejos de tener 27 mts. , con la alfombra manchada, el baño con hongos en la parte superior de las paredes, sin un lugar para poner las cosas, con una cama pequeña. Un armario pequeño, Al hacer el reclamo sencillamente me dijeron que no habían más.  Nunca se preocuparon de siquiera tener un gesto amable, no sé si es booking quien engaña al pasajero o es el hotel, pero habiendo realizado tantas reservas en booking me inclino por lo segundo.  El ruido en la habitación  es insoportable, todo el día y la noche se escuchan extractores o el aire acondicionado, yo fui por trabajo y necesitaba un espacio cómodo y tranquilo y fue muy desagradable. El aseo deja mucho que desear, la aspiradora la pasan muy de vez en cuando y las camareras (alguna no todas) se acercan a decirte que ellas no van a estar para que le des propina. La verdad fue una muy mala experiencia, basta decir que jamás la repetiré, no lo recomiendo para nada, por pocos dólares mas pueden tener un hotel mucho mejor. De hecho yo me cambié al de al lado y fue un cambio del cielo a la tierra.  Evítenlo no se arrepentirán. Yo me arrepiento de no haber hecho caso de los comentarios negativos. No entiendo que este hotel tenga cuatro estrellas no le alcanza ni para dos.

title: Dirty, outdated, overpriced and overrated
text: I booked this hotel relaying on reviews of others on line. The photos don’t correlate what this hotel is truly. As soon as i walked inside I felt that I was trapped in tiny, dark area with many dark corners to get to the elevators. We got upgraded to a 2 story suite since they didn’t have king size bed in regular room. The room was dirty with mold in corners, stains and broken furniture. I was shocked to see how degraded this hotel and how expensive it’s. It looks like about 100 years ago it was glorious place with high ceiling and beautiful decorations plaster. Now, window curtains are torn, chair material is torn with nasty stains (liquid and blood). I felt like most of the furniture outdated and run down, needs to be replaced. I would never come back and stay here again. I come to New York several time a year, but I never stayed in that kind dirty place.

title: Great for business travel.
text:
I think this is a solid little hotel in a fantastic location. 

Have seen the other reviews with negative comments, I believe they are misguided. 

This a great place for the price you pay, it’s not the Ritz, nor are they trying to be. 

Good size room, clean bathroom. Staff is very pleasant.

title: Forget the five star hotels and get a duplex suite here. Ask for George at the front desk he’s great
text: This hotel has a great sole proprietor vibe, we had a duplex suite which I had researched before I booked and it was much nicer than we expected.  The suite in on two levels each with its own bathroom.  The plaster medallion ceiling is a nice touch and it even has a bit of a balcony.

title: Better choices elsewhere
text:
I booked 3 nights for my anniversary based on the most recent reviews but our stay at City Club was disappointing to say the least. It was bad enough to motivate me to spend the time to write this review.

1. Reading the reviews, I requested and confirmed with the front desk prior to arrival for a balcony room, TWICE. We did NOT get it. What we got was a smelly and decrepit room with a nice view of other building walls.
2. Bugs in the room. My wife got bit by something the first night. What a way to start a romantic weekend.
3. The room smelled musty and putrid. It was dreadful to walk back to the room every night.
4. The hallway on our floor reeked of marijuana every day
5. We were awoken in the middle of the night several times by noisy guests

This hotel needs some serious remodeling for a "4-star" hotel. We barely stayed in our rooms except to sleep.  The frontdoor guys were friendly and helpful which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. I can't say much about the front desk staff as our interactions were limited after no amendments were offered when they didn't fulfill our confirmed room request. The location is decent but the issues we encountered will not be seeing us go back.

title: Goes on my NYC Hotel List
text:
I stayed here during the Covid-19 pandemic so the hotel may normally have more services.

I tried the City Club because my usual w. 44th Street hotel (the Mansfield) was closed and I  got a very good rate on Expedia. It was perfect for me but not a place for someone who is looking for a lobby to hang out in or amenities like a business center.  My room was nicely decorated and extremely clean though worn (chair arm missing most of its finish, small tear in the blackout shade). Awesome, huge bathroom with C.O. Bigelow soaps and shampoo.

Check-in was professional and efficient. I received complimentary late checkout and a half bottle of wine because of my Expedia status (thank you).

W. 44th between 5th and 6th Avenues is a great street to stay on. Tons of restaurants, close to Grand Central, Bryant Park and good downtown subway access. Have breakfast at the Red Flame dinner, drinks at the Royalton and splurge on dinner at Kellaris Taverna, all without leaving the block.

title: Super friendly staff
text:
We stayed here with our family just last week. We have 3 kids and The location is really ideal to a lot of New York attractions such as radio city, Rockefeller, Times Square etc. It was convenient for us to walk to those things and there is a subway station within walking distance. 

it was a little bit of an older hotel as far as decor and style  but I don’t care about that because when I’m in NYC I’m only in the room to sleep 😂 the shower was awesome though! And I liked that they gave you qtips bc I forgot mine! 

The best thing about this hotel was the staff though! They were so friendly and so helpful. Our first room was hot and the AC wasn’t cooling well so they immediately got us a different room and even offered to let us keep our things in our old room for the night while we just slept in the new room because we had young kids who were already in bed. They also offered to move our things for us the next day if we just had it packed up. When we were leaving we were rushing to get everything out to the car bc our car arrived a little early and it’s a little hectic with 3 kids and the front desk staff came out and helped us carry things to the car and he even took my kids trash so I didn’t have to run back in and find a trash can. I was just so impressed with their level of customer service that I would definitely stay there again.

title: Loved the place
text:
Here's why I gave 5 stars : 
Front Desk : I have been traveling over 15 years and after  a seven hour flight to New York this was by far the best hotel I have ever been to the front desk staff was amazing I did not get a chance to catch everyone's name but I am almost 100% sure I encountered all of them because I was there for about a week. I will say that each and every staff member at the front desk went above and beyond whether it was just answering questions, checking on me, and the check in was extremely smooth.If you need a taxi for the airport they do have someone that works with them upon availability 
House keeping: The room was very clean I did have a room that had a balcony the balcony area was very clean as well they did also provide towels extra blankets and everything that I needed during my stay and their service was great. The one thing I will say is that our air conditioner did not work when we first got there but the maintenance came first thing in the morning and fixed it in less than 10 minutes I say that as a positive thing to show that maintenance was very efficient and fast of course things happen. 
Room :A lot of people don't know this about New York but most of the hotels are a lot older and they are not new so there will be some things like little small cracks in the wall or a very modern style bed. The room was amazing the location of the room was great it was a wonderful view.
Location : The location of this hotel is directly in Times Square it's about a 2 to 4 minute walk to the middle of times Square it's an amazing place and it is also next to the subway access and it is convenient if you have never been to New York.
Overall service : The overall stay was great everything went well. I cannot remember the person who checked me in but he was extremely nice his hospitality from the time I got there to the time that I left was just amazing sometimes you don't know what people are going through especially during a time like this pandemic to  receive this Nice nice customer service it was a pleasure for me. 
I hope to come back to new York in the future and hopefully I can get the same room style ! 
Thank you all so very much

title: Another Excellent Stay, Prime Location
text:
I’ve stayed at City Club Hotel for the past twenty-one years when in the city.  The midtown location is exceptional for business or pleasure stays. 

My wife often travels with me when I am in the city on business. She enjoys the shows and shopping.  The location perfect for my meetings and her sightseeing and shopping. 

The staff is friendly and the rooms comfortable.  

It’s close to great restaurants - in all price ranges.  I’ll be back again next month.

Thank you

title: My Visit
text: I Loved EVERY time i have booked a stay here at this hotel , i have gotten the most upmost care & greattttt customer service . Shawn which is the front desk manager is AWESOME & every other employee here in this facility. The bell man darnell and the other bell man abdellah are awesome as well , overall i can say it is worth the visit here ❤️

title: Very Meh
text:
This hotel needs to update their website to reflect all they do not offer anymore. There is no parking service, no on-site food/restaurant, of course this is due to Covid. Not their fault but should be noted. 

The front desk had masks down below their nose and mouth. It was very unsettling. The hotel is dark, brown, and dingy. The location is great since you’re right in the middle of the city but I would not recommend if you like nice hotels. 

This is solely a place to crash not enjoy.

title: Buen hotel pero mala atencion de algunos miembros del staff
text:
El fin de semana fuimos mi hija de 19 anos yo por vacaciones, nos hospedamos en el hotel. Buena ubicacion, muy centrico , las habitaciones muy limpias y confortables. Sin embargo el personal en front desk no siempre tiene la mejor disposicion para atender.  
El domingo  pedimos comida, pues debido a la pandemia no se puede comer en algunos los locales. Por mala suerte no nos incluyeron cubiertos, asi que llamamos a roomservice, no se si por la hora, domingo 8:30,  nos transfirieron a front desk:  explicamos la situacion y les pedimos cubiertos. Su respuesta fue no tenemos, ni una palabra mas.
El lunes cuando regresabamos, primero nos llamaron a las 11:17 am para recordarnos que el check out era a las 12,  posiblemente politica del hotel, pero  me parece de mal gusto, primera que vez que me pasa.  Luego a la hora de irnos al aeropuerto les pedimos el favor de llamar un taxi, la chica de recepcion dijo a mi hija, vayan a la avenida y tomen uno, no llamamos taxi. Creo que ambos son servicios basicos que no cuestan mucho y hay mejores formas para responder a un huesped. No todo se basa en la ubicacion del hotel.
Debo destacar que no me refiero a todo personal.  Fue mas amable el personal que me consegui en los pasillos que la cara del hotel ante el publico.

title: Sweet Spot in the City
text:
I enjoyed City Club. From the correspondence early on to make sure the accommodations I wanted matched up, to friendly front desk & early check in when I showed up - it was great. The location is perfect and an easy walk almost anywhere in the heart of the city.  

Bed was comfortable. Shower in the room was amazing. And for those who complain in other reviews about "out dated furniture"- Youre spending too much time in the room!!    And noise- Its  hotel. Its NYC.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
Nous avons choisi cet hôtel pour un séjour en famille. 
Nous avons opté pour la chambre double deluxe (nous étions 5, deux adultes un enfant de 12ans) 
La chambre disposait donc de deux lits doubles ainsi que d’une banquette. Seulement la banquette est très étroite pour un enfant de 12ans, dommage ! 
Le ménage est fait tous les jours. 
Concernant l’emplacement de l’hôtel, il est hyper bien situé !!! A quelques pas de Times Square Et très proche de la 5ème avenue, donc super !!

title: Absolutely perfect!
text: Room/bed was small but the location completely made up for it! Walking distance to everything you could want to experience NYC. Special shout out to Alisha at the front desk~went above and beyond to make things perfect.  I’d definitely recommend for a trendy, affordable spot in a great location with wonderful staff!

title: Not at all what it appears to be
text: I did not enjoy my stay at this location. From the decor to the staff, everything was outdated. The king size bed was on the floor and had no blankets on them. We booked a King Luxe room and it was not what we expected

title: Dirty and Loud
text: The sheets that my sisters slept on were stained, we had to ask the front desk for new ones. There were ants in the corners, it was gross. The front desk lady who was Black was super nice though, she was very accommodating to our needs. Never coming here again.

title: Disgusting
text: Super dirty hotel near time square. Loud and full off cockroaches. The bed sheets were stained and the carpet in the room sticky. Front desk staff doesn’t even wear mask. Despicable  management. Don’t waste your money here if you value your safety or life.

title: Amazing!
text: Loved the hotel! Darnell was an ANGEL! From the moment I got there, Darnell was friendly and very helpful. I asked him for 1000 things and he got them, NO PROBLEM! He was respectful, sweet, and he made my experience at city Club amazing !!!!

title: Dirty and loud
text: I stay in a lot of hotels in Times Square and this one has so far been the worst. Floors and walls falling apart and carpet and sheets dirty. Carpets in elevator and hallways disgusting. During the night, people in adjacent rooms yelling and fighting and banging doors. I called down to the desk 3 times to complain- each time it took about 5 minutes for them to answer the phone. Noise continued until 4 am. Awful night, awful hotel!

title: City Club Hotel...a great place to stay while visiting New York!
text:
Visitors to New York have an opportunity to see New York hospitality at its best at a charming hotel, just steps away from Times Square!  The City Club hotel is located at    55 West 44th Street, a great location for both business and pleasure trips.  What makes the hotel so special?  It's a combination of its location,  a cozy atmosphere and a superb hotel staff!

From the minute you arrive, you feel well taken care of.  You are greeted at the door by Darnell Harden, the bell man. You can't help but smile--- Darnell goes out of his way to make you feel welcome.  From handling your luggage,  arranging for coffee, or delivering your take-out orders to your door, Darnell is always willing to help.  I once asked him why he is always in a good mood, and he told me "because I love my job."  How refreshing!  (And what an asset to the hotel!)

Another treasure is Alisha Depino, who is at the front desk.  Alisha's bright smile (complete with dimples) and positive energy is simply contagious.  She handles every issue with such poise and respect that even the most difficult guest becomes friendly.   She is the perfect person for a job that requires quick thinking and the ability to change plans at a moment's notice.  Brava, Alisha!

It would be impossible not to mention the evening staff in this review. It is apparent that good management and thoughtful planning greatly contribute to the wonderful atmosphere of this hotel.

The City Club Hotel is managed by Joshua Barbee.  His quiet yet effective management style sets the tone for this hotel, and the hotel (as I've said) has a wonderfu1 tone. He does great job, and it is always a pleasure to talk to him.

I've concentrated on the staff in this review, because I believe this is what makes or breaks a business.  The staff is superb.  The rooms are comfortable and the neighborhood great.  I have no affiliation with this hotel.  Just wanted to give credit to a group of fine people.  Stay at City Club---its well worth it!

title: Stayed here June 6-8
text: Darnell was very helpful and so was the night staff would stay again thankyou :)he made sure everything was good and if we needed to let him know would stay again because of him he was very kind and I very much appreciate him and will be back soon !

title: Great stay at this hotel
text: I checked in this hotel May 15th and I am staying here until June 15 I have had a wonderful time here. I was given a complimentary upgrade by the general manager Joshua Barbee to room 802 and I love it. he is by far the best example of leadership at a hotel I Have experienced in America. Especially traveling in America during these times he has made my trip a great stay. I also would like to point out an extraordinary gentleman by the name of Darnell Harden. He has not only been a great help, he has offered tremendous conversation, superb service, and overall a great person. I wish him the best. He is a true gem at city club and in this world.

title: Excelente!
text:
I could not have asked for a better experience during my stay at the City Club Hotel. Prefect location in the heart of NYC close enough to everything, perfectly situated near public transportation and easily walkable to near by restaurants and the famous 5th Avenue department stores.

The City Club Hotel provides a boutique atmosphere. During my stay here I found the staff to be accommodating, inviting, and helpful. I was greeted by the concierge Jose outside the hotel, where he escorted me to the front desk for checkin and even aided me with my bags to my room. Jose provided me with all the information I need to make my stay even more pleasurable. 

I will recommend City Club Hotel to anyone visiting NYC !

title: Little critter
text: The staff at this hotel is beyond amazing they are very attentive and alert during my visit is was relaxing until I met my little friend micky Mouse the hotel took the right measures to Chang out my room

title: Vincent & Devin are impeccable!
text: I’ve stayed here a few times before and always had incredible service, but today was above and beyond thanks to both Vincent & Devin. With much ease and thoughtful understanding they showed compassion and true customer service to assist with my room accommodations for comfort. They both had awesome uplifting energy and gracious smiles. City Club truly has two incredible businessmen and partners within these two gentlemen.

title: My Go-To Hotel in NYC!
text:
I have been going to The City Club Hotel after it opened as a hotel, around 2000.  It's my go-to place in the city and the management is exceptional as they recognize me when I return and upgrade me when available. 

What I like best is the location, the small lobby and the warmth of the hotel. It's a little home away from home.  I have stayed in about every room over the years, and I have my favorites. The two-floor loft suites are very nice with two-story windows, neat period ornamental plaster ceilings, and a balcony overlooking 44th. 

I also like the proximity to everything, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, etc. 

It's a great place to stay, why not?

title: Broadway Show Hotel
text: Location, location, location.  This hotel was perfect for our four show weekend visit to NYC.  The room was clean and pleasant and quiet.  The staff of Alisha, Mo, and Jessica were most hospitable and helpful and gave us a nice feel for the wonderful staff.  We will return.  Thanks City Club.

title: お手頃価格で場所が良い
text:
安くはないですが場所を考えると比較的お手頃な価格だと思います。
リゾートフィーもこのときは10ドルとほかのホテルに比べるとお手頃でした。
たまたま部屋もアップグレードされたからか、ほかの口コミにあるような狭い部屋ではなく、アメリカの通常サイズくらいの部屋でした。
ネットもストレスなくつながり快適な滞在となりました。

title: Just awful
text: I’m really not sure how there are so many positive reviews. We arrived late last Saturday after a long journey only to arrive at the hotel to complete disappointment. We were informed we had been ‘upgraded’ I worry for the people that stay in the room we had previously booked, the room smelt like damp and cigarettes (there was still a shower cap on the smoke detector). It was not only the room that smelt like smoke the corridor did too as there was a lively party happening at the end of the corridor. We spoke to the concierge and asked to change rooms.. they then lied to us saying the hotel was fully booked - it 100% was not, as other than the party guests we saw no one else in the hotel. The concierge also said it’s an old building which is why it smells like damp...! They were also aware of the party but said it shouldn’t be too loud. The view out the window was of a brick wall and the paint was peeling off the walls. Location is good and bed is comfy - that’s the only thing they have going for them.

title: Nettes Hotel in guter Lage
text:
Wir waren mit unseren drei Teenagern von Mi bis Sa Gäste im City Club Hotel.
Unser Luxe Double Room hatte zwei Doppelbetten und ein zusätzliches Einzelbett unter dem Fenster.
Das Bad war geräumig und sauber. Allein die Duscharmatur stellte uns vor gewisse Herausforderungen. Aber nachdem wir lange genug alle Hebel ausprobiert hatten, stellten wir fest, dass „low“ für einen guten Wasserfluss sorgt (und nicht „high“!).
Das Zimmer war sauber und gemütlich.
Die Minibar war recht umfangreich bestückt, aber die Preise hielten uns davon ab, sie zu nutzen. Gleiches gilt für Frühstück, Roomservice etc.
Die Angestellten, mit denen wir zu tun hatten, waren höflich.
Unterm Strich stelle ich fest, dass wir das Glück hatten, ein besonderes Angebot nutzen zu können. Zum regulären Preis hätten wir das Zimmer als ziemlich überteuert empfunden.
Das Hotel ist von seiner Lage her einfach toll, da man eine Menge Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuß erreichen kann. Die nächste Subway Station ist auch um die Ecke.
Es gibt jede Menge Lokale, Cafés und Supermärkte in der näheren Umgebung.
Wir haben uns oft bei Whole Foods mit sehr leckerem Essen versorgt.

title: Decepcionante pero muy bien ubicado
text:
La planta 3a son habitaciones que se pueden fumar. No sabia este dato y como llegamos tarde en el hotel nos dieron una habitación de esta planta con bastante olor a tabaco. Intentamos que la cambiaran pero no disponían de mas habitaciones, prometieron que el dia siguiente nos cambiaban y nos ofrecieron un vale para desayuno en compensación Al dia siguiente no disponían de habitación para cambiar y nos aplicaron un descuento. Al tercer dia nos ofrecieron una mejor habitación. Las habitaciones son bastante anticuadas y con muy poca luz. Muy pequeñas, no hay armarios. Cuando reservas por booking : habitación doble deluxe, debe ser porque es Nueva York, pero deluxe no tiene nada, la cama es queen y el precio es bastante elevado por las características de la habitación. Nos decepcionó bastante la verdad. Hemos estado de viaje por toda la costa este desde Miami a Nueva York y hemos estado en varios hoteles, con habitaciones dobles mucho mas baratas y con mejores condiciones.
Dicho esto, quiero recalcar que el personal que trabaja en el es muy amable y su ubicación  excelente pero quizás tendrían que renovar un poco el hotel. Y si te hospedas en el y no eres fumador, decidlo porque el olor a tabaco es bastante molesto.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is right down from Time Square and other great places to see in NYC. Staff is very nice and helpful. Thanks for having us!! We will be staying here the next time we come into town. Thanks again.

title: Amazing room and location
text:
We stayed at the hotel in December for a 4 day break in New York. We were lucky enough to have a grand duplex room and it was outstanding. The room was like a house. It was huge and had two floors. From check in to leaving the staff were great throughout and everything about the room was great. 

The curtains were closed for us if we were out and loved the cookies left for us each night to enjoy. The only thing missing I think from the room was tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Would have been great while getting ready in a morning. 

Other than that the room and hotel were fabulous. Would highly recommend. The room was clean and spacious and the location is great. Right in the middle of Times Square, Rockefeller, Empire State and Grand Central station. Great hotel. Thank you

title: Best Hotel Service in NYC
text: Spent 1 night out and the service was anazing. Front desk, Richard was opened to help out and ask any questions. Darrell Hardn, another employee helped us at his greatest effort, truly appreciate it. Will definitely want to book again.

title: Best asset - DARNELL
text:
Never in my life did I expect this level of service. 
Never in my life have I receive this level of service.

Arrived yesterday for a business trip- booked the hotel 3 weeks ago. 

When I arrived- the TV remote was missing from the room. DARNELL came up and assured I would be able to watch my news by configuring the TV by hand. 

Today when I got ready in the bathroom I couldn’t find the outlet. 

There simply was none- it was camouflaged yet DARNELL helped me find it. - at first we both couldn’t. 

Then I told him that the USB port next to my bed did not work- unfortunately I had left my charging port at home but had the USB car. 

DARNELL- literally went out and bought me a CHARGING PORT. 
Which is crazy honestly. 
I am so so so thankful for people who go above and beyond. 
DARNELL is Kind. But his special. 
He’s a GENUINELY KIND person and those sincere actions aren’t taught. 

He is amazing he should scale in this hospitality industry because of his sincere heart felt efforts. 

I’m shocked beyond belief at the level of attention by DARNELL. 

Will be back - JUST because of DARNELL. 

Thank you for your hospitality.

title: Excellent
text: My recent stay at the City Club Hotel was superb, since I was traveling solo I booked a Petite room which was very intimate and chic but the prefect size just for me and even a guest. My room had a full-sized bed with the most comfortable bedding I slept like a baby.  All the amenities available made my stay even more pleasurable. The location for City Club Hotel is perfect in the heart of the city and close to many attractions and transportation in the area.  The staff was very friendly, especially Jose the bell man was the most pleasant and most helpful staff member during my stay, he helped me with my bags and provided me with car service at my leave.  I had an excellent stay and I would recommend it to anyone of my friends and i look forward to the possibility of booking and staying at the City Club Hotel.

title: Great service!
text: Darnell Harden helped us sort our room and provided excellent service from start to finish.  Highly recommend a visit here!  Great furniture and a comfortable room with a wonderful stocked bar.  Can't wait to come back.

title: Excelente Servicio!
text: Joshua y Darnell fueron maravillosos durante mi tiempo en el hotel. Me ayudaron en contrar todo los lugares y me ayudaron con todo. Me encanto el hotel y los empleados. Gracias por todo y luego vuelvo.

title: The good outshined the not so good
text:
The service was excellent, really friendly and helpful. We were a family of 6, 4 adults and 2 children. We had a “family suite” which consists of two rooms that open to/share the end of the hallway which then has its own door, so they are connected but can also have privacy from each room. Not sure if that makes sense but it works! Each room had a king or queen bed and also each a daybed, one for each child. So really great for large groups/families. The only thing was our side (the king) was very musty/dank smelling. I was very stuffed up while there through the nights. The other room complained of loud air conditioning (but I enjoy the white noise -we should have switched rooms) and they did see a mouse. But it’s New York and inevitable they are around.  
The wifi didn’t work in most of our room either, you had to stand in the doorway. No views from the windows but you’re out and about to see that stuff anyway. 
All that being said, overall it really was a great stay, I just like to give all the details. The restaurant downstairs was convenient with good food. The location can’t be beat for all your manhattan adventures. There’s also a great diner (red flame) about two doors down, we ate breakfast there a few times. The doormen were eager to help with anything (getting drives, umbrellas, etc). The bathrooms were awesome.. Really big and lots of water pressure. We would go back, would request a different room if we encountered the same stuffiness/musty smell.

title: AMAZING STAY AT THE HOTEL
text: We had an amazing time at the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with anything we needed. Deven and Inshon at the front desk were wonderful and made our stay very pleasant, we look forward to staying with you guys again!!

title: Vacation first time in New York
text: Darnell the bells man was very helpful. Please visit their hotel nice area. Friendly and has great customer service. Thank God for Darnell he went over and beyond!! Very knowledgeable about the area for entertainment,eatery and local landmarks.

title: Great hotel for FAMILIES!
text: I had searched online for a while looking for a hotel that would be great for families as there were 5 of us traveling for the first time to the city and with a very curious 6 year old.  And I am glad we did!  All the staff was so helpful especially Celeste and Insah.  Everyone was super friendly from the bellman Mark to the gentleman who helped us request a Town car in order to get to the airport.  The room was extremely clean and comfortable with a City view.  The hotel is so close to so many attractions and excellent dining and it's is within minutes of Central Park and Times Square. The housekeeping was great and the cookies in the afternoon were a wonderful surprise.  Overall if you are looking for a hotel that is great for families this is the place.

title: Great location
text: We booked a standard room through Priceline, but upon arrival, upgraded to a room with a king bed.  The room was a decent size, comfortable bed, good shower and amenities.  The staff were very helpful.  The hotel was a great location for us and we would definitely return.  We ate breakfast every day at the adjoining restaurant and also dinner one day and found it to be very good.

title: New York City break
text:
Visited New York for a 6 night stay with the intention of seeing Mark Knopfler in concert at Madison Square Gardens and a short break to see the city. Booked the hotel and flight on Expedia having seen the previous excellent reviews for this hotel. I had booked a luxury room with queen bed and on arrival was able to gain early entry. I was pleased enough with the room but not the bed, certainly not the queen size I had expected. Speaking with the receptionist I was given another room 204 which was better although was again at the side/rear of the hotel with a view of a wall and rather large air-conditioning system on adjacent wall which was extremely noisy throughout my stay.  Room was fine with good shower and perfectly suited my purposes. Had one other concern with noisy staff in the small hours of the morning who were using the service room opposite my room and I had to bring this to the attention of the hotel staff who seemed unaware of this.
All staff I met were extremely professional and assisted me with my stay providing local information, help and advice for which I was very grateful and I must particularly mention Celeste and Mark. 
Hotel position is handy for Times Square and within minutes of the subway system and suited me fine. There is a very good diner just a short walk from the hotel which I used although the hotel has a restaurant attached. Wireless internet available in room which was adequate.

title: City Club Hotel - Six Stars
text: We stayed at the Club only one night but was an exceptional experience.  We had booked a King Room, but as a surprise to us we were upgraded to the two story suite, which includes a spiral staircase.  The staff was excellent, bellmen, front desk and housekeeping, very clean, bedding A+, of course room size no problem.  Our room was located on the front of the building, third floor and no street noise. I strongly recommend this "Five Star" Hotel but will give them "Six Stars" because of the free upgrade.  Great location a must stay (Sept. 12, 2019).

title: Great Location, Nice Staff, Clean - But Room Had Been Smoked In
text: Overall, this is a nice hotel with friendly staff and the rooms are generally well appointed. The bed was comfortable, the sheets and towels in new condition and good quality. Nice C.O. Bigelow toiletries included. The location is excellent, near Times Square and Grand Central Station. I drove to the City and valeted my car with the Hotel. It couldn't have been easier. It was just as easy when I was ready to leave with my car waiting out front. My only issue, but it is substantial for me, is that the room had been smoked in. It was musty with that heavy "un-fresh" air smell. I don't know if all the rooms are like that but that made my rating drop significantly. If it had not been a smoker room (and it was not disclosed as such) I would have rated it 4 or 4.5.

title: customer service
text: i have stayed here many times and it's always a pleasant experience. the rooms are tiny but that's ok because i am out all day anyway. i stayed here august 11-13 and unfortunately i forgot a pair of jeans in the room and realized it the day after i checked out. i was pleasantly surprised that housekeeping had it and followed instructions to have them sent to me. i was told to email the front desk and provide credit card information and they would take care of it. i informed them it was a time issue and they said they would do the best they could. well here we are 5 days later and i had to call 2 more times to find out if they were sent. the first phone call the gentleman said he would call me back when his manager came back from downstairs. i waited a couple of hours and called back. i was then told "oh yes, we have them and we have all the information". i asked why it is 5 days later and they are still there when it takes 1 day to ship within new york? there was really no acceptable answer.  i'm sorry, but i think that's rude and not great customer service!!!

title: Fantastic!
text: Just returned from a ten day stay, a fantastic hotel! There were 5 of us in one room but didn’t feel like we were tripping over each other. Maid service twice a day and cookies at night, spacious bathroom, very clean. Air conditioning was a god send. Located in the heart of Manhattan but being 2 streets back meant the air on drowned out traffic noise. Reception and bell men were very polite and extremely helpful. Would return and recommend  this hotel!

title: Bien situé
text:
Voici un hôtel bien situé, à 5 minutes de time Square. Personnel très professionnel, souriant, prévenant. Les chambres sont spacieuses et peuvent accueillir une petite famille.
Un restaurant chic est accessible depuis l'hôtel, et une pâtisserie est à quelques mètres.
Pas 5 étoiles car certaines choses datent un peu mais rien de rédhibitoire.
Un très bon séjour.

title: Preis Leistung gerade mal so ok
text: Wir waren 2 Erwachsene und 3 Kinder. New York ist teuer und die Hotelpreise exorbitant. Das City Clubhotel ist einigermassen zahlbar, sauber, das Personal freundlich, die Zimmer klein wie fast überall in Mittelklassehotels in Manhattan. Beim nächsten Mal übernachten wir in Brooklyn, Katzensprung von Manhattan mit der Metro und doch viel preiswerter.

title: Friendly Staff—Great Room Layout for Families
text: After our first hotel couldn’t honor our reservation for two queen beds, we ended up at City Club Hotel.  We were glad we did!  Front desk staff was friendly, the “bell hops” were very accommodating and the rooms were excellent!  We ended up with a king-sized bed with an additional “daybed” in the room—plenty of space for myself and my two teenage children.  The bathrooms were also clean and spacious.  The CO Bigelow toiletries were a nice touch.  Great place to spend two nights in the city!

title: Great overnight
text: We had 3 adults and 2 kids on an overnight trip to NYC. We got a room with 2 double beds and 1 day bed and it was perfect for us! It was a bit small, but we were only there to sleep so it was fine. The bathroom was huge and clean and tasteful. The staff was very professional and helpful. Check-in is at 3:00...we got there early and couldn't check in, but they held our luggage so that we could see the sites before checking in. Location was great...2 minute walk to Times Square and Fifth Ave, as well as other attractions. Definitely would recommend this boutique hotel for anyone visiting NYC.

title: Não recomendo
text: O hotel é bem localizado. Fica entre a 5th e a 6th Avenues, ao lado do bryant Park, próximo à Grand Central e à Times Square. A maior parte do staff é super atenciosa.  Porém é um hotel velho que precisa urgentemente de uma reforma. O hotel não tem lobby, a recepção parece uma entrada de casa noturna, um dos elevadores dava medo de pegar. No dia do check out , depois de entregarmos o quarto, não tínhamos um local apropriado para ficar esperando por nosso transfer. Reservamos um quarto com varanda, mas chegando lá nos disseram que não cabíamos no quarto com varanda. A cabeceira de cama despencou na minha cabeça no primeiro dia de estadia, depois foi consertada. Eles não cobram para receber encomendas, mas abriram meus pacotes, o que eu achei um absurdo, apesar de não ter faltado nada. Existem opções muito melhores pelo mesmo preço em NY. Não recomendo e não ficaria novamente.

title: Gran estancia
text:
Hotel situado junto a Times Square y la 5a avenida.
Estuvimos en una habitación de cinco con dos camas dobles y un sofá-cama. Nos arreglamos bastante bien aún teniendo solamente un baño.
Las camas eran cómodas y el sofá cama también.
Además justo en la misma calle hay una cafetería y un diner, así que para empezar el día estamos cubierto. 
Fue un gran acierto, buen situado, limpio y cómodo

title: Good location, great staff!
text: Our first time to stay in New York and the location of the hotel was very convenient.  We ran into some problem with our airline and the staff really did their best to accommodate us. Look for Alisha at the front desk, she’s the best!

title: Très content
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits dans ce petit hôtel très bien situé à 5 minutes à pied de times square, Central Park et grand central station ( Penn station pour ceux qui arrivent de newark est à 15 min à pied ). 
Nous avons adoré le personnel, souriant aimable et au petit soin. ( vous aurez la chance d’avoir des cookies tous les soirs ). Bagagerie  gratuite après le checkout(12:00). Notre chambre était équipé de prise usb pour les téléphone. Un peu bruyante à cause de la ventilation extérieure mais qui n’empêche pas de bien dormir après une bonne journée de marche. J’enlève une étoile car nous avons faut la mauvaise rencontre avec un centipede ou cafard dans la chambre. J’imagine que c’est un incident isolé dont nous ne tenons pas rigueur. Les taxes de séjours pour 4 nuits étaient de 34$ ( difficile de trouver mieux dans le coin !)
Nous reviendrons avec plaisir !! Merci le city club

title: In NYC for Dr visit...City Club good choice
text: The neighborhood is busy with many restaurants and hotels and near theaters.  Doorman not always available but no stairs! Hardly a lobby ... just hard stools for 2 plus a small bench ... more sitting on second floor with computers!  Check in is easy but had to wait a bit at 3 PM for room to be available.  Taxi pick up and drop off can  be problematic...lots of competition on narrow street.   Room is small dark and quiet depending on hall noise and courtesy of others.  Nice bathroom ... large with shower in queen bedroom on 6th floor ...  no street noise!  Best of all next door is db Bistro ... very good and room service!  And many choices very close from a diner to fine dining and in between.

title: Nice hotel in midtown
text: Nice hotel with generously sized room.  Clean room and halls.  Nice, simple lobby.   The front desk staff was warm and accommodating and there was a nice plate of cookies in the room.  Would definitely stay again.

title: 1st trip to new York
text: I would highly recommend this hotel, its location and price is amazing for what you get. Fresh cookies every day, great staff and comfy rooms with a good selection of channels to watch if you've had a long day walking around. I would like to give a massive thank you Daniel out front, hes a very friendly guy who has good advice and knowledge of the area. He really made our stay one to remember and was such a great bloke to chat to whilst having a smoke out the front. Thank you for a great visit.

title: Okay but manager never called as they were supposed to
text:
We stayed over spring break for 2 nights. The room was okay. Staff was awesome, friendly and always willing to help. However, at checkout we brought an issue to their attention and were advised a manager would be calling back and have yet to hear back from anyone. 

It appears they are either in midst of updating or in need of updating rooms. When we checked in our room had a tile from the bathroom wall on the floor with a gaping hole exposing the pipes.  Now, to clarify this was not the issue we brought to the front desks attention, although we should have brought that up as well. 

Above all the accommodations were decent for NYC.

title: Nice Staff But ....
text:
We stayed there this last week end (3 nights). 
The staff is nice, the room was big enough and we were not hearing the people next doors so that was perfect for a good rest....!! 

But, the heat was to high, if we open the window it’s crazy loud outside as the hotel is very well located 👌
And the big disappointment was that the sink and toilet were clogged. It looks like the system is really old and not taking care of.

title: Perfect hidden gem
text: We recently visited and can not say enough about this great hotel. We had a family of six and a handicapped person the family suite was ideal. The cleanliness and service was wonderful. The location was perfect. Walking distance to everything time square, Rockefeller’s center , grand Central Terminal. Great location for shopping and restaurants as well. Someone commented about the room size being small, if you have stayed in other NYC hotels you would think the room larger than most. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that asks.

title: Great hotel
text: Was there for st Patrick's week it about 10 mins walk to time square staff are unbelievable friendly happy rooms were lovely what 5 lads want we want to go to see friends in Yonkers door man want went out of his way to get us alift he was great also he arranged for us to have a lift to the airport would highly recommend to people give them 10 stars

title: Great Experience
text: Jose De La Cruz  was very welcoming and helpful with my stay at city club. He was very informative and provided me with all the information I need to make my stay desirable. I would recommend anyone to visit just on the great customer service I received from Jose.

title: Excellent experience
text: Staff, location and rooms all excellent. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about restaurants in the area. We are a family of 5, got the family suite and it was perfect. The hotel rooms and location were very clean and safe. We will be back again!

title: Un pò meno turistico
text: Questo piccolo hotel mi è piaciuto molto anche se la camera era piccola non mi ha disturbato, era infatti molto curata e gradevole. Abbiamo anche cenato nel ristorante trovandoci molto bene. Personale gentile, pulizia. Posizione centrale. Non economico ma giusto.se non fosse perche mi piace cambiare ci tornerei

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
Upon arrival the front desk agent was super friendly. She was very nice. 
when we enter the hotel room it was a different story. Room was not clean at all, Bathroom door wasn't working. There was mold in the bathroom. Am so glade I stayed one night only. Even though we had late check out. Housekeeping kept on knocking the door. The only good thing about this hotel was the staff front desk and door man very nice.

title: The location is the best
text: It is a really tiny hotel, the entrance is barely to be seen. The staff was nice and friendly at arrival. However they blocked a deposit on my credit card without informing me upfront. The room is so small, two adults of small size had trouble to move. No room for luggage, coats etc. The bed was even for our small size too short. Anyway the price is okay considering the location, which is perfect. Also the cleaning and house keeping was very good. Would not recommend it if you need some space and air to breath.

title: Great location, great hotel
text: Very happy with the hotel. Great location, staff are nice, not a lot of facilities and our mini bar never got topped up but all round, very happy. Food and drink at the restaurant and bar were nice too.

title: Exceeds expectations
text: I booked a petite room for a one-night stay on a business trip to New York. When I checked in, I was upgraded to a queen room and found a complimentary half-bottle of wine courtesy of the management and staff. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was large. Two warm chocolate chip cookies were delivered for turn down service. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I would definitely stay again and highly recommend this hotel! Easy location just a short walk or subway ride to Penn Station.

title: Impressive and smart hotel
text:
Found this gem on a OTA for a decent price and lowered my expectation- needn't have worried, this little hotel 5mins form Times Square, 1 min from 5th ave and 10mins (each way) to Empire and Top of the Rock is very well located and the king deluxe room was impressive! Very large and the small touches like cookies each evening, a happy birthday card and wine, mini bar, iron & iron board, DVD player.... just perfect! Oh and they leave you an umbrella in case you need to borrow one!

We had room 802 on the 8h floor with a window overlooking 44th street... was so nice to hear the city coming into life!

Closeby,  try the deli beside Best buy.. it was so cheap! And next door Red Flame is a budget diner for breakfast!

The closest subway is 42nd Bryrant about 3mins walk. Penn station was a 15min walk up times square and Broadway.

Love this hotel ❤

title: Customer service
text: Great Customer Service and Location. My first time in NYC bellman De La Cruz was nice enough to recommend restaurants & nightclub as well made himself available as he worked over night. Overall great stay , will return to this location soon.

title: Stayed a couple times
text:
Stayed here for a week in January while working in NYC- it’s a great small hotel. Rooms are more spacious than other small nyc hotels- bathroom is huge. View is non existent- unless you like looking at a brick wall.
Restaurant associates offered a continental breakfast that ended up being the choice of 2 small items on the menu- very disappointed in restaurant.

title: ... bárbaro...
text:
Excelente localização... duas quadras da Times Square... meia quadra da Quinta Avenida... próximo a Grand Central...

Atendimento perfeito... camas e chuveiro excelentes... atenciosos no atendimento... certamente é de voltar...

title: Nice Stay
text: Great location and very nice staff. I was upgraded to a very nice room which was nice as we arrived late at night. Very well appointed and nice amenities. Treshawn and Jose were particularly welcoming and helpful.

title: Weekend Stay
text:
Conveniently located in Midtown. The room we had was large for NYC standards. The rooms seemed to be recently updated. Excellent water pressure in shower!

Nice clean rooms. Great service, and a delicious cookie every night left in our room. I will stay here again.

title: Buono
text:
Albergo pulito, personale alla reception sorridente e molto solerte ad esaudire le richieste, unico neo camere piccole, in tre con le valigie si fa fatica a girarci
Nel bagno, proporzionalmente più grande della camera, ci sono cortesie e buona biancheria.

title: Decent but not “Upscale”
text: I was slightly disappointed with this hotel. I was booked and prepaid for a ten day stay. When I arrived I was sent to a very small dark room. The bathroom was a great size though. There was no place to upack the closet was small and shared space with a refrigerator. After two nights in that space they moved me to a larger room. Better, but not great. There was an odd mix of design styles. A square table that was in the way and a Queen Anne style chair that looked lost in a modern hotel. Again, the bathroom was the highlight. Large and well done not somewhat dated. The drawback was sound. Not the horns and sirens of the big city but an especially randy couple down the hall. I know they were having a good time. Turn down service with cookies was hit or miss. The location was convenient to the theatre district.

title: Perfect location!
text: My son and I stayed at the City Club Hotel for 3 nights prior to his deployment.  This little hotel was great for just that.  It's a tiny little place so if you're looking for a huge room with superior views, this isn't it.  If you are looking for a quaint stay near the action, this is the go to spot.  The bed was a tad uncomfortable but that didn't ruin anything.  There isn't much space for your things.  We stayed in a queen room and had a tiny little closet, a little desk and a little night stand.  It was fine though because we didn't need a lot.  The rooms are stocked with a mini fridge (in the tiny closet).  There is no coffee maker in the room but there is a coffee shot across the street.  I was a tad shocked when they put not only the room cost, but $100 per night on your card.  I would have liked to have known that prior to arrival or in the hotel's description.  $300 extra dollars on a card when you're not expecting it is a tad steep.  Overall, we had a fabulous time and will stay again!

title: Séjour en famille
text: Hotel situé à deux pas de Times square. 2 chambres familiales communicantes, idéales pour notre famille de 4 enfants et très peu bruyantes pour New York. Cookies offerts tous les soirs, ménage fait tous les jours.

title: Caro e ruim
text: Viajo com certa frequência e esse sem duvida foi o pior hotel no qual me hospedei considerando a relação custo-beneficio. O único apelo é a localização, de fato muito boa, a umas 3 centenas de metros da Times Square. Afora isso pouco sobra. O hotel é antigo e mal adaptado a modernidade. Uma das camas do nosso quarto simplesmente desabou quando sentei no canto. O frigobar ficava dentro de um closet apertado. Para ter acesso a ele tínhamos que pedir ao nosso filho pequeno para entrar no closet de cócoras pois só assim era possível abrir a porta. O próprio closet era um algo improvisado aonde pouca coisa cabia. Os colchões (algo muito importante num hotel) eram apenas razoáveis em termos de conforto. O banheiro razoável, com uma pia antiga, sem balcão de apoio. O hotel nao tem uma academia de ginastica. Os acessos são ruins. Para um cadeirante, imagino a dificuldades de locomoção. Os preços (elevados) são completamente não condizentes com o que o hotel oferece. Não voltaria a me hospedar em algo assim, a não ser que não houvessem opções.

title: Difficult to locate it
text: Hotel was difficult to locate even when our taxi arrived at the GPS indicated location because the hotel name was very small and the entrance was narrow.  The reception area was small.  We booked a family suite for 4 nights.  It consisted of 2 rooms plus a short portion of the hallway.  One room had a king size bed plus a sofa bed.   The other room had a queen size bed plus a sofa bed.  Each bedroom had an attached bathroom, a small closet for clothes, a mini fridge, a safe and limited space for luggage. Clean rooms and clean towels.  Free wifi.

title: Sadly, it used to be great but, no more. :(
text:
I'm giving it one star because someone in the owner/management chain needs to wake up and start upgrading this once great boutique hotel. Sadly, not great anymore.  

City Club used to be one of the family's favorite.  My family stayed at City Club years ago, more than once, over several trips to NYC and loved it!  We have'nt been back in awhile, at least 3/4 years.  This hotel is apparantly that not being maintained, and being allowed to crumble, simply age, and fall apart. Everything from the unclean appearance of the sparse lobby (even though sparse, the lobby used to be squeaky clean)..to the elevator, rugs, door jams, peeling wallpaper, old mattresses with deflated springs,....nothing is being repaired, refurbished, repainted...nothing is being done!  The interior decorating is very nice but,  it is the same as it was years ago, and not being maintained. This hotel is sadly dying on the vine.  

Previous visits, used to find warm chocolate chip cookies at night in the room. No more.  

If you stay, do not get a room facing 44th street. Extremely noisy due to the original windows in place without any insulation from the breeze blowing thru the cracked window pane, and no insulation from the noise on the street.  I felt as though I was sleeping on the sidewalk outside.  Get a room away from the street if you stay. 

TV in the room did not work. Weak or no signal was the error on the TV screen. When I called the front desk, they grumbled about the storm, and when there was a storm the TVs lost signal. It was raining lightly outside. No major storm. Overcast. When I said , "Oh so you have satellite tv?"...the person on the phone had no idea.  Regardless, the next morning, despite no storm outside,  the TV still did not work. Same error. Meanwhile, when leaving the room, we saw the room next door had an operational TV.  Bad front desk service, and obviously no one really cared if the TV did not work.  It was not "the storm" .

Sadly, looks like the era of our happy stays at the City Club NYC are over. Time for us to find a different hotel.  We do have good memories of the City Club from visits of years past but, no more.  Good-bye CC.  It was fun while it lasted. City Club has now become Shabby Club.  The End.

title: Quiet, boutique hotel in the middle of the action.
text:
Right in the middle of Midtown this quiet, small, boutique hotel provides a clean and friendly place to stay. Hotel staff are friendly, rooms are clean and the pricing is fair (for NYC).
If you want a big hotel with all of the amenities - this is not your place. But if you want to be in midtown, be close to the action, but have a calm environment - City Club is a terrific spot.

title: Great location
text: Stunning location, lovely staff, all in all great value for money and a weekend we will definitely  repeat can only be recommended. This hotel is very close to 5th Avenue, Times Square and the theatre district of New York.  Lovely restaurants nearby including a great Italian called ceci just around  the corner.  Room a little dated but impeccably clean and very spacious, could only recommend

title: Nice Lil Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: We stayed here for a quick two day getaway. Our room was on the ninth floor. There was a balcony but very awkward as we did not have any views. There was a 5 foot tall concrete wall, but I guess that’s what keeps people from jumping over. Hotel staff was friendly doorman extremely polite. The hotel is very centrally located within walking distance to everything. Very affordable as well. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing location and staff!
text: The location was amazing. It literally took minutes to walk to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, but the rooms could use a little sprucing up. A keurig in the room or the common area on the second floor would be an amazing addition. Also maybe some prepackaged breakfast items that guests could grab on their way out in the morning would be great.

title: 良いのは場所だけ？？？
text: 場所は素晴らしく良い。ミッドタウンの真ん中。ブティックホテルになろうと頑張って内装もしている感じはします。しかし、狭い。本当に狭い。昔のニューヨークのホテルにありがちなやつです。コスパは悪いです。一泊45000円払えば東京の５つ星に泊まれます。5連泊もしてますし。まあ、需要と供給の関係だからここまでなら評価は3でした。しかし、泊まる前にバスタブ付きの部屋をリクエストし、メールではＯＫしながら当日になってそんなの出来ないと。証拠のメールを示そうとしたけどあまりのつっけんどんなフロントの態度に馬鹿馬鹿しくなり止めました。これで評価は1。フロント以外の従業員の態度が良いので2にアップしました。何れにせよ二度と泊まりません。

title: Otima localização
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado. Proximo a estacao de metro e a duas quadras da 5th Avenida ou da Times Square. Considerando os custos elevados do transporte e o transito caotico da cidade, isso é sem duvida uma grande vantagem. É possivel ir aos shows da Broadway a pé ou comprar ingressos na TKT e voltar ao hotel em minutos. Os quartos sao pequenos para quem vai com familia. Nao ha conzinha e o banheiro é um chuveiro com cortina (fato que produz alguma bagunça ao dar banho em criancas). O cafe da manha nao é recomendado. A internet funciona com alguma dificuldade. O pessoal da recepcao é muito prestativo e nos ajudou bastante. Nao se trata de um hotel luxuoso, o custo é elevado, mas para os padroes de Manhattan, uma otima opcao.

title: Great location, great staff!!
text: Our family of 5 - 2 adults, 3 teens had a great overnight stay in a deluxe double room at the City Club Hotel in November.  It is very hard to find a room for 5 that is not a chain and is so centrally located.  The room was large and clean and the daybed was made up (without asking) at check in.  We were greeted with smiles and the woman at the front desk was very helpful with printing our last minute show tickets. The complimentary continental breakfast at the restaurant next door was good - particularly the piping hot oatmeal with dried cherries and honey roasted almond slivers.  The cookies left in the room was a nice touch. The only (small) complaint I have is that there were only 2 cookies and 5 of us.  :)

title: First time in New York
text:
This hotel is in a fabulous location just a few minutes from Times Square, The Rockerfeller and Grand Central station. There are lots of places to eat very nearby which is perfect when your feet are sore from a big day seeing the sights!!
The staff are very friendly and helpful, the room was spotlessly clean. Super.

title: Very Central middle of NY
text:
Due to my arrival i nearly crossed the hotel without notice as the front was under construction  , bud never had notice any problem due the works , the staff was very helpful and kind .
Lot of attractions are on walking distance Times Square , Rockefeller Centre /Top of the Rock 
Some very nice restaurants around as well the Hard Rock Café , anyhow when I return it will be here

title: Très déçus par les chambres
text:
Hôtel très bien situé avec un personnel accueillant et gentil. 
Un restaurant en bas. 

Mais hôtel un peu vieux et surtout un système de climatisation / chauffage bruyant. 
J’avais une chambre donnant sur l’arrière du bâtiment sur la petite cours. 
Donc aucune vue et bien au contraire les bâtiments à côté et en face à 3m de distance donc oppressant. 
La climatisation de l’hôtel fait du bruit et même lorsqu’on éteint celle de la chambre on entend les clims des chambres et immeubles voisins. 
J’ai donc passer 5 nuits dans cet hôtel sans ouvrir la fenêtre et avec le volet baissé pour ne pas voir les occupants des bâtiments en face. 

Par contre le bon point est la salle de bain qui est belle et spacieuse.

Vraiment dommage. 
Déçu.

title: Fantastic stay during business trip
text: Came here for business, and was upgraded to the nicest Grand Duplex suite at the hotel. What a surprise! This suite is to die for!  Overall, the rooms are a little outdated but it only adds to the charm. The bed was super comfortable, very clean, location is truly unbeatable and the staff was overly friendly and helpful.  Definitely a great place to stay steps away from Times Sq!

title: Perfect
text: Visited with our 21 year old son for a week. Simply amazing. The room was spacious for three adults. Close to most attractions and transport. Staff could not do enough to help. We loved our stay here. Clean. Polite, friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely stay again.

title: Good for what it was
text:
I reserved a duplex suite.  Prepaid in January for an October visit.  At check in I was given a normal King room.  Front desk said none of my room types was available.  Very disappointing for a trip to New York for my wife's birthday.  We'd been looking forward to this for 10 months.

On the plus side the bathroom was quite nice with good water pressure and a deep bathtub.  The restaurant attached to the hotel is really quite good.  Perhaps the best eggs Benedict I've had.  

I won't be going back.  They had one chance for their first impression.  With plenty of choice in NYC, my wife and I will go elsewhere next visit.

title: Good Value in Midtown - Would Stay Again
text:
I struggled whether to give this hotel a 3 or a 4 rating, and decided on a 4 because of the quality to price ratio -- i.e., the hotel is a very good value and I have done a lot worse in New York City at similar or even higher price points (I'm looking at you Yotel and Algonquin, two of the most horrible hotels I have ever had the displeasure to stay).

I was in New York during a week with very high hotel rates and was despairing about whether I would be able to find somewhere semi-reasonably priced when I stumbled upon a last minute deal for City Club. 44th Street is a great location - right in the heart of things, but a relatively quiet street -- and I have previously stayed at the Algonquin (horrible), the Sofitel (was once nice, but I have refused to stay there for a couple of years after I got a horrible room, badly in need of refurbishing, for over $500 a night) and the Royalton (another hotel not showing its age well). However, despite being a 44th St. veteran, I had never previously stayed at City Club.

Given the price I paid, I opened the door to my room expecting the worst, but was pleasantly surprised to see that the room was not a shoe box and was nicely laid out with a huge bathroom. There were a number of nice details, like an ironing board that popped down from the closet, a nice mini-bar hidden behind an attractive painting, a robe in the bathroom, a full length mirror in the bathroom and plenty of space in the bathroom to lay out toiletries (the latter being hard to find in New York except at very high end hotels). 

The problem with the room -- an interior Queen -- was that there were only two small windows, both of which looked out at air shafts, so the room was quite dark and the interior lighting was not bright enough. One afternoon I tried to read in the room and even with the windows open and all the lights on, there wasn't enough light and I had to add a flashlight in order to see the text. (However, on the positive side, because the room looked out on air shafts, it was dead silent at night and you would never know you were in the middle of Manhattan). The shower in the room was heavenly, but rather than a glass door, there was a half door/shower curtain arrangement which did not contain the water, leaving the bathroom a wet mess after my shower.

I'm a person who generally likes to spend a lot of time in my hotel room when I travel, but on this particular trip, I had meetings from morning until night and thus didn't spend a lot of time in my room. So the room turned out to be fine for this particular trip, but I wouldn't have been as happy if it were a trip where I wanted to hang out in the room during the mornings and afternoons and work or relax.

I stayed 7 days and for the last 2 days asked if I could move to a room with more light. For a $25 nightly upgrade fee, I was moved to a King room facing 44th Street, but that room turned out to have some downsides as well. The King room was bigger and since it was not an interior room, did have more light, but it still wasn't bright and sunny because the smallish window had scaffolding in front of it and just looked across the way at the building across the street and 44th Street is a fairly narrow street. Surprisingly, the bathroom and shower in the King room was smaller than the bathroom and shower in the Queen room, although the King room shower, despite also having only a shower curtain, didn't flood the bathroom when I took a shower.

The King room also had the downside that instead of the mini-bar being tucked behind a painting, it was placed in the closet, which made it awkward to get to and which cramped the closet space. The other problem was that you couldn't open the closet all the way because of where it was placed in the room -- when you opened the door, the door was blocked by the angle of the day bed in front of the window. It was the final two days of my trip and I had moved from another room so I didn't bother unpacking and instead lived out of my suitcase, but that closet would have been an issue for me if I had been placed in that room initially. Also, the angle of the closet made the ironing board on the closet door unusable.  I didn't need to iron anything for my last two days in the hotel, so it wasn't of consequence to me, but still something to note.

The biggest problem with the King room was that it was much noisier than the dark interior room and you could hear street noise from 44th St. This particular room was also right next to the elevator, so you could hear guests loudly returning to their rooms late at night. I didn't think the room was worth the $25 a night upgrade and asked to be moved back to an interior room, but alas none were available.

Housekeeping at the hotel was great and I loved the turn down service and the delicious chocolate chip cookie they bring you each night from the db Bistro restaurant downstairs. If you leave housekeeping a tip, they write you a nice handwritten note thanking you, which was not something I had ever seen before and which I thought was a nice gesture.

I tried laundry service and it was good and efficient.

The staff at the front desk was very pleasant, as was the doorman who helped me with my luggage both coming and going.

Some neighborhood tips -- the Red Flame diner is a door away. I have seen people on TripAdvisor rave about what a find the Red Flame is and I guess it is okay if you are a family of 5 looking to save money, but the omelet I had there was horrible. If you are by yourself, do yourself a favor and pay $3 more for an omelet at db Bistro, the restaurant attached to City Club, and you will get a delicious, properly made omelet. db Bistro also has excellent "Reserve" wines by the glass which they serve using the Coravin system, so you are getting pristine wine. Pricey, but worth it for a splurge. I also had breakfast one day at Gaby Brasserie next door at the Sofitel because I love Gaby's egg white, asparagus omelet. Again, if you like good food, much better than the Red Robin diner.

All in all, I would stay again at City Club despite the room issues because the location is great and I would rather spend my money in New York on good food and wine than on a super high end hotel room. Yes, you can get a much better room in New York, but be prepared to spend a couple hundred dollars a night more for it. So far, City Club is the best hotel I have stayed at in New York at its price point.

title: Excellent!
text: Great position and close tobTimes Square. Very comfortable beds and a decent room. Fresh cookies left in the room each day. Fresh lined similarly. Great staff. If I had o e wish, it would be s nice bar to relax in, ad opposed to the restaurant with room to just about sit at the Bar!

title: Four stars - I don't think so
text:
I'm not sure if this hotel is going for a rustic charm or just poorly maintained.

The first impressions we got when we walked into our room was this is OK, but, it quickly went down hill from there. The closet was small, half of it was taken up by a 30 deg shelf which was obviously covering something but made the closet unusable to store bags etc.

The bar fridge that was also located in the closet had a freezer section that couldn't even keep 4 ice-cream sandwichs firm/frozen.

Next I opened the window shutters to see if we had a view and I nearly died from the stench of rotten mouldy wood. When I tried to close them, I thought they were going break with how much force I had to use.

The air conditioner was noisy, the beds weren't too bad and while the bath room looked to start off with, it soon came apparent it would very tired and need renovationing.

It took some photos of the cracks in the basin, the taps that had been cleaned so many times the brass was showing. The shower had an old fashion plastic shower screen and my kids managed to flood the bathroom but seeing it had no drain in the floor the water ran out to the carpet. Looking at the bathroom door and carpet, this isn't the first time this has happened.

The lifts haven't been inspected since 2014, but where inspected every year prior. The lifts were very noisy and I always wondered if I was going stop working when we were travelling in them.

The front desk we very friendly and professional but the maid service never gave the right number of face washer for the five of us staying there, even after asking the front to remind them. They did not leave spare toilet paper when there was only a third of a roll left and we had to get the front desk to bring some up.

They also did not notice the tissue box being empty, so we had no tissues on the last night.

Finally at the end of our hallway there was a large curtain, when I pulled it back to see view all I found was a damaged wall with bits of wall paper hanging from it.

All I've got to say is I'm thankful there is a lot to do in NYC as I would like to be stuck in that room, awake, for very long.

title: Fabulous
text:
Loved this boutique hotel in central Manhattan and an easy walk to time square.
Our suite boasted 2 levels. My daughter slept in a pull out bed and had her own toilet and we were on a mezzanine level with large bedroom and lovely ensuite with excellent shower.
Our small balcony overlooked the busselling street below which added to the charm.
Great front office team who were had an extremely accommodating approach.
I believe this charming hotel offered excellent value in this prime location .

title: This One’s a Find
text: Ideally located in the heart of Midtown, yet on a relatively quiet street - at least compared to 6th Ave. Very friendly staff in the lobby, prudent daily cleaning in rooms, comprehensive amenities in bathroom etc. Double queen bed room was large on a NYC scale with views towards 44th str. QPR was outstanding! Will be staying again.

title: SINIESTRO Y DECEPCIONANTE
text: Nada que ver con la imagen que venden. La limpieza brilla por su ausencia. Oscuro y siniestro. Nos hemos ido a otro hotel perdiendo el importe prepagado. No entiendo las críticas buenas que tiene tanto aquí como en booking.

title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff and Excellent Location
text:
The City Club hotel was a great choice for our stay in New York.  The hotel is located in Midtown and is an ideal for base for exploring Manhattan.  The staff were very friendly, check in and check out was very smooth, with no surprises.  The room was kept spotlessly clean throughout our week's stay.  The beds were very comfortable and we found the Duplex suite to be extremely spacious and a relaxing place to rest after hours of exploring New York.

The restaurant and bar next door was also very special, well worth a visit whether or not you choose to stay at the City Club.  We had a great stay at the city club and I would highly recommend it for families and couples alike.

title: Excellent staff, great location, lovely rooms!
