text: My family of five including 3 teenagers went to NYC for the weekend and City Club Hotel was the perfect place to call "home". The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (everyone we encountered) and the location was perfect for exploring Times Square, Rockefellar, Central Park and Broadway. They upgraded us to a lovely suite with a balcony and 2 floors which was so unexpected and exciting. They even delivered delicious cookies at bedtime.  The beds were comfortable, rooms very clean and even the linens and toiletries were extra luxurious. Easy parking at the garage across the street and you can walk most anywhere from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, it's an excellent value for the price and the staff can't be beat!

title: Excellent location
text: If you are visiting Manhattan and would love to live in the heart of Times Square, this is the hotel to stay at. Nice, neat & clean rooms. Great staff, very helpful and kind. I had cookies in my room every evening for free.  It has the best location, accessible by foot and is a total value for money.

title: Céntrico
text:
Supongo que por precio no se puede pedir más. En España no pasaria de un 2-3 estrellas . Habitación en mi caso sin vistas y con el espacio justo para 5 personas (2 camas y 1 sofa). No hay salones y solo una mínima recepción. 
Lo que es cierto es que está en pleno centro en el barrio de Broadway a 5 min. De Times Square y como te pasas el día en la calle no necesitas muchas comodidades en el hotel.

title: Perfecta ubicacion
text:
Si te gusta más el centro claro!!! Pero advierto.... el encanto de New York son sus barrios ;)

El hotel muy bien y cerca de cualquier tipo de transporte. Lo mejor es la amabilidad y simpatía de todo el equipo del hotel.
Volvería a este hotel si vuelvo por aquí.

title: Ok hotel.
text:
Family of 5 and booked 2 rooms, we stayed for 4/5 days in 20-25th Aug 2018

Small hotel, just a couple blocks away from times square. 

The room was very outdated and tiny, with no kettle or complimentry water but they did have free cookies everyday!  Sleeping in the room at night was very noisy, not sure weather it was the street noise or the AC. The carpet was abit dirty, and very small hallways and lobby downstairs. 

The location of this hotel was great! & in close range to loads of different attractions as well as being in walking distances. We didnt have breakfast here but they do have their own restaurant connected to downstairs. 

Overall I wouldnt stay here again due to the size and interior as well as noise at night.

title: Great Hotel for Family of Five!
text: We booked the adjoining queen rooms- the rooms were very large (by NY standards) and contained a queen or king bed, and then each room had a very comfortable window seat bed that was long enough for our tall teenage son. The location is ideal- being so close to the theaters we saved so much money by not having to take the subway everywhere. It is just a block and a half from Times Square, which meant tons of restaurants, shops, and theaters were literally five minutes away. The staff at the hotel were incredibly nice and so helpful- they had dining advice, car services, and even printed up our flight boarding passes for us for free! We will definitely be staying here for all of our future visits.

title: Hôtel un peu ancien mais superbement placé
text:
Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel. Faire un choix à été compliqué et nous avons opté pour un compromis sur la situation de l’hôtel et les notes des utilisateurs.

L’hôtel est à la hauteur des notes, ni plus, ni moins. 

Le personnel, surtout les femmes de chambre, est hyper sympa.

Maintenant, les chambres auraient besoin d’être rafraîchies, et les clims refaites complètement. Elles fonctionnent, mais soit trop, soit pas assez, et le bruit qu’elle génère est juste ÉNORME !!!  

Les chambres ne sont pas super bien isolées non plus. Si le silence est important pour vous, passez votre chemin.

Ceci dit, notre chambre au 9eme (901) avait un balcon, plutôt sympa même si la vue était un peu « bouchée » par d’autres immeubles. 

La vraie valeur de cet hôtel tient en son emplacement ! A 2 rue de Time Square, il touche la 5ème avenue, vous pouvez commencez votre visite de New York à pied à partir de cet hôtel...

title: Great Location and Excellent Staff
text: We staid there for 5 days with our 2 kids. The location was excellent, The room was clean and the staff was very helpful and welcoming. The air con worked perfect. There are few thing which has to be improved: WiFi- sometimes can't connect and more impotent, it is about the time to change the mattresses in the twin beds.

title: Excellent place
text:
very convenient location, friendly and helpful staff.
Nothing to complain about - everything was just right. We (family of 4 plus two dogs) stayed for 2 nights (7/14-7/16). Room was big to accommodate all of us, there are plenty locations for breakfast around the hotel. Parking is across the street which is very convenient.

title: Great for famly of 5, great location and price
text: We stayed here two weekends ago.  We were lucky enough to get the big, fancy room that is displayed on their webpage (the 2 level suite with a terrace view of the street.) Our stay went well, no issues.  We are a family of 5, and it is hard to find a reasonably priced place to stay with that odd number.  I was pleasantly surprised that our room was HUGE, 2 levels, and fit 5 of us very well.  This was our first trip to NYC and I was not sure about the location.  It is 2 blocks (a very short walk) to the heart of time square, and you are close to several subway stations.  grand central station is about 4 blocks away.  there is a lot to do within walking distance.  also, there was a diner just 2 doors down that was EXCELLENT for a family.  Ok, getting back to the hotel.  The hotel itself is cute but it did seem as if it is due for renovations soon, the carpet looked a little old, but that is about the only negative I can say.  our room had a lot of facny details. hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful when we spoke with them!!  we did not eat at the food place in the hotel (or next door) because it seemed a little expensive for a family, but would be great for a romantic, couple dinner. I would definitely stay here again.  For the size and location and price, can't beat it.

title: Bon service et situation Idyllique
text:
Hôtel est idéalement situé à 2 rues de Times square, et à proximité des différentes lignes de métro, ce qui permet de se déplacer facilement à travers tout Manhattan. 

Les chambres sont petites, vue sur le mur de l immeuble d’en face, mais bon à NY, elles ne servent qu’à dormir et se laver! Elles sont bien isolées et équipées d un mini bar, climatisation/chauffage, La literie est de bonne qualité. Moquette au sol bof. Sdb sympa avec WC, nécessaire de toilettes fournis.

Le personnel est souriant, très sympathique et fera tout pour vous contenter. Un cookie est offert tous les jours vers 17h. Les lits sont faits, les serviettes et nécessaires de toilettes sont renouvelés tous les jours. 

Collé à l’hôtel, un bar/restaurant permet de se restaurer ou boire un verre.
Petit dej testé : 16$ (taxes et services compris) pour du pain ou brioche, beurre, confiture et café ( a volonté je crois). 
Sinon en face de l’hôtel il y a un Gregory’s coffee (chaîne type starbuck). 
A quelques rues (35 ou 36th street) ne louper pas andrews coffee shop qui fait des pancakes à tomber! 

Petits points négatifs :
-fumer à NY est assez compliqué, j’ai sélectionné cet hôtel qui indiquait un espace fumeur...en fait c’est sur le trottoir. Mais c’est toujours mieux que bien des hôtels qui interdisent les cigarettes à 25 pas de leur entrée. 
-le site précisait que la chambre comprenait un coffre-fort...mais non, Déception!! Mais le personnel a accepté de mettre dans un coffre, nos espèces et passeport avec toutes les mesures de sécurité possibles (compter ensemble et apposer sur le dessus le contenu de l’enveloppe et nos signatures, et copie pour nous et eux). Nous les avons bien embêtés je pense, mais ils sont toujours restés patient et aimable. Pour nous c’était quand même pénible cette perte de temps à chaque fois que nous avions besoin d’argent (il n’avait pas toujours tous le code du coffre).

Je recommande cet hôtel, pratique, un bon rapport qualité prix!

title: The little things let this place down.
text:
Stayed in May

The motel is located a couple of block from time square.  The subway is also only a couple of blocks away.  You can walk to a lot of major destination from here.  For example, Rockafella Centre, Empire State Building, Madison Square Gardens.  So location wise its not a bad choice.

Room was small with a view of an air shaft and a thin gap between some buildings which provided a small glimpse of New York. The bathroom however was large nearly half the size of the room.  Shower pressure was acceptable and it was clean.

However, the little things let this place down.  Upon arrival an hour after checking our room was not ready.  The toilet got blocked and over flowed.  When enquiring later that afternoon if it had been fixed, the reply given by the front desk was "Did you report it", I said, "Yes I did"  with their reply, "Well it should have been."  Not ever professional.  I'd like to know if I'm walking into a mess/smell before I get back to my room.  The elevators are also very slow.

You also have to have an eagle eye to find this place.  Its a very narrow entrance of no more then 3 meters with a small, 'city club' sign.

Overall just an average motel.

title: 뉴욕의 중심 가까운 호텔
text: 객실은 굉장히 깨끗하게 준비되어져 있으며, 더블베드 방을 예약을 하였는데, 이층으로 나누어진 즐겁고 생소한 경험을 할 수 있는 호텔이였음. 리셉션은 좁지만 사람들이 드나들기 쉽게 되어 있으며, 직원들은 상당히 친절하다. 뉴욕에서의 위치는 44번가로 42번가나 타임스퀘어 등이 다 주변에 있어서 가깝게 걸어 다닐 수 있어 위치 적으로는 좋은 호텔.

title: Very comfortable hotel with great customer service!
text: We were very happy at City Club!  From the great location, comfortable and quiet room to the friendly front desk and doorman!  We enjoyed the boutique style and size of this hotel.  Our room was spacious enough for 3 with good use of space!  The washroom was beautiful too!  We never had to wait for an elevator which was an added bonus!  We would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Nice place to stay
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 8 days. Location is great - right in the middle and easy walking distance to almost everywhere. Rooms where clean and comfortable. Reception always friendly and helpfull. 
Did not book with meals so can’t comment on that. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text:
Ya me había hospeadado ahí anteriormente, a mi me gustan  los hoteles pequeños, más íntimos y este para mi es una buena opción. 

La ubicación es excelente, está ubicado  entre la sexta y la quinta avenida y está muy cerca todo, la biblioteca, el Moma, Estación Central, Rockefeller Center, Time square, Central Park,  etc.. 

El restaurant que les da servicio es muy bueno, súper atención y la calidad de los  alimentos es muy buena, ya que en NY no se come bien.  

Me he quedado por trabajo y me acompañaron mi marido y mi hijo y se han sentido muy agusto. 

El uncio comentario es que en mi habitación todo el tiempo se escuchaba el sonido de un aire acondicionado, a mi marido y a mi hijo no le molestaban... 

El personal es amable pero no te sientes asfixiado. 

Muy recomendable.

title: Nothing Short of Amazing
text: This hotel has been so amazing and kind to us. The staff has been truly outstanding! I want to personally thank Razia, Jevante, and Daniel. They have gone above and beyond for our family and our stay here. Our room is very cleaning and they always do a great job cleaning it. We have all had such a good trip staying at this hotel.

title: Nightmare ...
text:
Currently on my second night in a suite and yet again my a/c is not working ... to say I'm disappointed is an understatement - the hotel fire stairwell is colder than my room! 

I've been loyal to this property for the past 10 years when business and pleasure brings me to New York, but never again. To be paying for a premium room and forced to sleep on a sofa by the balcony window (and listening to construction noise all night) is beyond unacceptable.

title: Fun for family
text:
We stayed four nights in the Grand Duplex Suite which I found for a good price many many months in advance on another site. 

The location of this hotel is perfect for first time visitors or families who want to be near the touristy end of things: Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, Bryant Park, etc.  It is reasonably close to subways.  Cabs seemed to be in abundance too. 

The room is two stories so that in itself was pretty fun and memorable for my kids. Having a balcony was pretty neat especially at sunset. Kids said the pullout couch was comfortable but one adult would sink it.  The hotel had set out a rollaway bed but we didn’t use it so we asked it be removed for more space and they did. Loved having a half bath on the first level. The full bath upstairs is gorgeous. The king bed comfortable. Everything was very clean but a little aged but I didn’t mind. It was all in working order. 

One note of caution: this room is very, very loud. The street noise you would expect but it’s amplified because you trade off pretty, older windows for zero soundproofing. And the walls to the other rooms must be paper thin. You could hear anything above quiet talking. So the guy talking on his phone, the kid playing at all hours of the night, the parents squabbling - heard all of that as if they were in our room with us. I made a noise complaint call once and the front desk called them right away so I appreciate that. The staff is very friendly and helpful. 

Overall I would recommend for location and the uniqueness of the room.

title: Very Average
text: We had a family room as travelling with three teenagers. The room was tight, but we didn't expect a huge room in NYC. 2 small doubles and a day bed which was just about big enough. The fixtures and fittings all dated, chips out of bedside lockers, beds have seen better days. While on the face of it, the room seemed clean, I dropped something behind the bed and had to fetch it, to discover it was deep in dust and dirt, clearly a long time since the cleaners went behind this particular bed with a vacuum cleaner. Service was generally ok after some confusion at login about payment in full having already been taken at time of booking. Noisy with street noise owing to the original (authentic) windows, but wasn't expecting a library. Needs a bit of investment and attention to detail. Only average.

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel bien placé, personnel agréable et très à l’écoute.j ai eu un petit problème de chambre et ça a été réglé très rapidement tout est bien , comme souvent à New York les climatisations sont bruyantes à part ça c est super chambres propres lits confortables

title: Personal amable y servicial. Muy buena ubicación entre la 5a. y 6a. avenida.
text:
Al entrar al hotel, la recepción de no da muy buena impresión pero luego la atención es amable , la habitación confortable aunque la insonorización deja que desear. La limpieza muy buena y el baño con un buen tamaño.
Dos ascensores que funcionan rápidamente con un mínimo tiempo de espera.

title: Mais ou menos
text: O hotel é perfeitamente localizado. Excelente para quem quer passear por NY. No mais, é pequeno e velho. Fiquei em um quarto queen, de bom tamanho, mas era antigo e faltava manutenção. Meus pais, porém, ficaram no quarto standard.... Impossível. Nunca vi um quarto tão pequeno, mal cabia a cama. Um hotel que pretende ser de qualidade jamais poderia ter um quarto como este, um absurdo. As camas eram boas, o chuveiro ótimo e a internet Ok. Bom café da manhã. Não recomendo entretanto. O hotel é três estrelas no máximo e, nas proximidades, já fiquei em hotéis melhores e de mesmo valor.

title: GREAT LOCATION AND STAFF
text:
As mentioned in the title, the location of this hotel is superb, only a few blocks from Times square, the theatre district and many other attractions. Upon arrival the staff were quick and efficient at check-in and were extremely helpful with all our questions and gave some great tips, this continued throughout of 5 night stay. At the end of our trip we had a full day before we was collected to go to the airport and the staff was more than happy to store our cases for us until we had to go. 
I agree with some of the reviews that the hotel does look a little tired and is in need of some TLC but it was clean and everything you need when your in New York, for the amount of time we spent in the room it was fine. We had a queen luxe room, the bathroom was spacious and this includes the shower, never got the reasoning why there was only one bath robe though, not that we had time to lounge around in bathrobes! We had fresh cookies left for us daily which is a nice touch.
Just a few niggles.. the view from our room, oh dear the worst hotel view I have ever seen (lucky for us we hardly spent any time in the room so just left the blinds closed) nothing like the views shown on the website! 
The toilet was extremely noisy, I am surprised our neighbours didn't hear it flush, again this is just a minor gripe! Overall this hotel is good value for the price. If you plan to spend all your time in your hotel room whilst in such an amazing city then maybe try a different hotel, but if you are in New York to explore and have fun, you can't go wrong with this place

title: THEY STEAL FROM YOUR ROOM - do not book a room with this hotel.
text: A shopping bag with about $300 of merchandise disappeared from the room, conveniently the day before check-out.  When I went to complain, they just simply told me that there was nothing they could do.  It was Saturday and I had to leave NY so I could not stay much longer arguing with them.  I asked to speak to the manager and they told me that the manager does not work on the weekends.  So I asked for his phone number and they gave it to me. I left approximately three voicemails in one day and he never called me back.  So I wrote an email to explain the situation and now, after three days, he still has not answered. Not even to apologize for the bad experience I had with the hotel. This is unacceptable. Do not reserve a room with this hotel!

title: Superb boutique hotel in mid-town/theatre district
text:
I really have to wonder what hotel some of these negative reviewers stayed at, because it was not the City Club where I stayed for four nights. Every single person I interacted with was pleasant and helpful, and went out of their way to provide excellent service.

The price was good for the area (check out the Algonquin if you don't believe me), and if you have some flexibility, you can score a great deal. Keep in mind that many of the less expensive hotels in that area only provide a shared bath. 

The petite room was compact, but still quite roomy for one or two people, with a large, tiled bathroom (shower only) with bidet, a modest desk and comfortable chair, three-drawer bedside cabinet, deep built-in shelves for folded clothes, books, electronics, etc. The small closet was amply supplied with wooden hangers, and included a table-top ironing board and iron. They even provide a lovely terry cloth bathrobe and an umbrella to use while you stay -- and a fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie every evening! The room was very quiet; I almost forgot that I was in New York. 

I only have two criticisms : No coffee maker and not nearly enough outlets at the desk for electronics. I like a cup or two of coffee first thing in the morning, but I'm not about to pay a $10 delivery fee in addition to the price for a pot of overpriced room service coffee (all room service at all hotels is overpriced). A simple power strip under the desk would take care of the outlet issue. 

I would also say that they'd sell far more of the snacks, drinks, and alcohol if they dropped the prices by 1/3.

title: We will NOT be coming back to this hotel!
text: Terrible experience. It is not worth the money. There are several other hotels in the same location. The hotel has an extremely old decoration and no maintenance (look at the pictures). No matter what problem you have, it can only be dealt with the manager who is only there during business hours (when you are out touristing). The staff was friendly, but that is not enough. Will not go back.

title: Lovely stay, great location and very friendly staff!
text: The hotel itself might be a little old (especially the rooms), however, this does not take away from the fantastic stay we had there last week in May. The rooms were perfectly clean, had comfortable beds and delicious cookies. :)  For a family with two grown-up kids, it was a perfect outcome to have two seperate rooms that were connected with each other. The hotel is located in the middle of the center, 2 minutes walking from Bryant Park - a great location for breakfast. The staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful!  We would defintely recommend this hotel!

title: New york city vacation
text:
I find the hotel very old. 
The rooms are too small to accomodate 3 person with 3 luggages. 
We can hardly move inside the room
The a/c unit i bit noisy
All the staff are very helpful and nice
Price at usd265.00 is cheaper compared to other hotel with similar location
5 to 10 mins away to the center of broadway

title: Thank You Amazing Customer Service
text: Thank you for the concierge service Jose de la Cruz me n the family enjoyed all the restaurants New York has so many options so diverse will be back in July To enjoy more great food n the never ending funny train rides Love is Family

title: tired and tatty
text: Disappointed with my recent stay at the City Club. I stayed there primarily because it offered rooms with an outdoor terrace in a part of town that I needed to be staying in. Despite booking two months in advance and specifically requesting such a room, and then following up with a call to confirm this request a month in advance, when I arrived I was not told that there was no such room available for my first night, with the hotel's response to my complaint being that "requests cannot be guaranteed". To be fair to the hotel, they put me in an upgraded room for my first night, and then moved me into a room with a terrace for the rest of my stay. However, both rooms that I stayed in were tired and tatty. The furniture on the terrace in my second room was dirty and the "cupboard " in the room was basically a small space carved into the wall which also housed the minibar and a tiny safe that was difficult to access. Basically, in my opinion, the hotel offers barely three star facilities at four star prices. It is long overdue a renovation. I would not stay there again.

title: Un excellent séjour
text:
Il s'agissait de notre cinquième visite à Manhattan et sans doute la meilleure expérience en terme d'hôtel.
Très bien situé, entre les 5e et 6e avenues, il permet la visite à pied la plupart des sites touristiques de Midtown et alentours.
Nous y avons occupé la chambre 607, très confortable avec une literie de qualité et une salle de bain spacieuse.
Le personnel est très serviable, disponible et d'une grande amabilité avec un General Manager très réactif et attentif au confort des clients.
Nous n'oublierons pas les délicieux cookies qui nous attendaient chaque jour à notre retour en chambre en fin de journée.
Les petits déjeuners sont servis au "Bistrot moderne" , endroit élégant  et  avec un service efficace.
Un hôtel que nous avons déjà élu pour notre prochaine visite à Manhattan.

title: Un cauchemar !
text: Hôtel réservé Fin septembre, 3 contacts téléphoniques, même le jour avant notre départ,. Le jour de notre arrivée, à l'aéroport JFK, nous apprenons par mail, que notre chambre duplex, pour 3adul et 2 enf n' est plus disponible... Pas un sorry, tirez votre plan...

title: Excellent
text:
Après avoir eu un petit soucis la première nuit, l’hôtel a été très réactif et nous a fourni une chambre de remplacement très confortable.
Nous avons également pu bénéficier des petits déjeuners au restaurant le bistrot moderne. Ceux-ci étaient excellents. L’accueil a été parfait. Nous tenons sincèrement à remercier la direction pour tous les efforts qui ont été fournis à la suite du souci que nous avons rencontré la première nuit. 
La suite familiale qui nous a été proposée en remplacement était très confortable et parfaite pour une famille de cinq personnes . Les salles de bain sont spacieuses est très agréables. Nous espérons pouvoir revenir très prochainement dans votre établissement. Encore merci pour tous vos efforts. 
Excellent emplacement

After a little trouble the first night, the hotel was very responsive and provided us with a very comfortable replacement room.
We were also able to enjoy breakfast at the restaurant le bistrot moderne. These were excellent. The reception was perfect. We sincerely want to thank the management for all the efforts that have been made as a result of the concern we experienced the first night.
The family suite that was offered as a replacement was very comfortable and perfect for a family of five. The bathrooms are spacious and very nice. We hope to return to your hotel very soon. Thank you again for all your efforts.
Excellent location

title: Fantastic
text: You have certain price to ‘what you get’ expectations when booking a hotel in Manhattan. I have to say that the city club is a brilliant choice. Perfect location, wonderful staff and a big room with lots of space (you can’t often say that about nyc hotel rooms). For that alone I recommend it whole heartedly.

title: Perfect location!
text:
Stayed here in March with family to celebrate my Aunties 50th birthday.
Superb location a stones throw away from Times Sqaure.

Great interconnecting rooms so we could keep the middle door open to have a through hallway into each other's room.

Hotel staff were fabulous and a big shout out to Linda on reception. Couldn't do enough to help with any questions we had and also got us a cab early one morning in the pouring rain. 

Towels and beds changed daily. Great hotel to explore what this great city has to offer.

title: Top Notch Customer Service in the heart of Midtown
text:
This was our second stay at the City Club Hotel in NYC and I continue to be impressed with the location, room, and top notch customer service. Our first stay was in June of 2017. We upgraded upon arrival from a petite room to a king luxury. Even in the middle of midtown, our room was silent at night. Beautifully appointed with a luxurious bed and chocolate marble bathroom. Very clean and well maintained. Individually controlled thermostat, fantastic water pressure, and nice toiletries made the room perfect! Each employee we encountered was professional and made us feel like we were their top priority. Special thanks and acknowledgement to the phenomenal Alfredo at the front desk. 

During our stay on March 24th, we realized just how wonderful the City Club is to its guests. We were booked into a nearby hotel with a group only to find out that there was a water main break and the hotel was flooded. We quickly walked to City Club and explained our situation. To our delight, Alfredo was at the front desk and remembered us from our prior visit. He quickly eased our fears and was able to place us in a remarkable room for the night. In true manner of excellence, Alfredo made the problem his own and found a solution which will forever make us return to City Club. 

Our room was a very large double on the 6th floor overlooking 44th. Quiet and clean, it had two closets, wonderful beds, 2 night stands, a beautiful dining set for 2, oversize bathroom, and an extremely generous daybed / window seat. The shuttered windows opened onto the street for a nice vintage feel. Daniel was quick to deliver our bags and wonderful the next morning in holding our luggage while we took in the city. The highlight of our stay was our time spent in the fantastic City Club Hotel. I highly recommend Alfredo and his team for their top rate customer service and high standards. Luxury accommodations in the heart of the city!

title: Ottima posizione
text: Ho soggiornato in questo Hotel nella settimana di Pasqua.  Scelto su Booking  si è rivelato un'ottima soluzione per rapporto qualità/prezzo. Il soggiorno è durato sei notti. Il personale è  gentile ma non parla italiano; la cucina è da evitare perché molto cara esattamente come  la colazione. Quest'ultima non era inclusa nella mia prenotazione e mi è capitato di pagare un caffè espresso (che ho portato sola in camera)  più di sei euro.  La posizione è a due blocchi da Times Square quindi fantastica: a pochi passi dalla vita di New York. La mia camera non aveva il bidet, ma ho trovato ferro da stiro con relativo asse, phon e relativo kit di cortesia completo di tutto. Agli italiani ricordo gli adattatori per le prese elettriche.  Lo consiglierò ai miei conoscenti.

title: Nice hotel right near Times Square and all the action
text: Booked the family suite with two rooms and wasn't disappointed.  No complimentary coffee or breakfast, but we knew that when we booked.  Parking lot right across street for $52/day no in and out was a bit inconvenient, but you are in the heart of Manhattan, so all bets are off on parking.  One negative was no one showed up from our call to the front desk on checkout day for ice and luggage...so we left without ice and carried our own bags.

title: My 50th birthday with my sister and 3 nieces
text:
This place is amazing close to all New York can offer.
The rooms are spacious beds are comfy maid service every day.
The staff are so so friendly especially Linda who couldn't do enough xx
Receptionist are so welcoming amazing xx
Shower wow xx
Room wow xx
Definitely go back to this hotel amazing words cannot describe New York xxx

title: Amazing lovation
text:
Stayed in the City Club hotel for 5 days for my first visit to New York and couldn’t ask for a better location. 

The lobby is small, but perfectly sized and the staff are really friendly and so helpful. 

The rooms are more than adequate and have everything you need - I’ll most definitely stay here again on my next visit (unless I become a millionaire and fancy 5 star - but highly unlikely)

If you want a place to stay that is close to the tourist attractions that you want to visit, here is perfect (2 mins walk to Time Square)

title: "Fantasic Hotel! Splurge & go for the room with the stairs!!!
text: Ive stayed in many hotels in Times Square and i will say,  this is by far the favorite great customer service great big rooms and wonderful Location!! Staff very helpful and great customer service! _katie/amy

title: Comfortable room, great location
text: I booked this hotel at the last minute and was very pleased. The midtown location was ideal, the room comfortable and ample; a big bathroom too with a tub. Check in was easy and quick . The hotel is small and virtually no wait for elevators. Plenty of good restaurants nearby. My room was very quiet even in this busy part of town. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: perfect set up for traveling with our teen daughter and her friends
text: Excellent location, a couple of blocks from Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal.  Quiet but close to 5th Avenue shopping and a long block or so from Times Square. Plenty of restaurants and subway stations are close by.  We had adjoining "queen rooms," which turned out to be a queen or king room and a full or smaller queen bed room.  This fit our group perfectly.  Adults in the room with the smaller bed.  A small group of teens in the end room with the larger bed.  Both rooms had an additional daybed and a private bathroom with a bidet.  The adjoining part was a small anteroom/foyer that connected both rooms to the hotel hallway.

title: SMOKE SMOKE and MORE SMOKE!!!
text: Checking was a breeze, however when I arrived to Room 206- it smelled of smoke!  I called down and was offered another room,  again room was definitely previously occupied by a smoker!  Not to mention the hallways smelled Of marijuana smoke!  Rooms were both very dated, carpets were stained , and bathroom tiles were dingy!  Truly felt like I was in a brothel! Staff were all friendly—-quite unfortunate!  Bed was comfortable however, I had very little sleep due to the smell!

title: Molto scarso
text: Htl posto in posizione centralissima a soli 5 min a piedi da time square. La stanza era ampia. Staff dell'hotel molto gentile e disponibile. E qui finiscono le note positive. Le stanze son fatiscenti, arredate male, completamente da ristrutturare. Pulizia estremamente scarsa. A parte la posizione sconsiglio vivamente la struttura

title: Fantastic on all points
text:
Wow, this is a GREAT pick. It ticks every box. Excellent, central location and very walkable to a lot of things like Rockefeller, Grand Central, 5th Avenue Shops and much more.

The room (King) was huge by NYC standards. We traveled with our 5 year old son and the hotel staff had the sofa converted into a comfy bed on arrival without us even asking, fantastic!

The room design is pretty clever and fun. The way they've made use of every nook and cranny is pretty impressive. The mini bar is hidden behind a painting on the wall, the closet door is nearly invisible and blends in with the wall, etc. 

The staff were all very friendly. My only few, small complaints were the noise of the plumbing. When you flush the toilet it's excruciatingly loud and shrill. Fortunately though, the rest of the room is super quiet. We didn't hear our neighbors once during our stay.

My other, very small, complaint is the doormen. I know it's winter and it's cold, but more often than not they were standing inside at the front desk chatting with the reception staff rather than tending to the door. They are super friendly though and have great suggestions on best and cheapest transport options.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Midtown area. We will most definitely be staying there next time we are in NYC!

title: Location was wonderful
text:
The room was very small..but I would definitely stay there again...Was in walking distance to 2 different subway stops.  Walked to Broadway plays and Times Square.
The staff was exceptional and very helpful.

title: Really HARD to find
text: The placer is almost impossible to find unless you squint your eye and see the tiny "CC" sign in front of the door or recognise the place from the giant Sofitel next door. I wasn't really concerned about the appearance of the lobby or anything as I was only in New York for a short business trip, but overall the first impression after I got up the creaky old elevator (scared me everytime) dimly lit, haunted looking hallways of the 9th floor (maybe add some more light?) , the room was actually pretty decent with everything intact. The bed is clean and soft, the bathroom is pretty big in New York standards. I wouldn't stay here again, but it wasn't that bad of an experience.

title: Great location
text: I love staying in a hotel that is close to Bryant Park and the Broadway theaters. I always want a room with 2 double beds, and this hotel fit the bill.it was spacious, and the bathroom was great! I always need a frig in my room, as I have meds that need refrigeration, and all the rooms here have a frig!

title: Hyggelig personale
text: Vi ble møtt av en kjempe hyggelig resepsjonist, og de passet på bagasjen vår og gav oss et kart og anbefalte steder til oss. Det var flotte og smakfulle rom, gode senger. Vi bestilte frokost på døren og den smakte fortreffelig.

title: Excellent place
text: Stayed in City Club Hotel on 12/25/17-12/28/17. I really do not have any complaints like others. Excellent location, friendly staff, pets are welcomed - Bryant Park is two blocks to take your little friends for a walk. Parking is across the street - we left the car there for three night and pick it up after we checked out. Paid approximately $150 - surprisingly affordable. By the way - check in and check out process is absolutely painless. Our room was clean and very convenient. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Not friendly
text:
It was a long trip to school for my son ...Just From Moscow to NYC .. It took it three days! With two stops because it was a snowstorm in NYC . And City Club  was third hotel where he must spend a night before last way to school. It was also hard time for me and my family because we was worried very much and we have 8 hours difference between Moscow and NYC .. I payed 111$ with Hotel Tonight for 1 night , get hem 100$ toked to hem and get sleep because in Russia was deep night. 
So.... He spend 3!!!hours in lobby to try wake me ! Because persons who worked tell hem : or I make deposit 100$ on your credit card or give me 250$ cash !!! 
My son 16 years old .. So.. If he didn’t phone to me he will sleep on the street after all 3 days trip ?????
Now I tell not about hotel rules (through in Grand Hotels nobody asked me 250$ cash for one night!) I want tell about human relation !!! You employees don’t know that it! 
I think it was not good story even I you have so strong hotel rules .

title: Top star hotel and staff!!!
text: Arrived very late on 26th/27th Dec staying for 4 nights and greeted by a very lovely Linda. Amazing customer service and everyone couldn’t do enough for you. 2 adult and 3 children in a double double room on second floor. Couldn’t fault the room. All staff made this a wonderful experience for our family and can’t give them enough praise! Walked to Bryant park- Times Square- Central Park. Walgreens around the corner.  Nice to have a hotel just off the busy areas . Every morning gave Linda our itinerary and within minutes step by step plans were posted through our door!!! Thank you city club hotel and Linda for making this a break of a lifetime!!! The Owens thank you all!!!!

title: Excellant !
text: The room was a good size and clean. " Elliot " at the front desk went Above and Beyond to cater to all our needs, and he helped us with every need! Thank-you so very much Elliot, you deserve a raise and a Bonus! This hotel still keeps a few rooms for smoking guests which went a long way with us. We will certainly stay again every time we are in the city, as long as you keep a smoking room open to us! It was very close to times square too. Very pleased. Went from December 23rd till December 26th. 5 Stars

title: thank you Elliot Foster for making our stay a success
text: a great location in New York, close to everything, good restaurant in same building that also covers in room dinning, nice room service, small room but very clean, nice and helpful people at the reception, great all around.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text: I stayed here for two nights, and the overall experience was awful. I was assigned a petite room, which was really petite: my height is 5'5" but my feet was dangling over the bed! And the room was so dated and small that I could hear the door slamming, people talking in the hallways etc. Also there's only one electric outlet you could use. On the first night I was abruptly woken up by a call from the front desk saying some family came to visit me. I said, "Who?" and they were like, "oh, maybe it's not you". Seriously? It was 3:30AM. I was so mad and so tired that I just hanged the phone. And after that long ringing and ridiculous conversation I couldn't sleep afterwards. They ruined my night's sleep completely. Now, if this was a legit 4-star hotel, they should have apologized to me the next day. When I went to the front desk in the morning, they were clueless. Even if the night-shift front desk assistants have finished their part-time job and left, they should have communicated amongst themselves to cover for the accident. Unfortunately I had to explain everything, and all they did was to offer a breakfast voucher for tomorrow. When I told them I don't need that (because I usually have one apple for breakfast) and rather I would like to move to another room, they told me I should pay $25 more. They've done things wrong and wants me to pay? I declined and decided to stay calm, trying to understand that these things can happen... just to realize that after I came back to the hotel room in the afternoon, the housekeeping came in. I put the sign "Do not disturb" but I guess they don't know what it means. Privacy please! They even took the bath mat and didn't replace it. Then later they called me again and asked me "You need room service, right?". Excuse me, I said " DO NOT DISTURB" can't you read? It's just so ridiculous. 4-star hotel? Are you kidding me? I moved to another 4-star hotel right after this, and oh boy, their services and the rooms! I've been traveling to NYC on a regular basis and also other cities around the world and this hotel should be a 2.5 star or at most 3 star. Just go to another hotel if you want to get some respect as a guest.

title: Money has been taken
text: I stayed two days in the hotel. It is quite good hotel (not 4 stars). In my way to leave the hotel in haste cos I was afraid losing my flight, I forgot some money and items in the safety locker and I remembered that in my way to the airport. So I contacted the hotel and infromed them that a guy will come to receive my items which suppose to be safe and bring them to the airport. I was really worried about losing my jewelries and finally I received my things in transparent zip bag  (any one can see the money and that could attempt any one to steal it). I was in hurry and I didn’t count them (as an usual habit) but I counted them in the airplane (I felt some thing wrong) and I discovered that the money is shorted 100KD which equals almost 331 USD. In any hotel the customer items shoud be safe because honesty is a quality of high stander hotel. I know how much I have that is first. Secondely, I know the driver who picked up the money and I got his car and phone number. If he tried to steal money, he would be caught. Thirdly, my items were in the locker with a code no body knows it (I was alone in the room). If there is no honesty and loyalty for the work and  no respect for the customer’s personal matters, then it is not qualified hotel to stay in or to choose. I won’t recommend that hotel at all. Don’t waste ur time even to view it.

title: Loved it!!
text: My bf likes to stay at Marriots bc he can use his points and we usually do. I booked this on price line and not knowing what to expect was nerve racking. Im a freak for cleanliness.  I loved this boutiquey hotel. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful. Avail food and water in room came in handy for a midnight snack. Huge bathroom and ambient lighting in our room. 2nd night we had fresh cookies when we returned late. Location was 5 star and the D&B Bistor breakfast was to die for. All around perfect holiday vacation. Just adorable. Would stay again. Thanks!

title: On our way to Paris!
text: We were upgraded to the two story suite and received VIP service through out our stay! Wonderful staff and clean environment! They are excellent at recommending things to do in NYC. Much better to stay in a personable boutique hotel @CityClub

title: Delightful and Exceeding all Expectations
text:
I am writing to rave about the wonderful experience I had at City Club recently.  A regular,  who has spent about 6-8 nights here over the last 6 months, it was a pleasant surprises to get such a lovely upgraded suite this last visit.   Check out the pics. 
Peter and his front desk team really aim to please. Always greeting their guests by name and making you feel like THE most important guest in the place!
Rooms are super comfy and TV comes equipped with more channels than most. Including all the obscure ones on cable and every sports channel, too. 

Breakfast in DB is a treat as well.  If you’ve found a better hot oatmeal, ANYWHERE, please. tell me.  It’s incredible! 

I’ll be back !

title: Tranquilo y muy bien ubicado
text: Fuimos 6 adultos y nos hospedamos en dos habitaciones conectadas. Cada una con su baño, que era bastante amplio. Las habitaciones limpias y cómodas. La ubicación perfecta, a 5 minutos andando de Times Square pero en una zona sin nada de ruido. El personal simpático aunque la recepción no puede ser más básica, nos costó un poco reconocer la puerta del hotel. Volvería.

title: Best customer Service
text: My mom stayed in the city club for her 65th birthday n lost her iPhone n Jose Delacruz found it n returned it to her n on her last day he paid for her taxi to the airport I love New York City Thank Thank you Thank you so much Cruz Thank you

title: Cozy boutique hotel in an excellent location!
text: The title above says it all!!! This is a small hotel tucked into a prime location within easy walking distance of all the downtown sites.  We were very lucky to get upgraded to a king room which was still small compared to "normal" hotel rooms but the unique layout managed to fit in a good sized closet, hidden bar fridge, desk, couch and a bathroom with a full size tub!  The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no view from the windows (we looked out onto a brick wall) but we were not there for the view from the room!  The staff was amazing on both the day and night shift - always pleasant and helpful.  We could not have been more pleased - I will recommend this hotel to everyone!!!  And yes, the homemade cookies in the evening are a nice touch!

title: Great Thanksgiving trip
text: I have stayed in the city a lot with my two older kids as well as for for work so know hotels there fairly well. This was a hidden surprise for us. Location of course is perfect for parade etc we needed to get to, but the room was bigger then expected, beds were great kids lost their mind over the shower and barhtub.  Staff could not have been nicer. Will absolutely look them up before I look anywhere else next time I’m in new york.

title: Amazing Customer Service!
text:
The front desk supervisor, Elliot Foster, is amazing! He took my booking error and fixed it immediately without any hiccups. His humor and kindness during my moment of panic was so greatly appreciated and should be what everyone in the hospitality business strives to be. 
Can not recommend this hotel enough - the people are what make a stay special.

title: Not as expected
text:
The first thing that I noticed was there was no "real" lobby, but I was expecting one because there was a doorman.
The staff was extremely nice from the doorman to the front desk staff to the staff who brought warm cookies every evening. The room had a very big bathroom but the room was smaller than expected with no "real" closets & no dressers. The location is great!!

title: Perfect place for us
text: My daughter and I came to visit NYC.  This was a great stay.  The room was a nice size and completely clean.  There was a day bed type setup already loaded up with sheets and blankets for my daughter. The bathroom was huge and had tiled walls which was very nice.  Everything was very clean.  The best part, however, was the friendly words we got from the staff as we left and returned...well, the cookies each night were pretty good too.  The only issue we had was no closet or place to hang our clothes.  Not a big deal.  A great value stay.

title: Top service
text:
Un hôtel idéalement placé à quelques centaines de mètres de Time square 
Le service client est remarquable par sa gentillesse et sa disponibilité 
Les chambres sont d’un bon standing 
Nous n’avons pas tester la partie restauration en sachant qu’il y a de nombreux restaurants de toutes sortes aux alentours 
Pour le pdj nous vous conseillons Junior’s qui se trouve à 200 mètres de l’hôtel; un pure Dinner

title: On the fence
text:
I'm on the fence about this hotel.....

The Good:

Location!  2 blocks from Grand Central Station.  3 Blocks from Times Square.  The location is really good.  

Staff!  From the minute we walked in, we were greeted with smiles and by friendly and professional employees.  Every time we walked in or out, it was the same, they were fantastic!  They even let us store our luggage the day we left for a few hours after check out.  Nice people.

The not as good:

The room is amazingly small.  I mean really small.

The room is also quite dated, the wall paper is peeling, dirty looking and just kinda gross.

Oddly, on the 7th floor, our windows opened all the way up. (Room 709)  One could jump right out if they wanted, which is unusual for me to see in any hotel.

The hallways are very dark.

The in between:

We did not stop at the bar/restaurant in the hotel, but it looked nice.

The bed was comfortable, yet the mattress was way small in length.  I am 6'2" and my legs seemed to be hanging off by like a foot.  My wife is 5'1" and she was toughing the end.

So, on the fence with this place.  Good and not so good.   Would I stay again, probably not unless by myself.

title: מיקום מצויין
text:
המלון ממוקם ברחוב , יחסית, שקט ממש בקרבת הטיימס סקוור. המלון קטן, והיחס של הצוות מאוד מאוד אדיב ואישי. כל מה שהיינו צריכים, הם עשו עבורנו את הבירורים וההזמנות. החדרים סבירים בגודלם יחסית לניו יורק , והחדר נקי ומאובזר. 
קיבלנו ארוחת בוקר חינם מהמלון, אחרת לא שווה להוסיף כסף או לאכול במלון. יש דיינר ממש ליד המלון...

title: Excellent customer service & location
text:
We booked to stay in the family room with our 5 kids! It was ample space for the 7 of us as well as 6 suitcases! 
The location of the hotel is wonderful, right in the heart of the NY buzz and within walking distance to Time square, Broadway and the subway! Plenty to do and see just in the immediate area even for anyone who doesn't want to brave NY traffic to get anywhere else. If you're an avid walker, you can walk further to see the Empire State building etc. 
The highlight of our stay at this particular location is actually their customer service. Very genuinely friendly staff and nothing was ever too much for them. We have stayed in many many hotels and airbnb properties all around the world with our kids and often having that many kids isn't welcomed nor liked. This was not the case in this hotel. 
We had a slight accident with our youngest where he fell and cut open his head on our last night here and the hotel's concern and response was wonderful and kind. They assisted us in every way possible to attend to our son's emergency flawlessly. 
Thank you to all staff and the front office Manager who made it his business to come out in the morning to check up on our son. 
We will definitely be back.

title: Don’t use this hotel ever
text:
I booked a room to my family: 2 adults and 2 kids, 3 nights October 6-9 2017. Eventually I had the option to change or cancel the reservation up to 24 hours prior of the arrival.
I called in to change the arrival from the 7th through 9 October, and eventually the unpleasant situation started.

1. I was charge for the canceled night without any notification, I’m talking about US$400.
2. Once we checked in, the receptionist gave us a key, when we stepped in to the keys with brown people and stuff in the room.
3. We return to the reception, we received the new room - I did not fit the entire family, fit only two of us. 
4. The receptionist told us I’m sorry this is the only room I have you have to find a solution to squeeze into this room, the room was with only single bad that they’re a live feed two adults, they expect the kids to sleep on the floor on the mattress however even the mattress could not fit in. I have to find friends in nyc to have our kids.
5. Once I found the manager the only thing he said is “I’m sorry”.

title: would not recommend
text: First of all, the room was tiny. Second, a dripping faucet all night made for a poor night's sleep. The bed was reasonably comfortable but there was only one side table, which is inconvenient for a couple sharing a bed. I would not recommend this hotel or stay there again. I found it to be overpriced for the value.

title: Needs TLC
text: The hotel rooms are small - but that is NYC.  However, to have a hotel room with only 1 accessible outlet - located in the bathroom - is bizarre.  All other outlets could not be reached or accessed.  Also, the cleanliness of the room was questionable.  Restaurant in affiliated with the hotel was fine, but take some advice - go up the street and you'll find a diner with very acceptable food at very modest prices.

title: Amazing, Center of NYC
text:
We had the best time in our suite @The City Club Hotel living it up in the center of New York City!! Why would i ever want to go to a big stuffy Hotel in New York city when we  can all enjoy ourselves at a boutique hotel!! So much better!!
The service the location and the cleanliness five stars!
FYI,  I tried to put this at the bottom on TripAdvisor web pg. ,but it is not accepting it correctly.
Happy New Year to everyone in the world

title: Horrible
text:
First things first, the hotel is an older hotel with minimal renovations. 
First day in my room maybe 30 minutes after I got in some random guy opens my door as if this was his room. Yes his key also worked in my room, comes night time I'm relaxing watching tv in the room and I see a rat running around my room!!!! 
Brought it up to management and this was as if nothing was wrong to them. They changed my room unwilling and said the next day they would have to change me again since that new room was booked for the next day already. 
Following day comes and in the new room it smells like an ashtray . I do not smoke nor I want to wake up to the smell of cigarettes!!! Horrible horrible horrible ! They spray some clean smell scent to cover it up. The toilet in the room was backed up. The breakfast was limited to 3 options and if you wanted anything else (including a bagel) it was out of pocket. 
The room had a broken door handle that I made sure to bring up to management because I did not want to be charged for it.

title: Complete disappointment
text:
We booked a family room which was supposed to be one room with two double beds and one with one double bed. We got connecting rooms with one king size and a hide-away bed and in the other room one queen size and a hide away bed. The kids ended up sleeping in one hide away bed in our room and I asked the housekeeping to make the bed with two covers and two pillows which apparently was impossible. The hair dryer didn't work, there was only one bath robe ( for 4 people) and the shower wasn't working properly. 
The carpets were partly dirty, walls were extremely worn down and there seem to be a problem with mice/ rats in the walls as there were sounds of these at night. 
The only thing good about this place was maybe the location. Other than that, I cannot recommend this place at all. So not worth the price and definitely not 4 stars more like 2.

title: First impression:  friendly staff & clean hotel in a GREAT location
text: The staff was so genuinely friendly, we felt welcome right away.  The hotel is in a super convenient location, the room was really nice with everything we needed, and even the extra couch/bed was very comfortable. We were extremely satisfied with our stay at City Club hotel!  The price was high but it's New York so we expected to pay more.  It was well, well worth it!

title: Best ever hotel !
text: I chose this hotel because of its prime location between Grand Central and Times Square. The wonderful surprise was the very friendly and helpful staff ! They were all so great! They made our trip even more memorable! The room and amenities were very good. I highly recommend this hotel !

title: Ci torneremo sicuramente!
text: Albergo molto carino a due passi da Times Square, molto pulito e il personale molto gentile e disponibile! La reception è gestita da ragazzi gentilissimi che ci hanno sempre dato ottimi consigli e portano ogni giorno portano dei biscotti nella stanza dopo le pulizie

title: VERMIN IN ROOM ALERT!!!
text:
My family and I stayed here the weekend of August 25, 2017 and, much to our shock and disappointment, discovered mice / vermin traps under one of the guest beds!!!

When we approached hotel management about this issue, they not only advised us that they could not find us alternate accommodations, they did not even attempt to deny the presence of the traps!!!

It is now more than 24 hours since we made light of the issue and we have not had as much as one call from management regarding this irresponsible, offensive and potentially harmful health hazard ...

For those of you looking at staying overnight in New York City, please do yourselves a favor and stay as far away from this place as possible!!

Michael G. Velazquez, Phoenix AZ ...

title: Nice, affordable hotel minutes from Broadway
text:
Stayed here a few days while visiting the large Apple, seeing shows. A nice find. 

Of course for  NY, and Europe, hotel rooms are small. My room was as well, though a surprisingly large bathroom. Estimating, the main area was 11' by 15', the bathroom 6' by 11'.  When staying in these smaller rooms it makes one wonder how much space is actually needed. Not a lot really. 

Stayed alone, with a full bed. This room was great for me, but too small for a couple, cause of the bed. Very clean. Quiet. Staff quite friendly, smiling (that maters), chatting up the theatre with Pete. Tiny street lobby though apparently a larger one on the second floor. Looked forward to the fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie awaiting me each night. 

I timed the walk (yes, I do that) from Broadway, the heart of Times Square. Around 4 minutes. (One busy intersection may add a tad if hit a red light.) 

My work schedule caused me to book late. I typically book direct through the hotel (don't know why), now and then using hotels.com. Ended up getting a "secret" rate or something. Total around $550 for 3 nights. Great deal. 

Price always matters. Assuming can get a good deal  would highly recommend. I have stayed in grand hotels here and there, with large rooms, stunning lobbies. But for value and such in NY, this hotel is impressive. 

Originally intended to book Hotel Mela on the same street but  because I had to delay booking, price jumped $100 over night. But that is less than 2 minutes from Broadway, gets good reviews, and also seems reasonably priced. Lobby seemed fine. Another to consider and price.

title: Disappointed-will never return
text:
2.5 stars.  Friendly front desk staff for the most part.  One gentleman did not even look at us when we spoke to him, not sure of his role, but he was in business casual and behind front desk.  
Day 1 consisted of finding out we had a broken boxspring.  The mattress sagged into this area.  The doorman kindly assisted us by finding 2 pieces of plywood and inserting them until it could be fixed/replaced.  We were not offered another room or replacement bed.  
Day 2, no follow up on the bed.  I had to call front desk again and was told 'an email was sent' and said  'oh...its not fixed?'.  We were offered a discount for both nights and were assured it would be fixed the next day.  
Day 3-bed was not fixed....again, no follow up care call.  Was not offered a discount for day three.  Woke up at 3:30 am to the sound of a crinkling bag.  I turned on the light only to see something was moving inside the bag, then a mouse scurried out.  We were mortified and at 4 am packed up and checked out.  It was dark and we were exhausted.  Did not have  a good night sleep on any of the nights we stayed (beds were extremely uncomfortable).  Since there was an incredible amount of walking during our stay, all we hoped for was a restful sleep...which didn't happen.  Old noisy air conditioner.  Carpets not the cleanest.  You'll get an instant musty old smell in the hallways, although rooms smelled ok.  Linens were clean.  Once we lifted the mattress to see why it sagged so much we noticed little black speckles of something on the boxspring, which we now know to be rodent feces.  Never again will we book a 'no name' hotel.  Learned the hard way.

title: Again, spot on
text:
Visited again, this time with family, and can only confirm my previous review.
It's nice to go back to your room at the end of the day and always find a smiling face waiting for you.
Nice comfy rooms as usual, great bathroom and consistent good service. Good toiletries too.
Small elevator but works fast.
Had an issue with our room and we were promptly moved to another room. This does make the difference between first class hotel management and the rest of the world.
Again as in all NYC if you want a super quiet room you have to ask for a back room. But that's NY.
Will go back of course.

title: Il mio viaggio a New York
text: Ci siamo stati 5 notti. L'albero gode di una location strategica ideale! A pochi passi da Brian Park, da Broadway, dalla 5th avente, dalla magnifica Time Square! È molto ordinato, impeccabile nella pulizia, nel cambio di biancheria, nella fornitura giornaliera dei prodotti da bagno . La stanza piccola ma accogliente , con letti alla francese, moquette pulita,climatizzatore funzionante.Il personale disponibile ma non allineato al costo del soggiorno prenotato con Booking. Abbiamo dovuto ricontrollare il conto con l'inconveniente della scarsa comprensione dovuta alla lingua.

title: Not satisfied
text:
When arriving the room was not ready and I had to wait another 45 minutes, small waiting area.
Room was spacious, carpets partially dirty.
Well situated but too expensive. I don't think to come back to this place again

title: Great Stay
text: I loved my stay at this hotel. When I first saw it I thought I'll have a terrible experience here. But I loved it.  The Location is great. To be honest the only thing I hated about this hotel was the sink. Friendly and really helpful staff. When I visit next time, I will definitely stay here.

title: Perfect Location and a Hard to Find Fit for a Family of 5 in NYC!
text: I booked City Club pretty much blind. I'd never been to NYC, knew nothing about where I wanted to be, uptown, midtown, etc.  This was simply the only room I could find that would fit 5 of us in one room on my budget.  It also had great reviews from families and about the location.  It was PERFECT!  We have twin girls and a teen boy, so the double bed and daybed in the Deluxe room was a great fit.  The beds were comfortable -- even the day bed.  Room was bigger than I expected, even had a closet and fridge.  Bathroom was well appointed.  Lobby was pretty underwhelming in appearance, but the lobby staff was friendly and helpful.  This was a great place to stay in  NY.  Just a few blocks from the theaters and Times Square, but quiet and felt very safe.  Would absolutely stay there again.

title: Oportunistas y abusivos. NO VAYAS!
text: Hace un tiempo escribí una opinión acerca del hotel cuando aún estaba hospedada ahí. Y todavía no había terminado mi estadía... Todo marchaba bien. Yo estaba conforme... dos días antes de regresar hubo una nevada muy grande. Todo New York estaba colpsada. Muchos vuelos cancelados. Y lamentablemente teníamos que quedarnos dos días más. ERAMOS 5. Fué en ese momento en el que me sentí estafada. Se aprovecharon de la situación climática y nos pidieron 640 dólares por CADA NOCHE EXTRA por la habitación que costaba en realidad alrededor de 200 dólares. No les importó nada. Triplicaron el precio y nos vimos obligados a salir en medio de la trormenta con mis 3 hijos a buscar otro hotel. SON DELINCUENTES. ELIJAN OTRO LUGAR!!

title: Royal Treat
text: The room was very royal, but a bit small. The bathroom would give you the royal feel and added to that you have a mini bar in your room! The staff was very nice & friendly and they keep your luggage in cloak room before your check-in and after your check-out which was very  advantageous for us as we would squeeze in to see other attractions of the city not bothering to carry our luggage after we checked-out! Definitely would look out of room at this hotel next time! :)

title: Svært godt fornøyd med oppholdet
text:
Min familie og jeg overnattet en natt på city club hotell. Vi booket hotellet på bakgrunn av anmeldelsene på bla tripadvisor. Og vi ble ikke skuffet. 

Beliggenheten er helt super og alikevel litt utenfor det verste folkemyldret. 

Rommet var stort og mer enn god nok plass for vår familie på fem. Kanskje ikke det mest moderne , men fremsto som bra.

Personalet vi møtte var ekstremt service minded og gjorde sitt til for at vi skulle ha en god opplevelse. 

Prisen var heller ikke noe å si på i forhold til Nyc. 

Anbefales!

title: Great rooms for a great price
text: We shared a couple of rooms, and they were both great. None of the beds felt weird at all. Housekeeping even leaves cookies for you when they are done cleaning. Very friendly staff also help out as much as they can with booking and other arrangements. 5 stars.

title: Nice and Great Location
text:
Our family of 8 stayed 1 night here.  We found the hotel b/c we were looking for something close to a play in Broadway/Time-square area.  I'm glad we found this hotel.  It was clean, only 2 block from the heart of Time-square, but you felt far enough away.

It is really convenient to walk all around Times-square and shopping on 5th avenue.  We didn't use a taxi once.

The staff at the hotel is super friendly and helpful.  The check-in area is small, they utilize space really well.  Check-in process was less then 3 mins.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite which was perfect.  3 beds, 2 bathrooms and plenty of space.

Our room was quiet and at the end of the hallway, probably the furthest from the elevator, but it was only 5 doors down the hall.  So all rooms are easily accessible.

Rooms were very clean.  We went and had dinner.  Upon arriving back the rooms were turned down and chocolate chip cookies were left for us.  Nice touch, kids loved that.

I would recommend this hotel.  The location, space, how much per night it was, all was great!

title: Very good for a small space.
text: Very nice small room with a great shower.. Very helpful staff and great location. Little pricey, but worth it if you like comfortable spaces. Close to time square and food. Would highly recommend to anyone.

title: Peccato
text: L'hotel ha una posizione molto buona e centrale, è un po' datato ma tenuto abbastanza bene, il problema principale per noi è stato che ci avevano dato una camera per due persone nonostante fossi in tre, come da prenotazione, arrivati le 11,00 di notte dopo quasi un giorno di viaggio abbiamo dovuto adattarci con una aggiunta di una brandiva che quasi non entrava nella stanza. Per andare in bagno dovevamo saltare la brandiva. Ci hanno cambiato la stanza il giorno dopo ma ancora non avevano capito che eravamo tre e mancavano accappatoi e asciugamano.peccato perché poi il personale è stato gentile anche se non molto competenti specialmente alla reception..

title: grande arnarque
text: Ayant régler mon sejour avec un tour opérateur l'hotel a quand meme débité ma carte bleue et impossible pour eux de me sortir une facture lors du chek up. Ils m ont dit que jamais rien a régler de plus alors qu ils vont débité de 80E sans mon accord et ni fcature! a bannir de vos hotel

title: No todo es lo que parece o se comenta!!
text: Cuando entra a un hotel que reservo lo primero con lo que se encuentra es con el Lobby y muchas veces nos desilusionamos al ver que es pequeño, y pensamos, si así es el lobby como serán las habitaciones. Pues bien, como dice el dicho, "No hay que juzgar a un libro por su portada.." En este caso quiero hacer justicia a este Hotel. En muchos comentarios se ven fotos sobre detalles que no hacen a la estadía. Pensemos que los hoteles en New York, mas específicamente en Midtown son hiperconcurridos y la mayoría habitaciones diminutas. En este caso realmente me sentí sorprendido cuando entre a la habitación. Muy por encima de la media en tamaño, aplia, con caja de seguridad, frigobar, y el protagonista el BAÑO, super amplio con bidet y excelentes amenities. Si bien no es económico, se puede decir que una excelente opción con na ubicación excelente. Sin dudas volvería. El personal es Maravilloso y hay gente que habla español.

title: Love the home feeling
text: We stayed there for one night during the Memorial Day Weekend. My kids LOVED the room. Because we are a large group, we stayed at the suite. Not only it has a home feeling, the hotel also has its own character. It is also convenient to walk to the Broadway Theater and yet it is far enough from the craziness and noise of Time Square. We will definitely stay there again!!

title: Une nuit pour deux oui, sinon aller voir ailleurs !
text:
Nous étions 4, réservation sur Booking. Nous avons réservé une chambre pour 4 comme indiqué. 
A notre arrivée l'accueil est agréable, l'entrée dans la chambre moins. 
Il n'y avait qu'un seul lit et un canapé. Pour 4 amis c'est étrange de n'avoir qu'un lit ! Après signalement la réception nous dit qu'ils vont transformer le canapé en lit, mettre des draps etc et faire un lit en plus à côté. 
A notre retour un drap et un oreiller était déposé sur le canapé, je présume que c'est à nous de faire notre lit ! 
Et à côté un matelas sur roulette était disposé, lui aussi avec un drap et un oreiller. Celui-ci était disposé de manière à ce qu'on ne puisse plus rentrer dans la salle de bain soit dit en passant. 
Si le service est embêtant vaux mieux pas faire hôtelier !!! 

Emplacement idéal néanmoins. Pour une nuit à deux pourquoi pas mais pas plus. 
PS : WIFI GRATUIT NE MARCHE PAS SAUF DANS LE COULOIR

title: Room with no view
text:
The room was clean and comfortable but windows on both sides of the small room gave very little light never mind a view - claustrophobic if you spend anytime awake in your room.
Staff were very friendly and helpful - although a request for a late check-out was mat with a snarled response of NO

title: Stay away horrible mangement and service
text: Unfortunately its not worth the money for paper thin walls on your  31st birthday******* the staff was rude and aggressive looking to blame nosie complants on anyone they deemed gave that vibe.... So me and my husband soldier on for my b-day, we wanted it 2 be postive*. Being we day 1 more day and a room that was a night 800$. Well i up woke the next day and i had bites on my face and hands..... When i brought this 2 their attention, they said its the weekend we have 2 talk 2 our manger...um ok but i clearly have bites. No soultion so i spent all day looking for a new hotel.... I ending up going 2 the london hotel that day!!!(and cancled my last day with them) the london saved my birthday!! Treated me right w respect and gave me more amenties for cheaper w better room** I even stayed 2 more days ,2 make up for this hotels straight, disregarded for customer service and emotional harm ** them care none for their customers!!Anyway while at london i recived a phone call from my bank about a fee for nosie complaint... Unreal so i told them what happen sent my pictures**  the forms from my doctors proving they were bug bites!!  Well my bank made me whole agian( got my money right back)** then i got a horrable phone call from the manger! which i wanted 2 talk 2 on saturday(moring when i woke up with bug bites at the hotel), but wasnt there!!Well it was wednesday now** she called me up 2 tell me i was wrong and cused at me... Horrable* Anyway if i could give no circles i would* ty for ruining my birthday* shame on you* beware stay away!

title: Clean, friendly business hotel
text: I stayed at the Club City for one night during a business trip. The staff was very friendly, efficient and gave me an upgrade. Room was clean, comfortable and very good anemities. The in-house bistro looked nice but I did not use it.

title: Bargain in a good location
text: Comfortable and right next to theater area.  Db Bistro next door provides very good meals.  Some rooms small, but bathrooms I have seen are large.  Have stayed here 4 times and sent friends.....  Occasional glitches with the very young desk staff are addressed and corrected quickly...they go out of their way to help.  Occasional noise from cleaning and service staff...but generally quiet with comfortable beds.  Best of all...good prices for NYC. Be aware that taxis are sometimes scarce especially at dinner & theater-time - because there are so many hotels on this street.  The upside is - more places to eat! Walk to 5th (downtown or South) or 6th uptown (North) to find transportation more easily.

title: Very cool older small boutique hotel
text: I recommend upgrading here.  The regular queen rooms as very small (NYC small). The bathrooms are all new and gorgeous.  The rooms themselves are hip and retro and you just get into it.  After one night in a small double queen room we upgraded to the two floor suite.  It has stairs and a balcony, master bedroom and two bathrooms.  It was luxurious and perfect for the four of us!  My husband and two kids.  The large room didn't disappoint, it impressed!  Also great location to Times Square, midtown shopping, and Broadway.  Front desk people were nice and the in house restaurant which provides 24/7 room service was also great!

title: excellent emplacement
text: l’hôtel est situé a quelques pas de times square. Salle se bain en marbres, la literie de bonne qualité, les chambres sont de bonne taille.  En fin d’après midi des cookies tièdes vous sont servis gratuitement. Le personnel est très sympathique. Hotel très confortable

title: City Hotel canceled reservations less than 24 hours before arrival
text: We booked two adjoining suites several months in advance. We booked far in advance so there would be no surprises. We confirmed the reservations the month prior to arrival. Less than 24 hours before arriving the City Club called us to say that only one room would be available. So, we booked several months in advance and then City Club left us scrambling to find two adjoining suites at another hotel with less than 24 hours notice.  They even had the audacity to charge my credit card even though they canceled the reservations. The only reason this hotel gets one star is beause you can't leave zero stars. We booked reservations and we were charged for the stay but there was no room for us. Now I am out thousands of dollars for having to book at another hotel last minute. Not even the smallest apology from City Club. Unacceptable.

title: City Club Hotel de NY
text: Hemos pasado unos días en este hotel,las habitaciones no son grandes,como casi todas en NY,el baño en cambio si era enorme,tenía hasta bide.A cambio es muy tranquilo y se duerme muy bien.Es un hotel pequeño muy bien situado,el personal muy amable y atento,el restaurante no está mal,un poco caro algunos platos que no se justificaba,pero bien en general.La wifi funciona de maravilla,posiblemente la más potente que he encontrado en un hotel,que al estar fuera se agradece.Limpio y ordenado.

title: The best hotel to enjoy with family
text: We are Uruguayans and we loved New York. A very nice hotel, just two blocks from Times Square. The staff has the rooms in excellent condition. Very comfortable beds and rooms with all amenities. At the reception they help you always and more if you are a foreigner. Many thanks to John for having helped us with great patience, a great worker.

title: New York business trip + family
text:
My family and I visited April 2017. We have 3 children aged 10-14. We wanted somewhere that allowed us to walk and subway everywhere. I had business downtown and my family wanted to walk to the museums, central park, uptown and 5th, Madison etc for shopping. This hotel is perfectly located. It's a boutique hotel but with great size rooms and bathrooms. We had the interconnecting family rooms. There was very little noise compared to other hotels I've stayed at in NY. W44th is a good quieter street.
The one thing that sets this place apart are the staff. Every single front of house team member is just great. Brilliant attitudes, skilled and bright. Whoever recruits and trains the staff is very good at their job. All the people that work here at present will all go on to have 1st class hospitality careers. Well done and thanks.

title: Surprisingly large room blocks from Broadway at a decent value.
text: Very conveniently located hotel 5 minute walk from Times Square action.  We had a room for three adults with two very nice queen beds and an additional couch bed.  The bathroom was very spacious with a huge walk in shower.  I was pleasantly surprised how much space our room had by New York standards.  I'd say it was a 5 star property due to the quality of the courtesy bar etc.   Several eateries near by. Very friendly and helpful staff.  Nice courtesy umbrellas!

title: two nights in the city
text:
To be totally honest...a friend pricelined this hotel for us as we were coming to the city, but ran out of time to book something.  She knew the area we liked and we had previously stayed in a hotel just next door.  The entrance is tiny (no lobby to sit really, nothing really old NYC about it like its neighbors).  When we checked in we found out we had a tiny room with a double....not what we were hoping for, since this was my husband's and my first time travelling without kids for 24 years!  A room with queen and a balcony would be ready for an up grade and after three...we took it site unseen.  They too our # and luggage and we hit the city!  Received a very lovely and polite call saying our room was ready and we could come home whenever we were ready ( it is the little things!)  Had Halal guys for lunch----love them! then proceeded to Central Park Zoo since it was stunning weather!!!!!!  when we returned, room was still small, bed was incredibly comfortable, balcony, had table, bench and two chairs....what a treat!!!!!!  Bathroom was dark tile, clean...and had amazing water pressure in shower....it was wonderful!  The desk staff were lovely people, really kind and helpful and there is a great restaurant connected.  We only had one nice day of weather....so we did not get to enjoy the balcony on the second day....but it was lovely to be able to sit out doors, hear the city and stretch out our legs.

Location is great for Time Square, theater.  Great dining and bars.  Was there with hubby but would easily return with the "girls" and a trip with the kids!!!!!  Felt very safe.

Thank you for a great stay!

title: First time in New York :)
text:
Great location, great staff, I was so excited to get there it was unbelievable.  We took a little travel kettle so we could have tea when we got up in the morning.
We were at the back of the building so had no view (didn't bother us), we kept the blind shut.  Over all it was a wonderful trip, loved New York and everyone we met was so nice and helpful especially when we used the metro lol

title: Great location, good value for family of 5
text: The staff is extremely nice and helpful.  We comfortably fit 5 people in one room with two beds and a day bed by the window.  Good price for the awesome location.  Very short walk to times square, 30 Rockefeller, Radio City Music Hall, etc.

title: So glad I returned!!
text:
I remembered being in this Hotel a few years ago, I usually stay in this area which is convenient for business travelling (I often travel solo). I returned this time and I was very very pleased.
First of all we were upgraded to a bigger room, pleasant surprise.
The hotel is nicer than I remembered. Beds super comfortable and choice of different pillows which I loved very much. Bathroom spacious and with nice toiletries offered.
