The room was in the back (my request, it was very quiet indeed) so a bit dark but this has happened to me almost in every NY hotel. 
And all extremely clean, no exceptions.
The cookie at night is a lovely touch too.
The reception was always friendly and helpful. We stayed during the snow storm, the glass front door broke the night before, and they have been gracious all along. 
It is a bit pricier than other nearby locations but honestly the room was worth the money and service outstanding.
I am going to return definitely.

title: great location.  clean.  friendly staff.  will defintely be back.
text: Location couldn't be better.  Nice, clean modern decor.  Just a few blocks from Times Square, lots of public transportation options nearby.  Good diner on the block and great coffee shop across the street.  Love the staff.  Reasonably priced.  good for both business and pleasure.  wifi was great.  Nice lounge on second floor.

title: Great staff.
text: Not only was the hotel cozy and warm but Stacey was an amazing help. Very knowledgeable and friendly.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay near 42nd street NYC.  Great time.

title: Lucky last minute find
text: Booked in for just one night.  Desk staff very welcoming (and upgraded us which was great).  Yes, rooms are small and a bit dark, buy who goes to NY to sit in a hotel room?? Warm, cosy room, big comfortable bed.  Really very good value for such a well-sited hotel.

title: Outstanding front desk staff
text:
I look forward to staying at the City Club when I come to New York on business.  The rooms are great, location is perfect and there's a wonderful restaurant on the first floor.   On one occasion I had to cancel because of weather and the cancellation process could not have gone smoother.

For me, though, the best part is the front desk staff (John in particular).  Travelling solo, the personal touch is really important - the warm welcome and the feeling  that you are remembered and that your comfort is being looked out for.   Checkin and checkout are a breeze and they are extremely helpful in giving helpful 'insider' type information about getting around the city.  Special thanks to John for all his help and attentiveness during my last visit and for going the extra mile.

title: Best Front Desk Staff Ever!
text: Our family group had three rooms for 4-6 nights.  The hotel location is great for getting around the city.  We always felt safe.  The front desk was always helpful and so pleasant.  I travel a lot and haven't found better.  Every effort was made to facilitate our requests.  They made our 3 and 5 year old feel like they owned the city.  The property is small enough to have a boutique feel.  We got warm cookies in our room at night. I'd definitely recommend the property and hope to come back in the near future.

title: excelente ubicacion
text: En pleno midtown, el hotel esta cerca de todo. Se puede ir caminando a muchos lugares. La atencion del personal es impecable y son muy amables. Las cookies que sirven por la tarde son deliciosas. Muchas gracias por ayudarme a resolver un problema que tuve con una valija!

title: Fabulous
text: We just returned from a 4 night stay at City Club Hotel. This hotel is in an great location. Our room slept 5 and was extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly, helpful and obliging. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return again at some point.

title: Excelente elección
text: Estoy hospedada en el hotel en este momento. Está ubicado estratégicamente en el mejor lugar de Manhattan. Cerca de todo en una zona por donde se puede caminar seguro a toda hora. El hotel es tipo boutique. Edificio antiguo bien mantenido. Decorado de manera moderna y con muy buen gusto. Las camas muy cómodas. Las sábanas impecables. El toilette tan grande como la habitación con delicados detalles, frasquitos muy originales de shampoo, acondicionador , body lotion y gel de ducha. Batas blancas de toalla. Frigobar lleno de diferentes opciones de bebidas y snacks. De primera calidad y marcas. EL PERSONAL ATIENDE MUY AMABLEMENTE. Gente correcta, educada, hablan español también. El precio muy bueno!!!  Estoy más que feliz con esta elección. Lo recomiendo 100%.

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text:
I stayed here this past week while in town on business. 
Steps away from tons of food, drinks and shopping. 
2 mins walk from Time Square. 
Super safe neighbourhood even though the area is pretty crowded. 

Hotel staff was great. 
Room was clean. 
Sized as expected for NYC. 

Water pressure was strangely the best out of any hotel I've been in. (150+/year)

Ill definitely be back to this hotel whether its for work or when I bring my family on vacay.

title: Ottimo albergo
text:
Ho dormito 5 notti in questo albergo, in pieno centro, vicino a central park e times square, personale molto gentile disponibile a prenotarti il ristorante oppure una sera durante un diluvio a chiamarti un taxi per strada,ti lasciano dei biscotti sul letto che noi usavamo come colazione con il cappuccio in camera ordinato il giorno prima.
Consigliato con prezzi di New York ovviamente.

title: Excellent stay
text: Well maintained boutique hotel a few blocks away from Times Square. We stayed in the duplex for my husbands birthday and the space was exquisite.  Lush down comforter and soft towels.  The gym acres was amazing and did not disappoint.  The DB restaurant had wonderful food and service as well.  We worked with Christian a lot during our stay and he made the stay a bit more personal.Overall an excellent stay.

title: Diverse cose da rivedere!
text: Siamo stati 10 giorni in 6. Il prezzo non è eccessivo per la posizione ma più e più volte ci sono stati problemi con le camere perché la struttura è decisamente vecchiotta! Il personale non è molto preparato ma gentile. E il wi fi, nonostante alcune recensioni fossero super positive!, a noi andava a stento e per pubblicare una semplice foto ci volevano 20 minuti!

title: Nothing fancy but gets the job done
text: The City Club hotel is nothing to write home about - nondescript entrance, smaller rooms, no fancy accouterments -  but all the basics are there and at a pretty reasonable price given the location. The room is clean, modern, and well lit. Heater/cooler works (I hate when it doesn't at a hotel...). And the staff is friendly and attentive (the cookie after cleaning my room was a nice touch!). Overall, a pretty solid experience.

title: Great location but not very comfy knowing we found cockroach
text: I stayed there about a month ago with my family and found a cockroach in our room. We were told that we'd get a refund back for  half a nights and that has not happened. Tried having hotels.com contact them for my refund and no luck. Unreliable.

title: Confortevole
text:
Ho soggiornato 2 notti in questo simpatico hotel con un entrata un pò anonima ed una piccola reception,ma subito accolto da personale molto cortese che mi hanno cambiato la stanza con una più grande rispetto a quella prenotata, quindi  la cosa è iniziata bene.
La camera era molto carina e ben arredata ,anche se non eccezionale,ma pulita e accogliente, bagno grande e bello , unica pecca la finestra era di vetro sottile non isolante anche se comunque la camera si è mantenuta calda.
La posizione è più che ottima ,a due passi da Time Square e dalle Avenue dello shopping, inutile dire che è circondato da tutti i tipi di servizi.
Nel complesso un buon hotel.

title: Good location
text: Not far from time square this small hotel delivers if you want to be able to visit uptown or downtown and still be able to get back for a siesta if required. We didnt try the restaurant as there is a great diner a couple of doors down that also do take out. Staff helpful, rooms good size and not too noisy considering where it is.

title: Oh dear
text:
First thing to say about The City Club Hotel, it’s exactly the location we wanted to be in.
The Staff are extremely friendly and very, very helpful.  Not just because they earn their living from tips, but they engaged in conversation and were genuinely interested in making you feel welcome.
The rooms are quite spacious, particularly by New York standards.
I’m afraid that’s where the positive comments end.
On passing inspection (not even close), this is quite a shabby residence.
Cracked, chipped tiles in the bathroom. Faded carpets in the corridors.
Appalling clothing storage space.
Peeling wallpaper joints in the rooms and plug sockets that come away when you take out your plug (this comes under the heading of, BAD).
It just feels…tired.
The air conditioning is loud when on constant and louder when it kicks into life initially (usually on a timer around 4am or whenever the thermostat decides to reboot).
Even the famed American morning shower is an unpredictable experience. On the last morning of our stay, the large brass water splitter inside the head had worked loose under the intense water pressure and nearly ‘took out’ my wife. 
Couple that with a shower curtain (??!!? Who still has curtains), and polished tiled floor, this is a disaster waiting to happen. 
I really wanted to like this hotel and with some upgraded refurbishment works, I’m sure I will, but I’m sorry to say, the only thing we enjoyed was the company of the delightful and attentive staff.

title: Great hotel in quieter area off of Times Square/Broadway area
text: This hotel had a great/friendly/helpful staff with large, clean rooms. They have a wonderful restaurant next door, and a well stocked pantry/bar in the room. Great location! We will stay here again! Loved it!

title: Great Service and Location
text:
Jacob from the front desk is definitely one of the best I have ever experienced. He was always friendly, went above and beyond for us and always had a smile. Give this guy a promotion!. The City Club itself is in a fantastic location, we had a great room that was not as small as some of these reviews have said, especially for NYC. The only issue we had was the noise. NYC is a busy and loud place in general, but I think the fact that the hotel did not have sound proofing for the windows, made it even louder, even late at night. There happened to be construction a block away (which doesn't happen often), but it kept us up one night until we got ear plugs.
Other than that, the hotel is close to Time Square and Bryant Park, which is ideal. Definitely stay at this hotel!

title: Muy buen Hotel.
text: La ubicación es excelente, las habitaciones son de tamaño justo y muy bien equipadas. Muy buen baño, un frigobar bien equipado, un TV de alta calidad y camas muy cómodas. Es una opción para cuando vuelva.-

title: Excelente experiencia
text: • Excelente ubicación • Muy buen servicio • Buen precio en temporada baja • El baño es impresionante • Habitaciones confortables con caja de seguridad, heladerita con frigobar, armario con perchero • A la tarde te traen cookies con chispas de chocolate • Tienen wifi gratutito

title: Fantastic service and experience
text: I highly recommend this property. The staff at City Club hotel is excellent, particularly Pete and Jacob.  They are very friendly and courteous, and gave great recommendations about the local area. You can tell they really care about making guests feel at home and are on top of things. They even went above and beyond to make it special occasion when I told them about celebration. The rooms are nicely appointed and beds super comfy. Weather was cold during my stay, but thats not their fault. If anything, it felt like a sanctuary amidst all the hustle & bustle. Location cannot be beat ! Definitely check them out for a smooth & comfortable stay.

title: Nice place, nice stuff.
text: I stayed there for 3 nights, they provided me a very good service. The location was great - 5min walk from Times Square, 10 min away from Top of the Rock. The only disadvantage was price. But it's not because of the hotel, it's because the rooms at Manhattan are expensive at all. Would come back again.

title: Ideally located
text: We enjoyed our 4 night stay, staff very welcoming, Christian on the door was extremely helpful.  The room was basic despite paying for an upgrade.  Good sized room, plenty of space for luggage, bathroom small & shower excellent.  No tea & coffee making facilities which TBH should be standard in a hotel like this, I did query it & was told that the management feel that tea & coffee can be purchased in the restaurant so that is sufficient, they are missing a trick, there is a coffee shop across the street which you would use instead of paying for a restaurant price coffee.  The windows in our room looked to be original (which was lovely) but were very draughty & with only internal shutters to cover them (no curtains) it was a bit chilly at times, the bed was really comfy which was lovely at the end of a busy day sightseeing.   All in all a nice clean hotel just needs a tiny bit of Tlc in some areas.

title: Great Staff
text: I literally booked this hotel on the bus from Newark into the city and chose it purely because it looked clean and was near my conference. I'm so glad I did! I had had a horrible flight and was exhausted and must have looked insane, but Allison and James at the front desk took good care of me. They even upgraded me to the most beautiful hotel room I have ever had the privilege to occupy. The bed was super comfortable, the location was great, the room was stylish and very clean, and the bathroom was huge by New York standards. I love this hotel and will stay again, even in a tiny room :)

title: Merkezi, temiz ve gurultulu
text:
Times square ve 5.cadde arasinda, cok merkezi bir yerde. Odalar temiz ama kucuk; boyunuz 1.70'den uzunsa ayaklariniz yatak ucundan disari cikar :) bilgisayarinizi koyup calisabileceginiz bir masa sandalye vs yok. Odada utu masasi ve utu var. 
Havalandirma cok gurultulu, asansor sesi var vs. Ama rahat bir otel.

title: Small but quaint
text: The room was small. Basically a bed and nightstand with very limited closet space . Very hard to move around unless one person was sitting in the bed. However the bathroom was spacious with a large shower. I think it was actually half the size as the actual room. Since it was just an overnight stay it was not very uncomfortable but for a longer stay I would suggest upgrading to the suite.

title: Very comfortable and reasonably priced
text: Simple, modern and our room was large, with large bathroom, large built in couch, a desk, big tv, small but comfortable double bed.  Quiet - no lobby to speak of, but the people at the desk are helpful.  There are many good places very close for meals.

title: MUCHO MAS DE LO QUE PARECE
text:
Habia leido comentarios de otros pasajeros e igual me decidi por este hotel y quiero decirles que agradesco hacber seguido mi instinto por que el hotel City Club es mucho mas de lo que parece por las fotos o los comentarios. Habia leido que no hablaban español y me sorprendi cuando la canarera Yurlin me contesto en mi idioma, e; de la puerta, el que me trajo hielo cuando lo pedi, muy bien. La habitacion 702 que me toco era amplia, bien iluminada, el baño limpio con una ducha con buena presion, dos camas de dos plazas aun cuando yo viaje solo y sobre todo MUY BUENA ATENCION DE TODOS.
LO RECOMIENDO

title: La pequeña gran sorpresa
text: La habitación súper chiquita y súper cómoda tenía todo lo necesario, excelente ubicación del hotel las galletas de la tarde son especiales, todo súper limpio y tranquilo sin dudarlo regresare en mi próxima estancia.

title: Worst experience ever
text: I was so disappointed with the room. I rented tbe spiral room for 5 people.  It does not fit 5 people it is very small. The room does not look like it did in tbe picture at ALL . It's an old dirty  uncomfortable pull out couch and a cot. We don't even get a cot the first night, we had to sleep 3 in a bed.  All 6 days we listened to the neighbour's conversation as the walls are so thin you can hear everything.   The room is very dirty. Dust everywhere.  For the amount I spent you'd think I would have gotten a great ckean room. My bill for the 6 nights wad $5880.00. Defenately was not worth it. This is probably the worst room I have ever stayed at in my whole time travelling .  Made our New York experience unhappy.  Would not recommended  this  hotel to anybody.

title: Nice Location
text: We tried this hotel because we love db bistro moderne. While the restaurant gives the hotel a nice appeal, we weren't as happy with the room as we expected to be; we found it cold and dark. It wasn't the worst hotel we've tried in NYC, but we have enjoyed better.

title: Family with 2 Littles
text: I was really nervous about coming to the city with two young children (2 & 4) at Christmas time. All day as we drove I was worried that it would be stressful getting them out of the car and into the hotel in the busy street.  We were greeted by two amazing Bellhops who were extremely gracious and welcoming.  We will stay here again and hope to see the same people working.  Everyone seemed excited to be working at this hotel and very kind.  A GREAT place to stay with or without kids.  It's very quiet at night and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We did not have to call a cab at any point.  We hated to leave!

title: Thank You City Club, NYC
text: We stayed for 3 nights in the City Club Hotel, NYC. Our room was the ‘King Luxe’. This was our second time staying at the hotel and both times have been fantastic! The room was spacious and elegant along with the bathroom. The location was perfect for all the activities we had planned. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A special thanks to the staff: Allison, Eduardo (housekeeping) and Eddie. They made our stay very special and we appreciate them truly. City Club is very fortunate to have these excellent employees. Thanks again.

title: Soggiorno buono, ma stanze antiquate!
text:
ho soggiornato in questa struttura durante il ponte dell'Immacolata. Nonostante che sia un 4 stelle e posizionato in zona centrale denota alcune carenze, tipo le camere un po' spartane e soprattutto vecchiotte. La prima sera la nostra camera non era disponibile, causa rottura di un tubo, e ci hanno proposto senza sovraprezzo una suite per poi ritornare nella stanza prenotata. Per scusarsi dell'inconveniente ci hanno offerto una colazione presso il loro bistrot. Pensiero ben accettato. 
La stanza una tripla, era abbastanza piccola e c'era il letto matrimoniale con il divano letto e poi c'era il bagno con vasca. Insomma non c'era tanto spazio per muoverci. Per quello che ho pagato mi aspettavo una stanza più confortevole. Il bistrot era molto carino, alla moda e ben frequentato. I prezzi erano quasi proibitivi. Da consigliare per l'ottima posizione.

title: Não fossem os bed bugs, teria sido tranquilo
text: Hesitei, a princípio, em avaliar o hotel, porque não queria prejudicar sua imagem ao relatar um problema de bed bug (que pode ter sido um caso isolado), mas também não tinha a mínima motivação para avaliá-lo bem, já que é um problema que não termina com o fim da hospedagem, pois existe a preocupação de poder ter trazido bed bugs ou ovos do inseto nas bagagens. Mas resolvi relatar o ocorrido, como oportunidade para o hotel registrar a medida adotada em relação àquele quarto e as medidas preventivas para que esse problema não ocorra com futuros hóspedes. Bom, eu havia reservado um petite room por 5 noites, mas como não havia petite room disponível no check-in recebi um upgrade para o queen luxe. Na penúltima noite, vi algo que pensei ser uma joaninha andando no meu travesseiro, mas depois vi que não era joaninha, pesquisei por bed bug no Google e constatei que era um. Matei o inseto e fui até a recepção apenas para informar sobre o problema, nem pretendia mudar de quarto, já que restava apenas mais uma noite, além de não haver garantia de que um outro quarto não teria o mesmo problema. Quanto ao tratamento dado pelo gerente noturno a quem comuniquei o problema, não tenho queixa: tratou o assunto com bastante seriedade e preocupação, disse que providenciaria a mudança de quarto, até para que eles pudessem inspecionar esse quarto que tinha o problema, e me orientou a empacotar os meus pertences, principalmente roupas que ficaram penduradas no closet. Na manhã seguinte ainda matei mais dois bed bugs no meu travesseiro e no mesmo dia houve a mudança de quarto, recebemos um café da manhã cortesia, pediram desculpas pelo transtorno; mas isso de fato causou estresse e preocupação. No quarto novo, não me deparei com nenhum bed bug, mas também não vasculhei a cama nem o restante do quarto. Não fosse esse problema, não tenho o que reclamar da limpeza e do conforto do quarto. A localização é excelente, além de estações de metrô próximas, é possível fazer muita coisa a pé partir do hotel. Também há opções na mesma quadra do hotel para tomar café da manhã (como o Red Flame, Gregory's Coffee e mesmo o DB Bistrô, cujo atendimento é muito bom). O pessoal da recepção do hotel e os rapazes que ficam na porta são prestativos, com destaque para o profissionalismo do gerente Carlton.

title: Great stay in an awesome location
text: We loved the personalized attention, location and ease of getting to/from your room. The staff was very nice and attentive to our needs. We loved the size of the City Club and how we could walk from our room to outside within minutes. We never had to fight crowds for the elevator or walk through a huge lobby and down long hallways. It was nice when you want to make the most of your time. Loved the design of the room and use of space. It was very comfortable for me and my two daughters. Two of our windows faced a wall, while it wasn't ideal, we didn't mind because we didn't spend much time in the room. The bathroom was a nice size, but with the pedestal style sink there wasn't any counter space. However, you could store toiletries/makeup bag on a shelf in front of the mirror. We ordered coffee/tea service one morning and it came very quickly and was superb. The location was the best part for us! We loved it!

title: Quick Christmas Get-Away with the kiddos
text: Room and location perfect.  Jacob and Eddie V happily tended to our never-ending needs with warmth and kindness; they are an asset to this hotel, and provided over-the-top hospitality throughout our stay.

title: Location is everything!!!!
text: The location was excellent.  Staff was amazing.  Expensive bar and restaurant next door however this is NYC and you are to expect a 15.00 cocktail.  Room was a bit dated and needs updating but was clean.  Bathroom was amazing.  We had a balcony room although we could see nothing was a great little plus.  Room was not ready until 4:30 but for us that was no big deal as we were walking around town anyhow.  Would recommend again.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
El hotel chico pero muy lindo, pero más no se necesita en esta ciudad. La atención, el servicio, la limpieza y el personal hicieron de lo más amena la estadía.
La ubicación muy buena, vale la pena solo por donde está ubicado.

title: Terrible small and very old
text:
I booked 2 nights in this hotel as it's close to my office and it was so bad I didn't stay a night.  And booked another hotel and left. 

First the hotel is on a block amongst excellent hotels like the Sofitel. Don't be fooled by this.  This hotel does not belong on this block. The room was musty and VERY old furnishings.  The wall paper was dingy and the over all room had unclean feel. 

There were two cookies left on the bed, I guess as a welcome. But they were not in any packaging and just sitting on a plate. They were stale and crusty.  It is unbelievable that they would put uncovered exposed food on the bed. 

The room smelled like smoke, some other chemical and must. I went to the front desk and asked for another room.  They sent someone up with some spray, which only made it worse. 

I couldn't stay another second in the room and since they didn't have another room, I left. 

Additionally hotels.com associated had tried to get me a refund but the front desk people refused to first answer the phone and then telling them they were too busy to listen and refund my money. 

This is not a place to stay.

title: Unauthorized credit charge!!!
text: The walls are super thin.  My 4 sisters and I stayed up late after seeing a play.  We were talking and laughing (not very loud, I might add) but the guest next door decided to complain.  We were told to hold down the noise level which we did.  When we returned home, we discovered that City Club charged us an additional $400 for the noise complaint.  Apparently they lowered the bill for our next door guest, only to charge it to us.  I am deeply disappointed and will NEVER stay at this hotel again.  They could have told us that there would be a fine OR they simply could have eaten the charge altogether.  If you're in the habit of fining guests, maybe you should come down on the price.  We paid just as much money as other hotel guests and should have been able to enjoy our room.  Not professional or complimentary AT ALL.

title: Location, location, location for shopping and theatre!
text: First time stay at the CC.  Usually stay in SoHo or Tribeca area, but for a holiday shopping getaway - this is the place.  Historically for my mid-December shopping stay across the street, but after a recent visit to the Sunset in LA and meeting Jeff Klein, who is so enthusiastic about his properties had to stay here.  Incredible front desk, bell and valet service.  I will say that I was a little disappointed about what they consider turndown.  First night we had cookies placed upon a bed that we had taken a shopping nap in and they were just placed upon an unmade bed.  Plus, no towel replacement or clean up in the bathroom after the morning service if you come home to take a shower and get ready to go out in the evening.  Besides that small discomfort, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

title: Girl's Slumber Party
text: Stayed overnight for a girl's slumber party. The staff was very accommodating, great location, & the duplex suite was very nice. My only complaint is that the walls are very thin so the amount of noise you can make is very limited.

title: Great Accomodation for a Family
text: We stayed for 3 nights in the City Club in the duplex room. This was a great solution for a family of 5, with the kids downstairs on the large sofa bed and pull out bed and us upstairs on the king. The room was very funky with the spiral staircase and the records on the wall. It has a great feel to it. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic between 5th and 6th avenue me3ans you have access to lots of great shops and activities. We walked everywhere to Time Square, Central Park, Radio City etc. We didn't use the restaurant as we were surrounded by so many but food looked great. Overall it has a great feel, they put out balloons for my birthday and really contributed to us having a great trip.

title: Honeymoon
text:
We booked to stay in this hotel very last minute as our previous hotel had cancelled our reservation.... and we are so happy they did as the City Club Hotel was everything we could've asked for. First off we checked in with Jacob on reception who was very helpful and informative. When we got to the room we were very happy with it, the shower was the best i have ever had, the bed was extremely comfy and the complementary cookies each night were a very nice little touch.
The hotel is nicely hidden away from all the noise but is close enough to either walk or take the subway to all the major landmarks the city has to offer.
I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for somewhere to stay whilst in New York and will be looking to stay here again on our next visit!

title: From now on the only place for me to stay in New York
text:
I'm currently waking up from my third night of four. I upgraded to a 2 double bed room as I'm travelling with my son. I must admit the room compares well with my previous favourite, the Waldorf.
Clean , comfortable , quiet even though we are opposite the lift, with plenty of space.
A mini bar that doesn't require a small mortgage to use.
Staff are friendly and swift to help with any request.
The easy access to most places of interest
10 minutes to Broadway , Central Park , shopping means a real saving in taxi fares.
The Service and comfort of most better known hotels without the stuffy formality.
I'll definitely be back

title: Intimate, trendy hotel right in midtown
text: Staying here makes me feel like I am returning to my apartment in New York, but with all the advantages of being at a hotel. Very comfortable, clean, trendy furnishings and a bar/restaurant attached. Friendly, helpful service. Just don't expect a big lobby and lots of people coming in and out, this is a very intimate spot right next to the Algonquin on one side and the Harvard Club down the street. Close to metro and to Times Square, yet in our room on the inside of the hotel, no noise (even during the Brazil day celebrations one day!) I would happily trade a view for the quiet we had at night. Highly recommend.

title: Amazing staff at City Club Hotel!!!
text:
I can't THANK  enough the amazing staff City Club Hotel has. Starting with adorable JACOB who went above and beyond every day to make all the arrangements we needed my 4 children and me to make our holiday vacation memorable. John, Eddie D., Eddie V., Arissa, Allison, Marcus, Alain, Nick; made our stay warm and welcoming, always prompt to help and answer any questions we had. We were so happy with everything, the remodeled room clean and fresh, was spacious enough to accommodate us five, the beds were really comfy, the chocolate chip cookies every night were delicious; it had everything that you want, excellent location, close to main attractions in walking distance, transportation available. One night we ordered room service and the food was outstanding. I can't wait to come back to New York and to this Hotel!! THANK YOU ALL FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART!!!!! We had a Blast!!!
Maria Guerra

title: Staff Makes This Boutique Hotel
text: I have stayed numerous times at the City Club Hotel over the years for business travel. Time has definitely taken its toll on the furniture and room interiors, and at this point the rooms could use some TLC, but overall the rooms are kept clean and fresh. What has not changed over the years is the hospitality of the staff. Everyone from the Front Desk, to the Bell Service to the Housekeeping is welcoming, warm and ready to assist. The location of this hotel absolutely cannot be beat - close enough to the tourist zone to walk to just about anywhere, but far enough away from the glaring lights of Time Square that you feel off the beaten path. Bryant Park is just a few short blocks away for a nice place to relax and enjoy the sounds of the City. And, you get a delicious, fresh chocolate chip cookie on your bed after returning back to your room. The price befits a decent stay in the heart of Manhattan, but in my opinion the location and service makes it well worth your pennies.

title: City Club Hotel.
text: Stayed with City Club Hotel during our stay to NYC, A great central location just 5mins walk to Times Square. Room size was in my opinion big enough, Okay not the huge suites that some people want these days but with ample room in our double for a comfortable stay for a couple although have to point out that the shower in the en suite bathroom was amazing. The Hotel itself had everything that you could want from room service, cable TV and all the little goodies that make the room just a little extra. An onsite upmarket bistro which we didn't use but seemed popular enough being full every night. We did take advantage of the 24hr room service which was excellent and prompt and reasonably priced we thought. The staff were a genuine godsend. Friendly, always met with a smile and a 'How are you today?' and no request was too much trouble and no question was left unanswered be it about the hotel or local information or even arranging transport to a location, Can't speak highly enough of the staff who made our stay very warm and welcome. All in all a great hotel. Would we stay there again.......Without a doubt YES.We're already planning and saving for next year,.

title: Stay in NYC
text: This hotel was pretty great. The staff, the accommodations, the location - everything was fantastic! The lobby is cozy but the staff are super attentive and polite. Donovan, one of the bellmen on staff, went above and beyond every day for my mother and myself. The location of this hotel was superb! Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral, as well as Rockefeller Center. I would definitely try to stay here for future trips to NYC. I would also recommend upgrading your room for a one a little bit larger - I found that I needed the extra space.

title: "Fine" New York Hotel
text: Overall, the staff were friendly and the hotel was 'okay'.  The room was small (traditional New York - not smaller than most NYC hotels - just was expecting a bit larger).  The wallpaper on the walls of the room wasn't lined up which made the room look a bit dated and dingy.  The closet (which was cut into the wallpaper) looked a bit like a place where someone would hide out if they were going to jump out at you.  The restaurant attached was nice feature.

title: Great Rooms. Best Staff Ever!
text: We reserved two rooms for our group of 7. Both were nicely decorated, clean, very comfortable, and larger than we had expected. The location was perfect--close to Times Square, but quieter. The best part was the attention that we received from the staff. Arissa, Eddie, Eddie D., Jann, Marcus, and Jacob were fun and they went above and beyond in their helpfulness. They even made sure we got an extra special treat in honor of my birthday. Loved them!

title: Our New FAVORITE Hotel  44th between 5 & 6th!!!
text:
What a great boutique hotel!!!!  (Sister to LA's hip Sunset Tower Hotel)  We recently stayed for a week and loved the hotel a little more everyday...  It has a fresh vibe without being trendy, snooty or making us less "trendy" people feel out of place.  

The staff is OUTSTANDING, friendly and very helpful-- Every singe one of them!    

Our room (#802) was huge-- Beautiful, comfy King Bed with lovely linens, a large window seat/day bed that could easily double for sleeping.  It has a nice sized table and two comfortable arm chairs.  There's a big, adjustable HD flat screen tv.  Bathroom was modern and stylish with the best NYC shower I've ever had-- Also very large and good quality big towels.  The art work was not your usual generic stuff and quite interesting.

The attached restaurant, DB Bistro Moderne (Daniel Boulud chef- YUM) was excellent and offered 24 hour room service.  

The location is PERFECT-- Theater district is close but you're not in the thick of all the tourist.  Steps from 5th Avenue but far enough down that you're not in the mobs of people protesting Trump Tower.  On the same block is the Red Flame Diner which is cheap/cheerful/clean for a fast bite to eat.  Across the street is Gregory's Coffee (way better than Starbucks!), The Strip House is a great option for a steak a few doors down.  Easy walking distance to Grand Central Station too.

We're in NYC often and usually stay at the Parker Meridien or Warwick in midtown, but like this hotel now much better.  Smaller, less crowded and less noise.  We'll definitely be back!

title: Idéalement placé
text: Nous avions choisi une chambre familiale avec 2 grands lits plus un lit simple et une salle de bain. Parfait pour cinq personnes, nous avons payé 1300 € toutes taxes comprises pour trois nuits. Situé entre Time Square et la cinquième avenue cet hôtel très propre et idéalement situé. Gare central se trouve à trois rues. Cet hôtel est si tu es à la 44e rue cinquième avenue. Le restaurant qui se trouve au rez-de-chaussée est cher mais de très grande qualité.

title: Fantastic stay
text: Our stay at the City Club was one of the high points of our recent trip to NYC. We travelled with family and booked in the two-room family suite, which fit us comfortably. The room was clean and well-designed, with luxurious beds/bedding and spacious bathrooms. The staff could not have been more accommodating. The location was ideal for sightseeing. Will definitely return, for work and pleasure.

title: What a hidden gem!
text:
This is one special boutique hotel. We stayed with them over a long weekend of theatre and business and could not have been happier with the exceptional and professional staff, wonderful location, and clean and nicely appointed room. West 44th Street everything you might want when visiting the city!

We checked in with a notable movie star and comedian which suggests they may have a reputation as a tucked away little enclave away from the madness that NYC can provide. Thanks in particular to Peter and the other staff at the front desk who made our stay so very enjoyable.

Thank you!

title: Overall Nice Stay
text: I stayed with my family of 4 (2 adults, 11 and 15 yr old) for one night this past weekend in a king room and it was very nice.  The room was big enough with the king bed, a couch/day bed and a rollaway bed.  The bathroom was different with chocolate brown marble and the shampoo, conditioner, etc were in generous sized bottles.  The décor was contemporary and the room was in good shape.  We had room 501 in the front of the hotel with a window over the street.  It was a little noisy with occasional sirens, truck noises, etc., but that's to be expected in a big city.  The room was right across from the elevator so there was some noise from people waiting outside the door, but there weren't many rooms on the floor so that only happened a couple of times.  Someone left 2 chocolate chip cookies in the room while we were out (turndown service) so that was a nice touch, but it would have been even better if they left one for each person in the room.  We ate twice at the Red Flame diner 2 doors down and it was fine.  We wound up there for dinner Sat. night because every other place near Times Square had long wait times (find a place that takes reservations) and we had dinner there Sun. morning.  There are a few other hotels on the block so the diner was crowded Sun. morning.  The front desk staff and bellman were nice and helpful (gave me a map of the city).  The hotel is in a great location - 3 blocks from Grand Central and Times Square so close to the subway, near the Broadway theaters and lots of restaurants.  The only minor negatives we found were:  had to wait until 3:50 for our room to  be ready (check-in is supposed to be at 3:00), the king bed had a mattress or box spring that made a noise when you shifted on it, and no tissues in the bathroom.  We had to wait for our room on the 2nd floor in a small lobby/lounge area that had 5 or 6 tables with 2 seats but no room for a couch or seating area. They gave you the wifi passcode to appease you I guess.  There was scaffolding over the building entrance so you had to look close to find it.  We arrived early, around 10:30 AM, so they stored our bags while we went sightseeing. Overall we liked this hotel and will come back for our next trip to NYC.

title: great location, good for business travellers
text:
Stayed for 3 nights, location is amazing for me to attend business meetings in midtown nyc. From newark airport, if you prefer the express bus, it's 17$ and stop at Bryant Park on 42nd street and 6th Avenue. Two blocks walk, you will arrive at the lobby.

Cons is getting to airport, no other transport service except for the private car for hire at 113$ per trip.

title: Great boutique hotel in Times Square area. Very clean, great staff!
text:
We would to stay here again. The staff at the front desk was so helpful and personable. We initially spoke with Arissa by phone and upgraded our room.  She gave us helpful general information...thanks Arissa!  Eddy was very helpful in guiding us to the best bus tour for us.   We highly recommend the Big Bus Tour to see all the different neighborhoods and what they offer.  Thanks Eddy!  Jacob showed us a standard room and gave us lots of helpful information about the city.  Thanks Eddy!  (We were glad we had upgraded as we had a queen bed in place of a double plus the little balcony gave a little more room. Standard rooms are very small but if all you need is a bed it would work.  .  Housekeeping cleans every day AND leaves chocolate chip cookies every day..thank you girls!  There is a nice, little restaurant and bar and, of course, room service.  The location was within about 3 blks of the subway, and Times Square so lots of entertainment!  
We used Uber from LGA to the hotel and were very happy with Uber.  It was $30-$34 (tip is included in fare quoted online but we enjoyed our drivers so much we gave a little extra in cash). 
Hope you go and enjoy your stay as much as we did!

title: fantastic location and staff!
text: This hotel is two blocks from Grand Central Station,  two blocks from Time Square and two blocks from the theater district.  The location is perfect!  The rooms are spacious, trendy and clean!  The staff were SO helpful.

title: Perfekt beliggenhed
text: Familie med teenagebørn boede her i 4 nætter. Blev mødt af venligt og hjælpsomt personale. Værelset var helt fint og stille om natten set i forhold til hvor tæt på Times Square det ligger. Gåafstand til mange forskellige ting og Diner og Deli'er i nærheden.

title: They bring freshly baked cookies to your room every night!
text: This is an amazing hotel, small for sure. But I think that's a good thing when you have sprawling mega hotels just round the corner which won't necessarily give the same level of service as these guys. They upgraded my room at a reduced discount, and I'm glad they did because the room type below had no bathtub. Any questions about where to go and what to do in New York were answered quickly as any native to the city. The location is excellent in midtown Manhattan with Times Square less than five minutes away, but the actual street the hotel is on is not too busy. A special mention must go to John, Marcus, Sara, Jacob, Eddie and Donavan.

title: Delightful Getaway
text: This small boutique hotel offers outstanding service in a great central location close to Times Square & midtown. It is easily walkable to many of the city  highlights from Rockefeller Plaza, Grand Central Station, Broadway, Bryant Park..the list goes on. It is suitable for everyone including families. They have a wonderful restaurant next to the lobby for drinks or food. When you return each time the staff are very welcoming & helpful. Rooms are tasteful & comfortable.

title: Great Spot In The City
text:
I stayed here recently with four girlfriends, after deciding to visit New York for a long weekend. 

The staff were incredibly polite, and always greeted us when we came into the foyer, even kindly pointing out the closest coffee shop that was open at jet-lag early hours.... 

We stayed in a room on the 7th floor at the back of the building (as requested, to avoid the traffic noise). The bathroom was a very good size with a full sized bath and combined shower. 
The room  its self was clean and showed no signs of wear. My only comment would be that whilst the room that we booked was advertised to sleep 5, the room really wasn't suitable for 5 adults. The double beds were small doubles, and with the daybed being used there wasn't sufficient space to pack away the suitcases and all the clothes. We ended up stepping over the cases to move around. This isn't a major issue, however, I thought it worth mentioning if anyone is travelling in a group. 

The hotel is positioned in a great spot to access all the touristy and non touristy parts of NY. Armed with our lonely planet guide we did a lot of walking during the stay and found some great spots..... The Highline, a great Irish bar themed on the Gangs of New York film called the Dead Rabbit. La Colombe coffee shop which has an insightful history, Bathtub Gin, 65 at The Rainbow Room... just be mindful if its misty.. the view is non existent... and the usual sites. 

As a final note the bus stop to catch the airport bus is just down the block by Bryant park, for those who want to save on a cab fare.

title: Amazing rooms and great staff!
text:
I cannot say enough about how great the staff is at this hotel. From check-in to check-out they were always in a great mood and eager to hear about how your day was. They did anything they could to make your stay more enjoyable, and even brought a warm cookie to your room every evening.

The room is stayed in was great. The room was spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a great size and shower worked perfectly. The biggest letdown were the towels, which almost felt like sandpaper.

I would have no problem staying here again, and I look forward to my next visit!

title: Per una notte..
text: In transito a NYC per Boston abbiamo pernottato al City Club, tra i pochi Hotel trovati ad un prezzo accessibile in offerta a poco più di 200 euro a notte. La prima difficoltà è trovare l'albergo benché sia a due passi da Times Square. L'entrata è poco più di una porta normale. Con il nostro navigatore ci siamo passati davanti senza notarlo fin quando abbiamo chiesto, 10 mi più avanti, e ci hanno detto che lo avevamo appena superato. La hall è piccolissima e la reception è ricavata in un angolo ed è poco più di un metro lunga. La camera assegnataci al nono piano era carina, proporzionata agli standard della big Apple, con un balconcino delimitato, però da quattro muri Che consentivano di guardare solo in alto. La dotazione (amenities) in camera e in bagno soddisfacente. Letto comodo e, tutto sommato, stato di manutenzione sufficiente. Con piccoli interventi ed a quel prezzo sarebbe un'ottima soluzione   a NYC.

title: Un très bon séjour
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, en plein Manhattan et à proximité de Times Square.
Chambres spacieuses et confortables, très propres.
En arrivant, nous nous sommes vus attribuer, malgré notre demande, une chambre au 1er étage, donnant sur la cour, avec la clim qui passait devant notre fenêtre. Le bruit étant insupportable, nous avons demandé dès le lendemain à bénéficier d'une chambre dans les étages et donnant sur la rue. Le personnel très agréable et à l'écoute nous a immédiatement trouvé une autre chambre et le reste du séjour a été parfait. Prix assez élevés mais justifiés.

title: Small Hotel in the Big City
text:
I loved this place. It was in an old political club two blocks from Times Square. There were only about 50 rooms in the place on eight floors. It was dwarfed by many of the surrounding buildings. But the hotel staff was excellent. The front desk was very friendly. When I came back from dinner there was a man working the front door. Same in the morning. He asked if I needed a car and had an umbrella at the ready on the dreary morning.

The front of the place is a bit hard to find if you aren't paying close attention. The sign clearly shows "CC" but you have to understand that is what you are looking for. DB Bistro is in the ground floor and easier to see from the street.

The room was very nice. I had a single on the 4th floor. It was very clean and modern in appearance. The bathroom was pretty big, modern and clean. Despite another reviewers comments earlier this week I had no problem with the AC it worked perfectly and quickly. The room was cool in seconds. The air was fresh. Strategically placed mirrors made the room feel twice its size.

The TV was a bit small and hard to control since the cable box was attached to the back of the TV (I used the mirror to "bend" the signal from the remote) but otherwise had a good selection of channels.

I ate dinner at the attached DB Bistro downstairs. It was very good. The menu was limited, but the halibut was tasty.

title: No A/C, Bad Mattress, Smell in Room
text:
When you book a hotel that says it's a four star hotel, you expect a basic level of decency. I walked into my room, and it was hotter than the lobby. A nice 78 degrees in my room on an already warm evening (75 degrees), due to a malfunctioning (and very outdated) standing air unit. The fact that you're also welcomed by the lack of ventilation exacerbating the odor of smell of feet and old carpet doesn't help.

I arrived past 1 a.m. from JFK looking forward to a clean and comfortable room. The fact that a room is rented out in this condition is disappointing.  Thankfully, the maintenance guy who came was nice and brought me a fan. Yes, a fan, in a hotel that advertises itself on its website to "pamper guests with genuine comfort and luxury."

Oh, and the mattress is lumpy and uncomfortable. First and last time here. As a TripAdvisor user who uses others reviewers notes for guidance for my frequent travel, I've never been compelled to write my own until now. Please be mindful of what you're paying for. The decor is well appointed, but manage expectations that this is a budget hotel in reality.

title: Delightful!
text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights during Fashion Week and found it absolutely wonderful. Friendly and helpful staff, very clean room with quality toiletries and jumbo towels! The room felt larger than other NYC hotels we've stayed at- we booked a deluxe king- and was very comfortable. The yummy cookies every afternoon were an unexpected delight!

title: un hotel encantador con una entrada discreta en una calle llena de hoteles con grandes entradas
text:
Es un hotel al lado de la 5ª Avenida, a 5 minutos de Times Sequare, y cerca del Empire, por lo que la ubicación es extraordinaria, y el precio es muy aceptable.
Era un antiguo club de caballeros, por lo que la entrada es muy discreta. 
La habitación en la 9ª planta con terraza es estupenda y todas las tardes suben a la habitación unas cookis calentitas, que después de patearte la ciudad,saben a gloria. La atención del hotel es maravillosa.

title: Location Location Location
text:
A last minute booking to this great hotel was perfect for my family of 5. We had a Double Double and with a very tall son the sofa bed was perfect as it was probably the longest we will ever get!

A small boutique hotel a stones throw away from Times Square and 5th Avenues designer shops. 

A decent sized room for New York with a great walk in shower. 
The staff were courteous and helpful with directions etc. and warm cookies were waiting in your room after a hard day walking the streets of Manhattan (Nice touch).  

I would happily recommend this to family and friends if you can get a good deal on the price.

title: Good size room
text: The room is a good size especially for NYC. Bathroom is also good size with a large shower and bidet ( if u like). No bathtub. Lobby is very small and my room view on the 2nd floor is a brick wall so I gave a lower rating but I would stay again if it's just a place to sleep. Room design is modern.

title: Hotel très bien situé
text: Nous avons séjourné en famille avec 3 enfants dans cet hôtel qui est très bien situé , le personnel est très agréable et ils sont prêts à tout pour que votre séjour se passe au mieux, je le recommande vivement.

title: Fantastic!
text: The people and the room were top notch.  When I called to say I'd be in late, they knew exactly who I was-- like they were looking out for me to arrive.  Friendly from the first moment to the last-- Arissa, Eddie V. And Eddie D. made me feel like a celebrity.  The room was spacious and clean-- and 2 chocolate chip cookies were waiting for me.  The bathroom was ENORMOUS.  Everything was awesome.  Thanks for a great stay, guys!

title: Great Staff, Great Hotel, Great Time
text: The hotel was nice and cozy with a restaurant conveniently placed beside the lobby, and was in a great location being so close to Time Square. The staff were very accommodating and there was two staff members that were especially kind. These two people were Avissa and John whom gave us a multitude of places where we could go and altogether they were just a pleasure to talk to. You could tell they really cared about their customers and they always made us feel welcome. Housekeeping did an excellent job as expected and every night they left us with fresh, warm chocolate chip cookies. If you are planning to stay at New York then City Club Hotel should be seriously considered.

title: nice hotel in the big apple
text:
the hotel location is amazing . great hotel , the stuff was amazing . 
the room are big enough for family of 5 . 
every evening we recived fresh cookies and ice to the room .
the stuff help us in every questions we have.

title: Abzocke
text:
Die Angestellten sind, solange man sich im Hotel aufhält, freundlich und zuvorkommend. Sie sind jedoch nicht in der Lage einen Mietwagen zu reservieren. Meiner Meinung nach sollte man das als Gast erwarten können. 
Die Zimmer sind so winzig, dass man klettern muss um ins Bad zu gelangen, sobald zwei mittelgroße Koffer darin stehen. Der Kleiderschrank bietet nicht genug Platz, um die Kleidung darin unterzubringen. Dazu bekommt man einen Ausblick auf einen ungepflegten Hinterhof ohne besonders viel Licht. Rechtzeitig bezugsfertig war es auch nicht.
Für all das haben wir 250$ die Nacht bezahlt, was selbst für New Yorker Verhältnisse unangemessen ist. Da findet man sicher etwas besseres. 
Für das Frühstück haben wir für zwei Personen 80$ bezahlt, was zwar viel ist, aber nicht unüblich in New Yorker Hotels. 
All das führt aber nicht zu der schlechten Bewertung. Viel mehr liegt es daran, dass unsere Kreditkarte mit 1500$ (!) zu viel belastet wurde. Nach mehrfachem schriftlichen Austausch haben sie sich nicht mehr gemeldet mit der Begründung, dass sie die Belastung nicht im System finden können. Telefonisch wurde uns mehrfach versprochen die Sache zu klären, wozu es jedoch nicht kam. Glücklicherweise konnten wir den Sachverhalt aufgrund unserer Rechnung gegenüber unserem Kreditkartenbetreiber darlegen und wir bekamen unser Geld zurück. Trotzdem empfinde ich es als Unverschämtheit, zumal 1500$ nicht wenig Geld ist.

title: فندق جيد
text:
فندق جيد مقارنة ببقية الفنادق ذات الثلاث نجوم .. تعامل ممتاز من الموظفين و اثاث جيد .. الموقع المتميز اهم النواحي الإيجابية في هذا الفندق ..
عند زيارتي مرى أخرى لنيويورك الرائعة ان شاء الله سوف اختار هذا الفندق مجددا

title: Emplacement et confort ! Magnifique !
text: Ayant pris l'habitude d'aller à NYC tous les 2 ans, cette année j'ai choisi de loger en plein centre de Manhattan pour éviter les voyages en métro. Je ne suis pas déçu du voyage dans cet hôtel !! Certe le prix est ce qu'il est mais le service et l'emplacement en vaut largement la chandelle. Nous avons passé deux nuits géniale en groupe de 5 personnes. Toutes les personnes différentes que nous avons eu à la réception ont toutes étaient merveilleusement gentil, agréable et attentionnées. De plus, le portier/bagagiste est à nos p'tits soins avec nos grosses valises. Si vous passez vos vacances à Manhattan arrêtez vous une nuit ou 2 ou même plus selon votre budget vous ne serez pas déçu !!

title: Bon emplacement et prestations correctes
text:
Le nerf de la guerre à NYC encore plus qu'ailleurs, c'est l'argent. Trouver un bon hôtel à un prix raisonnable et proche du centre de Manhattan n'est pas aisé.

Le City Club Hôtel est à quelques minutes de marche de la plupart des lignes de métro, de Bryant park, de Times Square, et de tant d'autres merveilles.

Pour le tarif mini, vous aurez une petite chambre, correctement équipée, avec une fenêtre qui donne sur la courette étriquée entre les immeubles, mais nous ne venions pas pour la vue depuis la chambre.

La salle de bains est très bien, équipée de façon très satisfaisante.

Le service est à l'américaine : très pro depuis le portier, en passant par le comptoir d'accueil, et le service de ménage.

Petits plus : vous aurez tous les jours votre édition du New York Times à votre porte, ainsi que deux petits cookies près de votre lit.

Le restaurant associé propose des mets de qualité que nous avons testés la veille de notre départ (la flemme de partir à la chasse dans la ville) mais c'est un peu dommage d'aller à NYC pour manger français (le chef est Daniel Boulud) et les tarifs sont plutôt élevés. On peut aussi y découvrir de très bonnes bières locales et quelques bon crus.

title: nice stay
text: The staff was very nice, especially comparing to rest of New Yorkers. Not much of the lobby, but who cares.  The room was nice and clean, but small. Great location, withing walking distance 15-20min to Times Square, Top of the Rock, Empire bld., the library and grand station. Definitely would stay again

title: A due passi da Times Square
text: Se volete soggiornare a New York e volete essere in una posizione strategica, vi consiglio questo Hotel, apparentemente meno appariscente degli altri (non ha una hall vera e propria) ma con camere belle pulite e più grandi della media e personale gentilissimo sempre disponibile ad aiutarti .

title: Amazing amazing hotel!
text:
I was working at a camp near by to New York and got a few days of work last minute so me and 11 others booked 3 rooms at the hotel! When we arrived after a longer journey than planned we got to recepetion stressed out hungry and tired, instead of telling us that we needed to pay the bill straight away they told us to leave our bags in the hotel go get food and come back check our bags in and then come back to pay later which was amazing and made us feel welcome. After eating we returned to the hotel to where they had broken the bill down for us and let us know what we each owed.  
The hotel was perfect close to everything and bought us cookies every night. The reception staff were amazing and always would advise us what to do in the city
Thanks for an amazing stay and if I return to New York I will definitely stay in this hotel

title: Perfect location, great rooms
text:
Loved this little boutique hotel conveniently located on 44th between 5th and 6th. We will definitely stay there again. Rooms were clean and beautifully appointed, not to mention totally quiet. Super easy to check in and out, and everyone was friendly, including the housekeeper, the bellman, Marcus, and the front desk manager, John.

Huge mini-bar selection, and they also offer room service from the bistro next door.

It was also really great for our family of 5. We had two adjoining rooms at the end of the hall that formed a little suite.

We are planning to return in a few months!

title: Something special in the heart of NYC!
text:
I stayed at City Club Hotel last year, because I found a last minute deal on another website. I booked the hotel room because it looked nice from the pictures and it was a quick walk from Grand Central Station. 

I had a very late arrival, but was so surprised when I arrived to find out that my room had been upgraded for free. The room and the welcome cookies were amazing. I paid a very low price last year, but the room was worth two or three times the deal I found.

The location was perfect - close to Grand Central and Times Square. 

I did walk past it however, at first, because at night it is easy to miss and set back from the sidewalk a bit...thank goodness for GPS!! Anyway, I had a friend visiting from Italy and he was very impressed by the hotel room. 

This week, I was again looking for a room for tomorrow night and I searched the usual websites. Once again, I saw a deal for City Club Hotel, however, it was not nearly as good as the one I found last year. That being said, I was more than willing to pay an extra $50 this year just to stay there again! 

For this stay I requested a room with a bathtub, because the tubs at City Club Hotel are very luxurious...so much so that I fell asleep in the one last year. I guess this could count as a negative, but I did wake right up when my head fell in the water! :-) It was a very relaxing experience even though I was only able to stay there for one night. 

Honestly, I didn't want to leave the hotel room! I'd stay there for a week if I could afford it some time! 

I'm so looking forward to staying tomorrow night and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice relaxing break in the city.

(Full Disclosure: my stay was in late August of last year (2015), but the nearest option from the drop down menu here was September 2015).

title: SCAM: Most horrible hotel experience of my life
text:
I still get angry thinking about my stay with City Club. After making a reservation in advance, showing up at 10am with my friends, the hotel tells us our room will be ready later that day. We go about our day and return around 7:30pm. Suddenly they are overbooked and do not have the room we booked anymore. According to the reception they already knew earlier, but apparently they didnt bother to call or email us. 

As it was a saturday night in NYC and we already had plans for that evening, we decided to go with their "best option" to take the last room with a small discount and have extra bedding sent to the room. I would think the best option is send us to another hotel or give the night for free if you suddenly are overbooked and you know we were coming.

The room turned out to be a tiny 2 person room which we had to sleep in with 4 people. And the extra bedding turned out to be a blanket and a half inflated kid mattrass so 2 of us SLEPT ON THE FLOOR!!! Absolute horrible night and spent the next morning in tears of being treated this way in a 4* hotel nonetheless and not getting any sleep.

This is not what we expected and since we did not make any mistakes here we make a complaint to the hotel manager Pete Cullim, who then says "we will not do anything and your card has already been charged so bye". No sympathy whatsoever for what they did to us.

Never ever had a worse treatment and hotel experience in my life (by the way i went backpacking in SE Asia and Africa). City Club Hotel will NOT treat you as a guest and is guaranteed to give you the WORST hotel experience in your life! Absolute scammy scammy hotel

title: Excellent Stay, Times Square, Upscale, Botique
text:
I have been staying at the City Club since 2003.  Occasionally I book late and it's sold out, always reminding me why I stay.

It's a small boutique hotel blocks from time square and within the center of the city. It has a restaurant attached db Moderne which is good too.

The hotel was and old NYC club in the day.  Many of the rooms have beautifully ornate ceilings which complement the rooms nicely.

The staff is friendly, quick check in, central to great restaurants, sights, business.

I will be back in a few weeks.

title: Hotel from hell
text: This hotel is so ridiculous. Even in a 1* hotel you would still get a bed for each person in the room and you would not be charged for sleeping on the floor. Extremely upset by the lack of empathy of the so called front desk managers Pete Cullim and Eddie Vorobeychik. Pete Cullim even went so far to say that he would have let 4 seventy year old ladies sleep on the floor too. Worst hotel experience ever. You call this a 4star hotel?

title: Perfect city break location
text:
Hotel is quirky (not bland international), comfortable and the staff (Marcus, John and Eddie) were extremely helpful with advice and making sure we felt welcome to the hotel and their city.

You have the option of breakfast in and we were able to do a late checkout and store our bags as we had a late flight

title: Visitor
text: Nice hotel, great staff.  Would stay again.  Good location near Times Square but far away enough to not have Times Square at the front door.  Rooms small but well appointed.   John and Marcus at front desk especially helpful!!!!!!!!   Will recommend to others.

title: Great location
text:
The hotel is well located ... Just near 5th st and few minutes walk to times square.. 
The lobby was very small...I didn't feel that I entered a hotel!
Receptionists were very kind and helpful.  
The hotel doesnt have parking but there is a parking near it...45$ per 24hours...
Our room was well designed. The bathroom was very clean ofcourse without bath tub.
The worst thing about our room was the window!!! Our view was the window of another building...
The room was really dark in the morning!!! When we woke up at 8am ! we really feel like 3-4 am!
Overall, I dont know wether I will stay at this hotel or not! It depends on the situation 😁
May be I request for aroom on the other side of the hotel!☺️

title: A BUTique hotel is a boutique with a few BUT's
text:
We stayed in this hotel for a 5-day stay, picked by my wife for being in a great location and being a boutique hotel.

The hotel is in 44th between 6th and 7th, very well located, BUT if you don't pay attention you easily miss it as its front is composed solely by a door less than 1m wide (the majority of the front goes to a Bistro run by Daniel Goulud).

The staff is friendly and agile, BUT they are not flexible in general, they won't allow you to check-in any time earlier than 3:00pm ('you know we are a boutique hotel') for example. They won't you check-out any later than 1:00pm also.

Breakfast is available at US$21 p.p. in the Bistro, BUT you may want to consider the excellent and less expensive Red Flame just a few meters away.

The room was spacious, always clean and had smart decoration tricks, like having mini-bar and safe behind a picture/door, BUT its two windows faced no more than the bricks from next building's wall, a mere 3 feet away from us. That was really bad, because of that the room was always dark and always needed lights on. From the window you could not tell if the sky was bright sunny or totally dark. Although that made the room a little but depressive, it provided a very good sound isolation, we did not listen to a single siren while in the room.

The bathroom was spacious, beautiful and had a perfect shower experience, BUT the toilet flush had such a loud hiss it looked like a bath. And it was not my privilege, we could hear hisses from nearby rooms.

The room has a phone set with messages, BUT when you press the flashing Message button, nothing happens. The TV set is good quality, BUT located over the sofa-converted-into-our-son's-bed. By 6:30pm they bring lovely cookies, BUT only once they brought 3 cookies for the 3 guests inside.

They do not charge for receiving parcels, BUT they won't do any return process if it arrives after your departure, they will just reject it and bounce it back.

When coming to NY next time, I would not go there again unconditionally nor rule them out automatically from my list, BUT I would consider other options.

title: US holiday
text: Excellent hotel, ideal location in Manhattan for shopping, theatre as well as doing touristy things in NY. Good value, clean, well equipped room for the 3 of us. Very helpful staff, safe and secure. Opportunity to have breakfast in the boutique restaurant in the building but also very easy to go to the diners next door. Would come again, no problem.

title: Excellent!
text: Everything was excellent!!I'm a travel agent and i was on holidays in Nyc, i will recommend this hotel to my customers. We found each and every staff member to be very professional and helpful. From Arissa to John,Pete,the other girl at reception ,all the reception staff,the doormen, housekeeping staff ,each of them very friendly and polite! The hotel is located 2 blocks from times square, close to everything (34th.42th. empire state,bryant park, rockfeller center etc..). We had room 901 with a terrasse ,nice room and the bed is very comfortable. Nice bathroom! wifi is free and fast , Compare to the other hotels in Nyc (big buildings) the city club is very cosy. And the last but not the least, every day we had 2 delicious cookies on the bed!! delicious! We will definitely come back !

title: Excelente
text: O quarto e a localização são fantásticos! E os funcionários são muito simpáticos e me ajudaram muito com recomendações de lugares para comer. Sem mencionar que os cookies que estavam no quarto quando eu chegava no hotel são deliciosos. No geral, excelente! Recomendo com certeza.

title: Cozy and Close to Everything!
text: I love this hotel!  I've been going there for years, now, which kind of says it all.  It is a little gem tucked between 5th Avenue and the Theater District with a host of excellent restaurants on the same block.  If you're doing a short trip to New York for some shopping and a show--and a couple nice meals, of course--it would be hard to do better and very easy to pay much more.  Rooms range from New York tight to moderately spacious and, no matter which way you want to go, they are immaculately clean and well-appointed.  The place is quiet.  It is next to DB Bistro Moderne, which serves as its pretty fancy breakfast offering (with an interior door so you can get lunch, dinner and late night drinks, too), and on the same block as other favorites like Triomphe, Kellari, The Strip House and Blue Bar at the Algonquin.  If you want something a little less ethereal that will get the job done in the morning, there's coffee at Gregory's across the street or breakfast at The Red Flame a few steps to the right when you go out the door.  You can hold your breath and walk to 5th Avenue to shop or walk a couple minutes in the opposite direction to get to a Broadway show.  On the trip referenced in this review, I went there alone but I've gone many time with my wife who I know would echo all of my observations.  Best of all, as with any excellent hotel, the people really make the place.  I have always had unfailingly friendly and helpful service here--they even remember me when I come back, now, which I do whenever possible.  If you're driving, there's an Edison Car ParkFast right across the street.  And, hey, they put a pretty fine cookie in the room for each occupant every day!--a nice touch.  If you go once, I'll bet you'll return.

title: Great stay
text: Clean, friendly, affordable, room for 5 of us in one duplex style room, staff was genuine...addressed and fixed a noise complaint from music in room next door immediately!!! Great location centralized for all we did in the 2 days we spent here...

title: Very close to Times Square,and everything else
text:
This Hotel was awesome, hotel was nice and clean.
Pete,Sarah,Rob Donavan and the rest of the staff were great. Definitely recommend this place and will go back on my next trip. Great location Best part we got free chocolate chip cookies

title: Great hotel
text: It was a cosy hotel in a great location. You would walk one direction then you would be at Times Square , walk the opposite direction then you would be at fifth avenue. It wasn't noisy and the staff were really nice and helpful. The room was nice and the bed was quite comfortable.

title: Sra
text: Un hotel que no es lujoso pero los cuartos están súper bonitos , aunque el mío no tenía ventanas a la calle pero el tamaño y la decoración me pareció buena. La atención súper y la ubicación súper !! El precio depende de la época . Yo si volvería, ah además tiene un restaurante Bistro súper rico y buenisimo aunque es caro .

title: I will definitely go back to the City Club Hotel!
text: We stayed in a King Luxe Room. The size of the room including the bathroom was perfect. Everything in the room was comfortable -especially the bed- and clean. The location is also very convenient, in a walking distance from Times Square but there was no noise in the hotel, therefore we had really pleasant nights. The staff at the reception is also very helpful with anything we needed.

title: Buena opción!
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado, cerca a la Quinta Avenida y a Time Square y a la estación del metro Bryant Park. Personal amable y habitaciones espaciosas para estadía familiar. Encantador el detalle de las galletas con chips de chocolate que dejan en la habitación al final de la tarde. Buena relación precio-calidad.

title: One of my "Go To" Hotels in NYC
text:
What I love about this hotel is the friendly folks, who truly make you feel like you are visiting a private club.  The rooms are always neat and tidy; and while yes, they are small...that's NYC.  The entire hotel has a nice intimate feel; the neighborhood is great to walk around...grab a bite to eat.  And it's really close to Times Square/the Theater district, without having the horrible noise and crowds.  

I stay there both on business and for pleasure.  Most recently was a combined business/pleasure trip and I had five delightful nights.

title: Thank you to the wonderful folks who work at City Club Hotel~
text:
We recently stayed at City Club Hotel in New York.  The room was large and shower was huge with plenty of pressure and hot water.  

I was particularly impressed by the folks who worked at the front desk.  James, John, Keith Rob and Marcus were always helpful and kind. My deepest thanks goes to James who got us a car when we were running late to see Wicked. Because of his help, we got to the theatre with time to spare!

title: A Real Find in NYC
text:
Many people will write about an irritating incident that happened on the night of June 21.  At 2:00 or so, the fire alarm mal-functioned, and the staff took a long time to get the incessant siren turned off.  As I checked out today, I heard one man say, in an annoyed voice, "Well, it was certainly inconvenient."  Yesterday, a man yelled at the desk clerk for his three hours of sleep. I must not be very particular.  Yes, the noise was inconvenient; and, yes, I got only four hours of sleep.
     All of this was over-ridden by many factors in the hotel.  A clean room, with a comfortable bed.  A large bathroom (with bidet!) and an ample, invigorating shower.  The unfailing friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, from the door to the desk.  In fact, the doorman went out his way to get a taxi for a friend who wasn't even staying at the hotel!  Finally, the Peter Cullim, the front office manager, gave me a 50% discount on the room for the nigh ofthe alarm.
     So ignore the negative comments.  Things happen when we travel.  If we expect the comfort of home for $300 a might in NYC, we should stay home.

title: Great Staff and Service
text: My business partner and I were impressed with your staff and the high level of service we received.Everyone was great!The gentlemen who took out of the taxi as well the guy who put them in are fantastic. The people behind the check in desk were wonderful especially Sarah.Keep the staff!I'll  be back.

title: The staff made it better
text:
We booked into this hotel online and were ushered to our room where you could barely swing a cat. Not that we had a cat with us but you catch my drift. A quick word with the reception staff got us a room upgrade at a small cost and it was a much more spacious room. Very comfortable, clean, well kept, with all the extras in the bathroom and bar provided for. 

Maybe I'm not used to sleeping with an AC switched on so I found the one in the room seriously loud. I'm a light sleeper so the slightest of sounds do tend to keep me up or wake me up. 

The hotel is very central to the hub of 5th Avenue, Times Square and all the other touristy places we visited. I loved the fact that the staff at the reception suggested we try the Big Bus Tour and even offered us discount coupons. Well recommended - the tours were quite a highlight of our trip. 

The only breakfast you get is a roll and coffee and the cookies at turndown service are YUMMY! :-D 

In all, a very pleasant experience but I was expecting bigger rooms and a decent American breakfast. As a tourist, this was fulfilled at the diner next door.

title: Fun
text:
Just returned from four NYC visit with daughter and granddaughter. Stayed at City Club Hotel on W 44th.  Amazing service and amazing amenities. All staff members wonderful from check into housekeeping.  Will certainly stay again.   
Location perfect for theatre, midtown, Central Park and subway.

title: Nice hotel fantastic location
text:
We were here for a week in May and were happy with our choice. The location is amazing, and we got a good deal. The hotel is quite small in that it does not have a lot of rooms, or a huge lobby or anything, but that adds to the charm.
The room itself was very nice, good size nice bed. Loved the daily fresh chocolate cooky! 
At night you have to be able to sleep in a city, as you will hear city sounds, or aircon, etc but that did not bother us much. Even the fact that we couldn't really open a window as then the smell from neighbouring restaurants would come in our room did not bother us.
We had breakfast there once, which was very nice, but maybe not worth the price. Better options are available outside.
All in all very happy with our choice, recommended!

title: Superb
text: We stayed there twice over the course of one week (I was on a Business trip nearby NYC) and although never been to NYC it felt home right away: very nice and helpful staff, excellent rooms and perfect location. Highly recommendable.

title: Posizione strategica
text:
Questo hotel si trova in una posizione realmente comodissima. A due passi da times square..vicino al rockfeller center..broadway e con i mezzi pubblici comodi.
La struttura è tradizionale. Pulita.  Spaziosa. Il personale veramente cordiale. Al mio ritorno di sicuro ripeterò. Consigliato.

title: Good, somewhere between 3 (average) and 4 (very good)!
text: Stayed at the Club City Hotel for 5 nights in early June 2016, staff extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful and price was good for the great location just 5 mins from Times Square. Lifts dark and need a quick makeover, very dark but acceptable as only in then for a few minutes at a time. Room was very small and looked onto another building, could see no daylight at all and decor could have done with some work. Bed was comfortable but small, bed linen was a strange affair that consisted of sheet duvet sheet in a sandwich which by the end of the night was all tangled and awkward. Bathroom good, good toiletries and powerful hot shower. Could be really great with just some minor tweaks.

title: Perfect location, extraordinarily friendly staff, needs some TLC
text: We've stayed at many different places in NYC but City Club wins the award for most friendly staff.  Everyone from the cleaning staff to the doormen to the front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  The hotel is centrally located and a perfect landing spot to explore the city while still offering a very quiet night's sleep.  We didn't have any street noise whatsoever.  Our only suggestion is that the hotel rooms are quite small and the decor is very tired and needs to be updated, as do the elevators.  The elevators did not inspire confidence.  Having said that it's clean and the wonderful staff makes up for any shortfall and the price for NYC is very reasonable.

title: In the heart of Theater
text: City Club Hotel is located less than a 10 minute walk to TKTS at Times Square. The hotel staff is superb: I use Expedia and I was given VIP upgrades, complimentary breakfasts, and free wifi. The rooms are spacious enough and well appointed to elegantly blend the old with the new. I stay in New York often, but this was the best in value, ambiance, quality, and location. If I can get the same rate, I will be back.

title: Great place
text:
We enjoyed the hotel for 4 nights.
Service is good, stuff are smiling, everywere clean and tidy.
In house resturant. Reasonable prices.
6 minutes from Times square, safe area to walk at night.
