Enjoyed the very close transportation ( underground, open bus, taxis etc.)

title: Great location and great team
text: Sarah, Pete and the door men are fantastic. Help you book dinner and theatre.   Amazing location ease to explore all sights.  Get a room facing street less noisy air con.  Excellent for exploring New York.

title: Fantastic location and a lovely room
text: City Club is located in a convenient spot just a block away from Times Square. We saw three shows while in New York and all were within a 10 minute walk. The room was quiet, comfortable, nicely decorated and the hotel staff were very helpful with our requests. Add-ons like breakfast are not cheap, but this is New York so that isn't unusual. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay close to Times Square in small hotel.

title: Great location, solid overall
text:
We booked relatively last minute on a "mystery" / locked-in booking website. The price was quite reasonable, but it was certainly under the advertised/posted rates.

The location was excellent for those looking to stay in Manhattan. It was a very short walk to Times Square and the theaters nearby. There is certainly noise and bustle from the city, but from our room with the sliding doors closed, they did a reasonable job keeping the sound out.

The room was slightly small for the North American average, but it was not uncomfortable by any means. The large comfortable bed and TV were nice touches, and the small outdoor balcony was also appreciated. The table was a touch small, but that is likely personal preference. Most of the furniture showed a little bit of wear and tear (some nicks and dings), but nothing unreasonable or unexpected. The washroom was clean and neat, but the tile chosen does get a bit slippery when wet. The toiletries included were neat and worked for us.

The service was fine for the short time we stayed. There was no major positive highlight or negative to note. We did not partake in any room service or the associated restaurant beside/attached to the hotel property.

Overall, City Club has an excellent location and was a perfectly acceptable stay. It met our expectations in all respects.

title: What a rip off
text:
I had the displeasure of "staying" at this hotel recently. Was looking for a deal for one night in Manhattan. Everything was expensive on May 17th, so based on the OK reviews of City Club Hotel, I booked 1 night at $730 including taxes.

So, what do you get for $730? My room (Room 202) was a nasty dingy little thing next to the elevator. A curtain hangs in front of the "mini bar", the window has wooden shutters, no drapes. Dirty carpet... But, thats not the worst part. The mattress was sagging so badly in the middle that after just 5 minutes of laying down, I had to get up. I called the reception and they were sold out so they did not have anything else to give me. So, I decided to take a shower and find another hotel for the night. Big surprise... no hot water at all. Packed my bags and left. No refund possible... Total rip-off. 
1 star because there are no options for negative stars. Stay away from this overpriced dump

title: Un buon hotel al centro di New York
text: Niente da ridire su questo Hotel al centro di New York centrale ,non immenso personale gentilissimo camere pulite e abbastanza grandi, bagno molto spazioso, letto comodissimo, si trova tra la 5a e la 6a Av. Vicino a Time sq. E alla 42st accanto ha un ristorante,che si puo usufruire per la colazione, pranzo o cena oppure per farsi un drink.

title: Excellent location with friendly, welcoming staff
text:
We stayed at the City Club Hotel over seven nights celebrating my 50th Birthday with five family members. Our room was a family room for five, at the front of the hotel on the eighth floor, which was very clean and well furnished with a spacious bathroom. The one and only negative was the small wardrobe space, which for just two people would have been fine but a little small for five.

The hotel is perfectly located for exploring and has everything you need by way of eateries and shopping all around.

Pete the front office manager and all of the staff were very helpful and pleasant and helped make several arrangements for us during our stay. They all made us feel very welcome and helped to make our stay very enjoyable.

A small but more personable, well situated hotel with all that you need for a short or longer stay in New York. We will definitely stay at the hotel again when we return.

Thank you Pete and staff for a great stay at the City Club.

title: Muy buen hotel y la mejor ubicacion para visitar la ciudad
text: Muy buen hotel, al principio asusta un poco cuando llegas y ves lo pequena que es la recepcion, luego cuando subes a las habitaciones, ya es otra cosa. El hotel es excelnte y la ubicacion es inmejorable. la limpieza es muy buena. La habitacion es amplia y con terraza. Todas las noches nos dejaban unas cookies en la habitacion que estaban deliciosas. El servicio del hotel super amable y servicial.Las cama de nuestra habitacion era super comoda. Es un hotel moderno y perfectamente ubicado para hacer turismo. Un hotel sencillo y moderno, sin lujos pero todo muy muy correcto.

title: Ordentliches Hotel
text: Ordentliches Hotel in super Lage 5 Gehminuten vom Time Square. Sehr freundliches und aufgeschlossenes Personal am Empfang. Saubere Zimmer, großes Bad. Klimaanlage. Leider gehen alle Fenster zu Hinterhöfen, in denen Wärmetauscher anderer Klimaanlagen stehen. Also null Aussicht, aber schlafen kann man trotzdem gut

title: Go location, good price
text: Stayed at City Club with wife for business and pleasure. We found City Club to be neat and clean. The price was reasonable, The location was great. We were above a trendy restaurant which allowed us to put the dinner on the room.

title: Good location, but not a hotel to hang out at
text: Very good location, close to Times Square and Central Park.  Hotel is nice.  There's an expensive restaurant that I didn't try.  Rooms are simple, modern and clean.  Most rooms have no view, except for those in the front (3 rooms per floor) but they are noisy on street side.  No lobby to meet or relax.  Nice place if you're not hanging out at the hotel.

title: Something needs to be done to the air conditioner
text: The location was excellent, The room was small but very adequate, The bathroom was sensational but needed a magnified mirror. The service was great. The convenience of an excellent restaurant off lobby was a plus, The major minus was the air conditioner. The fan was ancient and kept awake almost all night, A definite negative,

title: Convenient
text: I stayed at City Club for a couple of nights and it was a pleasant experience. Rooms were small (it's NYC), yet well appointed. The comfy bed and cookies deserve a special mention. Location was good and checkin staff were cordial and helpful. In summary, a cozy convenient spot.

title: Perfeito em tudo
text: Excelente localização, quarto espaçoso e limpo. Equipe espetacular. Recepcionistas Arissa, Marcus e Eddie são formidáveis. Prestativos em tudo o que for preciso. Cookies de chocolate quentinhos todos os dias às 18h no quarto! Recomendo a todos e voltaria com todo certeza.

title: Excellent 4-Day Weekend Based at The City Club
text:
Our room was one of the amazing, historically-significant Grand Duplex Suites.  Amazing space!  I'm an interior architect and chose this hotel and this room so that we could experience the space!

Excellent décor, furnishings, ambience!

title: Super endroit
text: J ai hésité à prendre cet hôtel Car certains avis étaient négatifs, comme toujours et c est normal, j ai trouve le City club super bien placé, a2 pas de Times square et de bcp de points de vue! Nous avons été surclassé donc bonne surprise à notre arrivée! Accueil chaleureux, peu de bruits extérieurs, seul hic; le bruit de la clim mais Ca n empêche pas de dormir non plus!!Tous les jours vous avez un cookie dans la chambre qui est délicieux! À refaire!!

title: Preislich ok
text:
Also vorweg, der Preis für New York ist ok, wir haben 139 EUR pro Nacht bezahlt, das war es wert, mehr jedoch nicht.
Kleine Zimmer was noch zu verschmerzen gewesen wäre, das erste Zimmer im 3. Stock war furchtbar laut da im schrecklichen Innenhof die Maschinen für die Klimaanlage liefen, so laut dass nachts kein Schlaf möglich war, haben aber am nächsten Tag anderes Zimmer im 7. Stock bekommen wo das etwas besser war, das einzige Fenster war leider wieder zu diesem schrecklichen Innenhof der eher wie ein Maschinenpark war, somit als Fenster nicht zu gebrauchen, war auch mit Jalousie verdeckt damit man das nicht sieht, defacto also Zimmer ohne irgendein Fenster. Sauberkeit so einigermaßen, aber auch schon alte Zimmer und daher abgewohnt.
Dafür wirklich sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal das sich sehr bemüht hat

title: Super Lage in Manhatten
text:
Kleines aber feines Hotel in bester Lage in Manhatten. Service war super nett und freundlich und es gab Cookies jeden Tag :)
Kurzer Hinweis: Petite Zimmer heißt wirklich petite Zimmer.
Würde das Hotel wieder besuchen.

title: Sad that we could only stay one night
text: We loved this place. Unassuming entryway and front desk had us a little worried. Silly us!  The room was wonderful. We had a double facing the street on the 7th floor and were very pleased. Everything about the room was clean and luxurious. The window bench and a window that opened were an amazing surprise.  The staff was curious and attentive and never condescending.  The beds and pillows were wonderful. The marble shower and oversize towels were a treat!

title: Cozy clean and quiet!
text: I was upgraded to a queen room from the tiny room I had booked which was great. After a very long haul from Australia I was so appreciative of the very very comfortable bed! I found 'real' coffee across the road at Gregory's and went to a fantastic play in the same street. Despite the lack of any view, the room felt really cost and the hotel has a certain ambience that is rare. Thanks to John and Peter at the front desk and to the man (forgotten his name) who can get a cab outside immediately!

title: Great location
text: I stayed here for one night in April after attending a conference down the street - I was looking for something conveniently located and reasonably priced and this fit the bill. I had originally booked the petite room and was upgraded to the next level on arrival which was a nice surprise My only complaint was that the floor that I stayed on smelled a bit stale but after browsing the reviews I realized after that I stayed on a smoking floor (3rd floor) so I would be mindful to request a non-smoking floor in the future. Had I been staying longer than one night I may have tried to move rooms. My room itself though did not smell of smoke and was well appointed - the bathroom was huge and the bed was comfortable. As a solo traveler I felt very safe and it was easy to get to/from the hotel. The room was nice and quiet as well - not something that is often found in the middle of Manhattan. The staff was all very pleasant and I would definitely look at returning.

title: Un bien agréable séjour
text: L'hôtel est particulièrement bien situé : proche de Times Square, du Rockefeller Center, de la 5ème avenue, de l'Empire State building, du Moma, ... L'accueil à l'hôtel  été très chaleureux. Nous avons été surclassés spontanément. La chambre était équipée d'un grand lit (très confortable), d'une banquette, d'une table bureau, d'un coffre, d'un mini bar (caché derrière un tableau), d'un petit placard et de la wifi. La salle de bain était spacieuse avec une baignoire, des produits Bigelow, des peignoirs et un sèche-cheveux. Les trois fenêtres de la chambre et de la salle de bain donnaient sur une cour commune avec les hôtels voisins. Ce qui permet de bien dormir et est finalement préférable à une chambre donnant sur la rue La ventilation est peut être un peu bruyante. Le personnel est souriant et extrêmement serviable (aide aux réservations, produits supplémentaires pour le bain, ...). La chambre était bien entretenue et nettoyée tous les jours. Tous les après-midis, un petit cookie est déposé sur le lit. Nous avons passé un bien agréable séjour dans ce petit hôtel à taille humaine. Un petit moins : la moquette des couloirs dans les étages pourrait être changée.

title: Beautiful luxurious and a pleasure to stay in
text:
We booked into city club in a frantic booking.com moment after a mix up with our previous hotel and travel agent

My oh my how i wish we had been here for all 7 nights in nyc instead of 1

The staff are helpful but in a genuine way 

The room  (a queen sized) was big and felt very luxe. The bathroom was probably bigger than our last room (a booking disaster our travel agent will be held accountable for)

Its close to all of mid town on a quiter street so taxi horns can't be heard and a hidden gem of tranquility in the craziest of cities 

I cannot recommend it enough 

#teamcityclub 

When i come back to nyc this will be my first choice for a.mid town hotel in this price range

title: Vacation
text: Outstanding experience!  Right down to the turn down cookies we had every night!  The doorman and front desk staff made our experience truly one of a kind!  Always available to help and keep us heading in the right direction!  Printing tickets for games, giving us directions, calling cabs, holding our luggage and meeting our family needs were exceptional & always done with a smile!  The rooms for a New York City Hotel were spacious and updated for a family of 5.  The hotel was very quiet and we did not have noise waking the kids or keeping us up at night.  Housekeeping was phenomenal and always kept us in order each day!  Did I mention we were a family of 5 with 3 elementary aged kids??  :)  The Location of this hotel had us within walking distance to major shopping areas, Times Square, Central Park, subway, etc.  We did a lot of walking and this was such an easy place to get to all the sights and places we were looking to see during our NYC Spring Break trip.  This is the place to stay!

title: Great Location
text: This is a great, little hotel situated just a couple of blocks from Times Square making it very convenient for both theatres and transportaion.  The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The room, although small, was clean and the bed very comfortable.  The bathroom was nicely appointed with a fabulous shower.  The only downside was trying to control the temperature of the room. The fan/ air conditioner was very loud making it hard to sleep if it was 'on'.  Our solution was to open the window and prop it open with a book to keep the air flowing during the night.  Overall, we would recommend this hotel for location alone.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Every time that I visit NY, I always stay at City Club Hotel this is really the most confortable and  Beautiful.
The people that works here is really nice, especially Pete, Arissa and John, those guys are fantastic, always with a smile on their faces and allways willing to help. 
I really enjoy the City Club Hotel, mostly for the great team. 

Try! You wont regreat

title: Vacation
text: I did enjoy my vacation after a long day at the hotel viewing the place due to the fact that my folk works there it was great.. I loved it and will definitely be going back summer for sure.  It was a little cold and all but that surely didn't take the fun out of my trip and i must say It was the best trip and gift ever as I was not only celebrating my birthday but me and my best guy's anniversary, just a year and it feels like forever.

title: Shirley Saliba
text:
Hi there, am looking at booking this gorgeous hotel for me and my teenage daughter going to New York at the end of July... Can anyone tell me if smoking is allowed anywhere or what rooms?
Thanks in advance

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
text:
DUPLEX SUITE WAS EMACULATE  , SPACIOUS AND ELEGANT
We were greeted by an extremely professional young man , John. He made our stay even more pleasant. He was both informative and conscientious .
The bellman Rob was very helpful with our luggage and questions.
The housekeeper Carol ensured our room was spotless and fully stocked daily.
The cookies just topped it all off........What a fantastic experience, cannot wait to come back .....

title: location makes up for small room
text: great location, great service....room super super but I was on my own so ok for the weekend.  great bathroom and loved the chocolate chip cookies at night.  good midtown location.  would not recommend if you have lots of luggage as there is no room

title: Perfect stay in City at City
text: As ex-New Yorker, I took my 7 year old on quick trip to NYC. I found City Club to be in a great location with an extremely attentive staff. The room was perfect with a comfortable bed and wonderful room service. I'm not an easy person to please and enjoy 4 Seasons service & cleanliness. City Club exceeded my expectations.

title: So Excited!
text: I am basing this review on price, location and the fact that it isn't a giant high-rise, cookie cutter hotel. We are staying the beginning of June and bringing our 16 yr old son for his first visit to NYC. He is so excited! We booked the Duplex Suite so we can spread out....can't wait!

title: A hidden gem!
text: A friend and I had the pleasure of staying at the City Club Hotel last week.  It's in the perfect midtown location, making it very easy to walk just about anyplace.  There are many terrific restaurants very near the hotel, from the Red Flame Diner, to Virgil's to The Lamb's Club, and so many more.  Our room was small (but not tiny), very beautiful, and had plenty of room to walk around the room even with a great queen size bed.  The bathroom was very large and luxurious (including a bidet), a real treat with the finest toiletries and plush complimentary robes.  The hotel staff was wonderful, very welcoming and helpful at every turn, especially Donovan, the doorman!  If all that weren't enough, they deliver the best chocolate chunk cookies late every afternoon.   I'm picky and I can't think of one thing to complain about or improve on. Can't wait to return!

title: awesome!
text:
Everything was fantastic about the City Club Hotel. The room with the loft was perfect, especially for a family with 3 kids. And you could not beat the location, walking distance to everything uptown.

The staff was EXTREMELY helpful as well - would definitely stay there again

title: Un ottimo Hotel fra la Quinta e Times Square
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel di New York, nel mese di 
marzo.
La posizione è eccezionale.
Non spaventatevi se la hall dell'Hotel è un buco.
Le stanze Luxury sono tagliate bene, con camera con letto
King, bagno con box doccia, accappatoi e raffinati articoli
da bagno.
Frigobar, televisore grande e Wi-Fi gratuito.
Al terzo piano ci sono le camere per fumatori.
Alla sera ti lasciano due biscotti veramente buoni sul cuscino.
Alla reception ci sono ragazzi svegli e simpatici.
In particolare Eric.
Rapporto qualità/prezzo molto interessante.
Prenotando con largo anticipo ho pagato le camere € 230,00
con già comprese le tasse.
Tenete presente che bloccano Usd 100 per camera, per notte
sulla carta di credito.
Consigliatissimo a chi adora la zona Times Square, quinta
strada, Broadway...

title: Fantastic Location - a hidden gem of New York
text:
This is more of a boutique hotel.  A small reception area (but adequate).  We booked a Duplex Suite on two floors.  The top floor has a king bed and bathroom, with a spiral staircase leading down to a sitting area with a king sofa bed and separate toilet and a small balcony overlooking the street.  The room was perfect for our group (three friends).

Located between 5th Avenue and Lexington, the hotel is within easy distance of all attractions and only 10 minutes from Time Square (by a very slow stroll).  Tucked down a side street, we were a little away from the hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue and some of the major tourist noises - out of the way, but still within easy reach.

title: Excited
text: I can not wait to go New York in December I have booked this hotel based on the reviews I have read and my girlfriend and I can not tell you how happy we are to be staying in a nice hotel the pictures and reviews look amazing and the beds look really comfy

title: موقع معقول وسعر مقبول ..
text: قريب من التايم سكوير , غرفة واسعة قليلا مقارنة ببقية فنادق نيويورك.. تعامل الموظفين ممتاز, انصح عند الحجز المباشر في الفندق ان تذكر لهم سعر المواقع الالكترونية لهذا الفندق سوف يعطونك اقل من السعر المعروض في الموقع,

title: Brilliant stay...
text:
Weve just returned from a stay at City Club Hotel for the 32 hours we had to enjoy NYC and the cation was brilliant..close to all central Manhattan attractions, only a few blocks from Times Square,5th Ave,Empire State,Chrysler etc..so handy for everywhere.
Room was very clean,great amenities,comfortable bed and the area around the hotel was quiet which all in all made for a very pleasurable stay.
The staff were extremely polite and courteous with special thanks going to 'Eddie' for all his help,hints and knowledge on anything that we needed to ask about our visit.
Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and if we travel to NYC again, without doubt we'd stay here.
Thank you

title: Extreme value for money
text: Maybe the smallest room we ever had but in a very competitive price in the heart of the city. Exceeding expectations having a lit of small details and several amenities although the small place. And Eddie in the reception has given us very good tips and advices.

title: Watch your charges!!!
text: So the room is decent but when you leave, they stack your bill with bogus charges.  You can't refute them because it's made after you're gone.  They need to train their staff better to stop making "error".  Would have had a nice time in NY if I didn't have to deal with this.

title: Splendid hotel
text: We spent three nights here in the beginning of the month to visit my hubsands relatives who live in New Jersey. Usually, we stay at the Hyatt nearby but we did some online browsing & acquired a great price for a room. We had spent a night at the Royalton a few years back so we are familiar with this street & location wise it was very convenient. Now, I will say that upon first impression of the small lobby it can skew your opinion but this hotel is a steal for the price. The rooms were very spacious for midtown standards and the bathrooms had water pressure better than anywhere we've stayed in NY. The parking garage across the street is a great rate for those who are driving as well. The restaurant next door is a bit pricey but make excellent coffee (which pair well with the turndown cookies). Eddie at the front desk was stellar, he took care of us both nights even going as far as personally taking care of our dinner plans and helping sort a billing issue at the end of the stay. We love coming to NY and this hotel might be our new favorite discovery. Hopefully the rates will be reasonable in November as we are planning to run the marathon this year.

title: Wonderful time 3/11/2016 - 3/14/2016
text: My BFF and I visited New York City to celebrate a major milestone birthday.  I've been to New York City many times and stayed at several hotels in Manhattan.  The City Club exceeded my expectations.  The hotel was lovely, the staff was superb and the nightly cookies were fantastic!  This is the best kept secret in Manhattan!  We loved you, City Club Hotel, and will definitely be back to visit.

title: i've definitely stayed at better.....
text: My husband and I booked a room at this hotel in January, for our trip in March. When we checked in, they were super nice at the front desk. When we got off the elevator on our floor, it wreaked of smoke. I'm super allergic to smoke, so we told the front desk of this. She said there wasn't anything that could be done that evening, but they would move us the next day. I'm sorry, but if someone is allergic to smoke, they should be accommodated sooner than later. For the inconvenience, she gave us passes for "free continental breakfast". There was no conditions listed on the card as to how we needed to use them. We ordered from the door hanger menu and ordered 2 continental breakfasts for the next day. When the "food" arrived, they told us the "complimentary" breakfast coupon wouldn't work unless it was specifically stated upon ordering......Um...this wasn't told to us so we were out 50 bucks for a few croissants and some terrible coffee that we didn't even eat or drink. Upon the last night staying here, they thought it'd be convenient to shut off all water from 12-8. I mean, we just have to laugh of the experience and learn from our mistake. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great stay
text: Loved our time here - we found a good rate  online and decided to book over the weekend with tickets to a show. Perhaps our expectations were limited but we had a fantastic two nights here. Great showers, lovely sinful cookies at turndown and the location is amazing. The staff were gems-both Eddy's in the lobby & the umbrellas were a well appreciated touch! Hope to be back in the summer!

title: Perfect Stay
text: My girlfriend booked this hotel and I was skeptical because I have always stayed at Marriotts or Hiltons. This experience has me rethinking how I will book hotels in the future. We flew into Newark Airport early and took a taxi to the hotel. We were very early (around 10 am) so they didn't have room for us yet. The bellman took our luggage and John and Pete at the front desk gave us some ideas on what we could do in the mean time. We ended up going for a breakfast/lunch at Cafe Un Deux Trois which was only a block away and then walked around Times Square. Right as we were deciding on what to do for the rest of the day the hotel called (at around 1 pm) to tell us that they had a room ready for us. We went back to the hotel and Pete checked us in and told us that we were getting a free upgrade to a room with a queen bed and a balcony. The room wasn't very big but probably still bigger then the room we booked to begin with and the balcony was a really nice touch. The weather was great so we ended up having coffee on the balcony every morning and ate our cookies that they leave in the room after cleaning it out there too. We only stayed a few nights but we will definitely stay there again if we go back to NYC.

title: Perfect Spot and Price
text: Great location, Nice clean room ,big bathroom. Good price, 159 dollars per night after taxes. You are not getting anything this nice so close to time square at this price. The only thing I did not like, Was that I went downstairs 4 times  through out the AM hours of the night and NO ONE was at the front desk. I went in and out of the Hotel un noticed. The same way anyone can go in and out. HEY! It is New York City! We did not have a special key for the elevator. So anyone can have access to the hotel floors. I would still stay here and I do recommend it!

title: Just Right
text: We booked this hotel using our credit card points. We originally booked a "petite" room since we did not plan to spend much time in the room anyway. We were pleasantly surprised at check in to find we had been upgraded to a larger room. The staff were very friendly and helpful in storing our luggage before and after our check in/check out. We received a nice surprise of warm, complimentary chocolate chip cookies one evening as we were in our room getting ready to go out for the evening. After a long day of walking the city, the shower was AMAZING!! The high water pressure felt fantastic. Surprisingly, I did not seem like there was much noise during the night. For the location to be so convenient, the surrounding streets seemed to really quiet down to allow for good sleep.

title: Just right
text:
After a lengthy delay getting from O'Hare to LaGuardia and then having my cab get a flat tire, I was exhausted by the time I got to City Club.  So, I thrilled to bits when they told me that they had upgraded me from my booked Petit room to a Queen Room!  I was travelling solo, and the room had everything I needed.  I loved the bed; it was the most comfortable bed I've ever encountered in any hotel I've ever stayed in!  The only odd thing I found was that there was no closet in which I could hang clothes, so I had to make do with drawers in the bedside table.  If you are interested in raiding the mini-bar, be aware that it is located behind the artwork on the wall!  Helpfully, the "door" of the minibar had been left ajar which naturally led me to open it, and voila!  I had hoped it was a closet, but no.  I loved the shower room (very Scandinavian).

Like everyone else has said, the location of The City Club is perfect.  I had breakfasts at the Red Flame diner just down the street (great for breakfast, not as great for lunch or dinner).

The staff was so helpful and informative, especially about the subway!  

Oh, also, I took advantage of their winter seasonal offer, so the price I paid for 4 nights in Midtown Manhattan, including tax, was $533 (the tax was $77), so I felt it was a bargain.

I highly recommend The City Club Hotel.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: Very nice hotel with a great location. Small and intimate with good service. I've stayed here several times over the years for business but I did notice on this trip that my room was starting to show some wear - like the walls need painting and the covers on the sofa near the windows are looking dirty and worn. Still like this place but it could use a little freshening up or deep/detailed clean.

title: Perfect place to stay
text:
I booked hotel through discount website and was treated with a smile and a sense of humor when I checked in. The front desk attendant (John) and the manager (Peter) were extremely helpful.
My room was beyond expectation. It was large, clean and pretty impressive. My only negative would be is the wallpaper and carpeting would probably benefit from updating but it certainly wouldn't stop me reserving here again.

title: Great location and service
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 2 days. The location was so convenient! walking distance to a lots of shops and great dinner available downstairs. 
The service was exceptional, I booked a room from hotwire, very small. I was traveling with a toddler, stroller and 3 luggage. we looked at the room and it was tinny!! the front desk lady was so kind and offer to upgrade, of course we had to pay extra for the upgrade. but the room was great! big and cozy. 
I loved the home made cookies they gave us! thank you!

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
I almost hate to write this review, because then it will become enormously popular and I won't be able to get a room. 

I am a Native New Yorker who has lived away from NYC for her entire adult life.  Since I miss the city so much, I come back several times a year to see a show, friends, all the fun that NYC has to offer.  I stumbled across this one for a name your own price and I was enchanted.  The hotel is gorgeous!  The staff is incredibly friendly, and were great when I brought my 7 year old in for her 1st trip to NYC, and surprised us with an upgrade.  It was so fabulous, that I had to explain to her that this was NOT the typical experience and most NYC hotel room are like closets with beds.  

The toiletries are top notch, the bed is comfy and just when it can't get any better, there are warm chocolate chip cookies provided with turndown.

Seriously, I don't even want to consider staying anywhere else when I go to NYC.

title: Situation idéale
text:
Hôtel sans prétention, parfait pour un séjour fait de mouvements et de visites.
Chambre très "New yorkaise" avec le lit qui prend tout l'espace de chambre 
Très propre et calme 
WiFi gratuit 
Salle de bain de bonne dimension

title: Ótimo
text:
Gostei muito da estadia neste hotel, recomendo para quem vai e com ctza volto. 
Pontos positivos que me fazem recomendá-lo: 
  - Localizacão excelente e preço bom: Ficar bem localizado permite aproveitar melhor NY, não tem problema em estar até tarde na rua, facilita o transporte, as atrações estão ao seu lado, faz-se muita coisa a pé, dá para voltar ao hotel no meio do dia/noite deixar compras, pegar mais blusa ou deixar, descansar e voltar para a rua. Já fiquei em Long Island, pelo preço.. é tranquilo, mas não se compara. 
  - Wi-fii grátis funcionando bem
  - Serviço normal, amigável. Quarto e banheiro bons. 
- Tem quarto para guardar as bagagens. 
Pontos negativos: Não tem café da manhã incluso, e não tinha cafeteira no quarto, apesar de no site dizer que havia. A TV grande, fica justamente em frente ao espelho, bem bizarro.. rs Tem espelho grande no banheiro, então ok.

title: Excellent in every way!
text:
Put simply, this hotel brings everything to the table. 
It's in a great area (especially for first timers to New York); it's between time square and 5th avenue.
The hotel staff is incredibly welcoming and accommodating (no offence NYC, but it's refreshing!). The room is spacious for the city, and the bed is very comfortable. 
The decor in the room is definitely modern and tasteful (for those who care about how their room looks), and also very clean. 
The hotel's policy is that every morning they leave a freshly baked cookie on a plate on the bed from their own french bakery (it tastes amazing and and is way above and beyond).
Plus, there is no fuss, hidden charges or hassles from check in to check out. 
It's pretty great... Stay here, for sure...

title: Lovely place!
text: The husband and I came into New York to visit our daughter and we chose this place online based on its value and central location but it was a great find! The lobby isnt overly large but very nice in design. We loved the showers and the umbrellas in the room came in handy. Eddie at the front desk was fabulous and parking right across the street for those who drive. Will be back!

title: Great for dog owners!
text:
My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary which is also valentine's day.  We didn't want to put our dogs in a kennel and it is really hard to find a dog sitter that is inexpensive.  We looked on trip advisor to find a hotel that allows dogs and thought this place to be the best option.  It doesn't have additional fees for dogs, we had to drive because we brought them and there was parking right across the street for only $45 a day, the hotel itself was cozy plus they upgraded our room, and it is close to EVERYTHING!  There is a park with an ice skating rink two blocks away, you are right at the corner of Fifth Avenue, broadway is a five minute walk, time square is right down the road, subway entrances everywhere, and central park is just a fifteen minute walk away.  The staff was friendly. The man at the front desk even helped us find a great restaurant for our anniversary after the ballet, which was just an eight minute subway ride away.
If you want to stay at a place where you have easy access to food, entertainment, and shops then you should stay here.  Also, if you have pets and want to share you vacation with them, this is the place to stay.  And although the rooms aren't that big, you won't be in there long enough to care because you will be out your whole trip.

title: Great short stay
text:
Spent Valentine's weekend here with my wife. We're now familiar with a lot of NYC
hotels, and this one was special--bigger than normal room and bathroom, comfortable beds, and lovely decor. No coffee but Gregory's is across the street. Would recommend.

title: Hidden Gem in the heart of NYC
text: I come to New York often for business and pleasure and the is my new favorite hotel. WOW!!! AMAZING, attentive staff! Decent sized room for city standards and actually has a desk AND large sofa. I was very impressed!!! I highly recommend this hotel and the price is unbeatable. Great room, great location, great experience. Oh... and the surprise delivery of the chocolate chip cookie was priceless.

title: Adorei o Hotel
text:
Excelente localização e custo benefício fantástico! Para quem não está interessado em se hospedar no hotel das estrelas, esse hotel é uma excelente pedida.
Pequenino, simples mas com os quartos ótimos e banheiros excelentes também, ele atende super bem a quem quer aproveitar NY e não o hotel.
Ao lado tem um restaurante top que você pode beber deliciosos drinks
Aprovado!

title: First Time In New York
text: This was our first time in New York and we had no idea what we were doing. This hotel was like a little secret, in the way that it is so small you could easily miss it. But we really enjoyed our stay, we originally booked a petite room but was upgraded to a king size. Which was awesome! The king size was  pretty small so I can't even imagine the petite room. So that was a really nice upgrade, the room was nice and the bathroom decor was really cool as well! We couldn't get the internet to work though and the tv was  messed up the first day but they fixed it. It may  be a bit overpriced based on the size but you can't beat the location! The first day we decided to walk to try to find some food and we literally just stumbled into times square. We didn't realize how close we were! It was awesome! I also would recommend the Cafe and Deli down the road, really good sandwiches. The staff was nice! The doorman was helpful, as well as the guy who fixed our tv and recommended a few places to get food.

title: You need to stay here!
text: I LOVED the city club hotel! I stayed alone for 2 nights and then was met by my fiancé. The rooms were clean, nice, comfortable and had all necessary features. The staff was truly the best of any hotel I have stayed at. They provided ample recommendations and were so much fun to talk to!  Everyday there were two warm chocolate chip cookies in my clean room. Location was obviously amazing- blocks from time square. We Will be staying here again!

title: Best place to stay in Midtown
text: Hotel is very nice. rooms are comfortable, big size beds & clean, reception is very accomodative and friendly. Location is perfect for visiting manhattani.e. near museums, restaurants, theaters, department stores.

title: Definitely NOT a 4 Start Hotel
text: This hotel is so not worth the price per night. It's location is good but not excellent for the price. Is very small and rooms are more like a 2/3 start hotel. Bed was not comfy at all. The only good thing I can think of this hotel is the friendly staff. Definitely will not repeat.

title: Only three rooms per floor with sunlight
text: I asked for a quiet room at the end of a hallway, away from the elevator.  I did not realize that I had requested "the cave."  Everything about the room was lovely -- terrific mirrors, magnificent bathroom, comfortable bed, decent-sized closet -- but the view from my windows was a brick wall.  Three feet from my window was a wall, not even a view of other buildings, just a wall.  IF YOU HAVE DEPRESSION, DO NOT ACCEPT A ROOM DOWN THE HALL!

title: Still a great boutique hotel which is very good value
text: I hadn't stayed at the City Club in my last two visits to New York because the place was full. But this time I managed it and it was great to be back. It has some of the nicest rooms in the city, especially at the price; very comfortable beds; free, fast wifi; great staff, marble bathrooms and a terrific midtown location. It's also it's very cosy in cold weather. There is an outstanding non-chain coffee shop across the street - very handy when I needed to file a story at 7 in the morning. I last reviewed it in 2010 and said it was my first choice in New York. It still is.

title: Pleasant surprise!
text: My first time in NYC for an overnight, and was nervous about finding a good hotel in the "big city".  Everything about this - from the guys at the front desk to the doorman to the room was awesome! (my teenage son accounted that the shower wasn't just a shower,  it was "an experience!" Parking was a breeze across the street, location was perfect and safe. We discovered the diner next door (Red Flame) and it was incredible! I'm ready to go back! Thanks City Club for a perfect introduction to the Big Apple!

title: Supreme stay in NYC
text: One of our favorite choices for an NYC overnight is City Club. Don't let the minuscule lobby fool you! The rooms are lovely, the beds comfy and the amenities and finishes top notch. Great location, too!

title: Nice rooms close to times square
text: Modern boutique hotel, in a nice area, easy walking to Times Square, great pubs and restaurants. Rooms are nice, bedding plush, baths luxurious. No cafe, no lobby, but this is NY, you just need a nice room close to everything and the staff was very nice.

title: Fantástica localización a una manzana de Times Square.
text: Muy buena situación, hotel pequeño, buen servicio, habitaciones no muy grandes, muchas interiores, concretamente una de las que ocupamos daba a una pared, la otra a la calle. Un poco ruidos a la calefacción. Muy amable el servicio de habitaciones. Un poco caro.

title: Manager
text:
I ween last month to NY I was very lucky to book a room on city club hotel it's was the best ever the customer service was excellence Lee and Wendy very polite professional and helpful I really enjoyed been over their the room very clean very organize big and beautiful the shower was the best ever I will love to go again 
Thanks lee and Wendy for the good customer service

title: Достойный отель в центре
text: Отель приличный, удобный, расположен в центре города. В шаговой доступности Таймс Сквер, вокруг много магазинов и ресторанов.  Скромный неприметный вход, можно сразу не заметить и пройти мимо.Номера уютные, комфортные- все достойно. Для тех кому важно остановиться в центре это самое то. Цена не дешевая но приемлемая- соотношение цены и качества.

title: Bargain Priced Shining Jewel in Great Location
text:
On a lark, hopped on the Express Bus from DC to NYC, to see a show on Broadway.  City Club Hotel was a bargain, and I was expecting a postage stamp-sized room.  I was upgraded without request, hesitation or cost to a queen room, which was quite roomy, especially so for Manhattan properties.  The amenities are outstanding:

* Feather beds!  (I notice some on this site think feather beds are a bad thing, I don't get that)
* Full tub shower - a glorious deluge!
* Plush terrycloth robes!
* Fully stocked bathroom with all manner of shampoo, conditioner shower gel, soap, shower cap, and hair dryer
* Fully stocked mini-bar, including a half a fifth of Bombay Sapphire!

Short walk to Times Square and theaters, just outstanding.  I will look to City Club first when I make my next plans - or on my next spur of the moment trip to New York.

title: Just Amazing !
text:
We stayed at the City Club Hotel for the express reason of seeing Manhattan before my daughter returned home to Bangkok via JFK airport . We parked across the street in a garage that charged us $45 us per day but $20 more for my full size pickup , still nice and secure in the high rent district . The City Club was directly across the street from the garage and next door to the Sofitol Hotel ( did I spell that right ?) . We chose this hotel mainly because it was listed as pet friendly and honestly after reading the complaints here did not expect much . That's probably why we were so overwhelmed from the door . The staff warmly welcomed us when we arrived or my two Australian Shepards , I still think they were happier to see them . Either way we felt extremely welcome and comfortable immediately and I can't say enough about the attentive courteous staff throughtout our visit . These people really cared about our enjoyment of New York . Be it directions or referrals to eat they never once acted too busy for any of our many questions , superb folks!
 We were given a room on the 3rd floor, a Queen suite, which would allow me to smoke if I wanted . We were simply amazed by the room . It was brilliantly laid out as so we never once felt we were in a small room . It had a delicious looking mini bar although we didn't partake as I am cheap , maybe next time . On the farwall they had what appeared to be a custom built in window bench seat surrounded by upholstered wall framing and a nice comfy cushion with big throw pillows , just an exceptionally well thought out functional amenity that looked great too. The bathroom was large and very well stocked with everything you would expect from any hotel , sewing kit , blow dryer etc. . The entire bath was done in turned stone tile and the water pressure was super . The shower was probably the nicest shower I have ever used and honestly I didn't want to get out . The tv had more stations than you could possibly watch with the free on demand viewing . We watched three episodes of what else Gordon Ramsay Hotel Hell . Once we were settled , we went out on the town and really did not need to leave 44 st .. We walked around until we found a show we wanted to see , Misery , ate at a New York Deli , had some New York Pizza , in the morning had coffee and donuts all on 44th st . All in all , I would have to say that not only would I stay there again but I don't think I would stay any where else again !

title: Horrible Quality
text: So everyone talks about the location, yes the location is perfect, but so is the location of other chain hotels which provide a much better atmosphere and location. So my trip was great! I got to the hotel at 7am, check in isn't until 3pm. Bell man at the door was so nice. James was nice too at the front desk. Okay could we do an early check in, well if there is availability call us and we will let you know. For now we can hold your luggage until your room is ready! Great. Called the hotel about 14 times because we had a 2pm show and wanted to change our clothes. Nothing was ready the whole day. Okay. Not a huge deal. Get to the room. It's extremely hot! Very small! Okay fast forward to bed time. Checking for bed bugs. Room is clear. Open the covers there is a comforter under a regular sheet that is staged as the fitted sheet for the mattress. So when your in the bed the sheets come off, the comforter that your laying on moves around...Not even sure why that was on the bed maybe as a "foam". It wasn't a foam at all. Then we had the thermostat on, which was louder than a truck. Around 10:45 the vent covers decided to fall off. There was cracks in the cover. I went down stairs to speak with the attendant, the manager was not there and the bell man could send up some box fans. So we slept with box fans the rest of the night. The room was not cleaned appropriately. The phones were not working since December...We paid over 250 dollars for this!!??? I was kind of embarrassed, however relaxed knowing how close we were to times square. Not a bad price for the location....But the quality and atmosphere was horrible. Had to park across the street in a parking garage which was 45 dollars for 24 hours. We could've gotten early bird special if we went to another garage...if you are 5 minutes passed the 24 hour they add another 18$ so it was almost 63 dollars, until my boyfriend gave the " scary face" and they let the 5 minutes go. Pictures from other travelers, for other rooms seemed to be much nicer than the room we got....and the hotel clerk said we were upgraded!! LMAO. Terrible!!!! Oh 1 more thing, when they took our luggage in the morning, I received my luggage and coat back, along with someone else's coat....feel bad for that poor person who almost lost their coat, however the coats had been cleaned up a bit. No one even said anything about it. I could tell though.

title: Buono solo per la posizione
text: Oltre la posizione veramente strategica al centro di Manhattan il resto è appena sufficiente. La struttura è datata, spazi insufficienti, la moquette non ispira senso di pulizia, il costo della camera dovrebbe comprendere la colazione.

title: Good location - Bad quality - stupid hotel .
text:
Well I make a reservation for 4 peoples then call to make sure we get 2 beds .(respond : no problem ) But in the room we find a large BED , and  SURPRISE 1 "roll in"  old and broken whit all spring out .NOT JOKING !  This  'bed' is just good to trash and the room for 4 is a old old piece of junk ...put this  next to a " sofa "  / bed ? of 30" larg Not sure what is it but sure is broken and unconditionally good to trash ! You can feel clearly all the springs , the room is much much smaller as the 36 Sq F on the web site . No place for suitcase , as no place for put your clothe out , except a small closed busy with a Mimi frig low, low, on the floor ,and other stuff you cant go inside if you do YOGA . The room is not so clean the wall have trace of  water liking / and mold . I ask the front desk  the first 1/2 hours to get a other room with 2 beds as reserved but nothing was available (?) (as always ...if is paid in a avance and don't care much about service ) I was proposed to get a 2nd room  but with a extra of $ 1700. Well is NOT a cheap hotel . After a first bad night we sleep in a old kid rollover with a broken old mattress springs out . This hotel Is maybe good if you never been  to New York,or stay in good hotel and /or a better place -go there if you Love to keep your clothe in suitcase - and stay in The decoration as grandma 1970. take a shower without water pression  and sleep on a old Blanquette transformed in "bed " and my wife was cold, because the blanket  is the same years as the decoration... I ask 3 times to get a extra blanket, and finally I get it one with but the day after the blanquette was gone ...I ask again and we get a more old smelly fur cover...haaaaa very bad service. The only. Good part is ; The bathroom and the liking tap, the tv large but fixed to the wall and be see only from / in bed . The remote comande  TV not workin so well. Never stay again there. New York have many good deal, and better place to stay. This one will not be on my list. After receive the infos from Expedia the management said ; was sorry and ask if can help ...but nothing is done. The front desk don't pass the info or no one care about customer's ? Don't rush to book you have many hotel around and much newer style  ...At the same price or maybe much less. oup's I forget make sure you check you bill because we also have a $38 for NOT drinking the mini bar ... taking out after asking as all bad stuff for 8 days/ night .
don't go there many hotel much better and same price or less .
this is a bad old hotel for a family ,

title: Very Convenient
text: We stayed at this hotel for NYE 2014.  It was the perfect location for everything.  It sat between 5th Ave and times square.  We were able to walk pretty much everywhere, but taxis were constantly coming by the hotel as well.  The only thing this hotel was missing was a gym. But, it was a boutique hotel so, we knew that ahead of time.

title: Amazing Find
text: Decided to stay here for a quick overnight stay on our way to Boston and have been pleasantly surprised. Parking is right across the street, the staff is pleasant and helpful, room was bigger than expected, decor is nice and the place is clean. The location is great, close to Time Square and plenty of great places really close. Will definitely come here again when we visit NYC!

title: Good location, good value!
text: Location is great.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Entrance is easy to miss.  "Lobby" is more like a hallway, doesn't matter at all though - rooms were comfortable and clean.  Will definitely stay here again!

title: Great stay!  Perfect location
text: Stayed at the City Club hotel the week of Thanksgiving.  The location was perfect, right around the corner from the Macy's parade, walking distance to many attractions, but out of the Times Square craziness.  We are a family of 5 so it can be hard to find a room that fits us and isn't too cramped.  We splurged on the Grand Duplex suite and it was gorgeous.  Looks just like the photos online, so much character and charm, also clean, tidy, and enough room to spread out.  (For only slightly more $ than we would have spent on a tight-squeeze, boring suite elsewhere.)  The upstairs bathoom is huge and also nice to have the half-bath downstairs.  There was some street noise, but we loved having the balcony view.  We are completely pleased with our choice to stay at City Club and hope to return again.

title: Nice surprise
text:
Cute, boutiquish, nicely decorated room, stocked mini bar in midtown. Good value for money. Perfect location for Christmas season or other time. Attentive staff. 
Good room service menu and good adjacent restaurant. Quiet rooms. The ultimate touch are fresh cookies when returning to room.

title: Lovely room, prefectly located
text: Had booked a single room, was upgraded to Queen on arrival, on 2nd floor.  Great room, superb bathroom.  Was on 2nd floor, room faces internal light well.  Had read previous reviews so was not surprised at lack of view and air con noise, it's expected for a lot of NY places. Didn't bother me at all.  Finally, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: I understand this is Manhattan, but
text: The room was tiny even for the city.  The "closet" also had the refrigerator and tray with drinks in it and was too short for my winter coat. In the same block there are at least three better alternatives, including the Sofitel, Iroquois, and the Algonquin.  Not recommended. The staff people were pleasant, but it did not overcome the tired, tiny room.  Never again.

title: Not at all we expected
text: To view the brochure ,it is difficult to believe one is in the same hotel,business centre?lounge? We must have missed something somewhere.Our room had a brick wall within arms reach and needed lighting all day,very depressing.The room service got every order either wrong or missed items. on the day of our departure we had no hot water and having asked to extend our departure until 16:00 ,we were asked to pay $200 ,only after explains that the room had not been made up and that we had not been able to showere before a business meeting did the receptionist reluctantly agree to reduce the the extra charge by 75%. In a lifetime of traveling we have never experienced a charge for a unmade room ,extended checkout.

title: 2nd visit still just as great
text: We stayed here with 3 teenagers again but this time were not upgraded to the family suite. We got the double room with a daybed and while tight quarters it was pretty roomy for NYC standards. My 6'4 son slept on the daybed and said it was really comfy. And the cookies had everyone begging for more. The location is right off Times Square on a quiet street but within walking distance of all the shopping, MSG and Bryant Park. I wouldn't stay anywhere else, love it here

title: Location, Service, Value
text:
This was my 2nd stay at City Club, NYC for just a quick overnite. I had booked a Petit Room and upon check-in was greeted pleasantly and upgraded to a King. Since very few of the rooms face the street I was not at all surprised to find that the view from the window was of the brick building next door.....but then again, unless you're booking a hotel near Central Park who needs a view from the room!
The King room was large for NYC standards...a very comfortable bed with high-end linens, a large marble lined bathroom, over-sized towels, and a strong shower. That's pretty much all I need!
Location: less than 5 minute walk to Time's Square. Directly across the street from the Parking Garage at the Hippodrome Building...$41 for overnight parking (in Mid-Town that's a bargain!). Wonderful restaurant within the Hotel building, or right next door is the Red Flame Diner for a quick breakfast.
Service: Front Desk Staff/Doormen were all friendly, helpful and genuine in their aim to please...of course the free upgrade was a nice surprise.
Value: while there may be less expensive hotels in the Mid-Town/Times Square district, I felt that for the price I paid ($215 pre-tax on a Friday evening) I had the location I wanted, larger and more comfortable room than expected, and terrific service.
I am looking forward to my next visit to NYC, and my stay at City Club.

title: Perfect
text: Fantastic location and great boutique hotel, booked a petit room and where it was small it was perfectly suitable for single person travelling. Stayed in a different hotel in my first week which was fine but this hotel which I stayed for 2nd week was much nicer, better showers, spotlessly clean, comfortable beds and pleasant staff, nothing bad to say!

title: Excelente Opção
text: Excelente opção. Fui com a família e fomos muito bem atendidos. Os quartos são confortáveis, limpos e todos os dias recebíamos cookies deliciosos de cortesia. Os funcionários são educados e prestativos. A localização é espetacular, entre a quinta e a sexta avenidas, uma quadra da Times Square. Certamente será minha opção de hospedagem em minha próxima viagem para NYC.

title: Tiny Hidden Gem in a Great Location
text: Great, small hotel close enough to Times Square if you want to be a tourist, but far enough removed if you don't. The front desk staff were incredibly nice, and the upgrade to a room with a terrace was a very pleasant surprise! Our room was reasonably large for an NYC hotel room, and the bathroom was very spacious with a great shower and plenty of shelf space for toiletries. The bed was comfortable, and the hotel was quiet - no kids running through the hall in the morning, no doors slamming.  I don't think I've ever had such a pleasant stay in NYC, and will definitely return to City Club!

title: OK For One Night - And Not For First Time NYC Visitors.
text:
Booked two rooms here on the hotel website for a 5 night stay. It was recommended. Check-in was good enough and staff were friendly.

I was given a King Luxe room on the 6th floor. The shock was when I went into the room and looked at a brick wall from both the windows. After looking at the "view" for a minute, I then became aware of a noise similar to an A380 with its engines idling.... At first I thought it was the air conditioning but that turned out to be off.  Going to the window, I soon found the noise to be exhaust fans and air conditioning units from the adjacent restaurant and the hotel. Given there was only 6 feet (2m) of space between my window and the wall of the next building, the noise came straight up.

I went back to reception and explained the situation. The two staff on duty were fine with my request for a room change - and said that they knew about the noise problem. I can only assume I wasn't the first one to speak to them about it.

Given a room on the 8th floor on the opposite side of the building, this one was a Queen Room - and yes, there was another brick wall to look at, but this time of the building on the other side of the hotel !  Six feet away and yep, noise from more air conditioning units.

Good size bathroom and inclusions. No tea/coffee making facilities.

My travelling companion, who had a King Luxe on the 6th floor (with a street view)
suggested we go to the nearby Sofitel and stay there - but having been to New York on many occasions before, I said not to bother and just took a photo of my new wall.... :)

So, fan noise 24/7 - it was along 5 nights. There was no breakfast included in the room rate, so it was into the adjacent restaurant for a $US20 cup of tea and some toast. 

This hotel is fine for a night or two if you are a business traveller and can use the corporate credit card . If you are first time visitor or tourist to New York - you will be disappointed. Yes, it's walking distance to Time Square and the theaters, and between 5th Ave and 6th Ave. They are the only bonuses.

It's not a boutique or luxury hotel by any stretch.

On the day of departure I got an account under the door. A room charge of 
$US 471.20 + four loads of taxes, turned a per night stay into $US 544.20. Put simply, that was for a bed.

After a quick check on the hotel's website, I saw that the Queen room I had been downgraded to (at my request) was $US 417.00 pn. A $60 difference. I went and spoke to the duty manager and he said he'd deduct $30 per night off the rate. Well, (as I said to him) "thank you, that's better than nothing".

Given the number of hotels in NYC,my suggestion is to shop around - particularly if you are a "first timer".  There are far less expensive hotels on offer and you will be able to get more than just a bed.

title: Lovely hotel, don't have their act together, poor customer service
text: My husband and I went in to see a show and stay over in the city this past Saturday night. We decided to try out this hotel for a change. We were told upon checkin that they offered 24 hour room service. Not only was this not true, the manner in which it was handled was poor at best. We called down at 8:30am to have some coffee brought up to the room. First attempt, there was no answer. Second attempt, they weren't sure they did just coffee. Third attempt, the chef came in late so it would be 45 minutes to an hour. For coffee? What? The staff made it worse after my husband went out in the rain to get our coffee and when he came back in they asked him if he wanted room service. When he didn't answer, they got snarky. Admittedly, they called and tried to offer us complimentary breakfast but, it was too late. Don't say you have an amenity and then don't come through on it. Poor form. Not sure we'll be back. Also, we asked for the General Manager to call us and we're still waiting.

title: Honesto
text: A localização do hotel é excelente, muito próximo a TS, teatros e ao metrô. O quarto é transado, mas pequeno (bem típico em Nova Iorque). O banheiro é excelente. A decoração é bem bacana, os funcionários muito prestativos. Anexo ao hotel existe um bistrô do DB que é bem legal. O hotel é pequeno, mas tem tudo, internet liberada em todo hotel(quarto inclusive).

title: Great hotel - just CHANGE the mattress!
text: City Club Hotel was great - awesome location, friendly service, and a huge, upgraded room! The chocolate chip cookies were a sweet touch (literally and figuratively), the amenities like a large umbrella for use during my stay we're really thoughtful, and the massively large room with slightly funky decor was great (see photos). The bathroom was equally large and upgraded, and the entire facility was very clean and inviting. My only complaint - the king size mattress was like sleeping on a bag of lumpy rocks. I am not very particular about mattresses and usually sleep well on a variety of densities, but this one felt like the really, really old thing in your grandparents' house, that had settled unevenly over the years so you slept on what felt like a sloping angle off the sides of the bed, and was so hard and lumpy, I kept shifting around all over it during the night just trying to get comfortable, Perhaps the mattresses in other rooms and/or other sizes aren't as bad so I still really recommend this very nice hotel. But should the sleeping situation have been better, City Club would have warranted a rating of 5.

title: Fantastico
text:
Hotel fantastico , situato a pochi passi da Times square. 
Camere arredate in stile moderno,pulite e dotate di ogni comfort. 
Staff gentile e cortese.
New York Times ogni mattina e cookies caldi(davvero ottimi) alla sera.
Ottimo rapporto qualità /prezzo

title: Excellent stay
text: We are on our last night here after a weeks stay. How anyone can criticize here is beyond me . The location is excellent , room was enormous for nyc standards ( king deluxe ) and the cleanliness is without fault. People moaning about lack of view / lack of space - if you book a petite room to save dollars then what do you expect. Either pay for the space or quit moaning. Staff were excellent , a minor issue with toilet was sorted with absolutely no fuss . We had a room at the back of the hotel which was very quiet to consider its nyc . Ok , no view but I prefer a peaceful nights sleep over a view - I'd have paid for a view ( had I been fussy about one ) but as I wasn't fussed about having a view then facing a brick wall was a small price to pay for the peace at night . Thoroughly recommend this hotel and so glad we chose here . I am extremely fussy with hotel rooms and this ticked every box. The only minor negative is the lack of coffee making facilities in the room , but hey it forced me to get myself  moving in the mornings and out of the room every day !!! Don't let the moaners put you off here , we are smokers and the fact we were able to book this as a smoking room just makes it all the better .

title: Ok Hotel - 3 stars only
text: Staff certainly try to be very friendly, rooms okay, bathroom nice.  No view - you are looking at solid brick wall of neighboring hotel.  Location excellent but excessive cost for this very average 2 or 3 star hotel with a bunch of kids running it and I manager who does not have the customer service to follow up on anything.  They need to stop using the word 'luxury' or 'boutique' hotel to suggest it is more than it is.  This is an older, dated hotel with no facilities.  There is no lobby, just a hole in the wall (literally!), the room has a tiny desk that barely fits a computer, no coffee machine in the room, exercise facilities are at the business next door and I had to ask 10 times for a pass.  Finally, I gave up.  Wi-fi was slow to the point of useless, so I had to go to the next hotel and use their free wi-fi to get any Internet service.  No business printing facilities … basically you get a room albeit the bathroom portion is nice - great tub!  I did ask the manager for a room upgrade, but he never got back to me so I stopped asking after the 3rd time.  They claimed to have in-room spa services such as a massages / facials, but again, I was send down the street 9 blocks to another business.  The bottom line is that we need more accuracy in rating hotels … for the price this is completely excessive and any 4 or 5 star hotel in NYC at the same price would be much better.  Trust me … I am in NYC 3 times per months and this hotel is not worth the price - it is a 2 star, 3 at the very most.  For the cost, I would stay anywhere else in NYC and will not use this hotel again.

title: Excellent location and service, decent though small rooms
text:
I was impressed with the friendly though not too familiar service, and the attention to detail. 

The location is superb, choose to everything, and next door to the Harvard Club as well as a convenience store, a great nyc style diner, a Chipotle as well as coffee shops! 

The room was small, and the only Window looks out on to the inner well of the building, bit was otherwise decent overall. Tiny closet but a very large bathroom.large bathroom larger large large bath

title: Location Location Location
text:
This hotel's location is amazing - within walking distance from dozens of the city's best attractions, best shopping and best restaurants. right off Times Square.
Other than that - nothing much. Our room was not nicely decorated, needs a refurbishment. It was not  clean enough, we found all kind of wraps under the beds. the bathroom's shower is uncomfortable to use and would be highly inconvenient for washing kids. and we had a flood in the bathroom. It was immediately fixed but never thoroughly cleaned. Hotel personnel are helpful but not always nice.
recommended for those of you who leave the hotel in the morning and come back to the room only to sleep.

title: Great boutique hotel in the middle of Midtown
text: This hotel was a great quaint hotel in midtown.  I loved the easy in and out and it wasn't too crowded, as most all things in NYC.  My room was a little dated but very clean and the perfect size.  Great restaurant attached to the hotel/next door which was convenient and I heard very good.  Also, as a special treat I got a cookie every night for turn-down service, it's the little things ;)

title: Konum çok iyi
text: Manhattan da kalmak isteyenler için konum çok iyi. Odalar küçük ama konforlu. En küçük odaları seçmenizi tavsiye etmem. Gerçekten çok küçük. Times meydanı, Emperial State, Grand Central gibi yerlere yürüme mesafesinde

title: Great location, good service, can be a little noisy.
text:
We have stayed at this hotel twice now. And we will be booking rooms there next time we travel to NY as well.

The location is perfect. Very close to Times Square, and 5th Ave. (between those locations)

As most hotels in this location, noise can be a problem. But honestly, we never worried about it and it certainly did not spoil our stay. Just keep in mind its' location and know to expect some street noise.

The staff are all very helpful, especially the doormen, they were very good at getting us taxis etc.

I would recommend this hotel highly.

title: Big room !
text:
Very good location. Near to everything. Old building but nice hotel. Our room was very big. Bathroom was also big with big towels. The people at the reception desk was very very nice and efficient. 
We checked out but we were not leaving until the evening. We were able to leave our suitcase at the hotel at not charge and without any problem. They were very nice and polite. We were glad we stay here.

title: Midtown boutique, handy and cool
text: This place worked for me, I do find the restaurants and bars around mid town a bit tacky and lots of tourist traps, but as on business the hotel still worked and I went to socialise out of area a few times...there's some nice touches at this hotel, the cookie turnover each night, the bathroom was huge and great, the restaurant next door which does the room service, the staff on front desk are a bit flakey, but it was fine, they are friendly enough, one of the guys on door also a bit too hungry for a tip, in aggressive manner, like I'm totally aware I tip you if you do things for me but when your not even smiling but just chasing money it's a bit annoying..good choice of TV channels, oh and the mini bar being a painting that comes out as bar, nice touch, it's a good 4 star hotel..

title: Séjour parfait
text:
Emplacement idéal pour toutes les visites, time square à 5 min à pied.  Tout en étant au calme. Proche de Briant Park pour se reposer ou prendre pdj ou repas en terasse. Petit hôtel comparé aux usines à touristes voisines. Charme de l'ancien mais prestations top. Accueil personnalisé, au bout d'1 semaine comme à la maison... Propreté top. Literie confortable. Sdb spacieuses. Attention des cookies quotidiens toujours agréable après une longue journée de visites. Les chambres communicantes du dernier étage sont parfaites pour 2 adultes et 4 enfants. Vue sur cour mais c'est le prix pour être au calme. Et vu l'heure à laquelle on retrouve sa chambre à New York....
Prix élevé mais dans la norme pour ce standing et cette situation.

title: great hotel & great service
text: I stayed here over Easter weekend & was very pleased. The hotel is located in mid-town near Bryant Park & other major attractions (Public library, 30 Rock, Times sq, etc) it's also within short walking distance from Penn station & Grand central. the reception staff were very nice and they upgraded me to the rooftop room when I complained that there were no windows in the first room! they were also very helpful in terms of giving directions or making recommendations for restaurants or attractions nearby. Compared to other hotels in NYC the rooms are bigger & the facilities are updated, it's a small building but feels new. I'll definitely stay here again since it's in my favorite NYC neighborhood & will hopefully get upgraded again!

title: Soggiorno ad inizio estate
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 10 giorni, con le nostre tre figlie, prendendo due camere. Inizialmente siamo rimasti delusi, perché le camere che ci avevano assegnato erano vicinissime ai condizionatori e non si riusciva a dormire. Abbiamo fatto presente il nostro disagio ed, il mattino seguente, ci hanno assegnato due camere vicine, al sesto piano.
La posizione è ottima ed è molto pulito. La zona e la struttura sono tranquilli, inoltre danno a disposizione il Wi-Fi gratis. Ha un buon rapporto qualità-prezzo.
Il ristorante interno è decisamente troppo caro. 
Le camere sono un po' piccole e l'armadio, inserito nel muro, non dispone di cassetti e non va bene per un soggiorno così lungo.

title: Small luxury hotel on a great quiet hotel/restaurant block near Times Square
text: I had a wonderful stay at this small luxury well-designed hotel and enjoyed room service from the famous Daniel Boulud Restaurant located next to the lobby.  The City Club is on one of the best blocks in mid-town lined with historic street lamps, clubs and restaurants and it was convenient for theaters just off Fifth Avenue.  Wonderful helpful staff that assisted with restaurant recommendations and reservations. Everything was great!

title: Hotel experience left me concerned about my safety
text: I don't typically write reviews but feel compelled to let others know about my visit and why I didn't feel safe staying at this hotel.  When I checked in, I was upgraded to a room by the front desk for free. As a younger female, at first I was excited because this typically never happens to me.  I'm usually put in crappy rooms by the elevators at hotels.  When I entered the room, there was a large floor length mirror by the bed that seemed to be in a weird spot and looked different than the rest of the mirrors in the room.  The weird appearance caused me to look at it closely, and after shining my phone's flashlight directly into the mirror, I discovered the MIRROR WAS ACTUALLY A TWO-WAY MIRROR SET UP WITH A CARVED OUT AREA BEHIND THE MIRROR with cords hanging down.  I didn't see a camera set up, but it was immediately clear that the "mirror" next to the bed was really hiding a bunch of electrical wires and wasn't a real mirror like the other ones in the room.    After leaving the room and going to the front desk to confront the gentlemen working, they didn't express any real concern and moved me to a smaller room (the one I had actually paid for).  I expressed my concern for safety and the guys didn't seem alarmed and said that they had never heard any other guest issue this concern.  I won't be returning to this hotel because of how the staff handled my concern and what I saw in the room.  What is even more alarming is that I found a review from February where another guest at the hotel described the exact same thing in their room.

title: Most AWESOME Hotel
text:
The hotel sign was a little hidden with all the other signs, however upon arrival I was greeted by the bell person and the front desk.  I informed Wesley that I do have a dog and was no problem.  Wesley checked me in, brought Toby in and we went upstairs to our room.  This is a small boutique hotel with the service level of Four Season and The Beverly Hills Peninsula combined.  Hotel is extremely close to Times Square as well.  I will staying here every time I go to New York as well as any of my employees.  
To the Hotel itself-----It truly was a delight to be treated as a family member and enjoyed the property totally 
Thank you

title: Best in Times Square Area
text: Close but not frightenly so to Times Square, hotel restaurant is by Boulud and quite good, the City Club has a variety of aspects that appeal to us.  Rooms are well equipped and very comfortable.  If you are feeling flush or are just lucky, book the two story suite at the front of the hotel.  Staff is fine, cookies at bedtime are welcome and all the midtown has to offer is at your doorstep.

title: Great little hotel - but boy the rooms were SMALL
text:
I'm used to staying in small rooms in New York, but this one was quite a surprise! I went back down to the lobby to ask where the closet was.... turns out it was sort of hidden in the wall.  I was there on business for a week, so no way I could store clothes, shoes, suits in a hole in the wall! 

Staff at front desk could have been a little bit friendlier.  Others were much nicer. In the end, I had to pay to get a bigger room. It was a lovely room - with a balcony. Everything else was very good - as with other small hotels, the lift was a bit of a challenge.

title: Seriously, a midtown hotel for $138?
text: We took an overnight trip to NYC for our anniversary. I had booked the morning before on Hotel Tonight App(Thursday morning for Friday night).  Booked the City Club Hotel, a boutique hotel.  If you want fancy marble floors and a giant lobby, this place is not for you.  If you want great service and an unbeatable location (we paid $138) then bookit.  I asked for a street facing room for more light.  We got room 903, it even had a balcony with seating!  Jackpot!

title: Grew to love it!
text: What our room lacked in space, views and electrical outlets was more than made up for with the great location (right next to the famous Algonquin and Harvard Club), super service (chocolate chip cookies with turn-down service), comfy feather bed and beautiful brown marble shower.  So what if you have to crawl over the bed to get into the closet?  The City Club was a nice home away from home.

title: Moderno y bien ubicado
text:
La habitacion muy moderna, con cama muy comoda y grande y una television gigante. Esta en pleno centro a unos minutos de times square. 
Como en todos los hoteles en Nueva York, el precio final aumenta con los impuestos pero en este caso, me pareció excesivo lo que nos aplicaron, casi 100 euros mas y solo estuvimos dos noches, ya que me cambie a otro mas económico.

title: Three star is Wayyyy Generous for this hotel.
text:
Nothing is more upsetting than driving 5 hours, thinking you are staying in a 4 star hotel and really getting a 2.5 star hotel.  The lobby is a one star.  The receptionist was friendly and that was the best part of our stay. The elevators are scratched up (stainless is scratched) and our button was broken (9th floor)
The room was teeny tiny and not very clean...the corners of the bathroom have never been cleaned.  The bed was so uncomfortably saggy I was up all night.  I kept smelling odor...it was coming from the pillow..ugh!  Very disappointed. Would not stay or recommend again.

title: Quite the Gem Amongst other Big Names
text: We stayed here this week to celebrate my wife's birthday. It's a boutique hotel with modern rooms and furnishings. The location is unbelievable in relation to Broadway, restaurants and museums. The rooms aren't huge but they're large enough to be very comfortable - including a very nice bathroom with bath/shower. There's access to a restaurant next door on the ground floor - we didn't try it as there's so much else to choose from in the area. There's one trade off to consider - the back rooms where we stayed were incredibly quiet but there wasn't a window view and much natural light. If you're on the go like we were, you'll just use the room to comfortably sleep in and that's just about it. PS. Tip the room cleaning staff - they'll take very good care of you.

title: Just what we wanted
text:
Family of 5 in a room with 2 double beds and a cot. Bit of a squeeze but we wanted a nice hotel in an excellent location and that's what we got. 
Room was good and well furnished unlike other reviews. 
Not many facilities but we didn't need them where we were in the city. 
Staff extremely kind and helpful. 
Good experience. Recommended.

title: Would stay again
