text: My husband and I stayed here with our 3 sons. We stayed in the 2 floor suite. What a wonderful experience! It was our first time in NYC so we needed lots of help. John at the front desk came through!  He helped us pick tours, suggested good restaurants, and gave us directions to wherever we needed to go. The hotel had an amazing location. Would definitely recommend.

title: Comfort e relax
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per 4 giorni durante il nostro soggiorno a NY. 
Camere molto pulite, ordinate e dotate di ogni servizio eccetto il bidè.
I letti erano comodissimi: l'ideale dopo giornate di lunghe camminate. 
Ogni sera il personale passa nelle stanze intorno alle 20/21 per lasciare un piattino di biscotti da consumare a colazione! Davvero una bella idea dato che a NY la colazione è molto cara! 
Consigliato assolutamente a tutti i turisti.

title: Nice location but old and worn hotel
text:
The hotel is well situated, close to Times Square, 5th Avenue and Broadway. 

However, the hotel badly needs a proper renovation. The carpets all around, also in the room, are dirty, the wallpaper is peeling, the bathroom flooring is tatty and generally all the furnishings are all old and worn.

title: Small rooms, Excellent service, nice & clean
text: Staff is great.  They are sop nice & helpful.  Nice bathrooms with full size towels and very clean, excellent water pressure. The rooms are small- a family of four would be very, very tight.  Do not get the petite room unless you are travelling alone or don't mind tight spaces.  The nest size up was perfect for 2 people- mother & daughter.  Great location near Times Square.  Free wifi a bonus and Edison paid parking across the street.

title: bon emplacement mais rapport moyen
text: Emplacement de l'hôtel appréciable pour visiter New York. A quelques pas de Broadway, Bryan parc et des musées... L'hôtel est propre, les chambres petites pour une famille. Par contre bon accueil, les cookies offerts chaque jour sont délicieux, et la décoration est sympathique. Hôtel correct malgré un tarif pas négligeable mais dans les normes pour NYC. Petit déjeuner non inclus mais un restaurant très bien à côté pas excessif pour 5.

title: Ha il bidet !!!!!!!!!
text: Ragazzi  , quest' hotel non solo è al centro di Manhattan , a due passi da Times Square e 5th Avenue , ma ha anche il bidet nel bagno ! Per me è un miraggio a NY (anche il altri posti a dir la verità!) , quindi lo promuovo a pieni voti . Stanza standard NY , come anche la piccolissima hall ma in generale , la permanenza è stata ottima .

title: Loved the room, ambience and location
text: Great location. I was there around the holidays... Rockfeller Center, Bryant Park were close by. The front desk personnel were friendly. The room, though tiny (double bed) with no view, was clean, modern, nicely appointed... quite cozy on a cold winter's night. The warm chocolate chip cookie in the evening was a nice surprise. I enjoyed a late lunch, early dinner at the bar in the hotel... Great service, food and drink... a bit pricey, but hey it's NYC.

title: A Gem
text:
So pleased we chose this hotel. 

Pros: location, all staff were very nice and helpful, bathroom-shower excellent, comfortable bed, room good size for NY, had mini fridge and a closet, quiet, and of course the cookies each night. 

Cons: no lobby but who cares!

Enjoyed our week here very much!

title: Great location.
text: Great location for a family-trip to New York. Easy to get to the attractions. Nice and clean hotel, good service from the staff.  A nice diner near by provides good breakfast, cheaper and easier than the one attached to the hotel.

title: Very clean hotel
text: The room was beautful. Great coffee across the street at Gregory's. Diner next door. A little noisy at night but then again it's the city that never sleeps. The bed and couch were very comfortable. Staff was also very helpful.

title: Great Stay. Great location.
text: Stayed here for a short weekend trip. The hotel staff was friendly. The room was clean and very comfortable. It is literally less than a 2 min walk from Grand Central Station and Times Square. Our room was on the street side of the hotel and the area is quiet. Would recommend th City Club to anyone.

title: 3 nights at City Club - Great experience!
text: City Club is a small boutique hotel about 3 blocks from Times Square... just close enough to all the theatres to make for fun walks, but not in the middle of all the Times Square craziness. Nice quiet street... Right around the block and you're on 5th Ave.  We had a queen "luxe" room; very nice.... small, but not as small as some NYC rooms I've been in. The space was used wonderfully well to maximize comfort and room. Decor very pretty and modern. Very nice bathroom - lovely, clean. Good, comfy bed. Nice quiet, reasonably priced hotel close to the shows and shopping. The staff was consistently helpful - absolutely no disappointments. In fact, one of the staff members, Eddie, was a wonderful resource when I was trying to get to and get around in Lower East Side (and Tenement Musueum - which is great). Eddie grew up in and lives in the Lower East Side and enthusiastically made my trip there easy and fun.  I have no complaints... none. Very good hotel experience!  P.S. GREAT coffee in the mornings....

title: Wonderful reasonable priced rooms and only a couple blocks from time square and 5th ave shopping!
text: Wonderful reasonable priced rooms and only a couple blocks from time square and 5th ave shopping! Absolutetry loved their turn down service with delicious cookies. Very friendly staff! Will be back!!!!

title: Stay here for a quiet room close to the shows
text:
My primary reason for this visit to NYC was to see some Broadway shows, and this hotel was a good choice.  At the last minute, I was able to get a very good rate (better than an Airbnb options), and the location is hard to beat.  In particular, I thought the location was ideal because it was far enough away from the big crowds and noise of Times Square, but close enough to the shows, Grand Central and the subway.  

This is a small hotel and is a very solid option if you are looking for somewhere quiet and clean to rest your head.  There's no fancy lobby or amenities.  DB Moderne is next door and offers good food offerings (although a bit pricey for what it is or once was).

The pros:  very quiet; extremely comfortable bed (feather bed toppers?); clean bathroom; close to Times Square, Grand Central, Broadway Shows, and the subway; strong and free Wifi!!; good shower pressure; chocolate chip cookie at turndown

The cons:  rooms are tight even by NYC standards (I had a standard with a double bed), evidence of water damage on the wallpaper that has not been addressed, you need to leave the general area of the hotel to find good food at a decent price (most of the restaurant offerings close to the hotel are overpriced tourist traps).

title: Great boutique hotel in the middle of NYC!
text: This hotel is a winner. I am a seasoned traveler and this hotel is a gem centrally located. Steps from Time Square, short walk to both Port Authority and Grand Central Station. Hotel is located between 5th and 6th Ave. It is perfect for a city stay. The hotel is chic in design. The rooms are small (remember this is NYC your only sleeping there) but very well appointed. Beds are very comfortable, room is clean and tastefully decorated. Bathroom is fantastic, large for the room size. Shower excellent.  Would definitely stay again. The price can't be beat!

title: Central to the city
text: I saved here on business. Centrally located in the fashion district but close to everything. Walked to Rockefeller and Central Park. Subway stations fairly close as the Bryant park stop is nearby. Hotel itself is nice. Very small rooms but that's in line with nyc. No view but again typical nyc. Didn't get noise at night which was a big plus.

title: great hotel
text:
stayed with my dad and my brother for a fun few days in NYC and the hotel could not have been better for us. great central location, so easy walk to everywhere we wanted to go. fabulous rooms, spacious, beautiful decor and wonderful bathrooms. 
the staff were also fantastic, won't name names as can't remember them all but every member of staff we dealt with exceeded even the American desire for great service. can not recommend highly enough.

title: Localização ótima!
text: Fomos a NY para lua de mel e a estadia foi no Hotel City Club. A localização é perfeita e a limpeza impecável. O melhor de tudo foi o mimo de receber cookies do Chef Daniel. Os melhores que já provei na vida. Um local para sempre que for a NY. Indicadíssimo!

title: June In NYC
text:
I love the convenience of this hotel it is right on the edge of Times Square (a 5 min walk). Since I have been coming to NYC over the last 20 years the area has been getting better and better for shop and restaurants.

I did have a slight hiccup as I originally booked for 2 weeks and had then extended as the hotel had lost my second booking, but we were able to resolve it amicably. Staff are super friendly and very helpful.

title: I loved City Club Hotel
text: I've stayed in NYC many times at 4- 4.5 hotels near Times Square.  This was my favorite.  Staff is excellent-very friendly upon arrival and departure.  Room was beautiful.  Bed great.  Bathroom beautiful.  Chocolate chip cookies delicious.  Perfect location. Close to everything.

title: Great Mid Town Business Hotel, Friendly Staff, Small Hotel = Quick Check In.  Why Not?
text:
My favorite NYC hotel since 2003.  I like its mid town location, boutique size for check-in.  It's only a few blocks from Times Square, yet caters more to business people.

The location works for all of my business needs. 

Entered the small lobby and was quickly greeted by the doorman who assisted with the door, and my bags.  The gentlemen (Eddie I think)  at the front desk was friendly and he quickly checked me into my room. 

He offered a little bigger room with twin beds recognizing I stay in the hotel often. Thank you 😄

I wake in the morning and always get coffee and breakfast across the street at Gregory's coffee. Again, quick and easy.  There is a full diners (red Flame) two doors down when I want eggs etc. 

While the hotel has not seen a comprehensive upgrade since 2003, it's well maintained, hip, and feels up scale yet not stuffy - comfortable.

I like this place and that is why I have returned time and time again for 12 years.

Danielle checked me out this morning - another pleasant experience.

I will return in a week or two...thank you City Club.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Albergo situato in ottima posizione vicinissimo a Time Square e Bryant Park
Camera piccola con armadio minuscolo, letto comodo, bagno grande con una bella doccia..vista inesistente in quanto l hotel è in mezzo a due palazzi, ma in fondo non importante in quanto si andava in camera solo la sera. Buoni i biscotti freschi ogni giorno in camera. Staff molto gentile e disponibile. ... unica pecca non segnalata: trattengono dalla carta di credito all'arrivo 100 dollari a notte come cauzione che quindi non potete più usare ...e se avete una carta di credito con limite basso sono problemi...

title: Perfect NY getaway
text: We stayed here last month and it was excellent. I had called in hopes of booking a room with some questions and Danielle on the phone was very kind and helpful with all my extensive queries. We found a good price online and we decided to book. The building itself is tucked away between some of the bigger hotels and our taxi almost drove by it. We arrived a bit tired but our first impressions were great. Wesley and Eddie were so gracious and extremely helpful both nights. Love the personalized attention to customer care that the staff displays. Our room was very spacious for the both of us and even had an additional small bed by the window. Bathrooms are huge! The location and reviews of this hotel is what drove us here but the space and staff hit high marks. This was a fantastic alternative to the Royalton across the street and delightfully so.

title: Poor customer service
text: I had booked this hotel for an vacation with my grandson.  My daughter and I were in New York and we went to check it out  The lobby was extremely hot. We asked to see a room and were told that that was not an option,  no other explanation. I cancelled my reservation and went to the Hilton were the customer service was awesome.  And we saw several rooms  I asked for a refund on my rooms from City Club and was told that if they could rent it out they would refund me.  I was told by the manager we probably couldn't see a room because they are ALWAYS full. I have not gotten a refund and the room was rented as when I was there I went to see if I could get a room and was told they were fully booked.  But no refund. I sent a letter of concern to the manager and got no response on it.  I would never recommend or stay there, They don't care and don't know what customer service is.  They are the important ones not the customer

title: Honesto
text: Você não terá nenhuma decepção ao reservar esse hotel. O quarto é pequeno e a cama também, mas é muito limpo, tudo novo e organizado. É ideal para quem vai passar o dia todo na rua e voltar pro hotel apenas para dormir. Super bem localizado, 2 quadras da Times Square, próximo da Grand Station e dos famosos arranha céus Empire State e Top of the Rock. No final da tarde deixam um cookie de-li-ci-o-so no quarto, reconfortante. Não tem vista, então se você pretende passar mais tempo no quarto, busque outro hotel. Preço justo e bom atendimento. Guardam as malas no check out e recebem encomendas sem cobrar a parte. Eu recomendo! Obs: wifi grátis e com boa velocidade.

title: Perfectly fine hotel
text:
Clean, well-located and reasonably-priced.

Was a little annoying that housekeeping didn't always leave enough towels and toiletries (we were a room of 5 - they hadn't even made the fifth bed ready for arrival) but overall a decent stay.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: We booked a queen room. Not sure if we were upgraded but the bed was huge and the room and bathroom were more spacious than those we'd previously stayed in at the more expensive The Pearl and The Library. No breakfast but the warm chocolate chip cookies every night are good! It's in an excellent location to find somewhere to eat and also for sights. Our room was at the back and didn't have a view but was nice and quiet, and who needs a view when Nyc is on your doorstep?

title: Cozy comfortable
text:
We stayed for a week primarily to see shows and walk around Times Square.  We planned to see a different show every night and we were able to walk to each theater within 10 minutes!  (and I'm not that fast a walker.)  That made this hotel a perfect choice.

City Club Hotel is very small and nondescript - our cab driver couldn’t find the entrance even though Google maps on his iPad mini led him right to the front door. I recognized the lower case CC logo from the Hotel’s web site so I was confident the driver delivered us correctly.  A doorman in a blue shirt let us in and helped with bags.  The lobby is exactly like the picture - no line with two people behind the desk who friendly greeted us..  I reserved a smaller room but palmed a $20 and doing my best Sean Connery burred, “whatever you can do will be appreciated.” The young lady checked us in and said we have an upgrade.  Score!  

Around the the desk and to the left is their Bistro - elevators to the right opened with no wait.  Anxious to see our room I realize it’s still one of their smaller rooms - the bed is a full-size. Oh well. Perhaps that tip was insulting and we were downgraded. 

The bathroom is nice, clean, big and shiny. The water pressure in the shower is strong and the ledge from the shower to the bathroom floor is low enough for excellent puddle accumulation.  Beware wet shiny floors barefooted. (tip: make good use of the floormat and the extra bath towels! especially the ones by the toilet!) The toiletries are high end and I particularly liked the mint shampoo.  There is a table with towels and reading material that is dangerously close to the toilet’s splash zone.  A mirrored wall is directly across the toilet giving yourself a strange uncomfortable/comfortable view of business.  

The wifi is fast.  The TV is big with a few HD channels and the remote is new looking enough for me to handle without encasing it in plastic. There is a closet behind a secret panelled wall that also includes a fridge and nicely stocked mini bar. There is small window that gives you a nice view of brick and darkness. The carpet is clean and feels safe to go barefoot. There are no bureaus or cabinets so we lived out of suitcases stacked on a loveseat built into the wall.  This room is cozy but not claustrophobic and the fluffy full-sized bed perfect for cramped afternoon naps. 

I shouldn’t forget the aforementioned cookie (from other reviews) during turn down because the one time they forgot to leave some, I felt dramatically rejected and ripped off.  Oh the suffering being denied a cookie!

Each time we left or entered the building there were no more than two or one (or none) groups of people checking in or out.  This felt like our own personal hotel.  During the week we walked into the lobby of Hotel Pennsylvania directly across from Penn Station and that place was a madhouse. There were multi-lines of people ready to check in or out.  Families were camped in the lobby around their luggage waiting like it was Disneyworld or Circus Circus.

A few doors outside and to the left of the hotel is a diner that serves a decent breakfast and stays open till 11 PM..  Across the street and to the right is what seems like a 24-hour falafel stand.  I bought a sketchy-sounding chicken shawarma at 3 in morning that was absolutely delicious. Around the corner on the same block is a drugstore in case you want something less scalp-tingling than mint shampoo or for some milk to go along with the you know what. And then down the street, less than a minute walk away is the Belasco theater where you can watch Hedwig and the Angry Inch - which perfectly dates this review.

title: Just like the photos
text: This hotel is about 2 blocks from Times Square and about 2-3 blocks from 5th Avenue.  Location is perfect, very close to subway stations and the street the hotel is on is very quiet by New York standards.  This is a boutique hotel, the lobby is tiny and the front desk is even tinier but all very efficient.  Staff were fantastic with subway directions and restaurant recommendations. Doorman was great for hailing cabs. Housekeeping staff was always smiling and they deliver warm chocolate chip cookies in the evenings. The 2nd floor honor bar was so-so, the selection was limited. We chose to pay and upgraded to a nice size king room overlooking the street. I never heard the guests in the rooms next to ours. There is only a small window in the room so I found it a bit dark.  The bathroom is a good size with a large shower stall and the best oversize bath towels I've seen in a while. Bed was fairly comfortable but should be replaced soon as you could definately see a dip in the middle. Overall very clean, some areas are showing wear- the bathroom floor tiles are showing its age.  Only negative was the front desk forgot to give us a wake up call early in the morning to catch our flight.  We just made it to the airport in time. We ate at the restaurant just off the hotel lobby- it was just OK, there are much better ones around town.

title: Great Deal for Three
text:
So we really liked this hotel. It was a great deal for three as it has a roomy/comfortable daybed that doubles as a sitting area during the day, complete with small cocktail table.  Well thought out.  Large bathroom by any measure but kingsize by NYC standards.  Clean.  Mini bar/fridge was hidden!  Didn't find until day 2.  

Hotel is very convenient to Times Square and theatre district.  It has an honor bar in the evenings where they had nice, drinkable wines at honorable prices.   Nice staff.  Professional and courteous.  Cookies at bedtime.

title: Sofisticado
text: Excelente localização, fica a meia quadra da quinta avenida e a dois quarteirões da Times Square, próximo ao Central Park e Empire State Building. Funcionários atenciosos e eficientes. Quarto confortável com banheiro espaçoso, um chuveiro maravilhoso. Porém,como é um hotel menor que fica encravado entre dois edifícios, não se tem vista das janelas, um bom pretexto para não permanecer no quarto e ganhar as ruas de NY.

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: This was a lovely & clean hotel in a great location near Times Square, lots of other great NYC sites, public transportation, and restaurants.  The staff were friendly & helpful and you get warm chocolate chip cookies every night!  Yum!  Wifi is included & you can connect as many devices as you like.  Their mobile web site is a bit outdated, but don't let that deter you.

title: A real find.
text: We absolutely love this hotel.  They upgraded us to a lovely queen room and we had perfect service throughout our stay.  Its not back breakingly expensive for the location and we could pop off to a quick musical or Central Park in a few minutes - A bit of a find that we will come back to if we are lucky enough to visit NYC again.

title: Excellent value for the business traveler
text:
We only stayed one night, as we were just passing through the city on business, but we could not possibly be more pleased especially for the price we paid for the room. It was a last-minute booking, we didn't know much about the hotel and we took a chance on it given that this hotel one of a handful for less than $200 a night. We hit the jackpot with that one! 
PERFECT LOCATION. The hotel is a mere 3 to 4 minutes from the action of 
Times Square.
EXCELLENT SERVICE. In our haste, we had actually booked a room with a double bed. They upgraded us to a queen at no charge. The room was NOT spacious, but super-clean with toiletries and guest services one would expect for a lot more than $200 a night. It was cozy and comfortable and (most important to me) I could not hear any street noise... which was fantastic. That made for a great, restful night sleep. 
PARKING. They do not offer parking (as far I knew), but that was fine because directly across the street there is public parking which we used without having to pay through the nose for valet parking.
OTHER AMENITIES. They did offer wifi, but we never used it, so I can't comment on how fast or slow it was. Also the 'business' area was quite small, consisting only of one desk and a computer. But I guess people don't go to Times Square for business, so that probably works out just fine. They did offer to print out tickets or whatever documents we needed - again the personal attention was just superb!
My wife and I both just love this hotel and we will definitely book with them the next time we visit the area.

title: Acceptable, very small and interesting
text: I travel a lot and use Hotwire so I don't know the exact hotel where I am staying until I book the room. I book using the star rating , location and reviews. Really I am just looking for a comfortable and clean room. The bed was very comfortable and the room and facilities were clean. The hotel was no frills. The room was cramped (but it is NYC) and I didn't have a desk to work on. The bathroom was awsome. The lobby was almost non existant, that being said the front desk and bell staff was very professional. The location was great. Would I stay there given the opportunity to stay at other similar hotels? No. Would I be disappointed if I got the hotel again, NO. It was acceptable.

title: Private little known hotel
text: If you want to visit NY and not be swallowed up by one of the Large over powering hotels here is a gem.  Located on a busy side street you would walk by it a 100 times.  But the rooms are great.. the staff wonderful.  The amenties not many but good.  NOT a discount hotel.

title: Lovely stay
text: We spent a few nights here in town for a show at the nearby Belasco Theatre. The hotels location attracted us and the parking garage across the street was convienant. The rooms were tidy and comfy but we absolutley loved the tub. The cookies that are served at turndown are sinful but a welcome treat. Wesley and Eddie at the front desk were a pleasure and so great. An awesome steakhouse recc our first night and they went above & beyond when we inquired about possibly changing rooms due to the street noise. The bistro in the lobby also has a fantastic wine list. This is a gem with a wonderful staff, comfy rooms and Location, location, location.

title: Excelente
text:
nao tenho nada negativo a dizer desse hotel. 
Ele é bem localizado, os quartos sao muito confortáveis. Só nao é incluso o cafe da manha, mas isso nao interferiu em nada, pois havia varios lugares para comer ali perto.
E por ser bem localizado, o preço é muito bom.

title: Mixed Bag
text: Start with the pros: great location near Times Sq/Bryant Park, nice architecture, nice decor. The rooms were beautiful and the amount of space was good. The best I've seen in the price range in this area of Manhattan. If you need a restaurant, DB Bistro is downstairs, and they don't get much better.Con: I was a little late returning, and the room was already clean and my things had been taken by the housekeeper. They were not turned in but were kept by her. Management was able to get everything back. But really? Yes I pack light, but the fact that my clothes were still in the Macy's bag with the tags still on them should have tipped people off that they weren't discarded items. This place would have otherwise had an excellent review. "Finders, keepers" is never a good idea, they need a better lost and found policy.

title: Hotel Excelente
text:
Reservamos este hotel na véspera da viagem pois tivemos um problema com o que estava reservado anteriormente. O imprevisto tornou-se uma bela surpresa!

A localização é excelente! Esquina com Quinta Avenida e apenas um quarteirão da Times Square. 
Tivemos um upgrade de quarto ao chegarmos ( reservamos o petite e nos colocaram no queen luxo). Muito espaçoso, cama grande e banheiro enorme com produtos de banho de alta qualidade. Armário embutido de tamanho razoável com cofre (bem pequeno, mas eficiente) e frigobar bem variado.
Na parte da manhã, recebíamos o jornal na porta do quarto e no final do dia, cookies deliciosos eram deixados em nosso quarto.
O staff foi atencioso e pudemos deixar nossa bagagem guardada mesmo após o  check out. 
Instalações de alto padrão com conforto e sossego em plena NY. Voltaria  a me hospedar, com certeza!

title: Perfect combination of business and pleasure
text: We've stayed at the City Club twice now and loved our experiences both times. It's close to meetings, shopping and theaters while providing a boutique experience. Fabulous room, shower, restaurant and service!

title: Great location
text: Located some 300 m from TIMES SQUARE you are really in centre of Manhattan. All  attractions are in a walking distance. Reception staff was very helpful and friendly. Spaciouis bathroom. The room was called Petite and was  really quite small. But the disappointment was the view to the yard. The curio was, that lady maid during cleaning the room took away my sleeping shirt and I never got it back.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: We booked a great rate online for a quick two night stay. Now while I certainly expected a 4 star experience, it was exceeded & felt closer to 5 stars. The decor of the lobby is chic and very demure. Check in was simple and easy. Eddie at the front desk was outstanding - smart,charming,funny & a true NYer. Told us about a great bookstore in soho (great finds) & he secured us two fantastic dinner res for both nights. We were left very impressed as avid foodies- a great concierge+service elevates this boutique property. Rooms were spotless and the cookies were a delightful touch both evenings. Lovely water pressure(always a must). The hotel restaurant is run by Daniel Boloud, lunch was superb & I enjoyed the bistros modern design. Only complaint would be the room view left some to be desired. The location is perfect and near all subways. We will certainly make this our go-to spot in NY and we look forward to coming back soon with our daughter!

title: Small Eclectic Room in Good Mid-town Location
text:
This hotel features small, eclectic rooms in a convenient mid-town location - it's on the same block (West 44th btw 5th and 6th) as the Harvard Club of New York City and the Algonquin Hotel.  Its lobby is postage stamp sized, and our room was small (overlooking an air-shaft), but the rooms are well designed.  Note: look for the various James-Bond like secret panels - otherwise you'll miss the minibar, and maybe even the closet with safe way in the side-back!

Despite its small size the room featured a king-sized bed, built-in couch, TV and DVD player, chair, and a good number of outlets.  There was an iron and ironing board.  The bathroom was marble and had a nice selection of items.  Shower water pressure was very good.

Not for the claustrophobic, but if you want a nice modern room in a good location I'd recommend the City Club Hotel.

title: Quiet, Quirky Hotel Near Time Square
text:
I stayed at the City Club hotel for a couple of nights in March, 2015. Let me first say...I'm not a huge fan of NY, so for me, going to NY is just an exercise in uncertainty. 

That said, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the City Club Hotel. I too was upgraded from a "Petite" to a "King" room (is everyone?) and for NY, both the room and the bathroom were pretty spacious and elegant. And...maybe I'm getting them in trouble here...but that seemingly full-flow shower head was fantastic when you're used to dribbling shower heads in other hotels.

Amenities:
- In room wi-fi included
- Better TV channel selection than most
- Good bedside radio that accommodates both iPhone and Android inputs
- Hidden (and I do mean "Hidden") wall unit with refrigerator, wetbar and DVD player

The hotel does not offer a fitness center, for $20, you can jog down the street about 200 feet and go to the NY Fitness Club which opens at 6 a.m. during the week. It offers most everything you expect in a fitness center.

My only real complaint are the warm cookies they deliver each evening (right before dinner). They're too good..really...they are. They ruined any chance I had at trying to eat healthy in NY.

title: Boutique style hotel in downtown New York
text: The City Club hotel is just over 1 block from Times Square. I was upgraded to the king size room and for 1 person I had lots of space. The bathroom had a cork floor which was great on the feet. On the 2nd floor there was a honour bar which I really appreciated - a touch of class. Registration was quick and the staff were very welcoming. There is a bistro next door so breakfast was easy. No views just bricks but you are there just to sleep. Great place!

title: A great central location, clean and  comfortable - if basic - room
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in mid March. Located on West 44th Street between 6th and 5th Avenues, a few minutes stroll from Times Square and another ten or so minutes to Central Park, this is a great base from which to explore Manhattan with attractions such as the Rockerfeller Centre, Empire State Building and Grand Central Station all within easy walking distance.

The hotel entrance is not immediately obvious, being overshadowed by it's larger neighbours - The Algonquin and Iroquois hotels - on either side. Likewise, the lobby and reception desk are at best described as functional rather than welcoming. These first impressions, however, should not mislead. We stayed in room 707 which was clean, comfortable and, compared to all other Manhattan hotels I have stayed in, extremely quiet. The room did not receive much natural light but as were out during the day time this was no problem.

Another advantage was that the bathroom was a generous size with lots of space.

If your hotel needs are based on comfort & convenience, and a status lobby is not  high on your list of priorities, I think this could be a great choice for you.

We enjoyed our stay and would be happy to return as guests on future visits.

title: A room with no view.
text:
It didn't matter that my window faced a brick wall. I was otherwise perfectly happy with everything else. I was up graded from petit to queen with an extremely comfortable bed and bedding. It was very cold out and I was happy to have good heating and a comfy duvet.
The room was kept clean and the bed turned down with a chocolate chip cookie in case I was still hungry after the superb dinner downstairs.
I ate several meals in the bistro--breakfast and dinner. High price, but high marks.
I am coming to New York again in April and will stay here once more. It had everything I could want. Great staff, location, etc.

title: Chic and Cozy Hotel in a Exciting Location
text: City Club hotel has a phenomenal location close to Times Square and a stones throw to many of the wonderful Broadway venues. The rooms were spacious and clean with adequate heating during this winter time. I appreciated the delightful cookies that were delivered complimentary every night. Staff were helpful and efficient in their rendering of service. Great value for money.

title: Quiet Paradisw on 44th St.
text:
My favorite small hotel in NYC. The staff are very kind and friendly, last visit Wesley and Keith at the front desk were particularly helpful. Small elevator takes you up to posh quiet rooms with huge mirrors, large bathrooms and very comfortable beds. The hotel is in the same building as the French Restaurant DB Moderne, which you glimpse via a glass wall from the elevator waiting area.
West 44th Street is a great location: Near Grand Central Station, Broadway shows, all sorts of restaurants, yet City Club is like a secret hideaway.

title: Great room
text: We stayed in the loft room. The downstairs was very roomy with a great balcony and view. The upstairs was great, with floor to ceiling windows from the downstairs you still had the amazing view. There was a half bath downstairs and the full bath upstairs. Very clean and even the bathroom was huge compared to NY standards. The walls were thin, so I am not sure how a regular room would be.  You do hear the typical NY noise outside and there seem to be construction going on late into the night when we were there in February, however, it didn't keep us awake. The only minor thing we incurred was when we checked in we asked if the bar/restaurant served a cheese platter to snack on and they told us they did. Upon going there they do not, and so we never ended up eating there. In that respect we always end up back at The Muse bar/restaurant which is wonderful.

title: Better options on W44
text: My sister and I visit NYC quite often and usually stay at the Royalton.  For this trip we decided to stay at the City Club.  The staff was friendly, the room was clean and pretty.  However the walls were paper thin and we could hear the couple next door recreating Fifty Shades of Grey, for two nights, all night long! The street noise sounded as if we it was going through the room!  I can say my stays at the Royalton I have never heard street noise. Sorry City Club we won't be staying with you again!

title: Great property in midtown for a decent price
text: We booked this hotel through a discount website and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived.  The location is perfect, just a block and half off of Times Square making it very accessible and yet not chaotic. The staff is very welcoming and super helpful on arrival and departure.  My friends and I had two rooms and stayed 3 nights.  My room was a single and it was definitely not large but perfectly sufficient for 1-2 people.  It also had a lot of charm in terms of decorating and a nice size bathroom, although without a tub.  My friends had larger room with a couch and large bathroom.  The hotel has some nice amenities, including turndown service and the maids left warm cookies on our nightstands each night.  My only complaint is that the hotel really does not have a lobby so there's no place to comfortably congregate while your party gathers, but that's definitely not a deal breaker. I would stay here again if the opportunity arises.

title: Great Hotel Experience!
text:
First off, I was able to land a great rate through a hotel discounter, but was delighted when I actually arrived at the hotel.  The young man at the front desk was friendly and very explanatory of the hotels features including the restaurant, the honor bar, wifi, etc.  He upgraded me to a double from a petite room as well (without me asking).  The room was lovely and I was equally impressed with the spa like toiletries, spa robes and fully stocked closet bar. The one disappointment was that the bed was a little lumpy.

The location is just a few blocks from Times Square and Bryant Park.  I took the advise of the man at reception and had dinner at the hotel restaurant DB modern bistro.  WOW!  The food and service were excellent.

title: Great hotel
text: My fourth visit to New York and this has been the best hotel so far. Excellent location (near Times Square and subway station), friendly staff, clean and spacious (for NY) room. Can't say many bad things about it... Room looked out onto a brick wall, but was only there for sleeping anyway. Enjoyed the evening complimentary chocolate cookie! Great stay!

title: Great clean room, very friendly staff willing to help with anything they can. Great location!
text: My stay was only for one night, however I would absolutely stay at this hotel for longer. Its small, VERY Clean, staff is great and the location is great, you have anything you can think of around.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Good place for a one night stay
text: I came to the city for one night to attend a conference in the Times Square area. I picked this hotel because the price was right, it had free wife, and booking it on Rocketmiles gave me 5000 AA miles. The hotel is located close to Times Square and lots of restaurants and Port Authority Bus Terminal. When I arrived at the front desk at 12pm, I was told that the petite room that I booked would not be available until 3pm but I could upgrade to a queen room for $50 (normally I would have refused the offer but I decided to treat myself since I was only staying one night). However, I had a feeling that they normally tell guests this in order to get them to book a larger room for more money. The room was a medium sized NYC hotel room (which made me wonder how small the petite room I originally booked was). I was really impressed by the marble shower, huge wall sized mirror, and bidet in the bathroom. And I really liked that the maid (I am saying maid because she was dressed in a traditional black and white maid's outfit) came by in the evening with a plate of chocolate chip cookies. A few things that I didn't like about the room was the lack of counter space in the bathroom. There was so much space in the bathroom but nowhere for me to put my toiletries. I also was a bit unnerved by the fact that my bed (although very comfy) did not have a fitted sheet over the featherbed and mattress. The featherbed was covered by a sheet so if you move in your sleep like I do, you will see the mattress in the morning. I just thought it was strange for a hotel with bidets in the bathroom that they don't have a complete bedding set on their beds. Also, it would have been nice to have a coffee/tea machine in the rooms. Overall I had a great night sleep there and a wonderful showering experience.

title: Tem vantagens
text: Se ficar no quarto com 4 pessoas,com certeza ficará muito apertado. Os quartos não são espaçosos, a recepção também não,mas a localização é muito boa. Fiquei num quarto ,de frente para a rua principal ,no sétimo andar e achei silencioso.O staff não é nada de sensacional,mas é atencioso,sempre tem um cookie,para adoçar o dia e é delicioso.O preço achei bastante favorável para o que o hotel oferece. O banheiro já é mais espaçoso ,com um chuveiro muito bom.Nos arredores ,a variedade de restaurantes,facilidade para ir nos pontos turísticos,são pontos favoráveis para ficar neste hotel.

title: Perfect place to stay for a night out
text:
We have to stay in the city ALL THE TIME so I'm constantly looking for good deals on hotels. I bid on Priceline a lot and have gotten some decent places so when I got this hotel for the same price I could of just booked directly I got nervous. 
I was pleasantly surprised. Granted they upgraded me for free to a queen room, I loved the place. Eddie at the front desk was a primo concierge and gave me great advice to what was near. 
I would definitely stay here again and as far as my room went I was very pleasantly surprised and happy!

title: Vale tentar!
text: O ponto forte deste hotel é a localização. Fica próximo da Time Square, quinta avenida,mas ao mesmo tempo é bem silenciosa a rua que está situado. Ficamos num quarto para 5 pessoas e estava bastante apertado. À recepção é minuscula, a entrada ,só uma porta de vidro,mas se for só pra dormir,o custo beneficio vale. Não servem café da manhã,mas tem varios lugares na redondeza que servem. Muitos restaurantes bons , há poucos metros do hotel. Gostei pela praticidade e localização.

title: Good location, clean, great service
text:
Chose this hotel mainly as we negotiated a great rate and it's only 1 block from our NYC office. For a 3 night business stay it's perfect. Small, discrete and quiet, the staff are very friendly, giving the hotel a boutique feel rather than a business hotel feel.

Rooms are quite large, very clean, with a good en-suite. Large TV, ironing board/iron, well stocked minibar, air con. Nice bar and restaurant on the ground floor, good for an early evening cocktail or business dinner.

Good place to stay in the heart of Manhatten - about 1-2blocks (5mins walk) from Times Square.

title: One night in NYC
text:
Location, location, location. This hotel has a great location, easy access every where. I stayed here only one night, so I wanted to have a great location. My room was large in NYC's scale. A large bathroom, good shower and a large room with a couch. During my stay, the weather was freezing, so heating needed to be turned on. The system was very noicy, so didn't sleep that well. 
Staff was nice and friendly, overall I enjoyed, all what I wanted for one night. But maybe I do not select this hotel for a long stay, 1-2 nights are fine. I got a very good deal via HotelTonight, it was a cheap deal. So I cannot compare this hotel with other hotels in same rate.

title: 1st time to the BIG APPLE
text: Had a great time....didn't realize how small rooms were but, I was told it was a big room for being in the city.  Staff was excellent and every evening when coming back to room there was always chocolate chip cookies. ...and they were so dang good too. Had a nice salad  and attached restaurant and my departing day I had breakfast from room service and it was really nice.

title: Great Find, if you can find it!
text:
Stayed for 3 nights with my daughter, we had a petite room which was indeed petite, but it's in NYC so no surprise.  I was offered an upgrade for $50 a night did not take the offer as we were in room only to sleep.  The bed was comfy but short!  I am 5'9" and my feet hung over the edge!  We laughed that if my husband was with us we would need a bigger room/bed as he is 6' 5".  Nice bathroom, excellent water pressure in shower which was nice and big.  Not much room for "stuff" in bathroom, bidet is front and center!  
We took the transporter to Bryant park and waked the 2 blocks to hotel which has a really small entrance and walked right past it...oops.  Free wifi, super friendly staff.  I will stay again.
Oh forgot about the cookies left on bed at turn down, yummy.

title: Very pleased
text: Originally from NewYork, back on a business trip. This hotel is the best of all Manhattan  hotels I have stayed in over the past 20 years in terms of staff, comfort and location. Danielle, Eddie, Wesley and Keith at front desk are outstanding, bright, personable, friendly. Rooms are comfortable, couldn't be better. Location is ideal. I would like to make this my regular horel for Manhattan visits!

title: Great Price Great Location
text: The location can't be beat, just off 5th Avenue, and close to everything - Times Square, Bryant Park, Shopping, Restaurants.  Very attentive staff.  They upgraded us to a Queen Room for the price of a standard.  Rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  Great Price.

title: Small hotel close to everything
text: This small hotel is only a few short blocks from Time Square, 5th Ave and a multitude of other sites/buildings/etc.  It is extremely clean, the bathroom is large and the fresh baked cookies in your room each evening is a nice touch.  The price was great too.

title: Perfect location with large room
text:
We recently stayed here for the second half of our holiday in New York.  Staff were excellent, always friendly and very helpful.  They upgraded us to a Queen Room which was big for NY standards - nice bathroom, lots of room and hot cookies delivered every night (not good for the waist line!).

Hotel comes with free wifi which is excellent.  Lots of places to eat right outside the door.  Grand Central a couple of blocks away, along with Time Square.  10+ block walk to the start of Central Park and lots of great shopping around.

title: Don't hesitate to book this hotel
text: Great staff. Great room. Great location. We loved it. It's two blocks from Times Square and 5th Avenue is just around the corner. The staff are so helpful and friendly. Great coffee shop across the road too. We will definitely be back.

title: Ótima localização
text: Hotel pequeno , com uma recepção pequena , mas com staff bem prestativos . O quarto é pequeno , mesmo ficando na suite para três pessoas , pouco espaço para as malas . Em compensação o banheiro é bem espaçoso . Ótima localização , perto da quinta avenida e da Time Square . A noite deixam cookies deliciosos .

title: Wonderful Mid-Town Hotel!
text: Lovely hotel just off Times Square. Convenient to everything. Great, attentive staff and spacious rooms. Evening turn down service included warm, just from the oven cookies.  Mmmmm!  The perfect downtown hotel at the right price. Really had a great time.

title: Excelente custo beneficio no coração de Manhattan
text:
Adorei Hotel. Hotel pequeno. Perto de tudo. principalmente se vc pensa em teatros.
Pena não ter café da manhã. Mas tem um restaurante ao lado onde vc pode tomar um excelente breakfast com preço justo (The red flame). 
Quarto amplo e confortável. Sem cheiro de cigarro.
Funcionários atenciosos.
Tem garagem em frente.

title: Perfect City Hideaway
text: Great boutique hotel.. Rooms are interesting, hotel is in a great location and staff are so nice. We travelled with our two teenage boys and it was their request to return.  They think the place has a great atmosphere.

title: Sexy Midtown Mediocre Plus
text: The attractive staff is aggressively helpful. The location is good. The cozy room is nicely designed for practical comfort.  A small hallway from door to sleeping area ensures a quiet night. The large mirrored bathroom with a big shower is the "Plus."

title: undvik
text: Arriving christmas day to New York. Nothing of Christmas appeared at hotelet. The entrance foyer was like a dilivery door for packages etc. Kingsize room which was ordered and paid. was extremely small, we wanted space and opened the window it was about 30 cm to the next wall (building) to close the window then went not, so we had to move to an even smaller room, queen size where we barely got into our suitcases. However, without receiving any compensation more than English breakfast. Having previously lived opposite this hotel, and both the right and left of this hotel, plus a score of other hotel in Manhattan this was absolutely the worst.

title: just perfect !
text:
One of the best spot of Manhattan .
A small hotel with few rooms in a calm street, an excellent diners just next door, metro at one bloc, and 3 minutes by feet to time square
The staff is very kind, helpful .
We sleep at 5 people in a big room, very calm, with a big Italian shower, with very good
cookies  every evening in the room, and very good beds.

title: Banheiro espacoso
text: Tem uma área bastante espaçosa no banheiro com shampoo, sabonetes e outros itens mas faltou uma cafeteira para consumo no quarto. Quarto com boa calefação e cama confortável. Próximo ao Grand Central e Times Square.

title: Atendimento ruim
text: Tive um problema à noite com o quarto ao lado, pois teve uma festa até mais de 2 horas da madrugada e nada fizeram. Me ofereceram um quarto menor que não caberia eu minha mulher e meu filho, sendo que estava no quarto dúplex. Mais queriam que arrumasse minhas coisas para me mudar, pois não poderiam ter dois quartos comigo. Mesmo não sendo eu que estivesse errado. Atendimento de baixa qualidade e sem solução plausível.

title: Nice, not flashy, but nice and clean
text: Stayed for six nights over new years...great spot, nice staff, clean room...everyone was helpful,  the adjacent restaurant was top notch...I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.....located in the middle of Manhattan. .

title: Excellent stay
text: We stayed at this hotel for a few days recently.  We loved the chic upscale rooms. The hotel is pet friendly and very accommodating.  We enjoyed the luxurious  beds and linens . The showers were phenomenal.  I only wished we could have stayed longer.  Great stay.   I was disappointed that there were no late night eateries.   I thought that NY didn't sleep.   Otherwise,  during the day , you have your choice of many dinning spots.  We enjoyed the holiday booths and vendors at the near by Bryant Park.

title: Отличный отель!
text: Отель находится в очень удобном месте. Номер: просторный, удобный, с большой ванной комнатой, очень чистый. Есть ресторан при отеле. Вокруг много ресторанов, где можно завтракать с 7:00. 5-ая авеню находится в 3 минутах ходьбы.

title: Good
text: Rooms are Xsmall but bathrooms are nice. Very confortable night stays, with quality pillows and overall beddings. Evening cookie treat. They get you umbrella in your room in case of rain falls, like I've been thru.

title: Fantastic Service, Perfect Location
text:
We stayed here for one night this past week, it was perfect!  The location was great!  We walked to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Penn Station and everywhere in between.  It was raining when we arrived and they had a complimentary umbrella for us to use in our room.  The staff that greeted us was very friendly, check in was fast and easy.  Our room was great, much bigger than I expected in the city.  It was clean and had everything we needed.  
There is a bistro just off the lobby, we had breakfast here, it was very good!  I really can only say good thing about this place!  If I had one con, it would be the view out our window was a brick wall, but I am sure if I had had a view of 44th street my one con would have been noise!, So I will take the brick wall over noise!  
We will stay here again when we find ourselves back in NYC.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text:
My wife and I just returned from an overnight stay at City Club Hotel in NYC. We absolutely loved it there! The hotel is located on West 44th, situated to provide one with easy access both to Broadway theaters and 5th Avenue shopping. It is a unique street with classy hotels, decorative street lights, private clubs and great dining. We enjoyed dinner at db Bistro Moderne located off the lobby.

The staff could not be nicer and more welcoming. Our room, 302, was a duplex on two floors with 1 1/2 baths and lots of space. It was the best room we have stayed in in NYC. Everything about the room was first class - the décor, amenities, Frette robes, bedding, lighting, furniture - all the best. The ceiling of our room was preserved from the ballroom of the club that used to occupy the site. The molding was incredible and the preservation that the hotel did is exemplary. Parking garage right across the street. I wish all hotels could aspire to this level of comfort and service.

title: Exceptional service, lovely room, amazing location!
text:
We stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving weekend. It was wonderful from start to finish. The highlight of this hotel is a tie between impeccable service and insanely good location! We could literally stand out on the balcony (duplex suite, third floor) and watch the Marcy's Tgiving Day Parade go by...it was on the street half a block from our balcony! Two blocks from Times Square, three or four blocks to Broadway, we walked everywhere! The service was amazing, very helpful and quick with any request. My daughter even left her boots there by accident, not only did the hotel find them but they mailed them to us! 
Pros: Location, service, clean.
Cons: (if I had to be picky) Room service was limited. There is a Bistro next door that also delivers up to the room but again it is limited (and WAY expensive, $13 for two eggs, really?). But, there is a coffee shop right across the street (room service coffee was $5, $9? Something like that, definitely NOT what I would pay for coffee). The room was a little noisy, walls were thin. We had a VERY excited 5 year old in the room next to us at 6 a.m., the hotel was quick to ask them to settle down and they did. Little bit of street noise too but hey, it is basically in Times Square. 
I would definitely stay here again, this hotel was wonderful and went out of their way to do whatever you ask, quickly. Oh and the duplex suite cannot be beat, especially if you have a teenager with you...there is a spiral staircase, the master is upstairs with a full bathroom, couch and sitting area downstairs with a half bath...perfect for our family of three.

title: Birthday Trip to the Big Apple
text: Chose this location because they were able to accommodate five to a more or less standard room. City Club did not disappoint. The room had a day bed for the "fifth" guest that rested up against the windows that opened. With five people in the same room it's hard to say that it was roomy but we got by. The staff was very polite and responsive and the room was clean and modern. Would definitely stay here again. One person in our group ended up leaving a blouse in the room. The hotel staff was not able to find the shirt, but they were very responsive and even got in touch with the linen company to try to locate it. Not a fan of the see through shower curtain but if you were on a romantic getaway it might be right up your alley :-)

title: Boulud Restaurant is the best part!
text:
Hotel is exactly what you would expect; my favorite part is its proximity to DB BISTRO MODERNE, the fantastic Parisian-style bistro by chef Daniel Boulud. It's warm and inviting, the food is exceptional, the service perfect. Very happy to discover it's right there.  

Had a good breakfast, and went back for dinner.  Also passed by during the day and saw it packed for lunch.

title: Boa surpresa
text: Adorei o hotel. Paguei um preço abaixo da média. Localização excelente, otimo atendimento. Ficamos no quarto em 3 adultos e 2 crianças pequenas e o tamanho estava ótimo. A única coisa q senti falta foi de uma cafeteira e de um microondas no quarto. Super recomendo.

title: A mixed bag -- some good points, some negative
text: We were planning an overnight trip to NYC (staying overnight on a Saturday night) and because we had so little time in the city (and because we planned to see a show that night) I was thrilled when I saw the great rate on a room that could accommodate a family of 5 at a "nice" hotel in mid-town. I knew the room would be a bit small, but I figured location would make up for that.  Before finding City Club I had made a reservation at another hotel in the upper east side.  Reasoning that the better location would give us a couple of precious hours  by saving us travel time to the upper east side, I cancelled the first reservation and went with City Club.  We arrived at 10:30 am and were greeted warmly by the front desk staff and the doorman.  We left our bags and told the we'd be back at 3pm for check-in.  We spent most of the day walking (lots of walking--all the way down to Union Square and then back!).  When we returned, at about 3:15, we were told the room wasn't ready but would be "just a few minutes".  It was disappointing, but we decided to wait. We were sent to a waiting area (tables and chairs) and waited...and waited.  At close to 4pm my husband went down to check on the room.  It had been more than "a few minutes" and the kids were exhausted.  We also were losing the time I had hoped to save by staying in mid-town.  The woman at the front desk apologized, but said she couldn't give an estimate on when the room would be ready, telling us, 'It'll be a few more minutes".  Supposedly, because we were waiting for a more rare "double room", it was harder to get the room ready. At 4:15 we had to change our dinner reservation because we didn't think we'd have time to regroup, dress, and get to the restaurant by 5:30.  At 4:25 -- finally -- someone came up to tell us the rooms would be ready "momentarily".  We got up to the room a little after 4:30 (an hour and a half AFTER check-in time) and were given free passes to breakfast at the restaurant.  This excited us until we went to the restaurant and were told the "free" breakfast was either a bowl of oatmeal, a yogurt parfait, or a muffin/pastry combo.  It was nice -- and free -- but hardly made up for the inconvenience of waiting that long for our room and losing over an hour waiting.  The room itself was fine -- the double is about the size of a standard non-NYC Marriott and the extra bed for the fifth person is a window-seat type of bed.  The beds themselves have nice bedding but the mattresses seem older.  The room was clean (I would hope so, since it took them 90 minutes to get it ready!), and the bathroom spacious. Our room faced 44th, so it was loud at night but we were tired so it was fine.  We know that things go wrong -- people check out late or it gets more busy than expected.  And we appreciate the apology from the staff. We were upset, though, because they knew we were there at 10:30 am...and even if the room wasn't ready when we returned, it shouldn't have taken another hour to prepare the room.  I wouldn't stay here again -- even though it is hard to find a 5 person room in NYC, I would try something else. The best part of this hotel is the location -- easy walking to most sights and shows.

title: Not a four star hotel
text:
I only stayed one night and I'm  glad that I was not there longer.  I usually stay in a neighboring hotel, but it was booked.  Thought I would give the City Club a try.  Of course the room was small, it is NYC after all, but their queen room was very small.  I don't think more than one person could manage staying in the room.  The hallways are also very tight.  Two people can't not pass each other in the hallways.  The bed was extremely lumpy.  The lighting is poor, especially in the bathroom.  Very hard to put on one's makeup with the bathroom lighting.  On the positive, the bathroom is almost the same size as the room with a large shower.  I don't think they have a doorman.
On the positive, it is in a great location.  There are several excellent restaurants and a classic NYC diner on the same street.
I probably will not stay here again.

title: AMAZING!!!
text:
My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday!  It was truly a memorable experience.  
Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  We were checking in as one party of four and they were very helpful since we were all arriving at different times and the person who booked the reservation was not yet there.
The lobby was clean, simple and unassuming,  we recieved a warm welcome from the young lady at the front  desk.  Once we got off the elevator and entered our room, there was definteley the WOW factor!   We actually thought of cancelling our plans & not setting foot outside of the room! The rooms were clean, with great style (mix of modern & classic New York)  and so comfortable! Within minutes of settling in and were welcomed with a knock at the door and the delivery of fresh chocolate chip cookies-DELICIOUS!!
Take every opportunity you can to stay here- truly an enjoyable New York experience and we could not have asked for more.
City Club will always be at the top of my list!

title: Feel like a smart people
text:
If you walk down the street when some ivy league school club is I felt smart like I am one of them, but many times I visit NY, I always choose this hotel because of location and extraordinary staff, they always welcome and treat us nicely specially after 14 hours flight we need a lot warm smile.
Room is bit small but our last visit they give bigger than usual and flowers in our room, not to mention the fresh bake cookies is always there.
Feel like a smart one? you have to find the closet, the safe deposit box behind the wall, or behind the pictures! it is fun to play "treasure hunting"    :)

title: Started Bad but ended Great!
text:
Taylory
I booked City Club through Priceline the night before I arrived.  Upon my arrival, I was advised that I did not have a room since the front desk staff could not find my reservation.  Of course, I am regretting booking on Priceline as I sit there for them to sort it out.  Fortunately, they were able to sort it out and accommodated me with a fabulous room. The bell man, front desk staff and the housekeeper delivered excellent service.  Wesley at the front desk went above and beyond to ensure that we had an awesome time - even the food in the restaurant was delicious. I would definitely stay again; it is in a great location two blocks to Time Square.

title: Gostei muito!
text: Sou do tipo de turista que fico o dia inteiro na rua e só volto pro hotel pra tomar banho e dormir o suficiente para aguentar o dia seguinte. O City Club fica perto de vários locais obrigatório visitar, além de ter cafés e restaurantes na proximidade e a 46th st, rua dos brasileiros, ficar a duas quadras. O quarto que ficamos tem tamanho bom, claro que não é enorme, mas é tranquilo para um casal, e você não vai à Nova iorque para ficar andando dentro do quarto, certo? O banheiro também tem tamanho bom e com acabamento bem bacana em mármore. Fica a uma quadra e meia do metrô (Grand Central Terminal), que é a melhor maneira de se locomover na cidade.

title: Hidden Gem in Times Square!
text: Booked a random Sunday night stay..great rate..great location..arrived and it got better! Anne and Emily welcomed us graciously and Steve got us to our amazing room.  The entire staff was young and energetic! Super clean room and common areas..yet eclectic high class appointments! Will definitely stay here again!

title: BELLISSIMO!
text:
Questo hotel ci è piaciuto moltissimo in quanto gode innanzitutto di una posizione strategica, di fianco a Time Square, la nostra camera era davvero confortevole, luminosa, elegante, spaziosa. Il bagno ampio e ben curato, la doccia davvero top.
Perfetta la biancheria, il frigo bar immenso.
Gradito moltissimo il dolce sul cuscino prima di coricarci.
Nonostante la posizione centrale la qualità del sonno è stata ottima.
Ottimo anche il rapporto qualità/prezzo.
Da tornarci.

title: В центре
text: Этот отель удобно расположен в самом центре активной жизни Нью-Йорка вблизи магазинов, ресторанов, театров, парка. Из внешних минусов- отсутствие парковки и сложно найти отель (вывеска неприметная), на такси очень долго стояли в пробке, одностороннее движение. Номер очень маленький, окно наглухо закрыто, уличный свет в номер не проходит. Но при этом в комнате есть все необходимое: удобная кровать, мини бар и принадлежности для глажки, шампуни/кремы в душе, халат, тапки. Отель подойдет для остановки на 1-2 ночи, если надо непременно жить в центре манхэтана.

title: Excellent BUT
text:
Everything going perfect. Location, personnel reception, great luggage helper BUT bathroom lack good LIGHTS over the mirror for make up
 The rest of room and bathroom impeccably clean. Nice big mirror on outside bathroom door.
Highly recommend

title: Pretty good hotel but happiness definitely depends on the room type
text: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and learned an important lesson - the number of stars there is for the hotel and not for the room.  We received the smallest room I have ever seen - 1 bed and not even enough room to open our suitcases.  After speaking with the front desk, we learned that this happens a lot when booking through a 3rd party and were told we could upgrade our room for an extra fee.  We decided to do it and it made all the difference.  The new room was a great size (bigger than other rooms I've had in NY in the past), with a big bathroom, fridge, closet, safe, couch, comfortable bed and amazing wireless internet.  I would definitely recommend the hotel based on this room.  The view wasn't great (brick walls) and there was noise from the attached restaurant on Friday night but it ended at midnight so it really wasn't bad.  The hotel was in a great location and close to restaurants, stores and a subway stop.  All in all I would recommend it.

title: Perto de tudo
text:
Da para andar de metro e a pé, até para o aeroporto fomos de metro.... O hotel é bom apesar de não ter café da manhã.. Quarto limpo, grAnde e confortável, sempre deixavam um cupcake no final do dia . Tinha até guarda chuva p usar em dias chuvosos
Ponto negativo: wifi funcionou um dia só, e ficaram dando a desculpa q logo arrumariam e nada...

title: お得な料金を見逃さないで！
text: 時々とてもお得な料金を出しているのでニューヨークにいらっしゃる方は日程が決まった時にチェックして見てください。書き込みを見ていると, 「狭い、セーフティボックスがない、」など問題もあるようですが、お部屋によってかなり違いがあるのでしょうか。。私の泊まったお部屋は最上階でテラスがあり,遠くにクライスラービルの夜景も見えました。狭いですがモダンな内装で機能的でした。USオープンを見に行った帰り夜中の2時になってしまいましたが 地下鉄からワンブロックですし、最近のマンハッタンは警官が多く夜中でも全く危険を感じませんでした。オススメの立地の良いホテルです。

title: Great Hotel with Helpful Staff
text: This place had everything I was looking for in a New York hotel.  Perfect location, great value, and super helpful and friendly employees.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in midtown.

title: Sleepless
text:
Not advise this hotel, the rooms are small and the worst is the noise in them, the air conditioning of buildings next door sounds in the room, it's impossible to sleep in it.
Also be careful with the credit card, once you make the checkout, they charge in credit card amounts without explanation ....... CARE.

title: New York Trip
text:
Great hotel, great location - nice people. Room with balcony gave us a good feel and made us feel less closed in.

BEing in central Manhattan, going up to our room after a long day and sitting on the balcony was a bonus.

The restaurant is excellent, recommended even if the wines are a bit on the expensive side but then I am comparing to France where I live.

title: Expensive, but worth it!
text: We stayed here with our little 4 month old infant for 4 nights. We had booked a petite room through Rocketmiles.com, but on arrival they upgraded us to a queen room at no extra cost as our original petite room was not ready for us at check-in time and the front desk staff thought it would be too tight a fit for 3 of us in a petite room, Great start already! Staff were really friendly and customer focussed - they accomodated all kinds of requests that we had for the baby during our stay. Rooms were compact, but had almost everything we needed. No coffee in the rooms. There was evening turn down service, and they leave you with 2 decadent chocolate cookies every night! Huge bath rooms, however we only had a stand in shower, which it made it a little complicated to bathe the baby so remember to ask for a room with bath tub if travelling with young ones. We also a bedae which reminded us of Europe. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing another hotel - so you don't really get any natural light in the room which is some ways is a good thing coz you sleep like a baby! Wi-Fi was not working on our last night. Location was ultimate - walking distance to all of the attractions (Grand Central terminal, Bryant Park, New York Public Library, Central Park, Time Square) but away from the chaos of Time Square. Taxis are always available right outside the hotel. Try the amazing coffee across from the hotel at Gregory's.

title: Bon hôtel idéalement placé.
text: Très bien placé à deux pas de Times Square et de la 5th. Chambre pour trois un peu petite (un grand lit double et un lit simple) mais suffisante pour se poser après une bonne journée de marche et avant d'aller se balader le soir. Le personnel est très gentil. Bref une bonne adresse.

title: Great location-avoid the Petite rooms though
text: I'm giving them an average because our experience started out terribly in one of their petite rooms, but then we upgraded, with the additional cost, of course, and it was a great room. Petite room was a disgrace. Tiny-basically a double bed w/a night stand attached to the wall, like a hostel, not hotel. It was also shabby (cracks, peeling wall paper, etc.) and the bed felt like a box spring w/a mattress topper (I'm pretty sure that's what it was actually). The air conditioner was so noisy, it would literally clang periodically. Bathroom was also tiny which was OK except for a bidet-total waste of space and disgustingly less than a foot away from the tiny sink-rather strange to even have one for US hotel. The next day we paid another $30 a day for an upgrade. I'm not giving them a 1 star as this room was great-large with a huge bathroom and much better maintained. Quiet air con-very comfortable, and we were glad we moved even with the extra cost. However, I also feel I need to ding them because I later actually spoke to a desk person and advised them that the petite room we had initially had was really unacceptable and they needed to attend to it. She said that she had had maintenance go check it out (the bed, air con, general I suppose) and they found nothing wrong with it. She explained that it was basically for business people traveling alone. (Who I guess are considered to be oblivious to their surroundings.) Although every one behind the desk was really nice, this interchange smacked of a bit of a snobby attitude. Personally, I think that every room in a hotel should be of a certain standard- I really think they should be ashamed to have any room in such poor condition. The location is great for sightseeing tourists. I lived in NYC many years ago so I was bothered by having to fight the craziness in Times Square whenever we went to the west side-tourists probably enjoy it though. I would consider staying there again-although I would have to compare prices given that we'd have to go with a more expensive room.

title: Ótima localização e quarto excelente
text: O hotel é novo e tudo é muito limpo. O quarto tem um tamanho bom e decoração excelente, apenas peguei um quarto com vista para o muro do prédio vizinho, porém é só deixar a cortina fechada que não me fez a menor diferença. O banheiro é grande e muito bom também. A localização do hotel é muito bom e bem central.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Reserve este hotel con tres meses de anticipación solicitando una habitación doble y cuando llegamos había una sola cama, pero la habitación si era grande y nos colocaron una cama pequeña adicional y como ya era bastante tarde al día siguiente nos cambiarían de habitación.
Fuimos cambiados a otra habitación más chica, con una sola cama queen y un sofá que servía como cama ( no era sofá cama) volví a reclamar y sólo me dijeron que lo sentían.  Estábamos mejor en la primera habitación que en la nueva que nos asignaron.
Las dos habitación muy limpias al igual que el baño, muy espacioso e iluminado.
Este hotel es muy bueno, muy bien ubicado y sino fuera por este inconveniente diría que es excelente.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Très bien situé à distance de marche de Times Square et des spectacles de Broadway. Chambre très petite mais relativement abordable considérant la proximité avec le coeur de la ville. Excellent service à la clientèle: nous  ont dédommagé d'un petit incident de plomberie en nous offrant une très grande chambre. 

Amenez-vous des bouchons d'oreille: On entend beaucoup, la climatisation ainsi que les compresseurs des autres même si on la ferme.

title: Superrumoroso
text: Hotel centrale, pulito, personale gentile, tutte le sere biscotti freschi in camera, doccia molto grande e confortevole, vista stanza una parete,  altra grande  pecca aria condizionata troppo rumorosa!!!!

title: Great Hotel
text: This is a great hotel and is near all the theatres. It is also minutes away from all the shopping areas.The only thing I would like to see is ice machines that you can avail of rather than having to call the main desk. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There are traxi's directly across the street which is very convenient when going to the airport. The hotel is very quiet. You can't hear a sound.

title: Ottimo Hotel eccetto il sistema dell' aria condizionata
text: Ho alloggiato in questo hotel per 4 notti. Non ho riscontrato problemi eccetto il rumore del sistema dell' aria condizionata che è molto vecchio e produce molto rumore. Personale molto disponibile e pronto ad aiutarti. Eccezionale la posizione la quale è strategica.

title: Great Experience!!!!
text: This hotel was above our expectations, the lication is great, you are near almost everything, the size of the room was good, not the small rooms you find in NY, but the nicest of this hotel is the service...All the staff is very nice and willing to help and they leave chocolate cookies every night at your room.

title: Нормальный отель
text: Отель действительно находится в нескольких минутах ходьбы от Таймс Сквер. В номере есть всё необходимое,в том числе и халаты. Отдельно хочется отметить размер ванной комнаты. Читая отзывы и выбирая отель, боялись, что номер будет ну очень маленьким. Да, номер небольшого размера, однако всё таки место для чемодана есть). Окна нет, но оно нам и не было нужно.   Единственный минус нашего пребывания - из за небольшого ветра случилась какая то поломка и в отеле 5 дней не было интернета и не работал телевизор. Списывают сумму с карты двойной проживанию, это было не совсем приятно, учитывая, что деньги вернулись не как было обещано (3-5 дней), а значительно позже.

title: Perfection Revisited
text:
City Club Hotel is a sweet little boutique hotel a couple blocks off of Times Square and tucked next door to the much more obvious Algonquin.  I I have to say, I would live here if I could make it happen without breaking the bank.  From the minute you walk in you are encased in an otherworldly calm from the streets of New York.  The low-lighting in the lobby and elevator help with this.  You just know that you will get a good night's rest when the time arrives, be that time 10 p.m. or rolling in sometime after sunrise.  

The room is really quite lovely.  As this is my second time, I thought perhaps I had imagined the greatness of the room seven years before when I came on business, but I was not mistaken.  It is spacious, has a small suite-style sitting area that (in my case) overlooked 44th street, a gorgeous dark marble bathroom with luxurious Bigelow bath product, a mini-bar stocked so well with snacks and beverages it was like Pandora's box, docking station, comfy king-sized bed, black-out shutters, a paper every morning, and the list goes on!!!

I almost don't want to go on because I'd rather keep this place a secret but then again, always give credit where credit is due.  From getting theater tickets, recommending places to eat, to obtaining transportation and making calls to friends so clients can feel like special guests at hard-to-get-into clubs, the front desk staff is stellar!  I am amazed by the level of customer service offered here. Housekeeping also does an amazing job cleaning up and being respectful of your sleep hours.

Lastly, the price is really reasonable for Gotham City and every night when you show up with aching feet, too many packages of cheap souvenirs, and the need to sleep off whatever your ailment, you find warm chocolate chip cookies for each guest waiting in your room.  I love you City Club.  I take this hotel, to have and to hold, forever and ever, until end-of-vacation do us part.

title: Great hotel in a great city
text: staying at the City Club Hotel was a wonderful experience. Located in the heart of New York Midtown, just a stone throw away from attractions like Times Square, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center or Moma. Arriving there I got an upgrade. Room was very stylish, a little dark, but very cosy, nice bathroom. Receptionists etc. very freindly. Price was around 150 USD which is a great deal for New York in that location. Totally recommended!!!

title: Nice But Expensive
text: We stayed here for one night on a girls getaway.  We had 3 rooms.  All of the rooms were clean, the furnishings were nice and the rooms were adequately sized.  But they were dark and the bathrooms were very small.  And the price tag was quite hefty, even for the Broadway district.  Not a great value, but a nice boutique hotel.

title: Pulizia e eleganza
text: Ottimo hotel per business trip nella grande mela. Lobby piccola, camere pulite e di giuste dimensioni. Letto con materasso comodo e doppio douvet. Posizione comoda, e nel complesso silenzioso. Bagno ampio doccia pulita. Servizio wi.fi di buona qualita. Climatizzatore leggermente rumoroso.Camera utilizzata 505

title: Great little hotel near Times Sq
text: My daughter & I stayed here for her first trip to NYC. She is hard to please! No complaints! Rooms are bigger than I expected. db Bistro Moderne in the hotel is very good.  I would definitely stay heree again.

title: Hotel excelente!!!!
text: Hotel com excelente localização. Os quartos são super confortaveis, limpos e espaçosos. Muito bons!!! Internet funciona bem e tudo muito limpo. Excelente equipe com prestatividade. Recomendo com certeza!!!!

title: Perfect
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights during May 2014. We originally booked a petite room, but the lovely young woman who booked us in upgraded us to a queen suite. It was absolutely beautiful, and though we only had a dark, somewhat dingy view of the back courtyard, this only ensured it was quiet during the night. We weren't there for the view, after all! The room was spacious and the bathroom was HUGE! Gorgeous bath and lovely toiletries, and the robes were very comfortable. The bed was comfy, the minibar had a great selection and the little touches like the umbrella and newspaper service was very cute. Not to mention the freshly baked cookies every day! They were delicious!

The staff were extremely friendly and polite (the same lovely woman who upgraded us complimented me on my hair and the flower accessory I was wearing, which was really sweet). 

Fabulous location too, only a short walk from Times Square. We turned on Good Morning America every morning, and if there were any cool celebrities then we dashed down to see them leave! We even saw Patrick Stewart and James McAvoy!

Definitely recommended, and we would stay again should we return to New York. Thanks, City Club!
