title: Bait and switch
text:
Be wary of the great reviews if you book through a hotel app.  I used a hotel app on my phone to book this at the last minute for a two night stay.  I booked based on the star rating, the reviews and the price.  Apparently the deal wasn't really a deal.  I opened the door to see a full size bed in a room half the size of my walk in closet. This room (on the 4th floor but apparently there is one on every floor) had an a/c unit that was so loud I might as well have been sleeping on the runway of JFK.  The wallpaper was stained, the ceiling was crumbling, the two foot opening that the hotel may call a window looks out onto a brick wall and the a/c seemed to have two setting: meat locker and suffocating. If this is four star,  the reviewer must have come out of a homeless shelter. 

Shame on the front desk for not giving us any warning when we arrived.  We most certainly would have upgraded or better yet, canceled given the choice but he claimed the only upgrade was $100 extra for a room with two full beds.  We didn't need two beds we wanted what you advertised not what you trick people into buying to fill your vacancies. Add the $100 to the advertised price and I would have stayed at a real four star.  I am disgusted at how we were treated.  When we were checking out and I questioned the validity of a four star rating, the front desk person sheepishly admitted they usually only recommend the room for one night.  I wish she had been there when I checked in.

title: Средний отель
text: Отель расположен в пешей доступности от всех центральных достопримечательностей. На этом его плюсы заканчиваются. Комната очень маленькая, без окон, как конура, и это 4 звезды?! Сильный шум вентиляции. Лучше жить на окраине Манхэтана и ездить на метро, чем останавливаться в этом отеле. Из плюсов могу отметить наличие тапочек и халатов в номере, свежую прессу утром кладут под дверь, вечером принесли, в качестве комплимента,  печенье- это приятно, но к сожалению, не сглаживает отрицательного впечатления от номера.

title: Fantastic stay in a fantastic hotel
text:
It was my first trip to NYC and I researched at length to find a hotel that was well located, provided the facilities that I was looking for at a reasonable price. I thought I had found something close when I booked City Club Hotel. I was wrong...City Club Hotel far EXCEEDED for expectations and made our 6 night stay very memorable. During our USA holiday we stayed in 25 different hotels and this one was by far the best.

The hotel is in a fantastic location, just a block and a half from Times Square. The staff were friendly and accommodating. They were happy to assist with all our enquiries. The room itself was not large but big enough to fir our 2 large suitcases, the bed was amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with quality toiletries provided. The towels were the largest I got in any USA hotel as well. My only negative comments on the bathrom would be that there was no space for personal toiletries and the shower flooded the floor everytime. Small negatives only. 

It was fantastic to have free, fast Wifi and the channel selection was terrific. I booked this hotel about 10 months in advance and secured a great price too...an added bonus.

When we return to NYC we will definitely stay at City Club Hotel again.

title: Awesome hotel!!! Must go here...
text:
This hotel is a Gem!  Stayed for 2 nights on a quick getaway to NYC with my husband & another couple. 
High end hotel and not too expensive, our rate was a good deal & booked direct with hotel. 
Great location and can walk to lots near by Times Sq, Broadway & all shopping/restaurants.
Really nice rooms, we had a suite which was really spacious/luxurious & our friends had a king which was also great.
Friendly, helpful & professional staff - always there if we needed anything, local knowledge, taxis, later checkout option!
Only 20 mins (in not too busy traffic) by taxi from La Guardia airport.
Didn't try the adjacent restaurant but had drinks in the bar, all looked good.
Of course, lots of restaurants nearby but we went to a Diner just a few doors down for a great breakfast, not too pricey and ok if you not need anything to fancy.
Definitely recommend a stay here and of course we will go back when we visit NYC again.
Enjoy!

title: A touch more would do the trick
text:
This was primarily a good experience.  The friendliness and service of the hotel staff well exceeded higher star establishments I stayed in recently.  They are faultless in that regard.

However, the room was ridiculously tiny.  There's nowhere to undress let alone open a case.  They did the best they could given the permanent wall structure of the room.  But a bit more in the right places would have gone a long way.  The wallpaper covering the cupboard/wallspace was totally worn out and needs urgent replacement.  It's weird how there's literally nothing behind the window.  Maybe you can do some sort of clever adhesive mural or something - anything - on those windows to trick the eye, maximize feeling of space and allow the blinds to actually be opened.  It also felt really dark in that little cave.  Even brighter wattage lights may help as the design of lighting was good fundamentally.  Maybe it's the color scheme, I can't say for sure, but the bathroom didn't have such a cramped feel as the room.  What about getting a moveable wall stand for the TV so it can be angled out in the right direction for viewing?  

Here's what they did right: having little books in the room to read, a random selection, this was unique and cool; wonderful staff; good cleaners and standards of cleanliness.

I think if this place was upgraded I'd give it a 4 or 4.5.  Unlike other places, the key fundamentals are in place so I really hope the hotel rethink just a couple of relatively inexpensive and small changes to help make this the little gem it could be - even in the tiny rooms.

title: Best hotel I've stayed at, ever.
text:
This trip was mainly a business trip (I was in NY for a convention over the weekend,) but I decided to bring my girlfriend along and take a few days before and after to vacation. 

We stayed in three different hotels (Night Hotel, Condor Hotel, and City Club) and this was the best BY FAR. In fact, this was the best hotel I've ever stayed in. 

As a note, this was also my second trip to New York and I've previously stayed at the Club Quarters in the financial district that trip.

We stayed in the duplex suite which is an extremely spacious, lofted two story suite with a small balcony. The couch on the bottom floor folds out to a comfortable queen bed and has it's own half bathroom and it's own big flat screen TV. 
Walk up the spiral staircase and the top floor has a king size bed with its own gigantic bathroom with an absolutely incredible marble tile shower. Once again with it's own huge flat screen TV. 

The high ceiling has molded Art Deco ornamental filigree designs that as an artist of the art nouveau style really made me happy and I couldn't help but stare at it when we were nestled in the comfortable cloud of a bed. 

The staff were absolutely amazing. We got there late at night after the last day of the convention. Check in was smooth, the guy helping us was so courteous and professional. When we got to our room, everything was setup the way I had asked them to (I had them make the couch into a bed since we were supposed to be a party of three,) and they even had cookies (which were absolutely amazing,) waiting for us on the bed with a breakfast menu in case we wanted breakfast delivered in the morning. 

The location was perfect too. Close enough to Times Square (a couple blocks,) but not too close because we all know it gets absolutely insane over there.

We stayed there 2 nights and it made me wish we had stayed there the entire trip. 
I now have no questions as to where to stay when in New York. 

Thank you to Irene and everyone at City Club Hotel for making it such an amazing memorable experience.  I'll be back

title: City Club Hotel - Good!
text: We booked our stay with airline reservations (hotel and air) and were going to by the reviews which were pretty favorable.  We were pleased (though initially a bit apprehensive since we asked to be away from the elevator as that was noted in previous reviews as something to request.) We were on the second floor and right next to the elevator. Sounded like there wasn't another option for the accommodations we needed.  Front desk assured us it wouldn't be a problem.  It really was fine...so that was a pleasant surprise/I had earplugs but the others said noise wasn't a problem.  Our first trip to NY so we didn't know what to expect. Staff was super friendly/professional; no lobby to speak of and "boutique" hotel is a good term to describe; kind of reminiscent of a 1940's and contemporary room decor. Nice bathroom though a suggestion would be some non-skid in the shower to avoid slipping.  Towel bar and counter/mirror must have been installed by a taller person as it's not for anyone on the shorter side.  Bed was a double and not very comfortable but we were so tired it was OK. We were there for 4 nights. We got cookies 2 of the nights...which were great. I think we got missed the other 2 nights. There were 3 of us in the hotel but we got two cookies. Also want to note the housekeeping service was amazing. Very kind/friendly.  The best part was the location.  Close to the theaters and Times Square. There were wooden shutters on the window above air conditioning unit and when folded open, we noticed black mold growing on the back side so we folded back shut but that really was our only complaint.

title: Not serious post service
text:
I will never return, i forget one thing in my room, i can remember when and where, i sent a lot of mails without response during one week (and nothing, any word or information!), finally i sent a mail talking about another thing and... Magical! My mail was answered in one hour.
Finally I call the hotel, they have not worried and they say "i dont have it", this service is shameful, i can remember perfectly where are my object, this hotel it not serious.

title: Beware!
text: Beware!  I booked this hotel for 4 nights for 2 adults and 2 children.  Upon arrival, we were told that the hotel was full and they could only give us a room with a Queen bed. We had no alternative at that point and were forced to stay.  Apparently, the City Club Hotel knows how to take a reservation but does not know how to keep a reservation.  If you are a family, I would stay away from this hotel.

title: Отдыхали в июне 2014
text: Оформление быстрое. Халаты,тапочки,чистая ванная. Будьте готовы: окна нет;блокируется сумма на карте 2 раза: один раз сумма блок, 2раз та же сумма оплачивается. Но локейшн-супер. На 1-3дня рекомендую.

title: Good place for business trips
text: I booked a room on very short notice for a business trip without having researched the hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised by the accommodation and staff.  The rooms were very clean and well serviced.  The restaurant downstairs was perfect for business meetings.  The location is very convenient.

title: Fabulous!
text: My partner and I booked a six night stay at the City Club Hotel for a recent holiday to NYC to celebrate his 50th birthday. Being a special occasion we decided to treat ourselves and so paid for an executive room. I cannot fault this hotel! The location was excellent, just a short walk to the Times Square area and all the sights around there. The room was excellent, really spacious and immaculately maintained. The bathroom was huge and very stylish in its décor, with very nice toiletries supplied and refreshed each day. The bed was very large and comfortable. House keeping were excellent. Every evening there were fresh baked cookies left in the room for us, which we thought was a really nice touch. Daily newspaper every morning. Large TV in the room. Complimentary Wi-Fi so we could use our I-Pad for internet. Reception staff were all very pleasant and helpful, and welcomed us back every time we returned to the hotel, and we really felt that nothing would have been too much trouble for them. Be aware that there is no 'business centre' in the hotel, so nowhere to print tickets or boarding passes yourself, but when we asked about this at reception they were only too happy to supply an e-mail address for the hotel so we could forward our boarding pass information. These were then printed and slid under our door for us the evening before we departed. No hotel bar which would have been nice, but then it's not as though NYC is short of bars! Very gorgeous-looking restaurant attached to the hotel next door, although we didn't actually eat there. Would thoroughly recommend this wonderful boutique hotel to anyone.

title: Small, boutique hotel
text: Perfectly located in midtown, tidy rooms, had a bidet and minibar, the diner next door is excellent, 2 blocks from the Newark airport express bus stop and pleasant staff.  The aircon was slightly noisy, that's my only negative. Overall, you can't beat the area for access up and down Manhattan.

title: Small hotel with nice touches
text:
There are lots of boutique hotels in NYC; they all start to blur after awhile. This one had some nice touches, and felt a bit less impersonal than the rest. It was slightly European in feel, and reminded me of a place that one might stumble on in, say, Milan: small, clean, efficient, stylish, and comfortable.

Though my room was in the back and on the small side (per the relatively inexpensive rate I was paying), it was fine for my needs. The bed/linens were excellent, the bathroom was huge (with nice plush robes), the TV had dozens of (free) channels, and there were good reading lights above the bed (never a given these days).  There were chocolate cookies on my bed at night, and a newspaper on my door in the morning. And the staff were nice and helpful.

44th St. between Fifth and Sixth Avenues isn't New York's most beautiful stretch, but it's extremely central. And if you're going to the theater, it's a much better location than staying right in the middle of Times Square, with all its commotion; you can be at any Broadway theater in 10 minutes.  

In short, I'd recommend this place, at least for a nice, relatively affordable weekend stay.

title: Central location is the only pre for this hotel
text: Arriving from the south were hospitality is in the genes, the first thing to happen in NYC is being ripped off by the taxi driver. The front desk was friendly and did their best to welcome us. We had booked a double room (as it was labeled on Hotels.com) The reception referred to it as a petite room, that was not very suited for two, but they were fully booked. But we could get a upgrade for 50 USD the next day. The room where tiny, there is no room to open your suitcases, you had to open them on the bed. The bed is small, i am 192cm and i had to sleep with my feats hanging out. And it was nearly impossible for two people to sleep side by side. This is a bit like false marketing in my point of view. The response from the front desk told me that this is a common thing, and it happens often. Since they where very fast in offering an paid upgrade. We stayed one night in the petite room, and then upgraded to larger room. The room we upgraded to was OK, but a bit worn. The room we had was on the 9.th floor, and there was a horrible noise from the ventilation system for the whole hotel. This hotel tries to be a upscale boutique hotel, and in some ways they are, in others there should be used more efforts to succeed. But there is one thing that can´t be beat, it is situated in the heart of Manhattan, only a few block from Times Square.

title: excelente!
text:
O hotel é novo, quarto ótimo, tudo muito limpo e a equipe fez a diferença. Em especial, quero destacar o carinho e a dedicação da Kelsey e da Danielle - me ajudaram muito, pois tive que fazer mais dois voos domésticos (chicago e detroit) durante o meu tempo lá, e foi tudo muito bem coordenado com auxilio delas.

Hotel excelente, localização otima, tanto para quem vai trabalhar como para quem vai para passear.

Eu que amo música, sou DJ, ter um vinyl na decoração do quarto foi um detalhe a mais.. Amei o hotel.

title: Nel cuore della grande mela
text:
Piacevole sorpresa! Arredato elegantemente con stile inizio secolo XX newyorkese ma con tutti i comfort, questo albergo situato in posizione strategica, sulla 44st tra la 5 e la 6 av è semplicemente delizioso! Pulitissimo, ricco di piccoli comfort e ...tranquillo. I contro.... Le stanze ai primi piani sono più rumorose e quelle con affaccio interno hanno il muro del palazzo vicino quindi conviene chiedere camere piano alto fronte strada. Lo consiglio, il
Migliore della zona! Ottimo  e da provare almeno una volta il ristorante dell'hotel

title: Terrific midtown hotel
text:
Really enjoyed my stay in this little hotel.  Comfortable beds, luxurious linens, nice room, super location.  Cookies in the room each evening, bath robes, lovely and helpful front desk staff, etc.  Reminds me of a small Sofitel.  

I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good hotel located close to theatre disctrict
text:
Went to NYC with my girlfriend and ended up staying at City Club and we were fairly impressed.  Chose a luxury Room with 1 queen bed.  Good location, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious.  Got free Wi-Fi in the room so that was good.  Other offers had us paying daily for that.  Glad we worked that out.  Stayed away from the elevator as mentioned in other reviews and noise was not an issue at all.

People at front desk were helpful.  The daily cookies were a nice treat.  Would have liked a little more storage space in the room for bags/clothes.  The closet is tucked into the wall and is very narrow.  The safe and minibar are both located inside.  Made it work, but a little more space would have been nice.  I guess that comes if you upgrade the room, but didn't want o break the bank.

All in all, a comfortable room in a great location and would stay there again.

title: Comfortable
text: I have stayed in several of the hotels on this block for business travel.  The room was small, but they are all small.  No lobby to speak of. This room was the most comfortable of the ones I have stayed in on this block.  Quiet and the bed was comfortable.  Everything in the room worked.  There weren't many usable plug ins available to keep things charged up.  The free wi-fi worked great for me while I was there.

title: Worried, however, pleasantly surprised
text: I go back and forth to NYC on biz fairly often. On this trip, the prices were high in NYC for my week there and I wanted to make sure to get a better deal than what my usual hotels were charging so arrangements were made for this hotel. I didn't really investigate until the day before I left home and was a little worried about the reviews this place had received. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was a fine size, I did ask for a room away from the elevators to ensure I didn't hear them running all night. That was no problem and I had a very quiet room. The windows did look out to a brick wall, but that was not an issue because I was just there to sleep. The room was clean, the staff were extremely accommodating and so very nice. The chocolate chip cookie was a nice treat. The bed a bit lumpy, but linens were high quality and overall was comfy. Location was perfect for me too.

title: Love the spacious bathroom
text:
One of the good hotel that is very close to the Times Sq.
Great service,clean bathroom,spacious.
We stay here for a week and we love the daily compliment cookies.
The only matter for us was the rooms are not sound-proof at all. You can clearly hear people steps and their conversations. It makes your stay super uncomfortable.

title: Gemütliches Hotel!
text:
Das Hotel ist klein aber fein. Die Lage perfekt! Das Zimmer war sauber und das Bett kuschlig :)
Die Aussicht nicht super aber das spielt in New York keine Rolle.
Wir waren super zufrieden und werden wieder dort buchen.

title: Средненький
text:
Прочитал много отзывов, мой наверное будет не лучшим. Мне отель не понравился, за эти деньги можно забронировать на порядок лучше (расположение/номер).
Номера оооочеь маленькие, ну вот прям зашел и лег на кровать сразу!
Расположение на мой взгляд не очень удачное. Один раз  в районе 28 и парк авеню жили там на много удобнее. 
Единственное, что сильно понравилось это косметические средства, редко бывают такого качества.

title: Boutique hotel with European Feel
text:
What a hidden gem! This hotel is sandwiched between two New York iconic hotels on west 44th street. The hotel location is perfect for businessmen due to its midtown location and outstanding for theatre goers thanks to its spot in the theatre district. We were there for the latter. No valet parking but the garage directly across the street is manned 24/7 and reasonably priced. When we checked in I had mistakenly chosen a room ("the petite room") with a full bed. The front desk kindly gave us a complimentary upgrade to queen without batting an eye. Now. This is a wonderful vintage building that has been re-vamped into a boutique hotel. While it's exterior is vintage New York, the interior is clean and modern favoring a more European design. With that in mind we found the rooms to be perfect for our purpose. It was on the smaller side but very well laid out with a fully stocked fridge and mini bar replete with snacks,sodas and plenty of alcohol for those who enjoy a pre-show cocktail or after dinner drink. The desk had plenty of room for working if one chooses to do so. Halls are a bit narrow much like small European hotels but very quiet despite the closeness to the street( we were on the second floor and heard NOTHING!) the bathroom was spacious and again well designed with marble and large walk-in shower. It had excellent water pressure and high end toiletries. One wall was floor to ceiling mirror and while it is frightening to be faced with full length images of me coming out of the shower, it is a classic design trick to make the space look larger and lighter. Successful on both counts. Staff was friendly, helpful and at the same time unobtrusive. A perfect combination in my opinion. Lovely to find two fresh chocolate chip cookies on our bed upon our return from the theatre. Speaking of the bed, the queen size bed was comfortably appointed with crisp sheets and duvet and plenty of pillows. The room was spotless. 
We were 1 block or so from Times Square and 2 from the theatre. A fun after-dinner treat was stopping for dessert at Sardi's! Known best for its collection of caricatures of the rich and famous. Restaurants abound in every price range. We did not try the bistro associated with the hotel but will save that for next time..... And there will be a next time!

title: Good option in Midtown Manhattan
text: Super location on 44th and 5th. We had the duplex room which was spacious by NY standards. Not much of an entrance lobby. I wasn't quite sure of the place when we got out of the elevator - ageing interior lobbies - we were very happy when we walked into the room though. Nicely appointed and spacious. Beware the walls are quite thin and you can hear all that's going on around you. It's located off 5th and 6th ave so not much road noise. Would stay here again.

title: Super hotel, staff and location. Thumbs up!
text: The hotel was very good located, it was just a short walk to Bryant Park and the Empire State. The hotelroom was very clean. The beds where compfy and you get a complementary cookie and newspaper every evening, thats great! The hotel doesen't have a restaurant, but there is a diner right next too the hotel!

title: Boutique hotel with perfect Midtown location
text: The location could not be better--in the heart of midtown, yet on a quiet street.  The rooms are very small and the bathrooms even smaller.  Fine for one person and a tight squeeze for two.  Beds are extremely comfortable.  Every night, there's a freshly baked cookie waiting for you - a nice touch.  Tiny lobby area. This hotel is a good choice if you will spend minimal time in your room amd don't need other hotel  amenities.

title: Rooms much nicer than you'd think!
text: The rooms are top notch, but the outside doesn't show it.perfect for business or romantic trips. Lobby is small and plain, no computer no coffee. Service is friendly but slow. View isn't great either you mught face a wall. But the rooms couldn't be newer and more elegant,  and I've never seen a nicer bathroom than this one. Close to macys, and fifth avenue and grand central.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
I stay in NYC about 2 times per month and always stay at the CC when I can. The staff is always accomodating and very, very nice. The rooms are well appointed, comfortable, and clean. It is a very small property which is nice - they staff actually recognizes me when I walk in the door! 

If I had any complaint it is simply that being a small hotel, street noise in some of the rooms at the front of the building can be a bit loud. Clearly not their fault and a problem with most smaller hotels in the Times Square area.

title: Great Boutique Hotel!!
text: I travel to New York, A LOT!!...so trust me when I tell you, this hotel is in a GREAT location!! Close to everything, and a close walk to subways for anything else!!  It doesn't have a GRAND entrance or huge lobby, but what it lacks in lobby, it makes up for in great customer service.  Very impressed from my initial phone calls to even a follow up query about my billing. We got an upgraded room for four people!! and the size was HUGE for NEW YORK!!..Love the use of the pocket door to the very spacious bathroom.  I will be staying here again for a girls weekend away!!

title: Perfect stay in a wonderful hotel
text: We were upgraded on arrival to a bigger room. Check in was super quick and easy. Friendly staff. Excellent location. Despite being central it was quiet and easy to sleep. Hotel is very tidy and the cookie everyday was a lovely treat to come back to. Would return!

title: good but
text: the hotel is in a wonderful location for theater and utilizing the excellent public transportation system of New York. The staff was welcoming and very friendly; We had reserved a small room - a catchy phrase describes it but think a small hotel room in Paris. The room was well appointed, the bed comfortable and the bathroom adequate to almost good but lacked a shaving mirror and really good lighting also there is a bidet which would be nice if the bathroom was large but acts as a hurdle to the toilet . Then we get to the real negatives: minimal space to store luggage, a closet which will not allow slacks to be hung by their cuffs - the length is too short and the worst - a light directly below the thermostat for the HVAC  - turn on the light and the bulb warms up the temp to 82 degrees F which then turns on the AC and freezes you out. Clearly the design was done by those of limited intelligence- retards but perhaps I am giving them credit too much credit. Would I like to stay here again - certainly not in the small room we had - perhaps others which are larger are better designed.

title: Goed hotel op, goede locatie
text: Na diverse beoordelingen te hebben gelezen, gekozen voor dit hotel. De ligging was perfect. We hadden de kleinste kamer geboekt maar kregen een gratis upgrade naar queen omdat we in New york mijn verjaardag kwamen vieren. Kamer was prima. Heerlijk bed, ruime badkamer met goede douche en heerlijke badproducten. 'S avonds lagen er chocolate chip koekjes klaar en 's ochtends een krant aan deur. Gratis WiFi. Personeel vriendelijk. Enige minpuntje lawaai van de airco maar die hadden we ook niet nodig. Dus uitgezet. Verder geen last van straat geluiden. Het ligt rustig.Kortom mede dankzij dit fijne hotel een top tijd in NY gehad.

title: Preferred by Vampires but good;-)
text: Very nice located midtown Manhattan Hotel. Clean, in a good shape, room hab been a bit small for two people. Offered with a double bed which is ok but not very comfortable. Minus for the room which had a window to the patio that it was necessary to close the curtain the whole time. Therefore after one day you start missing the daylight.

title: Loved this hotel
text: This hotel went way beyond my expectations. Book this hotel if you want a good standard hotel in an excellent location. Close to all the major sights and to the subway. Friendly staff. Had to wait 30minutes for my room at check in and so was upgraded!

title: perfecto!
text:
city club es un excelente hotel, éramos 5 y no hubo problemas, nos dieron un cuarto grande, dos camas de 2 plazas y una chica.
la ducha perfecta, todo muy limpio y bien arreglado, relacion precio calidad acorde. esta muy bien hubicado.el personal muy atento y cordial, nos guardaron las valijas 2 dias (ibamos a WDC solo con una mochila) a 5 USD por dia. 
a eso de las 17.00 hs te dejan en el cuarto una galletas dulces que son muy buenas.
todo ok con este hotel!

title: Very average hotel.  Watch out for the cots!
text: Good location...convenient to theater, shopping and museums. However, we requested a room to accommodate 4 people. Instead of providing two beds they provided a bumpy cot with springs digging into your back ....which must have been about 30 years old!

title: Working in the City
text: This quiet, friendly, deluxe hotel is perfect. The lobby is simply the entrance, the staff is courteous and competent.   The rooms are comfortable with the most comfortable beds, wonderful showers and extensive amenities.  The attached restaurant offers meals, and room service by Daniel Boulud DB Bistro Moderne Wow!!  Every subway line is a couple of blocks away.  Wi-Fi included.

title: Super emplacement!
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, à quelques pas de times square. Nous avons utilisé le stationnement en face de l'hôtel pour la somme de 35$ avec un crédit de l'hôtel.
À notre arrivée, nous avons demandé 2 lits doubles, nous avons dû payer 30$ d'extra, mais ça valait la peine, la chambre est beaucoup plus spacieuse. 
La chambre était très propre, rénové,  les lits ultra confortables et les jets de la douche super puissant. 
Je retournerais à cet hôtel sans hésiter.

title: No water for half a day, horrible customer service
text:
Horrible customer service. I was there for 3 nights, and on the last day, the water pipe has problems from 3 am in the morning at least. I asked for extension of my checkout and ask them to call me when they have an ETA when I can have a shower. Until 1 pm, no call, not even an courtesy update, no water. When asked about this, the junior customer rep blame the other for not contacting me and for not extending my pass for the late checkout (I couldn't get into my room!).
At the end, I had to have a shower in the gym nearby the hotel, haha, booked a four star hotel, only to have a shower in the gym?? what a joke.

title: Good service, super small rooms.
text:
This place is nice, good service, and clean rooms. 
That said, DONT get the rooms that are attached to the elevator. If you so happen to get these rooms, which theres one on every floor, you'll hear the elevator moving ALL NIGHT LONG.
You can even hear the bell "dink" once it hits the floors.
Besides that, the hot water was a bit spotty at best, they could make better use in the bathrooms and take the bidets out and include shelves for your toiletries. 
Staff was friendly and fast. 
Hotel was clean.

title: Comfortable base, close to the action
text: The City Club Hotel scored high points from my family for several reasons. Check-in was quick and simple. The room came just as promised -- we had two double beds and a sofa fixed up as a bed. The room was on the smaller side, but the hotel did a nice job of maximizing the space with a wall-mounted TV, a nearly hidden closet, and no bulky dressers. But they had some comfortable chairs and a marble-top table. The tile in the bathroom was very handsome, and they wisely used a mirror on one wall, floor-to-ceiling tile for the shower, and a clear shower curtain to make the bathroom seem even bigger. The location was easy walking distance to the theatre, Restaurant Row, the stores on Fifth Ave., Times Square and more, yet the street is relatively quiet (for NYC). One caution: Don't expect a lot of hotel amenities. The lobby is very small -- not much more than the check-in desk. But it was great for us. One last note: The room was very clean. It had had a high shelf with some books and decorative boxes, and I have to tell you that I fully expected to find dust when I pulled down one of the books. But the shelf and everything on it were spotless.

title: False Advertising
text: I reserved, through Hotels.com, a luxury room with a pillowtop King bed and Frette linens.  Upon arrival, I was told there was just one room left with a "King" bed.  As it turns out, the bed is not King at all.  It may be wide as a King but is strangely short in length. I am 5'10" and my feet hang over the bottom edge of the bed when sleeping.  And no pillowtop.  Just a regular mattress covered with a feather bed.  The linens are nothing special, the WiFi weak and forget about unpacking our clothes because there isn't any decent place to put them.  No dresser, just a few shelves tucked in the back of a small closet.  A daybed takes up a sizeable portion of the room, which we don't need at all since there is just two of us.  All in all, the City Club Hotel is a major disappointment.

title: Excellent property
text:
The property is quite fresh ... I suspect a makeover in the not too distant past.  I got upgraded.  Sometimes a later arrival can be a wonderful thing.  Great bathroom.  Bed was firm and outfitted with great sheets and comforter. Front desk staff were particularly helpful.  Further, all the staff were alert and friendly ... always a good thing.

I was a bit worried about noise at the location as it is in mid town, but I think I may have heard one siren all evening.  

Here's where I complain about how much things in NYC cost.  Someone get out the violins and play me a bit of sad music.

title: 場所は便利
text: タイムズスクエア―に近く観劇などされる方にとっては最高の立地です。小奇麗な小さめのホテルで無料のＷＩＦＩ、２階には自由に使えるパソコンやフリースペースもあります。しかしながら、私の泊まったプチルームと呼ばれている部屋はとても狭くデスクスペースもありませんし、日は全くあたりません。日が当たらないのは私にはきついことでした。また、バスタブやセーフティーボックスがある部屋は限定されているようでした。道路に面しているより広い部屋ではそのようなこともないそうですが、プチルームに泊まられる方は注意が必要かもしれません。ニューヨークは一般的にホテル代が高く時期により値幅が激しいようなので、値段が安いタイミングであれば良い選択かもしれません。

title: Good choice for the price
text: I have stayed here several times and always been pleased.  Location is great and rates are reasonable based on New York prices  (which are generally unreasonable). Rooms are adequate for the price. Love the bathroom.  Best shower.  Staff is helpful and friendly.   Hotel is very small with little by way of amenities.  No lobby to speak of.  Food and drinks at the hotel restaurant were very good.  There are much better hotels in NYC but be prepared to drop some coin.

title: great hotel
text:
Have stayed at this property a few times during my past stays in NYC.  Great location, friendly staff and very well appointed rooms.  Restaurant at the hotel is also very good.  Excellent salads and hanger steak cooked to perfection.  For the value and location, it's a great spot.
Especially like the turn down service with the warm "home made" cookie!
Would recommend as a great place to stay.

title: LOVED THIS PLACE
text: We booked the double queen with a daybed and got upgraded to the 2 level suite. Our kids were beside themselves, I had to keep explaining that this was not your typical NYC hotel room. It was the most amazing room, all of the extra details like chic chip cookies, really nice soaps, amazing bathrooms....really made it feel like a cool apartment. The location is amazing and perfect if you are trying to fit all of the usual NYC sights in. Quiet street, quiet room. I can't think of a single negative thing to improve upon. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC again.

title: Nice hotel, centrally located
text: Stayed for three nights, one adult and two teenagers. Ended up in a king room with a bench style twin. It's not a sofa bed and doesn't pull out. The size of the room was okay, typical for New York. We didn't feel claustrophobic, but we did have to maneuver around each other. The bathroom was very spacious and felt indulgent. Both the king and the sofa were comfortable. The room was clean. The tv cable was out most of the time. Front desk said they were working on it, but nothing changed while we were there. You're not in New York to watch tv but it's nice to get the local news, etc. Got to the hotel early and they held our bags with no problem. However, disappointing that our room wasn't ready until 4:30, but they didn't have late check out available for us. Held our bags again without problem. Turn down service with chocolate chip cookies and a daily newspaper were appreciated. Staff were always polite. The hotel is located midtown, in the theatre district, walking distance from Rockefeller Plaza and Times Square.

title: DO NOT STAY
text: My boyfriend and I stay at the city club this weekend. We stayed for 2 nights and split the cost, I did one night, he did the other. When we arrived the lady at the front desk put one night on my card and the second night on my boyfriends. There was also a 200$ security deposit, which was a surprise to me. Did not mention that when I called to make my reservation, so we split that too. The room was 383$ per night plus 100 for the security so 483 per night. When we arrived at our room we both checked our bank statement to make sure everything went the right way, and it did. I was charged $483 and he was also. The next morning we went down the street for breakfast, when we were done I gave the waitress my credit card and she came back saying it was declined. I started to panic because I knew I had money. I then checked on my bank statement and I had TWO charges for $483.00 at this point in time my account was withdrawn because I only brought a certain amount of money with me so I didn't spend to much. I then asked my boyfriend to check his bank statement and his 1 night which was $483 was BACK INTO HIS ACCOUNT. We then went right to the hotel and I explained the situation to the man at the front desk, which he wasn't very helpful at all. He had told us that it was a system fault because at the end of the night the system did not recognize that we were splitting the cost. Since I made the reservation my card number was the main one and the computer saw that my card was not charged enough for 2 nights and automatically charged me for the second night. The mam at the front desk still continued to not help me. Told me I had to call my bank. After being on hold for over 30 minutes with the bank I explained to her what had happened. She told me I needed them to fax overt information and what amount they needed to take off my card. After wasting about 2 hours with this, it was half way resolved. I am still waiting for my security deposit and the rest of my money to go back into my account. VERY UPSET AND VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. I do not recommend staying there because they just screw you over. To add to this the noise from outside was VERY VERY loud. Woke me up multiple times a night.

title: localização perfeita
text: hotel muito bom, quartos confortáveis, banheiro bom, a limpeza é muito boa. odos os dias no fim da tarde tem um cookie que é servido. pela manhã tem o jornal que é colocado na porta. perto de tudo, bares restaurantes, perto da Brodway. Os quartos não são grandes embora confortáveis.

title: Great stay
text: We recently stayed here and it was a great experience. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The room was lovely with an old world elegance combined with a modern vibe. We ordered coffee in the morning and the service was fabulous. It added some luxe to the start of our day.

title: Small room. Large impression
text:
I booked this hotel the night before the hubs and I went to NYC.  So we got a pretty good deal on it.  We opted for the queen luxe room instead of the standard 195 ft2 room, which I've read was too small to walk around.  

ROOM: Our room was cute.  Decent size.  Queen bed, sofa, closet, desk.  The bathroom was large and I agree with other reviewers that they probably could've made the bathroom a bit smaller in order to make more living space, especially if we were in the smaller room.  There was a bidet in the bathroom, which the hubs (of all people, loved).  It had 2 windows, but you looked directly into the next building.  We couldn't tell if it was cloudy or sunny outside.  

SERVICE: We arrived very early in the morning and our room was not ready, but we left our number with the receptionist who a few hours later, as we were at lunch, called us so we could check in earlier.  That was VERY nice.  They were extremely hospitable.  They left cookies on our bed each night as well as a card for room service and a weather report for the next day.  

LOCATION:  We took the subway from LGA to the hotel.  It was so easy to get there.  Their MTA is crowded but very efficient.  THe hotel is on a quiet street but only blocks from TSQ, which was great.  It was also near Grand Central Station, where we took a shuttle to the airport when we left for an early flight.  

Overall, we had a great experience and really enjoyed the hotel.  We would definitely stay there again in the future.

title: fantastisk hotel
text: beliggenheden er fin hvis man vil bo lige i midten ,hotellet  er super godt,vi var heldige at blive opgraderet til et helt skønt værelse i 2 etager .personalet var meget hjælpsomme vi vil  helt sikkert bo her igen

title: Nice stay
text:
The City Club is a perfectly located small hotel ... safe, quiet, and modernized.  I had a 'petite' room on the 9th floor.  The front desk gave me the option of upgrading to a larger room as I checked in, as the 'petite' room is very small.  But I was traveling alone, and I'd already read the Tripadvisor reviews of the petite room and knew it was snug but efficiently designed.

The only negatives about my room are the wallpaper, which is looking a bit tired, and the minimal shelf/storage space.  However, the bed was comfortable, linens were very good, the fixtures were all modern, and, most importantly when it's 9 degrees out, the hot water was plentiful and water pressure was superb.  Toiletries were also very nice.  And the stocked minibar is handy when you get the munchies.

Some reviewers have complained about thin walls ... I did hear occasional conversation in the hallway, but you can hear that at The W for a lot more money.  I never go to NYC without earplugs, and I didn't need mine.  

The hotel staff was extremely courteous and well trained.  When you check in, you affirm that you will not be partying or smoking during your stay.  Yay.

I was in town to see theatre, and the location of the City Club is simply perfect for that.  Also, there's a deli within steps of the hotel that's convenient for getting an inexpensive (really!) and delicious bite to eat.  

I would stay at the City Club again.  I did get an amazingly good rate on Expedia the weekend I was there, which might have been because it was the weekend before the Super Bowl and because the temps were extraordinarily low.

title: Хорошее расположение, но есть отели получше.
text: Отель обозначен как 4 звезды, но там не больше 3. Номера узкие и маленькие. Телевидение платное. Останавливались там только на ночь.  Расположение это единственный действительный плюс. За цену которую предлагает отель есть варианты получше.

title: Best overnight in NYC I've had while traveling...
text: Checked in on January 14th, 2014 after flying nonstop for close to 40 hours. I arrived to a smiling face at the front desk and was told that I was upgraded from the petite room to a standard with a king bed with a tub/shower combo. I was overjoyed! My room was on the 4th floor and faced the back of the building. It was very quiet. The room was a very nice size, it had a big flat screen tv, fully stocked hidden fridge with other goodies on shelves, umbrella, tons of hangars, desk, chair, a good sized marble bathroom with tons of towels, 2 plush robes and amenities by CO Bigelow. I was only staying the night but I unpacked anyway. What I forgot to mention is that turn down service was already done on the bed and to my surprise, a fresh, large chocolate chip cookie that put a big smile on my face. It was yummy! Within a half hour I was in a bed that felt like I was floating on clouds. The pillows were so soft. It felt great for this weary traveler. I slept wonderfully! The next morning I went out to grab a take out breakfast. I asked the ladies at the front desk if I could do a late check out so instead of 12 noon I was able to get 1 pm. I actually went back to sleep after eating. The shower pressure was great and adjustable. There was a blow dryer but there was no socket in the bathroom! LOL! So I plugged it in by the desk and it was all good. This is now going to be my go to hotel when I'm in NYC. The doormen, reception...everyone - they were all great, very friendly and it was a great change from staying at the usual "name brand" hotels. I highly recommend it!

title: Nice boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text:
The City Club indeed in a nice little surprise tucked away on W 44th St.  (Not a lot of signage--easy to miss.)  It is just a block or so away from the heart of the theatre district.  For me, it was a combination of location, price, and style.  I was looking for a good deal, which this wound up being for me, but also meant that it was probably one of the smallest rooms and did not have the spacious bathroom others mentioned and the view was into the air shaft (which was quiet though!).  Which was all fine; it was big enough for me, and who comes to the theater district to stay in the room?  I liked the atmosphere, and the staff at the hotel were all gracious and professional.  The other touches (nice toiletries, bathrobes for your stay, cookies on check-in) make it just that much nicer.  It's not the newest hotel, but my room was fine and the bed fairly comfortable. AND free wifi.  Now THAT will always win me over.  
The one thing it could use is a couple more outlets open for guest use in the room.

title: weekend getaway
text: It's a beautiful little hotel that I had booked based on the price and the 4 star reviews that was given on it.The location was very easy to get to. Its a staff were very helpful from front desk to turn down service. I would truly stay here again and definitely recommend it.

title: Like a nice apartment in the City--better than the usual hotel experience
text: This place really is a nice surprise in NYC, where even in "nice" places you can be easily disappointed. Smaller and more intimate than the usual hotels--this place sits in the old "club district" where clubs like the Harvard Club etc moved in in the late 1890s. City Club was a bi-partisan pols hang-out finished in 1904. Today the rooms have a fairly classy feeling--with lots of wood, historical lithos and very nice traditional bath fixtures. I've stayed several times and recommend the larger rooms (King and Queen)--you can find them on Amex in the travel section if you're trading miles. Also--the ladies will want a room with a bathtub which you need to request when you book. Big pluses incl very reasonable (35) validated parking directly across the street; warm cookies on check in; walk to Broadway theatres; and very good on-site restaurant (Daniel Boulud's DB Moderne) where I ordered a fab poached egg breakfast from room service.

title: Favorite New York City Hotel!
text: I have stayed at City Club Hotel on most NYC visits and LOVE it!  Fantastic service, small intimate and clear attention by the staff make for a perfect get-away in a fun busy city.  From the friendly approachable general manager to the hospitable and reliable guest services to the housekeeping staff.  Scented toiletries and the turndown service with a chocolate chip cookie make the stay. I can't think of a better hotel.  I plan to continue to use this as my first go-to hotel in the city.

title: Great Location and Nice Experience
text:
I just returned from a very quick business trip to NYC. Stayed at the City Club for one night only...wished I could have stayed a few extra nights. the location is outstanding for access to shopping on Fifth Ave, Radio City and Times Square. Anywhere else in NYC you need to get to is  less than a five minute walk to the subway station in Times Square. 
I reserved a standard room that had a full size bed and day lounge. My room was on the third floor and I did not notice any outside noise. . The bed and linen was very comfortable..the bathroom stylish and the shower had the hottest and best pressure I have experienced in NY. 
Returning from dinner I was greeted warmly by the front desk and in my room was a plate of delicious chocolate chip cookies. In the morning attached to my door was a small linen bag that held the daily newspaper..a nice touch.  The closet was a bit hard to notice in my room as the door is built into the wall next to the front door. The wall and door look pretty much the same. Plenty of room to hang clothes and in the closet is an iron and iron board along with a full size umbrella that can be used during your stay..however you are charged if the umbrella finds its way back home with you.
My room had two windows, both covered by the drawn curtain and neither with any view...which is fine by me...I don't book a room in NY for the view.
I was very pleased with finding this hotel and will definitely plan on staying here in the future.

title: Non soddisfatti....
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel tra Natale e Capodanno con mio marito e i ns. figli di 16 e 10 anni.
Abbiamo  scelto una King Deluxe Room al costo di 400 Euro a notte. Ho trovato la camera davvero piccola dotata di un unico  letto matrimoniale. I ragazzi sono stati rispettivamente sistemati su una brandina con ruote affiancata al letto matrimoniale e l'altro su un divano sottostante la finestra al punto che l'apertura delle imposte risultava davvero difficoltosa. L'armadio è  piccolissimo e ho dovuto sistemare molta biancheria sulla scrivania della camera.
E' chiaro che ci è stata assegnata una camera doppia facendola pagare per 4 persone!!
Avevamo scelto questo hotel anche perché dotato di Wii-Fi in tutta la struttura.... peccato che su 5 giorni di soggiorno, solo l'ultimo ha funzionato così come la TV.
La spiegazione che ci è stata data è stata quella di un guasto in tutto il quartiere dovuto all'usura dei cavi elettrici. E così siamo rimasti per tutto il soggiorno senza Wii.fi e TV!!
L'hotel è abbastanza datato, il bagno è piccolo e senza aerazione. Le camere vengono riassettate solo la mattina e gli accappatoi cambiati solo a fine soggiorno.
L'unico vero vantaggio di questo hotel è la posizione vicinissimo a Times Square e Bryant Park.
Per il resto non lo consiglierei

title: Excellent night in the city!
text: We booked this hotel last minute as a stopping point en route to JFK airport. We got a great deal from Hotels.com and the location was perfect as it was just a block from where our bus dropped us off. We arrived at about 10pm and were greeted by a friendly doorman and front desk agents who checked us in quickly and were able to answer questions about airport transportation. Our room was on the ninth floor, and upon getting in the elevator, we noticed the 9th floor button was added on after the elevator was built, which made us feel a little uneasy. However, when we got to our room, we were very pleasantly surprised! The room was small, but made good use of the space available. The double bed was comfortable and had a plate of chocolate chip cookies sitting on the pillow when we arrived. The room was very clean! The bathroom was very spacious and had a huge marble shower, two bathrobes for our use, and a bidet. We left for the airport early in the morning so didn't have the chance to try the bistro on the first floor. We would definitely stay here again! Very unassuming from the street, but exceeded our expectations! It is in a great location - only a short walk from times square and next to a few other boutique hotels such as the Royalton.

title: Great little hotel, easy on the budget
text:
I booked this the same day as arrival through hotels.com. Got incredible deal of under $150 - the location is on a little side street (44th) around the corner from the mayhem of Broadway and Times Sq. Arriving on a Friday night after a snowstorm, I was able to get street parking across the street from the hotel for $3.50 an hour while I checked in with my little dog. (After 6 I was able to park for free overnight) They were very welcoming of my well-behaved pup which I appreciated. Check-in so easy, the lobby is tiny and check in counter the size of a drive-through (not a bad thing). The hotel seemed like a small classic old-style broadway hotel, yet with several nice touches, updates, and finishes. Nice service as well.
The room was small and faced the "courtyard"/alley. I kept the windows covered the whole time so no biggie. There was no view out the front anyway.
Double bed was comfy, and linen was crisp and clean. Nice feather comforter. Bathroom was HUGE, but simple. Nice toiletries. I thought they did a good job with the layout of the room. It had a nice little settee space built in to the wall, that looked like it could also double as a twin sleeping space. Also there was a nice desk area that I was able to comfortably do some work.
The restaurant downstairs ambiance looked good but I did not try it. I did though stop into The Red Flame diner a few doors down from the hotel at the corner of 6th Ave for a late night snack after seeing "700 Sundays".
The next day I took a meander into the Diamond District on the 5th Ave side of the hotel and up a few blocks. After check out I was able to remote start my car from the lobby and when ready, drove off to do some business in SOHO.
Overall I found this to be a cute little place if you need to be in midtown. I generally like to stay in the less touristy places like the meatpacking district or Soho to get away from the mania of mid-town, but this place was intimate enough to make me feel like I was in a quaint neighborhood.
I have no idea what subways are nearby, but I'm pretty sure they are close by.
There are some other hotels on this street as well, but I would absolutely stay here again as long as I needed to be in mid-town and the price was right.

title: A little gem
text: Likely the best linen in New York and a great bed complete with a feather bed, huge and gorgeous bathroom, exceptional decor.  Very accommodating, friendly and helpful staff and a great location.  The air shaft view was a totally reasonable trade-off for the price.  Didn't sample the dining room's top-rated food but maybe next time!

title: Tired and disappointing
text: Location and responsive staff cannot make up for everything. Our, to be expected, small room smelt as if it was located in the kitchen. Helpful staff moved us to a tired one a long way away with just one side table, no real workspace and a cracked sink with a non functioned stopper - wasted lots of water just to shave. At least the reputed restaurant would would make up for it. Not to be. The excellent service could not make up for food that was both tepid and tasteless. All together this was a disappointing experience.

title: City Club Hotel
text: Nuestra experiencia con el hotel no fue buena pero por un problema personal, eramos cuatro personas y nos dieron una habitación de dos... La verdad es que su capacidad para resolver problemas es bastante limitadita y no había nadie que hablara algo de español. Dejando este conflicto de lado y siendo objetiva diré que el hotel está muy bien, el baño es muy amplio y moderno y la habitación está bien, con la cama muy comoda y el genial detalle de que te dejan dos galletas cada día. La situación es ideal porque está en el centro sin estar en una calle abarrotada y con mucho trafico, está cerca de todo y al lado hay un parque muy bonito. El restaurante es francés, no estuve personalmente pero parece caro. No cogimos desayuno y la verdad es que para desayunar por ahí no había ningún problema, hay mil cafés. Cuando vuelva a la ciudad este hotel será una opción en la que volver a hospedarme porque a pesar de la mala experiencia que tuvimos, en situaciones normales el hotel está muy bien.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, and EASY experience!
text: We stayed at the City Club Hotel on Nov 22nd 2013 and had a truly great experience. The location is around the corner from Times Square, and down the street from a large selection of broadway plays. The rooms are on the smaller size, but VERY clean, large windows, large tv, and large bathroom (what more do you really need). They stored our bags for us the next day after checking out. There is accessible parking across the street, which they will stop traffic to help you get into the parking garage. They will bring you a warm cookie around 5PM. All around it was a great experience for our first time to New York. I would return and stay at this hotel anytime.

title: Good hotel, brilliant position, friendly staff in New York
text:
We stayed at the City Club Hotel in New York for 5 days in November on business.

The Good - 
- The location is brilliant between 5th Avenue and Avenue of the Americas, about 5 minutes from Times Square but on a really quiet street. You are in the thick of things without the chaos.
- Once we spent the $50 per night and upgraded our room to a street facing king luxe room on the 6th floor, it was a really nicely decorated and comfortable room with good amenities.
- The freshly baked turn-down choc-chip cookies are awesome!!!!!
- The staff were generally pretty friendly and the experience was good.
- Like many of the other reviews have mentioned, the Red flame Diner is a favourite and so is coffee from Gregory's across the road.

The not so good - 
- We booked a queen luxe room and were given a room with a window that overlooked a wall about a meter away. Whilst the room was reasonably pleasant, it was extremely dark and miserable. We had a lot of work to do whilst we were there and being in a dark hole was a problem.
- There is nowhere to really put your bags without cluttering the room
- There is nowhere to sit in the hotel aside from your room.
- There is no coffee station in your room which is unusual for a 4 star hotel.
- They hang the towels and face cloths on a rail above the toilet. We lost two face cloths to the toilet. They should consider putting the face cloths directly on the rail and not on top of the hand towels.
- The windows do not seal too well so the room gets pretty cold at night. We tried to put on the heating but it is extremely noisy
- Finally, the rooms whilst being attractively decorated, are starting to show wear and tear with the wallpaper coming off the walls and the linoleum on the bathroom floor starting to bubble.

All in all, the hotel was definitely worth staying at. It is reasonably priced for what you get and the position is superb.

title: Great Location
text: There were 5 of us stayed here and none of us could complain. Having never been to New York we sure were happy with the location. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and talked us through the subway systems (which can be really tricky!) and gave us maps of how to get to the stations. Didn't take long to realise we were within walking distance of tourist attractions such as Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Fifth Avenue, and many, many others! The rooms were really nice and to a high standard, and even with all of our suitcases and shopping (imagine 5 girls) there was still plenty of room. The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in! Highly recommend this place and would definitly stay again!

title: A great location
text:
We stayed as a family of 5 in one room.
No problem with bedroom at all, beds very comfortable. Probably would be a bit claustrophobic if hanging around the room too long, but we were only there for 3 days and were out and about most of that time.  If you like hanging around your hotel this may not be the place for you as facilities are rather limited. Found staff to be very helpful and it is in an excellent location as others have described. On a side note first time in new york and thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Great Location and most comfortable beds
text: My husband and I stayed here last week for 9 nights.  The location is great, only a short 2-5 min walk to Times Square, and the same to 5th avenue.  Only a 10-15 minute walk to central park. The beds are amazing, very comfortable, nice bathroom with hairdryer, beautiful shampoo/conditioner/body lotion.  Each afternoon they deliver 2 warm, freshly baked choc chip cookies to your room.  Delicious.  Its a small Hotel, very quaint, welcoming and clean.  Staff were friendly and very helpful. It has a beautiful restaurant attached to it.   There is the "Flame diner" a couple of doors down and a beautiful restaurant a few doors up called "Kellari".  Is ideal for couples, a lovely romantic getaway.

title: A good choice off Times Square
text:
City Club Hotel is located on a wonderful block of 44th St.--its neighbors include the Sofitel, the Algonquin, the Iroquois, some university clubs, and other small boutique hotels.  It is well located relative to Fifth Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, and the Theatre District.  I stay at City Club frequently when I'm in Manhattan on business and need to be in midtown.
Overall, the hotel is, as other guests have noted, clean, friendly, and pretty well run.  The rooms are fairly large for Manhattan.  I stopped staying at CC when the on-premises restaurant, db Bistro Moderne, was about to undergo renovation and started slipping badly (this is important to me because I often need to entertain clients and it is most convenient to do so at the hotel restaurant).  I tried CC again on a recent trip and also ate at the remodeled restaurant (posting that review shortly).  Overall, the experience was pretty good, although I noticed on this trip that the hotel, which seemed chic and well-appointed a few years ago, is now showing some wear and tear.  Also, I was reminded that the front desk resembles a teller's window in a bank, which means that you may have to wait when checking in or seeking help.  For example, on this trip I stood in line for some time behind another guest who was getting information, even though there were three front desk staff standing behind the counter.
For the reasons above, I always look for alternatives but keep coming back to City Club because the value is very good at the price point, and the location is unbeatable.
If you decide to stay there, check out the pre-theatre menus at the Algonquin, which does a nice dinner for the price and has a wonderful history and atmosphere.

title: Guest oriented, clean, helpful, friendly, best location.
text: Concierge went above and beyond. Stored our luggage without hassle before check in and after check out.  Friendly, helpful staff with the info you need to get around and see the sights. Clean, modern, updated rooms. Great location close to Times Square but minus the noise and confusion. Liked the complimentary newspaper and the delicious cookies delivered with turn down service.  Linens never ran low and enjoyed the robes.  We stayed in a Queen luxe.  Lovely chocolate granite bathroom and waterfall shower.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Central Location and Clean
text: Stayed on a Friday night and received a free upgrade.  Staff was very pleasant and it was quiet. The bed was clean and bathroom was a nice size for NYC. Liked the complimentary NY Times and overall a terrific experience.

title: luci e ombre
text:
diciamo che la cosa ottima di questo hotel è la posizione , a due passi dalla 5th Avenue e da Times Sq.  Per quanto riguarda poi l'hotel in se devo dire che le camere standard e quelle queen (che avevo prenotato) danno tutte verso l'interno , quindi finestre "murate" e rumore continuo dei condizionatori. dopo la prima notte insonne ho chiesto di cambiare stanza e mi hanno detto che potevano mettermi sempre in una queen a un piano più alto con (forse) meno rumore oppure pagando la differenza in una king room che da sulla strada con bella finestra. ho preso la king e devo dire che questa è tutt'altra cosa (anche se da qui si sente un po' di rumore di strada) .
la camera è bella grande e il bagno altrettanto . tutto ben arredato e pulito.
la colazione non è inclusa nel prezzo . si può fare nel ristorante annesso al hotel. ristorante molto bello e direi ottimo sia per colazione che per eventuale cena.
la hall praticamente non esiste essendo solo un corridoio davanti al desk.

tutto sommato comunque bel hotel , a patto di prendere la king room . attenti al prezzo però perché in certi periodi è abbastanza alto . a quel punto è bene fare tutte le valutazioni del caso.

title: Very pleasant stay
text:
My husband and I really enjoyed our recent stay at City Club Hotel. For the dates we were looking for this hotel was at the cheaper end of the scale (for NYC) for a central location and we were very impressed.
Room; We booked a petite room but received a complimentary upgrade on arrival to a Queen Luxe, this room was still on the small side but very comfortable with all the essentials we expected (i.e. basic toiletries, TV, iron, hairdryer, iPod docking station) and a gorgeous bathroom with a huge shower! Location; Perfect - very close to Times Square but did not suffer from noise. 
Staff: were helpful and gave us a complimentary extended check-out time. 
Amenities; Hotel offers very little in the way of amenities, but you're in NYC so doesn't really matter in my opinion! Excellent diner (Red Flame) a few doors down street, highly recommend esp for breakfast. Also recommend Un Deux Trois Cafe for dinner. Slightly disappointed that City Clubs website states complimentary membership to New York Sports Club however, we were informed it would cost $20 as we'd booked through lastminute. 
I would definitely stay again....if only for the delicious cookies which were delivered to us each evening!!

title: Great bi-level suites for families
text: It's really hard to find a large enough space, with two bathrooms at a decent hotel in NYC. This is " the" place-and it is incredibly priced ( please anyone who thinks their suite price is high please compare to two bed/two bath room at any 4 star hotel in NYC ). They have several bi level suites, which offer privacy and two bathrooms ( only upstairs one is full bath). My daughter thinks the winding staircase ( not good for toddlers) leading up is amazing and the very hip decor is perfect for a NYC visit. They even supply you with a fully loaded iPod and Dock to listen to music. Great service, one of NYC best bistro is on main level adjacent to hotel, tons of space ( one of the largest suites I've had in NYC ) and it's right off Time Square. A gem, almost hated to disclose the secret of the suite in fear of it being sold out next time we go.

title: A bit pricey, but worth the location
text: We stayed here for four nights to celebrate my birthday. We booked  a king size bed and received a room with that, plus a day bed. We really did not use the day bed for anything more than piling our stuff on it, so it wasnt a useful feature for us. If you enjoy a lobby as a place to hang out, this hotel has no lobby. We were a bit worried when we checked in, as you walk in to a tiny vestibule area with a tiny "front desk". The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, providing recommendations and directions. Our room was on the eighth floor, facing 44th street. As with everything in New York, right across the street are other building with full views of whatever is going on inside. Our room had rudimentary shutters, not drapes, to block out light, provide privacy and probably to protect against the cold in winter. The windows are old single pane glass, and even though the days were warmer for October, we could feel the chill due to the old windows. The room was a bit tired re decor, and wallpaper needs replacing, but arent they all? There are no bureaus, just bedside tabes with drawers, which is where we stored extra clothes. Flat screen TV mounted on the wall. Lots of lights, and the bathroom, though small had a huge shower, with awesome water pressure.  The bed. Sigh. Why hotels do not realize that beds are THE priority is beyond me. Ours was an older mattress with a down pillow topper. No elastic bands to keep it in place, so it slid way down during the night. My husband spent the whole weekend hauling it back in place in the middle of the night. So, sleep was just OK due to quality of bed. Even though we were directly across from the elevator, the hotel only has 44 rooms, so the elevator noise wasnt constant. The main reason I would recommend this hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Just 5 minutes from Times Square, 5th Avenue and all that Manhattan has to offer. A twenty minute walk to Central Park. There is a diner down the block called The Red Flame, a strange name for a basic diner, but the food is amazing! Big servings, quality ingredients and friendly staff. We ate breakfast there every day, but it is super busy so be prepared to wait. So, I would recommend this hotel simply due to location. While there were lots of other hotels on the block, I am sure they were more expensive, with bigger lobbies, etc., but for the amount of time you spend in your room, save some money and stay here. Oh, and the chocolate chip cookies provided each night for turn down service are wonderful and a lovely touch.

title: Excelente!
text: Excelente hotel! Quarto amplo, muito bem arrumado diariamente. Recepção gentil. Excelente localização, pertinho da Grand Central e da Times Square. Pela manhã, o New York Times estava na porta; à tardinha, cookies de chocolate em cima da cama. Como é um hotel pequeno, os elevadores estão sempre à disposição, você não vê outros hóspedes, parece que o hotel é só seu.

title: tiny, tidy, quiet, well located
text: I joined family in NYC on a busy weekend; hotel prices were higher than usual and I opted for something on the lower end of the price scale. City Club proved a good value. Nothing pretentious about it; the lobby is so small it barely exists, two pleasant people staff the miniature front desk. I chose a Petite room, which lives up to its name - very small, but still comfortable. The hotel restaurant had been closed, and was just reopening, so only a continental breakfast was available. Moreover, coffee was only available as part of the continental breakfast, and since coffee was all I wanted, I had to leave the hotel to truly awaken in the morning. I trust that has been remedied by now. I had some trouble with TMobile coverage in the room, but that is certainly not the hotel's fault.  All in all I was quite satisfied.

title: Feel good hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel couple of years ago and we are counting on going back again this year.
Wonderful hotel, very well situated.And stuff is great, pleasant, helpfull, discreet.
Decoration is so tastefull with very good ideas.
The only negative point I would say is the price.

title: Amazing stay
text: This hotel is perfectly situated in NYC.  The hotel is very well appointed and the evening cookies are a bonus!  I appreciated the attention to detail and crae provided by their staff!  Wish the restaurant was open, but they made up by bringing my favorite madeleine cookies up when I checked in:)  Will definitely come back!

title: "Great boutique hotel, awesome midtown location"
text:
I have stayed here many times for work trips, and it's always my favorite place to stay. The location is fantastic. It has easy access to anywhere in Manhattan, close to the hustle and bustle, but far enough away to not be bothered by it. The hotel has a very cozy feel, quiet and comfortable. The rooms are decorated with beautiful dark wood and warm, wall sconces. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are almost spa-like. 

The staff has always been very friendly, and this time was no exception. The hotel doesn't have tons of amenities, but it's charm, location and comfort more than make up for it.

Make this your hotel if you are planning a trip to NYC.

title: Perfect Hotel
text: Very nice hotel - great location, good rooms (much larger than at some other fancier Hotels in Paris I stayed at). Staff is fantastic - accommodating, friendly, helpful... I would strongly recommend it everyone!

title: Perfect
text:
It was the most perfect place to stay.  Right in the middle of my two fave places, Grand Central Station and Times Square.  Myself and five of my friends had comfy beds, friendly Customer Service, tasty cookies and I got myself a copy of The New York Times.

It was the most convenient place to stay, we got to do lots of shopping then come home to a clean and fresh room to relax then hit the streets again.  Would definately stay there again. 

Thank you to the Hotel Staff for their professional, friendly and very helpful Service.  You made our New York holiday memorable.

title: Fez a diferença! Ótimo!
text: Entrada e áreas comuns despretensiosas, mas totalmente compensadas com a gentileza, presteza e simpatia dos funcionários (todos, sem exceção), com a excelente localização (entre a Time Square e o Grand Central Terminal), a privacidade, as acomodações (confortáveis e espaçosas), o wi-fi gratuito nos quartos, a ducha maravilhosa, a TV, as toalhas e roupões sempre confortáveis e limpos, a limpeza e a arrumação diária do quarto, o "The New York Times" sempre te esperando na porta, e, não podemos esquecer, dos cookies no final da tarde. Resumindo: o City Club contribuiu bastante para que nossa estada em NYC fosse extremamente agradável.

title: Great one night stay with my son
text: My 7 year old and O had an impromptu stay in NYC. Location was excellent, walking distance to Times Square, close to subways. Seems like a safe area around other hotels. The room was very comfortable for a stay with a child. My son (me too!!) loves the huge tub for bath time. The hotel was very quiet and relaxing. We had a great stay.

title: Excellent home from home!
text: This hotel was just perfect, a haven away from the bustle of NYC and yet right in the heart of things, brilliant location. The room was ultra modern and clean, the bed was the comfiest I've ever slept on! The staff were very welcoming and friendly. We stayed here for 5 nights and were very sorry to leave. The cookies they deliver to your room at around 6pm are such a nice touch, we were rarely there to recieve them but they were left on our bed for us to come back to. There was no view from our room but this really was not a problem, we were out sightseeing all day and just needed a comfortable place to relax. We will stay here again.

title: Location, appointments, convenience!
text: We spent a night here over Labor Day weekend.  4 of us shared the "family suite" on the 5th floor which privatizes 2 rooms.  Very clean and modern.  One room had a queen and day bed along with a huge bathroom that included a bidet and an enormous shower. The other room had a king and a day bed and another huge bathroom with a large shower/tub combo.  The room didn't have any view to speak of, but that was a nice help in the morning when the rooms stayed dark for sleeping in after a late night out.  We were able to park right across the street in the Hippodrome garage which was one of the nicest and cleanest parking garages I've ever scene.  I've never driven into or parked in NYC before so I was worried about security of the car before I went.  My worries were put the rest when I saw a $300K Ferrari parked a few spots down.  The overnight parking was only $35 with a hotel stamp... what a deal.  2 minute walk to Times Square, 15 minute cab ride to Battery Park, courteous staff.  We'd go back for sure.

title: Localização maravilhosa, hotel perfeito!!!
text: O city club hotel, ao contrário de vários hotéis que conheço, não tem uma fachada imponente, muito menos um hall que chama atenção. Mas quando se entra nos quartos, é realmente uma surpresa extremamente gratificante. Os quartos são amplos, arejados, limpos e extremamente confortáveis. O banheiro também é maravilhoso. A cama é confortável e os biscoitos servidos no final da tarde são deliciosos. O atendimento é muito bom, todos os funcionários são muito receptivos, simpáticos e pacientes, o que faz toda a diferença para quem não tem domínio de outro idioma. Agora, o melhor deste hotel é a localização, próximo ao melhor ponto da Broadway, ao lado de um delicioso restaurante, padaria e farmácia. A poucos passos, já estamos nos melhores pontos turísticos de NYC. Além de ser muito seguro.. Uma experiência maravilhosa!!!

title: Family of 5 Gem in NYC!
text:
Just arrived home after a long weekend getaway with my family and can't say enough about this little hotel.  Location was prime (5 min walk to Times square, steps from 5th avenue and Broadway, 5 mins to Rockefeller Plaza.  Traveling with 3 kids in general is never easy and I really wasn't expecting much from this NYC hotel but I was pleasantly surprised.  The room was big by New York standards (we had the Double, Double Luxe) and the day bed was perfect - big enough for a teen!  Beds were very comfortable too.
Yes, the lobby was small and there isn't a place to "hang out" there but who needs that when the Big Apple is at your doorstep.  
Staff was extremely friendly and even found us a really good deal on a car back to the airport.  Highly recommend for families or couples alike.

title: Lo risceglierei
text: Hotel in posizione strategica per girare e molto molto carino. Camera spaziosa, letto king, sofà e tavolino sotto le finestre... Tipico ! Bagno grandicello corredato da biancheria Frette. Non male. Sfizioso rientrare in camera nel tardo pomeriggio e trovare cookies appena sfornati sul letto! Quelle piccole cose cheti fanno sentire coccolata fuori casa.... Una nota negativa per me ha rappresentato il fatto che all'arrivo abbiano trattenuto una cifra esageratissssima come cauzione, dalla mia carta di credito!! Non lo trovo giusto e per giunta se fossi stata da sola e magari con quel l'unica carta a disposizione, avrei incontrato difficoltà nel fare spese durante il mio soggiorno! Qs non mi è piaciuto ma per tutto il resto l'hotel ci ha soddisfatti in pieno.

title: Fulfills all major tests.
text: As far as location, price, cleanliness and service go, this is a very decent property.  While there's nothing extraordinary about it, it fulfills all the major "tests" and works well as a locale for both the business and pleasure traveler.  NYC obviously offers better, but you'd be hard-pressed to find it at this price.  One note... the view of the back courtyard is very humorous in a "Manhattan-view" kind of way (pic attached).  Ask for a 44th Street view to avoid this.

title: Great Location
text:
I went last September and as I prepare to return to NY I thought I'd give this quirky hotel a review. 
First off the location is fabulous, especially if you enjoy broadway. The hotel room was nice, view was lacking but tbh I would take the location over a view.
