Wifi was spotty but at least complimentary. Food was good. 

Impressed. Very boutiquey.

title: Nice Hote with a Great location
text: Great Hotel and great Front Desk staff!. I booked my room via Hotels.com, and had zero problems.  I did arrive early so my room was not ready (I arrived at 11AM). The Hotel staff took my luggage and held it for me while I went to the Financial District. Upon my return, I did check into my room.  Is there a view with the room - nope, but face it, I got back late at night and basically slept. I wanted a nice quite and darkened room with a comfortable bed- which is what I had. For being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of things,,the room was INCREDIBLY quiet.  The room was certainly not huge but was well layed out. The bed was incredibly comfortable with high end bedding.The room was on very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was surprisingly large. I would definely stay at the hotel again.   Thanks!

title: A little gem in New York
text:
What a little gen this hotel is.. It is a modern hotel, clean comfortable and very nicely decorated. The staff were really friendly and helpful and it is located within 5 min walk to broadway. I booked one of the small rooms and yes the room is small, but very well appointed and has everything you need. Not a good room if you needed to work as you would have to sit on the bed to work. But for a short trip the small rooms are great value.

Great, staff, great location and very modern and clean is how I sum this hotel up.

title: Deluxe hotel!
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, and the service was excellent throughout my stay. The small hotel is located just 5 minutes walk to Broadway and 5th avenue, so just perfect for you shopaholics!
The rooms are furnished in a contemporary style, with a huge bathroom and everything a **** hotel should provide you with (Free WIFI, TV, magazines, bath accessoriesm, welcome gift etc.) 
It contains only 9 storeys, so those who suffer from vertigo will feel secure as well ;)
Only complaint I can express was that the hallway somehow always smelled of fish, which was a little off- putting when just returning from a lobster restaurant!

title: Fantastic Position
text:
Location: City Club Hotel was positioned well.  5 minute walk to Times square, 1 minute to 5th Ave, 10 minute walk to Central Park.  Mid town is a very pretty part of New York. 

Accommodation: We had 2 adults/3 children staying in a luxe double/double and it accommodated us well.  (we were only there to sleep) we were out all day/night .... the city that never sleeps!  Beds were comfortable, bathroom was clean. 

Other:  Street noise was minimal.  Lobby was small.

I had researched plenty of hotels and reviews and changed SO many times but in the end I was happy with my choice to stay at City Club Hotel for 3 nights.  As we were there for only a short time I didn't require a kitchen and didn't want to waste time catching subways etc to get to destinations.  Easily walked off the yummy food that was consumed and loved admiring all the pretty buildings!

title: Excelente
text: Mais do que um hotel, uma experiência. Ha muito conforto, exclusividade e privacidade. Praticamente nao se encontra com os outros hospedes e o elevador esta sempre no térreo te esperando. Pra completar, depois de um cansativo dia de passeio, ha cookies caseiros te esperando! Procurando fora da alta temporada, pode-se encontrar tarifas bastante competitivas

title: Firts New York Vacation
text: This was our first visit to NYC so I did some research before booking our hotel and activities. After reading the reviews of the hotel we decided to book it with Priceline (what a mistake). Before arriving I called to make sure the room will be with two beds, for my surprise they informed me that Price line booked me in a petit room so small that not even a rolling bed will fit!!! what!!! well more money $50.00 a day for the upgrade room.  The view of the room was two brick walls and not with two beds(what a fiasco). I was so frustrated but we pre-paid the hotel and no way to get our money back.  The hotel is super tiny with a very poor service to the guests.  room was not ready @ 3:00 and after asking so many times finally @ 3:40 we went up in a super tiny elevator.  Also my final bill was wrong three different charges but a week later they fix it.  We decided to stay a few more days and we booked a room at the Continental Hotel what a difference and almost for the same price.

title: Great location....but
text:
The hotel is clean and in a great location.  Booked through Travelocity...2 adults....the room turned out to be so small with one double bed....for two Adults!!!   Had to pay additional $$$ to upgrade to a "larger" room.  Still extremely small with a garbage view  
$358 for one night.....not worth it at all!

title: Great Option for family
text:
The City Club is in one of our favorite locations. Close to theaters and shopping and yet on a quieter and less hectic street.  We have previously enjoyed the Iroquois next door but none of their rooms accommodate four people. The deluxe double double at City Club even holds 5. 

With all of reviews about small room size, we were pleasantly surprised to find ours pretty spacious-particularly for New York. 

The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. 

Will be adding this to our favorites list!

title: It's the location baby
text:
Our room was tiny and the size quite a surprise when we opened the door.  We are accustomed to hotel rooms that are quite a bit bigger.  That said, it was clean, furnishings appeared new, and in the end we have decided that the room was near perfect.  Our bed was super comfortable, nice use of space to accommodate clothes, WiFi was free and fast, the turndown service (with cookie) was a nice touch.  

While it's odd to review a bathroom, this one was certainly worthy of a mention.  The shower was awesome, roomy with great pressure; my wife raved about the toiletries, and there was even a bath robe.

Best part about this hotel is that it is close to Times Square (and Grand Central station); it's the prefect location (and price) for a weekend trip to the Big Apple!  All staff were friendly and we got a "hello" every time we passed through the lobby.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Most Excellent
text:
We have been looking for a hotel to become "our" hotel in NYC. We generally prefer smaller boutique hotels; the service is personalized and the amenities tend to be nicer.  I must say City Club did not disappoint.

The lobby staff was friendly and upbeat each time we encountered them. One of the women even remembered my name the next evening when I had a question.

The room (a queen) was small but did not feel cramped or claustrophobic in any way.  The two windows opened to a dark alley and faced a brick wall, but room was bright and this was not a problem. In fact, it kept the room very dark in the morning, which made sleeping-in so much more pleasant!.

A delicious, freshly baked cookie was waiting upon our arrival and each evening as part of out turn-down service.The bathroom was fantastic and the shower was most excellent -copious amounts of high-pressure water of any temperature. The only addition I would like to see is a shaving mirror, the double-sided kind on a swing arm. The sink is large and far from the mirror.

The room also included some interesting books about The City. The WiFi was free and strong in our room. The only "con" was the size of the TV. It was very small (maybe 24") but of no consequence since we never used it. We didn't come to the city to watch TV (that and we have an iPad and a laptop.)

The neighborhood is also quite unique and historic. The City Club hotel is located at the heart of The City's cultural renaissance of the early twentieth century, surrounded by such landmarks as the Algonquin, the Iroquois and the Harvard club.  Parking is across the street with a discount for guests and our car was ready when we told them we'd be leaving, As an aside this was, hands-down, the cleanest parking garage in NYC!
 
At the end of the day we couldn't have enjoyed our stay more. We will be returning for sure and highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Perfect
text: We went in a family of four, me, my wife and two daughters, and it was just perfect. We got two rooms and they gave us suites 507 and 508 that come together with a common door, what was very convenient. The hotel is very well located, just two blocks from Time Square, two blocks from 5th Ave and so on, but in a very calm block. Rooms are well decorated and with enough space. Staff very kind and helpful. Services, just perfect (for example, wi-fi in the room, very good). Plenty of restaurants in the same street, with options also for breakfast at convenient prices. For sure, when we come back to NY we will consider return.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: I stayed for 3 nights last week, booked on hotels.com and was extremely happy with the location.  The staff is very polite and helpful.  Room service was great.  I agree with the only negative is the lack of natural light from a window.  The blinds are kept closed as the window looks at an office building.  Oh, and they need more than one mirror in the bathroom!  Would def stay here again!

title: Family of 5 welcome with ease...
text:
Went to New York with the wife, mom, and 2 kids... Finding appropriate lodging was a challenge since we would either need an expensive suite or adjoining rooms. City Club came through with adjoining rooms at the price of some other hotel's single room prices.

We had enough room to fit a couple more people. For New York standards, the rooms were spacious enough. The bathrooms were very nice, and made the wife want to redesign our's at home.

The lobby is small and no real frills, but do not be fooled. The rooms are top notch and the place caters to your needs. I am a service oriented guy and this place met or exceeded all of my requests throughout the trip. The room service and restaurant downstairs were very nice with good food; just a little pricey. (as is most room service or hotel restaurant) Right next door is a diner that is reasonable and has a kid friendly menu. Across the street is a good coffee shop that is also a little less expensive.

The location is right in the middle of the action and most everything is within walking distance.

All in all.. I was perfectly satisfied and would highly recommend City Club to anyone taking a trip with the family. (or as a couple)

title: Good hotel, great location!
text: I stayed here for one week in May and very much enjoyed the perfect location. Approx. 5 min. walk to the nearest subway station, the same to Times Square and many bars and restaurants. The staff is very polite and helpful and the room service does a brilliant job! The only negative point I can mention is the size of the room and the lack of proper windows with daylight. Very positive however is the size and the facilities of the bathroom! I can definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in New York.

title: Great Time
text:
I stayed here on a business trip and had the best time. The staff was very nice and always available.The location was the best of all! - I was able to just walk a few doors down to some of the nicest resturants. My room was small - but very comforable

Will be back soon!

title: Lovely quirky hotel, ideal location
text:
The hotel is small and intimate with lots of luxury touches. Also lots of quirks as we found out when we found the fridge etc behind a big picture and the hanging space behind a door that blended with the wall decor so it took us a while to find it. We never did find a mirror though in the room apart from the bathroom which was a little awkward when straightening hair.  
The bed in the room was super comfy and so were the pillows, i think its one of the comfiest bed i have slept in.

The staff were very welcoming and even leant us two adaptors because we forgot our own.  They were always friendly and ready to help with directions or information.
The hotel has little ways of making their guests feel important. At night while we were out they turned down the beds and always left two delicious chocolate chip cookies to eat.
The hotel even has a CD and a DVD library and has CD/ipod players and DVD players in the rooms. 
The location of the hotel is great for transport links and walking to the tourist places. Very near Times Square which is electric even during the day and a great place to people watch. There are alos plenty of irish pubs serving good food nearby. 

All in all i would definately recommend this hotel and stay again.

title: Situation géographique excéllente
text:
Cet hôtel se trouve au niveau de Times Square à quelques blocks entre la 5ième et la 6 ième avenue. Parfait pour explorer la ville à pieds. 
J'ai réserver une petite chambre mais ils m'ont donné une grande chambre avec 2 grands lits et une banquette sous la fenêtre pour se reposer et lire. 
Tout aurait pu être parfait s'il n'avait pas eu besoin de la clim.
Le bruit est assez assourdissant mais on s'habitue. Par contre quand la clim s'arrête cela claque et fait sursauter quand on est réveille mais cela réveille quand on dort!

title: Mala experiencia.
text:
Terminamos en el hotel por Hotwire.
Primero nos dieron un cuarto mínimo sin respetar lo que teníamos pactado por Hotwire. El cuarto petit muy chico no puedes caminar por el.
Segundo nos desapareció del mismo cuarto una cadenita y una polera de las cuales el hotel no quiso hacerse cargo.
No lo recomiendo. Aparte mucho olor a comida si te toca en el segundo piso! 
Finalmente casi no tiene luz exterior las habitaciones

title: Kleines feines Stadthotel in super Lage!
text:
Ich habe das Hotel wegen der super zentralen Lage in Midtown zu den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln und auch Grand Central sowie zum Bryant Park gewält. Ausserdem war mir ein nicht so großes Hotel mit nur 9 Stockwerken sympatischer.
Sowohl der telefonische als auch der persönliche Kontakt zum Personal sehr nett und hilfreich.
Wegen unseres längeren Aufenthaltes von 10 Tagen hat man uns ein Superior empfohlen. 
Vom Flughafen (JFK) ca 30-45 min mit dem Auto, mit Koffern ist Metro nicht zu empfehlen. In der 44th Strasse zwischen 5 th und 6 th Ave liegt das Hotel in einer eher ruhigen Strasse und in der Nähe sind gute aber auch ein einfaches Restaurant. Delis sind auch einigermaßen zu Fuß zu erreichen. Coffeeshops sind z.B am Bryant Park, wo man bei gutem Wetter schön in der Sonnen den Kaffee genießen kann. Trotz der ruhigen Lage ist Timesquare zu Fuß in 5 Minuten erreichbar.
Der Hoteleingang wird stets bewacht ist aber sehr klein. Man hat direkten Zutritt zu einem Restaurant neben an (Frühstück, Lunch, und Dinner sowie Bar) (waren nicht dort). Unser Superior Zimmer lag zum Hinterhof, also dunkles Zimmer, über das Badfenster konnte man zumindest einen Eindruck über das Wetter erhalten. Obwohl überhaupt keine schöne Aussicht hatte es zumindest den Vorteil, dass man in schönster Ruhe sehr gut schlafen konnte, dies lag auch an dem sehr bequemen Queenzise Bett und Kissen! Flat TV vorhanden aber die Senderauswahl ist mäßig, kein HBO etc. Kleiner Kühlschrank (Minibar) , Safe , Bügelbrett und Haartrockner vorhanden, ein Coffeemaker wäre schön gewesen. Kleiderschrank mit Bügeln sehr klein, aber immerhin konnte man die beiden großen Koffer auf einem 3. Bett gut aufbewaren. Das Bad war sehr schön und sauber, alles was man so braucht incl. Bademäntel vorhanden. Das Zimmer sauber, Teppichboden. Jeden abend wurden Cookies aufs Bett gelegt und jeden Morgen die New York Times an die Tür gehängt. W-LAN inclusive!
Alles in Allem sehr empfehlenswertes Hotel für NY Citylage, Punktabzug erfolgte nur wegen der Zimmergröße und der mangelnden Aussicht.

title: Excellent location, small hotel
text:
Location is excellent. Between Times Square and 5th Avenue.
We stayed in a very small room, but bathroom was good.
Wi-fi worked pretty well inside the room. 
Staff is as polite and helpful as described here by others reviewers

title: Perfect place to stay for a Family of 5
text:
I don't get excited when I get a "good deal" on a hotel, because sometimes, upon arrival you realize the deal wasn't all that great. I get excited by value...an excellent experience for a fair price.  It's hard to find value hotels especially when you are a family of 5 which in NYC usually means getting 2 rooms.  But I stumbled upon reviews of the City Club in NYC and they sounded really great. I am extra picky about cleanliness especially when making a decision where my little children will sleep for the night!   I saw reviews were good (re clean rooms) and I also ran a check on bedbug registry- all clear! The price was right (about $487 for deluxe double double)- so we booked it and kept our fingers crossed.
Upon arrival I was a bit worried by the appearance of the lobby. But I had read a review about this so I kept the faith. My husband however, raised an eyebrow like "really, you sure?". A few minutes later though I was pleasantly surprised when we got to the room and saw that it was clean, nicely decorated, and a decent size for our family of 5 (2 adults and kids ages 4 through 8). 
The location was perfect- walking distance to Rockafeller Center and a short taxi ride to the "touristy" spots we had planned to visit this trip.
The comfort and cleanliness of the room was great. My only complaint is that I had a tough time sleeping because of street noise but the rest of my family peacefully slumbered through the night- so maybe it was just me? 
Anyway- I felt this hotel was a real value and would recommend it to any families wanting to visit NYC and not sacrifice their kids college money;)

One disclaimer....if  the hotel were to raise the rates it would change my perception. Let me be clear- this is not The Ritz or Four Seasons. It is a very charming, clean hotel for a good price for a family of 5. I would stay there again. I will tell my friends about it. But if their prices started to creep up to Ritz/Four Seasons levels 
than my review might sound a little different.

Hopefully the prices stay where they are because I feel like I found a hotel that makes the city accessible to my family without breaking the bank.

title: Keep up the good work!
text:
The City Club hotel is an excellent place to call home if you’re visiting NY. The front desk service was incredibly friendly and quick. I called down for toothpaste one morning and I had it at my doorstep moments later. The rooms are elegant, chic, and beaming with old world charm. The bathroom was outfitted beautifully, and the bath robes and C.O. Bigelow products are a really nice touch. Location of the hotel is right in the heart of Midtown, so you’ll have quite a bit of traffic getting there, but once you’re there, everything is just steps away. The free internet is a great feature, and my room on the 5th floor had a killer view of 44th Avenue. The windows actually opened the whole way, so you could stick your head out and get a great look around! Bedding is very comfy and I slept soundly each night. You do get some street noise in the room as the windows are an older style pane glass.

I did not get a chance to experience any food (other than the delicious cookies served at turn-down), so I cannot comment on the restaurant. It did look like a very lively place in the evenings with folks enjoying themselves.

The value for all these services was incredibly good too. I've stayed closer to Times Square for more money, and a less pleasant experience. City Club Hotel fired on all cylinders and for less money!

I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

title: Decent location but you can do better
text: I stayed at this hotel but quickly transferred to the Westin after 3 nights. The City Club was more expensive, had a tiny lobby, rooms were small, and had no view.  The hotel is walkable to Times Square but there are better options in the immediate area.  My room seemed a little old and stale.  For example the closer looked old and run down.  Also, the bathroom shower had a holes in the privacy screen which I had to cover with towels.

title: Excelente ubicación.
text:
Es un hotel con una excelente ubicación, el servicio al cliente es excelente, los cuartos son algo pequenos pero son cómodos, nos atendieron correctamente y la verdad la pasamos bien.
El hotel se encuentra cerca de Time's Square pero lejos del ruido, hace que es una excelente ubicación, esta cerca de todo y es muy seguro.

title: City Club Hotel is Wonderful!
text:
We spent 5 nights at The City Club Hotel in New York City in mid- March, 2013.The lobby is tiny and  graced by a huge piece of art. Of course most of us don't need a huge lobby, and the really outstanding thing in he lobby is the personnel behind the desk, as well as the doorman/bellman and any other staff we encountered. They make all of the amenities just that much more special. They were very friendly, helpful, and efficient and a credit to their organization. Just behind the lobby and to the  left is an attached restaurant. Marvelous French inspired food, and again, wonderful service and friendly faces. The decor is stunning and yet quietly so. If we had somehow had to eat every meal there we would not have been shortchanged! Everything-breakfast, appetizers, wine, entrees, desserts, service-fantastic! Upon getting familiar with our room it became evident that the decor and art in the lobby, some of the hallways, the restaurant, and the rooms was subtle in its coordination. Had it not been it would have been fine, but what it said to me is that the City Club Hotel PAYS ATTENTION TO DETAIL. And that is very comforting and helpful when you are away from home. The location is also tops. We were about 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square one way, and about the same distance in the opposite direction from 5th Avenue. And the theaters were all around us! We even saw Tom Hanks leaving "Lucky Guy" on our way back from "Phantom"! The subway stations were all around us, and one can walk to Saks, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, Grand Central Station, etc. I have stayed at Ritz Carlton's, The Grand Hotel on Mackinac Island (in the room/suite named after and furnished by President and Mrs. Ford), Pinehurst (NC), The Grove Park Inn,(NC) etc. and many hotels internationally. While not historic nor as large, or as well known, the essence and the experience is much the same. We HIGHLY recommend the City Club Hotel! And on any return visits to NYC, we will absolutely NOT look anywhere else, and look forward to staying there again. The room was also quiet as was the whole hotel, and very comfortable.l.Oh,I almost forgot the delicious chocolate chip cookies in the room each night! Overall just a great experience!
Thanks to all,
Betsy and Ray Williams,
Lenoir, NC

title: The staff was great
text: Everything about this hotel stay was perfect. The staff were amazingly polite and tried to help out as best they could even though I was having a bad day. They were really great. The room was spotless and well decorated. Everything about the stay worked out great

title: Great place!
text: Clean - close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. - helpful staff - reasonably priced - fit our family of 5 well - warm chocolate chip cookies were a hit with our family - nice cushy robes and towels - the shower was spacious and had nice water pressure.

title: Sehr zentral gelegenes Hotel
text:
Wir haben in der Zeit vom 21. März 2013 - 27. März 2013 im CC gewohnt. Meine Frau hat dieses Hotel ausgewählt, da es eines der wenigen zentral gelegenen Hotels in Manhattan ist, in welchem man noch im Zimmer rauchen darf.
Das Zimmer war zwar nicht all zu gross aber sehr schön und sehr sauber. Der Preis für die Übernachtung war mit 431 US$ (inklusive aller Taxen) / Nacht nicht gerade spazig. Trotzdem sind wir der Meinung, dass wir sehr gut gewohnt haben. 
In 5 Min. ist man zu Fuss am Times Square. Was wir wärmstens empfehlen können ist eine kleine Baar auf dem nach Hauseweg vom Times Square ins City Club Hotel. Es ist eine unscheinbare Bar, der Eingang ist blau angemalt und die Bar ist sehr klein. Der Name der Bar ist Jimmis Corner. Der Besitzer muss ein ehemalgier Trainer für Boxer gewesen sein. Die Bar ist vollgestopft mit Trophäen und mit Bildern bekannter Boxer. Das wichtigste aber sind die Preise. Wir haben meistens 2 Getränke bestellt. Z.B. einen Manhattan und ein Samuel Adams (5 Dl). Ich habe pro Runde nie mehr als 10 $ bezahlt. Scheint mir die absolut günstigste Bar in der Nähe des Times Square zu sein.

title: Great spot for a family weekend
text: I chose the City Club for a recent weekend stay with three adults and two children. I booked the family suite which consisted of two queen rooms with a connecting hallway that could be locked out so the interior room doors could remain open. We had plenty of space. Along with the queen beds, each room had a window seat that an adult could easily and comfortably sleep on. The room size was average for New York (enough room for a bed, desk/chair, window seat)but I felt the bathrooms were a bit on the larger size. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a small problem with the our room rate showing higher than my confirmation but it was quickly fixed. The hotel is about 1 1/2 blocks away from times square. There is a fantastic diner a few doors down. Breakfast was crowded on a Sunday morning, so get there early. This hotel provides large, soft bath towels and CO Bigelow toiletries. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay as did the rest of the family.

title: City Club - Nice rooms in a great location
text:
I had to make a last-minute decision to travel into New York the night before a business meeting due to a forecast of inclement weather.  I found City Club online, on the same block as my meeting.  I had walked by it a number of times - it's out-of-the way, tucked in between the Algonquin and the Iroquois hotels.  You have to look carefully for the entrance.  When I arrived the staff was friendly and efficient and I was in my room in 5 minutes.

And speaking of rooms ... I was genuinely impressed. Some describe the rooms as small, but I've stayed in smaller rooms in New York.  I had a nice, comfortable king size bed (upgrade from what I had booked), large flat screen TV (although the cable channels are a bit limited), and a large bathroom with premium-quality toiletries and bathrobes.  A plate of cookies was waiting for me. And best of all...complimentary wi-fi.  The room was quieter than most I've had in New York.  No noisy guests, no garbage trucks outside in the early morning hours - genuinely a nice experience.  I would highly recommend City Club for both personal and business travel.

title: Great hotel!
text: Stayed for 4 nights; first time in NYC, a treat from my husband for my 40th birthday. Great little hotel in a fabulous central location. We upgraded to a king size deluxe room which was lovely. Reception staff always friendly & very helpful. Daily fresh chocolate chip cookies were a lovely touch. Can highly recommend.

title: Loved it.
text: One of the best kept secrets in NYC. The bedrooms are beautifully decorated and the bathroom is big and that is something for NY. My husband, myself and our 19 year old shared a room to safe cost and although the room was not overly large it had a very big bed and a very long sofa (window) bed and we were able to move around the room with ease. The bathroom is beautifully decorated with high quality toiletries. Instead of mints you get cookies on your bed each night. The front desk (which is tiny), staff were probably the highlight, if it could get better. They couldn't do enough for us. They cheerfully greeted us every time we came in or out and were so helpful. The location is second to none and my daughter and I felt safe walking home at 3am after a long night shopping at Forever 21. Times square is literally around the corner, but you're close to just about everything. I'd go back in a second. Loved it

title: Great value - little gem
text: This hotel very much delivers as promised.  For the price and location, it is difficult to beat.  My room was very clean, quiet and tastefully decorated.   I had to spend the better part of my first day working in my room.  The wifi worked well, and the staff and food in the hotel were really great.  I picked the location on this business trip because I wanted to see the MOMA after I was done with work, and it is close enough for a run through central park.  I could not have done better - had considered staying at the W, as I have stayed at many W's, but I was happy that I came here instead.

title: What a great Hotel!
text: So close to time Square! Walk out turn right, and your in the middle of time square. The room was very clean, the bed was huge! The bathroom was granite tiled it was beautifull. No noise from the city. We slept really well ! The Seconde floor lounge area has a wonderfull seating room. They leave cookies instead of mints. Yummy!! :) I would reccommed this Hotel for a weekend stay! It was a great suprise to have such a cute hotel in such a great location! Freindly and helpful staff.

title: Gem in Manhattan
text: I loved this hotel.  It's a little gem in the Midtown Manhattan area that's a few steps away from the action of Times Square, Macy's and more.  The concierge and employees were friendly, courteous and helpful and the room I stayed in was very modern and comfortable.... the perfect size for a weekend stay.  Comfy bed, plush towels and robes, ipod/phone dock station and more. My room was on the second floor and I didn't have any view as the hotel is stuck between 2 buildings but I didn't stay in my room much so that really was no big deal.  There is a restaurant downstairs that I didn't have a chance to try out but it seemed very busy every time I passed it. I highly recommend this hotel to every one and plan on staying there for my future visits to NYC.

title: Great Location - Friendly Staff
text:
You can't beat this mid-town NYC location. Sure, the rooms are Manhattan-sized, but still well-appointed and quiet. The desk staff were friendly and always helpful with greetings, printing email, storing luggage or suggesting eateries, sports bars or the best place to buy a baguette. Discounted parking and gym access are nearby. The lobby area is no impressive edifice, but a smiling midnight desk clerk sure makes up for the decor.

I left my mobile phone in my room as I headed out and before I could reach the lobby, cleaning staff had found it and called down to head me off.

I found a variety of deals via jettsetter.com and the straight-on hotel website. I plan and hope to stay there again. 

Thanks, City Club!

title: City Club Regular!
text: I absolutely love this little gem. It's an adorable boutique hotel in a great location. I first stayed here about 4 years ago and I can't imagine staying anywhere else while in the city! The management and staff are very friendly and helpful and will go above and beyond to accommodate you.

title: Boutique on a Budget
text:
Small room - think your college dorm room but cute. The bench seating is awesome; there is very little wasted space in the room. 

Hard to spot on the street as the entrance is subdued compared to the Sofitel a few doors down. 

Comfortable stay. 5 blocks or so from Grand Central Station. Good restaurant downstairs. No view, at least from the room I used. 

I would stay here again if I only needed for a night or two, or didn't plan to spend a lot of time in the room.

title: Convenient, clean and comfortable
text:
I recently moved to Boston from NYC and now when I go back for work, I generally just need a place to crash. So I don't need much room. 

This hotel was fantastic. I had one of the petite rooms and it was more than enough room. The bathroom was large.. the water pressure was good... and the bed was super cozy. 

There was no view---but I don't think a view is necessary depending on the type of stay you. 

The turn down service was great. 

Loved it :)

title: Conveniently located just off 5th Avenue & near Times Square
text:
The purpose of our trip was to celebrate my 30th birthday and was also part of our 'baby-moon'. 

Our first impressions of the hotel was that it looked smart but was very small. We originally booked a double bed room, however, as soon as we entered the room we knew it was way too small for our 5 night stay, so I called the reception for an upgrade. We was advised the cost would be an extra $30 a night, which we was willing to pay because the room we was allocated was too small. Unfortunately, their system was down so they wasn't able to upgrade us until the next day. When we went downstairs the next morning to enquire about the upgrade, we received a very nice surprise and they were willing to upgrade us to the queen sized room for free!!! We were very grateful for the free upgrade and was pleasantly surprised at how much bigger the room was. Furthermore, they helped us move all our luggage, so on our return to the hotel having explored the Time Square area, all we had to do was retrieve the keys to our new room. 

The bed in the double/petit room was more like a large single bed and my husbands legs were hanging off the edge (he is 6'1) and there was no room to put our two medium sized suitcases nor were there any space to hang our clothes. The double/petit room literally just had a petit bed, with no additional space for desk or chair. However, the queen room that we was upgraded to had a queen bed, with additional seating section by the window as well as an additional section for a desk and chair. Needless to say we were very happy with the upgrade to the queen room and the fresh cookies we received every night was a bonus. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel but only the queen room (if staying for more than 3 nights or more) and the staff were friendly and polite to us during our stay. However, if you are only staying for one or a maximum of two nights by yourself then the petit/double should be sufficient. If we were to visit NYC again, I would stay here again because of the convenient location. The hotel is located between 5th and 6th Avenue and only two blocks from Times Square.

title: Birthday Surprise
text:
I decided to surprise my partner for his Birthday with a night on the town with a few drinks, dinner, and a romantic evening in the city where we don't have to commute back home and mar the mood.    

Its hard not to give the hotel 5 stars when you were in the best room of the house.  The "Grand Duplex Sutie".  It was two levels and with a spiral staircase leading up to the loft Kind Bedroom with full bath.  Honestly I could have moved right in.  The decor was one part library and one part luxury hotel room.  The small Juliet balcony was just big enough to enjoy a drink and listen to the sounds of the city.  I think the room is bigger than out condo back home, and the service was impeccable.  The lobby was tiny but really what do you need in a lobby other than to check in.  

The hotel also houses the DB Bistro Moderne which I recommend for some very accessible french fair.  The Hotel is closer to Times Square but out of the way of the crowds.  It make a nice little getaway for a weekend.

title: A convenient and classy place to stay in NYC
text: This hotel is centrally located, convenient to theaters, restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. The rooms are spacious with lovely amenities, fluffy beds, and, in our room, a couch along one wall. They have a table and chair and plenty of room for writing or reading. The staff is polite, helpful, and knowledgeable. My daughter and I spent one night at City Club, and were upgraded  to an accessible room since she has issues with mobility. We loved the walk-in glass shower and the large bathroom.

title: Great Hotel Got From Great Site Travelation
text: I was looking for a flight and came across travelation.com. And luckily I checked their hotel deals and got the best one for city club in new-york. Actual price was $439 and I got it only for $373. Very good discount from travelation. And the hotel was great. Their service was very good. Room were very spacious and clean . Such a great room for such a low price was incredible. Thanks to travelation and city club hotel for such great service.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel but gets lots of street noise
text:
I stayed here one night for business and liked the hotel a lot.  I was upgraded from a "petite" 1-bed room to a larger room for no charge which was nice.  The modern room was beautiful and the bathroom was very distinctive with an all-glass shower although I wish there had been a spot to set my toiletries other than the top of the toilet.  Beds were very comfortable with European style duvets.

Their website makes it very easy to check rates on different dates and they vary a lot.  My room was $144 on a Wednesday night.  I see the same room ranging from $126 to $245 over the next couple of weeks.

I would definitely stay here again but I did have one complaint.  As an older building, it has old windows that actually open on to the street and I heard every honking horn and truck engine starting at 4AM when traffic picked up.  The windows do not seal well and let in about as much noise as if they were open.  Light sleepers should beware.

But if you like boutique hotels I would definitely recommend it.

title: Perfect for a Weekend Getaway
text: My husband and I spent one night at the City Club.  We arrived early, several hours before check-in.  The woman at the front desk could not have been nicer or more professional.  She offered to store our luggage until our room was ready, and she also gave us the option of an upgrade to a larger room for a small rate increase, as we were only staying overnight, and that room was available immediately.  We took the upgrade and checked right in.  Loved everything about the place. The location is perfect.  We drove in from CT and parked in the garage across the street, but had we chosen to take the train it would have been a plesant walk fron Grand Central. The queen luxe room had a HUGE bathroom, comfy bed, and plenty of space for two. We especially appreciated the turn down service with the chocolate chip cookies!  The only aspect of the place that may be a turn-off to some (it wasn't for us) is that from our room there was not much of a view out of either window and very little natural light.  Other than that, we couldn't ask for a better place for the price, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay here again!!  Highly recommend!!!

title: Excellent value for money, service, cleanliness and location
text:
The City Club is a boutique hotel. I prefer smaller hotels, I find the service more personal and the service here is excellent. Every front of house staff member were genuine and friendly, but then so was the lady who turned down the beds and left warm chocolate cookies for us. Little things like this make a huge difference. The rooms; well, I booked the cheapest room but as soon as I walked in I realised this room is better for one guest, not two, so I upgraded to a Queen room. The extra charge was expected but they reduced it as I was staying a week. The Queen room we had was perfect, with a huge balcony as a bonus. The bed was very very comfortable. I judge hotels on the beds and the linen used. The sheets here were crisp, clean and of a very high quality, so no need to be concerned if this is a make or break criteria for you. The bathrooms were deluxe, designed in a very masculine style with ample room in both the bathrooms, so Id imagine they are all similar. Gregorys coffee is directly across the road, so you will never be to far away from possibly the best coffee in New York City.
The City Club location in Times Square is perfect for those who want to be close to the action. Everything is a few short blocks away. Rockefeller Centre is about 4 blocks away, times square approx 2-3 blocks. It's a well known hotel, all the cab drivers knew it - nothing else to say really. We spent a week in this hotel during the xmas period and it only cost us $1500 which I think is a bargain considering what the hotel offers in terms of location and amenities. I didn't eat at the restaurant downstairs, which I regret, but it was busy a lot, which I take to be a good sign.
Enjoy the city club, I did. Will I go back? Not sure as I am price driven, so if they offered a great deal then yes.

title: We will be back without hesitation!
text: Sooo comfortable. Beautiful facility. Centre of town. Minutes from Times Square. Elegant bath and comfortable clean room.  The cookies were a special treat. They held on to our luggage since we arrived early and they delivered the luggage to our room once we checked in. Everyone is friendly. Thank you!

title: Fantastic cosy central base for a trip to NY
text:
We've stayed here twice and would happily stay again.  The hotel is in a great location and is very stylish and calm.  The reception area is small but staff are extremely helpful. The cookies at bedtime are fab although it varied from night to night how many we got - some nights we got one each and others we had to share.  

Pros - really comfy bed, spotless housekeeping, lovely bathrooms, lovely toiletries, charming staff, great decor, reasonably priced, great location, next to Red Flame diner so breakfast incredibly easy, free Wifi and newspaper. 

Cons - restaurant is too formal and not as stylish as the hotel, even though the lobby is small it would have been nice to have had a little bit of Christmas decor.

As a family of four we found the rooms great - the first time we ended up in a two large beds room but the second time we only got one proper bed and the day bed which only sleeps one.  The staff were great in sorting out a camp bed but I would suggest that you check the exact sleeping arrangements of your room beforehand so that you are not disappointed. 

We travel a lot to NY and the last 2 times we have needed a hotel we have chosen this one - everyone in the family was very keen to return!

title: Great location for a decent price
text: We booked on hotwire so went in blind. I was pleasantly surprised at the interesting but definitely petite room. Everything was nice - bidet was a talking point for us but went unused. Not 100% sure but our bed might not have been a standard length. There were dome dangling feet. Wish we had asked for an upgrade. Never hurts to ask right?!

title: OK stay
text: Pros: Clean, free chocolate chip cookie, speedy check in process. Cons: They charge you $20 to use the health club down the street when you book your room through Expedia. I purposely looked on the Expedia amenitie's listing and it had "Use of nearby fitness center (complimentary)" listed. I was very annoyed with this, as this is one of my main criteria when staying in NYC. I'll be going to the city again soon but will not be staying at City Club.

title: Wow...just wow...great location too
text: Spent an overnight there at the City Club. Booked online for a "petite" room and when I arrived asked for an upgrade. Boy was this a nice room for the price. Very stylish accomodations, very comfortable. The hotel is right in the center of the theatre district. Chocolate chip cookies and clean clean rooms.This is a well kept secret, travelers. Say hello to Lee and Amber. I was VERY happy in New York on December 21st, 2012.

title: Good hotel if you are expecting good beds and stay out during day time.
text: 5 of us comfortably stayed including 2 kids in a double lux room. Beds are comfy. Service was good. Location great. Small hotel but once in room it does not feel that bad. Much better than other brand name hotels.

title: Excellent location, friendly staff, and lovely boutique hotel! The chocolate chip cookies were a nice touch! Loved our short sta
text: Great place. Loved the decor, the location an the staff were fantastic. The chocolate chip cookies were a really nice touch. We stayed in a "petite room" which was cozy, but bigger than expected for a room in NYC, especially the bathroom with a bidet! They made fantastic use of the space. Loved our short but nice stay. Our parking price wasn't bad either. Thanks!

title: FRONT DESK
text:
PRO'S  Size of bathroom , Location
CON'S  Front desk people very poor customer interaction, not helpfull. Room size is not as described smaller, and thie picture are of the suite. The minibar is on the floor in the closet what a stupid idea get on your knees to get to the minibar, the closet is very small. the room layout furniture wise is very poor, floor are cheap tile not cork or wood and the windows are very poor for the winter (cold air leaks ). And the last is the lobby a hallway is the way to describe it, and the business center is a old computer (old).

title: Great location and exceptional service
text: We stayed in the "Petite" room on the third floor from Sat to Tues. The room was definitely small, but adequate for our needs since we were only ever in it to shower or sleep. The room was very clean and the servic e of the staff was amazing. Delicious chocolate chip cookies every night were left in our room, and since we didn't have a coffee maker, the staff got me a kettle of hot water for tea with two mugs every night. No noise heard from the street, but could definitely hear the elevator. No biggie. Great location. A very quick walk to several subway stops, as well as Times square and Rockefeller centre. There is a diner a couple of doors down from the hotel called the Red Flame. Staff is mostly unfriendly, but breakfasts are delicious here and well priced for what you get. No complaints, other than no fridge in the room and room size, both not a big deal at all. I would stay here again.

title: Find another hotel
text:
The room itself was ok, very small but still clean and decent looking. The problem was with the service. I stained the bedsheet a little bit with wine. They said it was ok and they'll take care of it. Then charged me 100$ for dry cleaning !!! 100$ ??? It's not like the bedsheet was Frette or any kind of expensive linen... 

Unnacceptable.

title: Great location
text:
Spent 4 nights here in November. Great location for accessing all of Manhattan.
I loved the decor but not to everyones taste as modern and quite dark, and no batth, just a big walk in shower. 
Great receptionists - we arrived early and they pulled out the stops to get us in our room. We booked the double double room. 2 double beds and plenty of room. The warm cookies delivered each night are bliss!
Could do better? Very small closet space, for 2 people at the end of a 2 week holiday, most clothes had to stay in the cases. No coffeee making facilities. No bar/restaurant, you can use bistro attached but this had the wrong feel for us - and always packed.

title: Avoid this property
text:
I have some good news and some bad news.....

All bad news in my opinion, but that is how I was greeted when attempting to check-in after the scheduled check-in time of 15.00.  The bad news was that my room was not ready, but the good news was that they were upgrading me to a suite.  After another hour and half of waiting, I was told my room was ready.  The one star is for the size of the suite (which was large by NYC standards), but for a hotel with no lobby (small is an understatement), no bar/dining options within the property (granted DBs is next door), and paper-thin walls (I was awoken at 02.00 by my neighbor who proceeded to engage in a screaming match over the telephone with some woman for the better part of three hours, which clearly could be heard by anyone staying at the property, including any staff), there are several other better options in this price range.  The kicker was my request for a one-hour late check-out which was denied (30 minutes granted, but when I asked why it was I had to wait 4.5 hours for my room to be ready for them to clean for someone before me, I failed to get an answer).
Do yourself a favor and look around before staying at this property.

title: Great stay!!!
text: From the begining, the staff in this hotel was wonderful. They were very helpful with our reservation and went out of their way to accomodate us once we got there. The room was spacious for NY standards, and the marble bathroom luxurious. Bidet, robes, and a big shower with a powerful shower head. Chocolate chip cookies were delivered to our room everynight, and the New York times every morning. No view in our room, but nothing to complain about. Only a block and a half from Time Square and block and a half from Grand Central Station. Excellent location. Since our flight didn't leave until the evening and check out time was at noon, the front desk kept our luggage until we were ready to pick it up on our way to the airport. We'll stay again there without any doubts.

title: Awful
text: If I could give less than 1 star I would.  We have just appeared at the city Club Hotel in NY after travelling for more than12 hours to find that the room we had booked for 4 people does not sleep 4 and we will have to pay $200 to upgrade on top of what we have already paid.  We are tired, upset and the customer service at the hotel is non existant.  Apparantly this is our fault because we booked through Expedia and not through the hotel we are also at fault because we did not contact the hotel to double check the sleeping arrangements with them. We are trying to change hotels but it is proving to be difficult.  This was to be a trip of a lifetime to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday that was rearranged from the Summer due to my husband taking ill.  This is just an awful start to what was meant to be a special family holiday.  Totally spoiled due to City Club Hotel especially the officious girl on recepton.    My family is now sitting in reception with our luggage trying to get another hotel and the City Club Hotel could not care less.

title: Beautiful hotel larger rooms by NYC standards
text: Stayed one night to see a show. Theater district two blocks away. Our room was an upgrade to a double level suite. Sofa bed on the first level with a powder room, while loft had king size bed with large marble bath. Lighted shelf in shower a great touch. Building is a restored 19th C. club and they kept nice features such as the decorative ceiling mouldings. Great cookies at turn down and the Times in the AM. Hotel validates parking at a very nice garage across the street ($35/day - a deal in Mid-Town).  We had breakfast at the resteraunt, DB Bistro Moderne (Daniel Boulard), which also provides room service. Excellent food and service. Hotel does have a small reception area, but this is on purpose according to their web site.

title: Excellent location
text: The hotel rooms carry all luxury details in a compact way. Nice bathroom and comfy bed. The location is excellent, to drop off bags during the day or for a short rest, close to everywhere and inspite of its central locations the rooms are very quiet. Recommend it

title: Great Location, Just What I needed
text:
Needed a last minute hotel in midtown for a business trip. The City Club was a terrific experience.

Helpful Staff, Free in room wi-fi, good sized clean room with plenty of light.

...and the cookie before bed was a welcoming touch.

title: Pequeno , discreto , perto , barato
text:
The city club hotel é um hotel pequeno muito próximo a times square , com restaurantes , farmácia e bancos próximos , além de estações do metro ! Pessoal muito gentil com serviço de ótima qualidade !
Quarto - grande com tv LCD a cabo
Internet - wi fi free
Cama - bom tamanho , roupa cama nova
Chuveiro - muita água quente e fácil de regular 
Ar condicionado - quente e frio funcionam
Carregador de iPhone disponível

title: A HIDDEN GEM
text:
I decided to use my new Tripadvisor app fort a b'day weekend in NYC. Pulled off West Side Highwy at 96th street and began search. My thinking was that  I would book something with last minute prices but now nothing was coming up in the Upper West Side which is where we wanted to be. Found nice price at City Club totally unknown to me and I've been in NYC and envirions since 1996. A call to the hotel I learned that the quoted price on my iPhone would only work if I could book it over the iPhone but it would not work. More frustration and my wife and I now getting hungry. I asked if I could book it on the phone with him and after a wait, he agreed but that the room advertised was a 'petite suit' and when I asked could two people use it he was reluctant to agree. Then  he said if I booked it now with him he would take that rate and give us an upgrade. Now that's a real 'pig-in-a-poke' situation but I decided to trust him and booked the room for two nights to celebrate my b'day weekend. The hotel was in the East Theater District. The drive was a nightmare but we got there with almost all our wits but hungry and angry at all the traffic snarls and totally exhausted. Now we had to hope and pray the room was at least a haven. Phillip was at front desk and very pleasant so we did the biz and  madame went up to the room while I took the car across the street for fifty-percent off parking rate. 
    Then I made my way up to the room and knew I was going to be greeted either by a crazy crying woman or a happy woman. Fifty-fifty. The room was MAGNIFICENT...Stunning Japanese motif, black marble bathroom from the movies, great water pressure. No view but who cared. All the amenities including cookies by the deco nightstand and an incredible mini-bar hidden behind a huge Japanese painting. Needless to say Phillip got a nice tip and we were home for two glorious and very quiet days after much celebrating. Never forget this place and plan to go again next time New York City calls. This place is literally hidden. There is a small door on north side of 44th street between The Algonquin and the Iroquois hotels. Used to be a private Club in the 20's I think. Go, enjoy, ask for Phillip then step into Manhattan the way it was meant to be for night-life. Jimmy's bar towards Broadway is not to be missed. Thank you Tripadvisor app. Thank you Phillip. Thank you City Club.

title: A room with a balcony in NYC!
text: This hotel was a small, modern boutique in a good location in NYC.  Our room was on the smaller side, but that's expected in NYC.  It was decently priced.  The bathroom was larger, and full of mirrors.  The bed was comfortable and there was a balcony, a good-sized balcony.  There wasn't much of a view, but it was spacious.  The lobby was small, but interesting.  The staff was friendly, but at one point we felt that there wasn't enough people to help out at the front desk.  The restaurant in the hotel was hip.  We had dessert and a drink there.  If you want a comfortable room at a good rate, this is the place to go.

title: Good location,nice but small room
text:
We stayed here for a long weekend.small clean hotel.We had horrendous problems with the toilet breaking.A maintenance man came to plunge it.We were assured the problem was resolved,but it wasn't,t.We had to use the lobby toilet which was down the hall.On the last night,we were moved to another room.Too little too late.
We will certainly never stay there again.
Otherwise the room was nice,but small.View of a brick wall,but I guess that is the norm for New York.

title: New York Getaway
text:
We recently had a great stay @ CC and just wanted to say a BIG thank you to ALL the staff who made our visit to NYC a great success.

John & I work in luxury hospitality & the service industry and we are both privileged to travel the globe a lot, (some for work but mostly for play) and every so often we have the pleasure of coming across a property that just does everything 'the right way'.

 At CC the staff were always friendly & smiling, the guest areas were always clean & smelled great, our room was comfortable with thoughtful amenities & well placed gestures that made us feel very happy & content to spend our time with you. The end of our city break came too quickly and we were quite sad to leave but more importantly, we are excited and look forward to returning to CC.

 Thank you and best regards

 John & Shannon Gaunt

title: Kleines NYC Hotel mit guter Ausstattung in bester Lage
text: Unser Bauchgefühl sagte uns 3 Tage vor unserer Reise nach NYC diese Hotel zu einem reduzierten Preis über expedia.de zu buchen und dafür das Comfort Inn Manhattan zu stornieren. Wir haben zwar 50 Euro pro Nacht mehr gezahlt (ohne Frühstück), dafür aber ein Super Hotel bekommen zu rund 270 EUR pro Nacht, was für New Yorker Verhältnisse ein akzeptabler Preis ist. Hinzu kam, dass wir statt des gebuchten Luxus King Size ein Upgrade auf eine Suite bekommen haben, die wirklich sehr schön war. Zwei Etagen mit viel Platz und individuellem Flair bei der Einrichtung. Unsere Tochter bekam noch ein kostenloses Zustellbett ins Zimmer gestellt und hatte somit ihr eigenes Reich mit eigenem kleinem Bad. Das Hotel bekommt auch unabhängig von diesem Upgrade eine klare Empfehlung, da die Lage, die Ausstattung und die Sauberkeit und nicht zuletzt die Freundlichkeit der Mitarbeiter sehr gut ist.

title: No view
text: Didn´t like the room  because  we haven´t   got   a view   to the street , just to  a brickwall. You couldn´t say if it was day or night.  The room was ok. Like the bed and bathroom.

title: NYC gem
text:
Location, location, location plus the room & bathroom were spacious and very-very comfortable, great mini-bar options and the zagat guide in the room was a great help too...and the turn-down service comes with an addictive surprise!

At CC the staff were always friendly & smiling, the guest areas were always clean & smelled great, our room was comfortable with thoughtful amenities & well placed gestures that made us feel very happy & content to spend our time in-house. The end of our city break came too quickly and we were quite sad to leave but more importantly, we are excited and look forward to returning to CC.

On the (-) : There is not a huge amount of closet space and there was no invitation from the duty manager or reception staff to visit the bar/restaurant for a drink/coffee.

title: Excellent location, great for business travels
text: My stay at the City Club was excellent. The hotel is decorated with abstract art and dim lighting. My room was given a complimentary upgrade which was nice, and the free cookies were delicious! The free wifi was also a bonus. The service at the front desk was always great. Sokorra at the desk was very helpful with my itinerary and the staff were always friendly. I definitely felt at home here. I love that it is close to the busy times square streets, but at a safe peaceful distance from the crowds. Will return on future business travels.

title: posizione ottima
text:
La caratteristica migliore di questo hotel e' senza dubbio la posizione centralissima .
L'hotel non e' economico ,ma paragonato ad altri nella stessa zona e usufruendo di qualche offerta ne vale la pena.
La camera pulita , abbastanza grande (per gli standard di New York) , bagno in proporzione molto grande e comodo.
Staff molto gentile , graditissimi i cookies al rientro in camera ,wifi gratuita .
Unico neo :stanza buia perche' la finestra dava su un muro di fronte ... In sintesi comunque un hotel da consigliare.

title: Cannot fault the location
text:
For walking anywhere, you cannot fault the location. Staff are very friendly and help where they can.

The rooms are so so, functional yes, well designed but getting tired. Amenities included fantastic toiletries etc, had a delicious homemade cookie with turndown service. Excellent.

On the downside I have two window views of concrete recesses and food is expensive. (but for the location this must be expected.)

Overall quite good.3.5 stars.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Abbiamo soggiornato quattro notti: la posizione del City Club è veramente ottima, a pochi minuti da Times Square e Broadway. Non è economico, però vale certamente la pena: è pulito, silenzioso, bagno grande, wi-fi gratuita in camera, cassaforte, asse e ferro da stiro, ottimi cookies recapitati ogni pomeriggio, personale alla reception cortese e collaborativo. Abbiamo scelto la camera Queen, le cui dimensioni sono ragionevoli: 1 letto matrimoniale grande, 1 divano, 1 tavolino, 1 poltrona, spazio per valigie aperte. Per colazione, di fronte all'hotel siamo stati da "Gregory": a prezzi ragionevoli cappuccino, cereali, muffin, vaschetta di frutta. Nei dintorni ristoranti di ogni genere e prezzo, ci siamo trovati motlo bene alla Trattoria Dopo Teatro. 1 solo appunto: in camera l'aria condizionata è regolabile, ma sempre comunque veramente molto molto fredda. Consigliamo sicuramente di soggiornare al City Club.

title: Location, unique and good value.
text:
In NY on business and needed a hotel close to the conference.  City Club reminds me of Room Mate Grace, but is less trendy and more comfy/quiet.  Check in was easy and I was surprised to find that there is a small bar adjacent to the reception area.  The room was typical NY size, perhaps a bit smaller than Room Mate Grace but fine (I was in a queen size room).  I have to believe that the "petite" is really small.  The room featured a small desk, queen bed, and a small sofa built into the window.  Flat panel on the wall, iron/board in the closet with the mini bar but NO coffee pot.  Bathroom was nice - a big bathroom (or not small) and marble always make you feel spoiled.  Free internet.  Bed was comfy, but the bed felt a little short (I'm 5'10" and my feet were down on the end).  Overall, I had no major complaints.  I did notice some foot traffic in the halls (no carpet out there), but the amount was small and didn't bother me.  I could see it being a problem if the floor was busy.  I also could not hear any of the guests in the adjacent rooms.  

Price - I saw some reviews talking about rates in the $200s and even under $200.  I paid $330 for a queen, which I thought was reasonable for City Club.  If you are able to get a rate here under $250 for a queen, I think you got a deal.

Other items to know - there is a 24hr pharmacy around the corner in case you forgot a few items and there is also a greasy spoon next door that opens at 6am and I think is open late.  The place was hopping, so I'm betting it was pretty good.

title: Hotel perfetto
text: Situato a metà strada tra Time Square e la Fifth Avenue, non è di certo il più economico, 4 stelle a settembre a 225 $/notte per una doppia. Se però si ritengono indispensabili una camera di 18mq con divano e letto matrimoniale (di quelli veri per intenderci), pulizia e arredamento con un tocco di classe, asse e ferro da stiro ad attendervi oltre ad un minibar fornitissimo, bagno finestrato da 5mq, tv LCD da 40" (con lettore DVD!!!), e avete inoltre visto qualche altro hotel un po' più economico in città, il che spesso vuol dire portarsi almeno a metà dell'upper west/east side, allora rimarrete favorevolmente impressionati. Anche nelle (e dalle) piccole cose. Qualcuno ad aspettarvi al rientro con il sorriso e che vi apre la porta in strada. Una reception piccola e accogliente dove ci si sente davvero ospiti. Un invito al servizio in camera con due biscottoni al cioccolato ogni sera. Gli accappatoi firmati ad attendervi in bagno, oltre ai soffici asciugamani di alta qualità. Insomma, se per le vostre tasche è affrontabile, ve lo consiglio.

title: Good hotel, marred by bad attitude
text:
I was pretty happy with $199 a night for a decent hotel in mid-town NYC, and despite trying to up-sell us a bigger room (guessing they were out of the ones we had), they they gave us an upgrade to a deluxe room too, which was spacious.

Amenities were fine, there was the nice touch of free cookies delivered to the room and wi-fi and showers were clean and functional.

Don't bother having breakfast - the prices are sky high, but there are plenty of diners and bars nearby that serve good food for less money.

I was pretty annoyed when I came back to pick up my bag in a rush to get to Penn station. There were two people on reception (one serving another customer) and the woman that was free refused to go and get my bag. Seemingly she was too important for this, and I had to wait for the bellboy. This isn't an OK way to treat a customer who is rushing to get a train.

If it hadn't been for that, I would have rated the hotel much higher, but I don't need that attitude in my life and I won't be going back. Judge for yourself!

title: great place to stay!!
text: This is a smaller hotel but great location 44th st between 5th & 6th avenue.The staff are very attentive as soon as you ask for anything it is delivered to your room quickly.The room was great the luxe double double had  ample room for five of us. A few doors down from city club is a great diner where you can have breakfast or pick up coffee,bagels, muffins and take back to your room. Bonus huge  homemade cookies in your room every night.we really enjoyed our stay here.

title: excellent hotel
text:
a very nice hotel, a very attentive staff, nice modern looking hotel and rooms, i booked the petit room, i guess that was the hotel's smallest room for one night only (because i messed up my bookings and had to book here for one night and another 7 nights in the hotel next door), when i checked in i was upgraded to the deluxe room, the was very nice, the bed was something to die for, the bath room was nice also, a nice looking hotel in a perfect location.
the only thing was that when i was checking out i asked for a late check out so that i meet the check-in time in the other hotel i was going to, but the receptionist refused to do so saying that they are running short in rooms..etc, i accepted it, but on my way out i met with the manager and she asked me about my stay and i told her everything was ok and i wished i booked this hotel, but had to check-in in the other hotel next door, there where she said: "oh we can accommodate you we ahve plenty of rooms"....I smiled and left the hotel..

title: Great Location, but Small Rooms
text:
Easy walk to Times Square and Central Park.
Hotel right between 5th and 6th Avenues!
Didnt try the hotel breakfast or the restaurant.
Although as you exit the hotel entrance (which is tiny dont miss it as u walk by!) walk to your right and there is a nice restaurant with breakfast which i enjoyed very much and wasnt expensive.
WiFi was weak in my room, on the uppermost floor of the hotel, but little better on the lower floors and lobby.
Room was tiny... But nice decor and bathroom.

title: Great Location, nice people, odd vibe
text:
Tucked away in midtown right next door the the famed Algonquin Hotel, the City Club is thiiiiiiiis close to being an awesome little boutique hideaway. First, the good: The staff is super friendly and pleasant. The rooms, while New York City small, have comfortable beds, and the daybed they set up for us was a million steps above the usual rollaway. The not so good: what is UP with the shower? Separated from the rest of the bathroom only by a half glass wall and a clear shower curtain, we flooded the entire bathroom every time we took a shower until we jerry-rigged a barrier; rolled up a bath towel placed on the floor to act as a barrier. Plus, it took ages to get the water to the correct temperature, and to top it off, we had to call somebody up to help figure out the lighting. This is obviously an example of paying attention to design at the expense of comfort.
Also, the dark hallways felt sort of creepy. There is no carpet (in both hallways and rooms) so be sure to pack some slippers. 
Would i recommend it? If the price is right (they were running a special at 20% off a four night stay), I'd say sure.

title: Good if you get a cheap rate
text:
I stayed at the City Club for one night in New York recently.  I had to make a quick trip for personal business and didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel, so I took advantage of a very good deal ($169) on Jetsetter.  The location is very convenient, and just far enough away from Times Square to be relatively noise-free.  The service was unfailingly friendly and efficient.  I was upgraded from a Petite to a Queen room, and thank goodness--the Queen room is tiny so I wonder what the Petite would have been like!  But the Queen was perfectly comfortable for one.

The hotel is a bit odd.  It is very dark--there is almost no lighting in the hallways and the dark floors don't do much to help illuminate things.  The floors are cork tile (in the hallways and the rooms), and are a bit sticky and rather worn (and faded near the windows).  I would say this is not a great flooring choice for a hotel.  

The bathroom in my room was immaculately clean with a GREAT shower--fantastic water pressure and a super shower head.  As a whole, the bathroom was adequate, but you can tell it was designed by a man--dark brown/black marble wall tile, the dark cork floor, and dim lighting, so forget doing anything in there that requires you to actually see, such as putting on makeup.  Still, there were lovely and plentiful toiletries from Bigelow, great towels, and nice robes.  And again, I was just there for one night so how far wrong could I go?

The bed was way too soft for my liking and a bit lumpy, and the sheets were a little cheap and had a couple of small holes in them.  The air conditioner was incredibly noisy and rattle-y.  There were only two accessible plugs (2 plugs, not 2 available outlets, so if you have more than a phone and a laptop, don't plan to charge everything at once).  I was on the penthouse floor and had a small terrace attached to my room, which would have been quite nice if I had spent more time at the hotel.  The large sliding doors to the terrace also meant the room had nice daylight.  The wallpaper was peeling, which gave a kind of seedy feeling to an otherwise quite well-kept room.

This is not a luxury hotel, but you will not pay luxury prices.  It appears that the rack-rate for a petite room at this hotel is just shy of $300.  That would seem like a LOT to pay for a room like the one I had.  But for $169, it really can't be beat in the middle of Manhattan.  I would probably stay here again for a rate of under $200.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text: Stayed here for three nights.  It is advertised as a four star hotel but at best it is a three star.  The room we stayed in was small even by NYC standards.  There was barely enough room for our carry on luggage.  Our window was covered with a rolling blind and no curtain.  This allowed light through early in the morning.  The room was quiet since it faced a condemned building.  The decor was cheap and there was no seating to relax on at the end of the day.

title: Great price for a really great location
text: Stayed for 4 nights at the City Club in the petite room - pretty small room, but enough if you're not spending much time in your room. Hotel was clean, we only once spotted a Cockroach - but i guess that's pretty usual for New York hotels in older buildings. A highlight were the delicious cookies we got every day and the service was nice as well.

title: Great Stay.
text: We stayed at the City Club Hotel with our 2 teenage boys in July and at the end of our holiday in Aug. The staff were very friendly and helpful, room was spotless and clean and smelled fresh. The location is great - a 2/3 blocks from Times Square - between Fifth Ave and Sixth Ave. We prefered this hotel to the big hotels on Times Square and would not hesitate to stay here again. Highly recommended if you like smaller boutique hotels.

title: Small, a bit shabby, but safe and a good location
text:
I stayed here for business for 10 days in June 2012, chosen because it was close to work as well as being close to attractions, and it was significantly cheaper for the dates compared to other hotels close by that I had stayed in previously. I'd actually give City Club 3.5 stars.

When walking in, the hotel lobby is tiny, and you may have to help yourself in with bags. However the service was excellent, very friendly which was appreciated after a long long journey from Melbourne. And I received friendly and helpful service the whole of my stay. 

The room itself was even smaller. Even by NY standards, there was barely room to put down my suitcases on one side of the bed, and if there had been two people, someone would have had to crawl out the end of the bed to get out. And it had the smallest wardrobe I have ever experienced, it was tiny, and with the snacks attached to the shelf in there, by the time I had hung up some dresses and trousers, they were covering the snack shelf, as well as my pants being folded over at the bottom. There was nowhere to put smaller garments or to store luggage so I ended up living out of my suitcase, and being creative in using other spaces to put things like toiletries (there weren't many options). The bathroom while pokey had a big shower, but with a shower curtain (which I really detest), the toilet was kind of unbolted from the floor so moved a bit, and there were no shelves to put anything. There was a separate bidet, if you like that. For me I would have preferred the space to be used for storage. Forget a work table. Funnily enough one of my colleagues was telling me how small her room was and when I saw it, it was a comparative palace. So if you want a bit more space, make sure you go for the slightly bigger upgrade.

The bed was comfy but it was a short double, not a queen, so my feet hung over the end, and there was just enough space for one small side table next to it. The power points were in strange locations. The room was well serviced every day, and I received complimentary chocolate chip cookies every day, which was a nice treat to come back.

The air-conditioning was incredibly noisy, but needed it on during the night as the room was too stuffy. And speaking of noise, you could hear everything that went on in the corridor (people walking passed), as well as hearing people talking/TV in rooms as you walked passed them which was a bit off-putting. The upside was that the room was not facing the road and was incredibly quiet. Overall the hotel itself was quiet and didn't disturb my sleep.

The hotel is marketed as "boutique" and I think they have the right intention. While a little shabby and strangely laid out, the room decor had a cool vibe, the linens were nice and the free toiletries were all good quality. If you're in a hurry, the lift is ancient and slow, and one was frequently being worked on when the other was (thankfully) going.

The hotel guide was out of date (in room dining menu was not correct) however the food was from the attached DB Bistro Moderne restaurant - which was excellent. Typically, breakfast was expensive and you're better off going to the diner just down the road or get great coffee from the coffee shop across the street. However, for dinner, the restaurant was one of the best restaurants I have ever been to attached to a hotel, and stand-alone an excellent restaurant. Really fantastic food. A great wine list, with an enthusiastic and helpful Sommelier, and we had brilliant service. A definite recommend if you want to spend the money on a nice dinner. Also a good bar if you just want to go in for a drink (good cocktails).

So you might think a lot of what I've mentioned above was negative, but really they were little things, and once I was used to my setup I really had a good stay for the limited time I was actually using my room. I felt safe, great location, good service, and if you just want a bed to rest after a exploring the city, then I would recommend the hotel.

title: Convenient Boutique Hotel adjacent to Time Square
text: A small jewel in the city just off Broadway. Perfect location. I much prefer this type of hotel to the huge mega tourist type. Polite staff, clean rooms, could use better lighting for putting on make-up, etc. But all in all, very pleasant.

title: Pleasantly Suprised!
text:
Had little expectation as we were a last minute booking (for just a Saturday overnight) to catch dinner & show with 3 of our kids (ages 15, 13 and 10).  The staff is exceptionally kind and the room was spotless! (2 things that matter VERY MUCH to me).  Linens were top notch, beds comfortable and bathroom updated with nice products and plush towels and robes.  Yes, the kids loved the cookies, but not as much as we loved the great location of this quaint hotel.  

Yes, I could hear some noise in the hallway as people were waiting for the elevator, but can honestly say it wasn't loud enough or long enough to bother me.  I was so happy with this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again...what a find!!

title: Efficient Business Hotel with (just enough) style
text: Central location for people doing business midtown - no lobby scene (which edits out the scenesters) but a very good hotel restaurant well-suited for business breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Nice touches like premium toiletries and cookies at bedtime.  Room for improvement: was surprised the hallways are not carpeted to minimize noise and the rooms are a little more tired than they appear in the photos. Pre-war bathroom charm. As a biz traveler, the room had everything I needed: nothing more, nothing less. If you want efficient in and out with a bit of style this is a great choice.

title: Localização Excelente
text: Hotel aconchegante, básico, sem complicação e com ótima localização. São muito atenciosos. Todas as manhãs deixam pendurado na porta o jornal New York Times e no fim da tarde deixam no quarto cookies com gotas de chocalates.

title: Great Little Hotel With Super Staff - Very Clean Room & Convenient Location
text: Before taking our first trip to New York City I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor before booking our trip through Travelocity.  Most important to me when booking was cleanliness and location - i wasn't disappointed.  The majority of the reviews for this hotel were positive, with a lot of comments about the small rooms.   We went expecting something very small, but we were pleasantly surprised.  I was traveling with my 4 teenagers and I can say we found the size just right given that we didn't spend a lot of time in the room - it was small but they made the most of the space.  Big plus for my taste - no carpet!!  That was great for cleanliness.  The bathroom was large with a big shower.  The staff was wonderful.  We arrived early and they checked our bags so that we could head out and enjoy the city until our room was ready.  They even took my cell number to call when the room was ready.  We got the same treatment on our way out - we checked out and they stored our luggage until we were ready for a pick-up at the hotel many hours after our check out.  The best chocolate chip cookies were waiting for us each night when we returned to the room - what a great touch to make you feel welcome.  There were videos to borrow from the front desk if you have time.  The location was wonderful - between 5th and 6th avenue - minutes to Times Square and the Toys R Us.  Keep your eye out for the door when you are looking for the hotel - it's easy to miss.  Just can't say enough about the staff, the hotel and the room.   Staying at City Club Hotel was wonderful.  Go in knowing the rooms are on the smaller side and you will see that the hotel is BIG on service.  We were on the second floor above the restaurant - no problems with noise at all - we slept great.
