Very Comfortable beds and generous amounts of pillows.  The day bed was very roomy and comfortable as well.  We will defintely stay here again if we get back to New York City.

title: Nice location and service
text: Close to Times Square and all the attractions. Clean rooms and good service. Price was regular. I forgot a suit pant and they sent me fast to Florida.  The bed was very confortable. Close to main train stations.

title: Very Pleased
text:
We stayed for a week for our trip in New York City and were very pleased with the hotel.  The room was quiet and comfortable with a surprisingly big shower.  The location was great, just a few blocks from times square yet very quiet. We were on the 5th floor and didn't hear any street noise or neighbors.  No views out the small windows, but the peace and quiet created a nice sanctuary after a busy day sightseeing.

We also liked the small personal touches, like the delicious chocolate chip cookies, the free daily paper and wifi, and the great recommendations for restaurants from the lobby staff.

Being in New York during a heat wave, we also appreciated the reliable air conditioning! We'd definitely stay here again.

title: Intimate space, great for a weekend in NYC
text: From the moment we arrived, they treated us as if we were home.  Welcoming staff are friendly and very helpful.  The rooms are not huge - they are however very efficient (and the bathrooms are very well appointed).  Look closely or you will miss the entrance.Feels very private and secretive.

title: Just what we needed
text:
The City Club is a little boutique hotel right across from the Algonquin.  My colleague and I were pleased with our 2 night stay.  I had a petite room which is quite small (of course), but it had more than enough space to handle my needs.  The finishings were nice and the bathroom quite large.  Wifi is free which was very useful.  The restaurant downstairs is good but very high end.  I was only a little disappointed in the attitude of one of the front desk people.  The whole staff was nice and accommodating except for one guy..  
Small Caution: My petite room wasn’t ready until after 4.  This could be standard

title: could have been heaven
text: the hotel is perfectly located and we were upgraded to a two story suite upon arrival. the room is so cool with many fancy decor and gadgets and two story high windows. It sounds perfect, I know but the noise! there is always too much going on on the street and these high windows provides no sound proof at all. You can actually listen the chat between the taxi drives waiting in the other side of the road. on top of this our room has two connection doors to the rooms in either side of it and these doors also make perfect vehicles to transfer every noise. we needed to call down to warn our neighbor at 2 AM since they are entertaining but we were kind of included without being invited. one more minus, there was very little number of employees around. no doorman since he is doing every foot job, I assume, only one person on the reception most of the time and no one else! with that price level we could make a better decision. I will stuck with the street but change the hotel next time.

title: Like a secret hotel
text:
The City Club Hotel kind of feels like a secret.  Squeezed between two larger hotels, and with the absence of the brown "CC" awning that I had seen in the photos, the only things that identified the presence of the hotel was the square nameplate on the wall and a glass door.

The petite room is exactly what the name implies, so there were no surprises in that regard.  The bathroom, however, took up a third of the whole room, which was great.  The flat screen TV was huge, and the closet was one of the smallest I've ever seen, so the room had a strange disproportionate feeling to it, but since the building is over a hundred years old I'm sure they did the best with what they had to work with.  The stifling heat outside meant that the air conditioning had to work pretty much non-stop, but the bed was really comfortable.  My room was facing the back, so there's not much to see except the back of another old building.  But I didn't spend that much time in the room anyway so that wasn't a big deal.

The room service comes from the adjoining restaurant, db Moderne Bistro.  I ordered dinner on my first night and it was great having restaurant quality food in my room.  I really loved the plate of chocolate chip cookies that was available each evening when the bed was turned down.

For me, this hotel met my needs for a weekend trip to NYC.  It was a few minutes away from both Times Square and 5th Avenue, and well within walking distance of most of the midtown sights (Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Terminal, etc).  I would stay here again.

title: Nice location and good service.
text: Nice location, not far from Time Square. The room was OK, the staff was always helpful. It was very hot in NY when we stayed at the hotel, and the air-condition was nice to have, but it was either always hot or cold there. A bit noise, but not too much.

title: Overpriced hotel with lazy receptionists in a good location
text: The first day, i almost got a large bathroom tile in my head when closing the door (gently). Two days later it was taped in place. There was a cockroach living in the bathroom the entire period we stayed. One day I asked the receptionists if they please could call me a taxi, and the answer was "no, sorry. You have to wait for the doorman". I waited ten minutes and gave up. The next door hotel workers on the other side were glad to help me get a cab. Choose one of those hotels instead :)

title: Oh my
text: I loved this place. Duplex room with the star spangled banner fluttering outside. Room was perfect. Staff were awesome whole experience was perfect. I would definitely stay again.

title: lock up your personal belongings...
text:
My friends and I went to NYC for a short wknd to watch Newsies on Broadway.  We wanted to find a place that was walking distance and my friend found this hotel on hotels.com for a good deal.  When we first arrived, it was a bit tricky to find the entrance of the hotel.  The location is definitely walking distance to many points of interest for tourists like Times Square, Rockafeller Center, Grand Central Station, to name a few.  

There were five of us and the room we booked had 2 full size beds and a day bed, so no one had to sleep on the floor or a cot, which was one of the main reasons why we booked the hotel.  We were having no problems with our room or the hotel until the second day we were there...

My friend had brought her ipad and when we left the room to explore the city one morning, she left it in her unlocked luggage in the room.  After a day of sightseeing, we returned to the room to find the ipad was missing.  We searched every corner of the room and everyone's luggage but no luck finding it.  She called the front desk and reported the missing item, and soon after 2 men knocked on the door to investigate the room and question my friend with the missing ipad.  They left telling us that this "wasn't the first time this has happened" and they would speak with the cleaning staff and check the security cameras.  They also said that it's their policy that cleaning staff never touches the guests' belongings, including their luggage.  Yes, we assume that is their policy, doesn't mean it can't be broken...

After some back and forth between my friend and the hotel staff on duty, she requested to speak to the manager.  Because it was a wknd the manager was not there but would give her a call on Monday.  The manager did return the call and spoke with my friend and put in a claim with their insurance but after a week or two my friend recieved a letter from the hotel's insurance stating they are not liable for stolen items in the hotel room, if the item was not in the room's safe or in locked luggage, therefore they cannot pay her for the lost/stolen item...

Sadly to say, the hotel did not compensate her for the ipad nor did they offer any alternative compensation for the loss of her belongings, like say, full or partial refund on the room.  

If it wasn't for the hotel's terrible customer service, our hotel stay would have been excellent.  

If you decide to stay here, lock up your belongings, whether in your luggage or the room's safe, behind a deceptively hidden closet door.  Or better yet, keep your valuables at home!

title: Very nice, NYC small
text:
I thought this hotel was really nice.  It has a very small lobby, a restaurant attached - bistro moderne - and is only 8 stories.  My room was very comfortable with 2 beds, a huge TV, a stocked bar, lovely shampoos, cotton swabs, etc., hairdryer, iron...  No coffee maker, though....  I used the computer on the 2nd floor - only 1 available.

Overall, I would go back again.  Cost me $575 for one night, though.

title: Good, but room for improvement!
text:
We loved the hotel's location. And would stay there again.

There were a couple of negatives, not major ones but worth mentioning.

Firstly, we were told very clearly that smoking was forbidden, this is great for our family as my wife and I do not smoke and we do not like it around our daughter either. We had booked 2 rooms, next to each other, and one of them smelled distinctly of old smoke. We noticed it every time we returned to the room.

We had booked the suites and our rooms were small-ish, bathrooms were large in comparison, which was odd. Not much room for hanging clothes either.

Rooms were generally clean, carpets have wear and tear though, but not too bad. The turn down service which is complimentary comes with warm cookies! Which I must say we enjoyed.

The elevators or at least one of them was a little temperamental too. Seemed to want to go in the wrong direction half of the time! And they were both HOT! Keep in mind it was around 30 or so degrees C when we were there.

Rooms had air-con, one of our rooms was always too cold and no way to adjust it down no matter what we tried, the other was a touch too warm. Again lack of real adjust-ability was the problem.

Beds are awesome! Really comfortable. Pillows are all feather as is the pillow top mattress cover. I found the pillows TOO soft, but at least there were many of them on the bed, so it worked out OK.

Location is superb! Being a smaller hotel, we did not hear any disturbing noises from the hallways, and we could not hear much in the way of noise from outside of the building. We would stay at the hotel again, as we found the location to be perfect for us. Close to Times Square and broadway, being between 5th and 6th Ave's was great for shopping too.

The staff were excellent. Very helpful with advice of places to go, and directions etc. Free WIFI was welcome too.

title: Will Return
text: Love this boutique hotel. The bell boy stopped traffic on 44th st. so we could reverse and park in garage. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a queen room. Our room was cozy and comfortable. Love the Bigelow toiletries. Overall, this hotel was a great value for the money and service was excellent!

title: Espetacular!
text:
Uma escolha excelente. Hotel muito aconchegante e com funcionários simpáticos e prestativos. 
E cookies que eles oferecem aos hospedes no final da tarde??? MARAVILHOSOS!!!

title: Hidden Gem
text: What a find for NYC. Reasonably priced, perfect location, clean comfortable room. Staff was personable and welcoming. Will surely go back.

title: Posizione tattica
text: Situato a 2 passi da times square permette un'esperienza verso la city sicuramente agevolata e confortevole. Vicino alle ferma della metro più importanti e ad un passo dalla fantastica fifth avenue. Accoglienza e gentilezza assicurate. Pulito e camere curate (ogni sera vi troverete 2 ottimi cookies al cioccolato ad accogliere il vostro rientro). Unico appunto riguarda la camera un po' troppo rumorosa e completamente priva di luce naturale (dava su un cortile interno molto buio)

title: Pobre
text: O hotel tenta ser o que não é. A frequencia de grupos muito barulhentos acaba denunciando a realidade. Portas que batem a noite toda e não permitem sossego. O apartamento é mal limpo e mantém um carpete anti-higienico sob a cama. O resto do piso é grudento. Não vale a relação custo-beneficio. Sequer sua exelente localização junto a Times Square se justifica

title: Pequeño, tranquilo, buena ubicación
text:
Tuvimos buena experiencia en general. Estuvimos alojados 7 noches. Al llegar al hotel pedimos un upgrade y nos cambiaron sin costo a una habitación mejor y mas grande que la que teniamos contratada. Creo que de solo pedirlo, si tienen disponibilidad, lo hacen, sobre todo si te quedas varios dias. Y la diferencia de precio era considerable entre una y otra habitación.
El lobby y los espacios comunes son pequeños, casi no parece un hotel sino un edificio con departamentos. Eso fue lo que menos nos gustó.
Fuimos en pleno verano. El aire acondicionado nos hacia renegar un poco porque no tenia termino medio. Pero mas allá de eso, no tenemos quejas. El diseño del baño es hermoso.
Todo impecable, la decoración, los detalles de la habitación, la comodidad de la cama y las galletitas que te dejan no tienen desperdicio. Tambien tiene frigobar.
La ubicación es ideal. Y creo que eso es lo mejor que tiene el hotel. Cerca de todo.
El restaurante espectacular. Está comunicado por dentro, aunque también tiene entrada independiente, creo que es frances, un poco caro, pero vale la pena aunque sea una noche para darse un gustito y probar. Comimos "coq au vin", una delicia, en un ambiente cálido y a la vez sofisticado.
No se si volveriamos al hotel porque nos gusta conocer distintos lugares, pero es una opción que recomiendo.

title: great location
text: This hotel was in a great location to walk to many attractions. The hotel and room was clean. The rooms are tiny , tiny, tiny but not unexpected in New York. The staff was great and very friendly and more than willing to help us with anything!

title: Business/leisure
text: Overall great place to stay. Location is very convenient and the rooms were clean. Perfect for A short business trip and great for a weekend stay in new York.

title: ottima posizione
text:
situato a pochi passi da times square e bryant park , metropolitana  vicino, estremamente comodo x una visita alla città.
pulitissimo personale molto cordiale e disponibile.ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.
le stanze sono pulite e confortevoli 
unico appunto le stanze vanno benissimo per 2 persone c'è un letto matrimoniale enorme (king size)ma  x 4 sono un pò sacrificate  c'è un divano e hanno aggiunto un lettto pieghevole 
l'armadio èun pò  scomodo e piccolo
il bagno invece è ampio e confortevole
è un hotel che consiglio

title: Holiday with daughter.
text:
I wanted a central location for our stay, so that we could walk to as many places as possible.This is a hotel to be used mainly as a base.The window views and natural light are minimal.If you want to be able to relax in your hotel room for a significant amount of time, then this is not the hotel for you.
This hotel was perfect for us and I would stay there again for eg a christmas shopping trip.The location is fabulous.Absolutely spot on.Inbetween 5th and 6th avenue and about 5 minutes to Times Square.The staff were delightful and extremely helpful in all respects.The bed was sooooo comfortable.Small room; large bathroom with good shower.Double bed plus sofa bed.
Cookies every evening, to return to and morning paper.
I would improve the lighting in the bedrooms and provide a kettle.Had a peep at the next sized bedroom up and would rather have that next time, I think.
I had read the reviews so I knew what I was getting.I got what I wanted for the trip.

title: A New One To me - And I Will Be Back!
text:
I can not believe that I have never stayed here before.  It is in a great location (44th between 5th and 6th) and a very personable boutique hotel environment.  If you need big crowds and big lobbies, don't go here, but if you like a nice room, nice people, a good locations, try it.

My room was big for NYC standards and had a king size bed, a big table, nice comfy chair and a window seat.  The TV was like a 47" or 50" set too! :).  Bathroom well equiped - big shower and big sink, you weren't balancing your stuff on top of things you would rather not touch...

Only complaint was that the room was warm even with AC cranked, but I would go here every time my budget allowed!

title: Fantastico!
text: Siamo rimasti affascinati da questo hotel in pieno centro a Manhattan, a 2 passi da Times Square e in una zona elegante. L'entrata è piccola ma l'hotel è disposto su vari piani, le camere sono enormi, spaziose, la tv è apparsa magicamente dietro a un vetro! Il bagno enorme e pulitissimo, di marmo, con accappatoi in microfibra e quant'altro. La mattina poi appeso alla maniglia c'era il Times! Non c'è la colazione compresa, ma questo in quasi tutti gli hotel di Manhattan. Poi al secondo piano c'è il computer collegato a internet e la possibilità di stampare (ad esempio x fare il check-in online). Insomma ci tornerei subito! E il prezzo non esagerato, per essere così chic (siamo stati in altri hotel a quella cifra molto più brutti), anche perchè era un'offerta estiva. Insomma consigliatissimo!

title: Club privileges without the membership fees!
text:
For my annual jaunt to New York, I always book boutique hotels since I want to stay away from the overly touristy crowds and noise that large hotel chains have. I went on Priceline.com and found it at a great price and decided that it would be decent since I had dinner at DB Bistro Moderne their attached restaurant and was impressed with their style and service.  And upon my arrival, the hotel did not disappoint - it IS a small but stylish hotel and has all the things necessary for a stay.

City Club also located within a short brisk 10 minute walk from the Port Authority which is perfect since it works for the majority of airport transportation services I use.  I went Newark Airport Express this time.

What I liked best: 
. Great service, the front desk staff member Danielle was knowledgeable and efficient.  She direct us to two local restaurants (one for lunch and the other for brunch and both were great value and food) 
. Check out time is Noon and free wireless
. Delicious cookies with turn down service
. Hand delivered bills the evening before
. Locally produced and distributed toiletries by CO Bigelow  

What to live with:
. Dark hallways and little natural light in the room (I expected as much so wasn't surprised)
. No frills lobby and amenities 

If you're looking for a small hotel with style and substance rather than fluff, this is the place to visit.

title: Perfect boutique hotel!
text: Just returned from NYC with my husband and 14 year old son. They had never been to NYC before and were very impressed!  Our stay at City Club Hotel was great.  It was a perfect fit for us because we were able to stay in a queen luxe room which had a very comfortable queen size bed and also a single "day bed" for our son.  Most NYC hotels only offer 2 "double beds" so this was a benefit for us.  A good nights sleep is very important after walking the city all day and then getting up the next day to do it all over again!  The room was quite small, but the bathroom was huge! Nice amenities, and closet and mini bar were hidden behind the wall! ( our 14 year old thought that was so cool! )  I have to say, it was a nice change from our usual "Marriott" kind of hotel room.  It enhanced the whole NYC experience!  We did have one problem though. Our air conditioning broke on the second night, and the staff was there with a fan but couldn't do anything about it until the next day, and the hotel was completely booked!  Luckily the temp was ok.  The fan helped,  and by the time we arrived back in our room the following day it was working again. We might not have been as happy if it had been in the middle of summer though!  All in all, it was a pleasant experience and I would reccommend this hotel to friends.

title: Good value, decent service, hard to fault
text:
First stay in NYC, had feared the worst in terms of service and value but pleasantly surprised by city club. Kindly upgraded from a petite room to a larger one. Turn down service is a nice touch, that few pricier hotels would even bother with. 
Only minor gripe, was that booking website advertised that access to NYC sports club was included in the rate, this was actually $15 extra. Not their fault, but something to beware of. Otherwise great service all round, will be returning next month.

title: Expensive and security is a bit too loose , but great location
text:
Yes, the location is fantastic ... IF you want to hang out near Times Square or Rockefeller Center.  But there is so much else to see in New York, not sure this will always be the ideal place to stay -- especially given the high cost of a room.  And those rooms are not very big!  But then again, we're talking Manhattan, where there is never a real big room to rent.  

Bed was comfy.  Ask for a room on the side of the building.  You won't have a view of anything, but the room will be almost soundproof.  You'll get a great night sleep, guaranteed.

If you're driving, there's a garage across the street you can park in for a small discount.  This being New York, even with the discount, we're still talking $35 per 24 hours.
 
Big plus here: close to subways.  Big minus: virtually no security at all.  We walked in several times, with no person in sight to make sure we were actual customers.  Anyone can walk in, take the elevator to any floor, and wait to accost a guest.  Not good.

title: A magnificent city gem!
text: I am a regular customer at the City Club. I usually stay at this wonderful hotel for business. This is definitely a chic hotel located in the heart of Manhattan. The decor is fabolous and the room is adequately supplied with various kinds of amenities but don't indulge too much since a can of soda can be quite pricey. Times Square and the broadway theatres is a short 5 min walk away. The staff is unbelievably friendly. I was quite suprised that they remembered my name during my first night there. I love how they leave freshly made chocolate chip cookies in the evening. The rooms are very quiet which is remarkable due to its location.  The quality was great for its value, plus the beds are quite comfy.  I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. You will not be disappointed.

title: Wonderful location!
text: Clean, tastefully decorated and best of all, very quiet hotel 1 or 2 blocks from all the theaters.  The rooms are kind of small (they do look just like the internet pictures, just smaller in real life).  We didn't feel cramped, though.  It seemed kind of pricey at first, but I did some more research and its right in line with the other hotels in midtown, including the "chain" hotels" and City Club is much better than those.  We stayed in a Queen luxe (3 days) and it was the best nights sleep we've had away from home in years.  We did not try the DB restaurant next door (very busy, though, so it must be pretty popular), but we did patronize the Red Flame Diner two doors down.  "Regular diner prices" (meaning CHEAP) right in Mid-town!  It was great!  Gregory's coffee shop across the street has the freshest muffins in town...melt in your mouth!  We would definitely stay here again.  Use one of the internet travel sites (orbitz, etc) to book instead of City Club website and save 20% or so.

title: Fabulous Location
text: A chic hotel in a location that can't be beat.  Free wi-fi and a very comfortable bed are the two best points.  Would have liked a coffeemaker in the room, as the only bar/restaurant is the rather pricey DB Bistro.  Loved the turn down service with cookies each night and the New York Times delivered to the door each morning.  Walked everywhere thanks to the unbeatable location. Only drawback is that there is currently construction next door at the Algonquin and they start promptly at 7:00 a.m.

title: Times Square convenience
text:
City Club hotel is definitely botique. Cost was fair (~300/night) given that it was 5 family members and the proximity to Times Square. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room did not have a lot of space for luggage/hanging clothes and desperately needs more hooks to hang towels. HVAC was challenging (a lot of fluctuation between hot and cold).

Very convenient to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and shopping. Parking garage right across from the hotel ($45/night!). 

Hotel signage out front was very limited. Unless you know the exact address, you'll drive and then walk right by it.

title: Excelente Ubicación, Regresaremos
text: Nos hospedamos en este hotel en enero del 2012, la ubicación es excelente, a 2 cuadras de time square y todo queda cerca, las habitaciones muy buenas amplias y comodas, eramos un grupo bastante grande, así que teniamos 3 habitaciones dobles, viajamos con 3 niños, uno de ellos de 7 meses, y no tenemos queja, el espacio de la habitación, excelente, la calefacción buenisima (super importante para esta época), nunca comimos en el restaurant del hotel, pero casi al lado hay un restaurat excelente con gran variedad que sirve para desayunar, almorzar o cenar:  Buen trato por parte del personal del hotel y algunos en la recepción hablan español.  Y a diario colocan unas galletas exquisitas, Definitivamente nos hospedaremos aqui cuando volvamos a new york

title: NEW YORK IN FEB
text: The hotel was very conveniently situated and the room was very nice. The beds were comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. The bathroom was also large and more than sufficient for our requirements of 5 adults.

title: In the middle of everything...
text: City Club Hotel was a nice surprise. We got a great deal at Cheaprooms.com and to our surprise it was chic and very close to what we were doing.(Bryant Park, Dinner,etc...) The desk clerk was very elegant and even gave us a room upgrade because they didn't have the room I pre-booked. It seems like a small hole-in-th-wall, but inside it was inviting and the rooms were very col and comfortable. We will definately stay again in the future.

title: Perfect accommodations in a prime spot at an amazing price
text: Looking for a quick stay in an odd month in the city. Found city club via hotels.com. It's in a great spot on 44th between 5th and 6th which made walking almost anywhere an easy task. When I arrived my room wasn't ready at 2:30 so I left my bags with them and came back at night. They upgraded me to a queen deluxe room simply for the short wait. The room was great. Comfy bed, thoughtful amenities and free Internet. The staff was friendly but not intrusive. I'm going back that's for sure

title: Fab hotel in New York - absolute gem!
text: I have been to new york loads of times and only once before have I had a room as spacious as this, which is a first for new york. I am not bothered about not having a pool or gym in the hotel if the room makes up for it and this without any doubt does. The room and bathroom are spacious which is rare for new york. Location also superb. Only disapointing feedback would be that the carpet by the bed needs cleaning as did the sofa cushions. Also the cupboard with the safe in was at a ridiculous angle making it really hard to put stuff in and take out without knocking the clothes in the wardrobe and was hard to see as the space was soo dark. Staff exceptionally helpful. Would def stay again. Shame they do not include breajkfast as part of their rates. Prob should not recommend as may get busy and more expensive if popular.

title: Cozy, comfortable, great hotel
text: Although the room we had was really small and we really didn't have anywhere to store our luggage, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and well serviced.  City Club is very quaint and is nestled in a great location. Great walking distance to Time Square, Bryant Park, Rockefeller, the subway, etc.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I thoroughly enjoyed the two fresh baked chocolate chip cookies for the turn down service!  They were delicious.  We will stay there again upon returning to New York.

title: Quaint and Sophisticated
text: My husband surprised me with a get-away weekend for our anniversary.  Normally, I plan our trips, so I was pleasantly surprised with his choice of hotels.  The City Club is a quaint hotel in a great location.  We were even surprised with an upgraded room upon check in.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were clean and well appointed and two fresh baked chocolate chip cookies were on the bed after turn down service!  The decor is right up my alley; modern!  I really like the small, boutique hotels in NYC as they generally offer a more quiet atmosphere than the larger hotels do.  My only complaint and this was not the hotel's fault- some rude parents (both mornings) were letting their small children run the halls and play with the elevators.

title: Cozy and comfortable at modern City Club Hotel
text: What a great find!  I found a great, conveniently located hotel in New York City -- the City Club Hotel.  We traveled to New York on dec. 26 to attend an event in the theater district.  The rooms were cozy and well appointed -- very modern looking.  The lighting added to the appeal (think trendy night club lighting).  The bed was very comfortable and the tv was a good size.  We had free wifi and I thought the nightly rate was perfect!  The room also had a built in day bed which was nice.  We will surely stay there again.  There is a diner next door for breakfast, a parking lot across the street and it is in walking distance to time square.

title: Great location, great hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here in November 2011 for a week visiting NYC. Great location, great staff and very comfortable rooms. There's a restaurant next door great for breakfast. Walking distance to Times Square and Broadway districts. We would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: I frequent the City Club monthly for business purposes and it has become my home away from home. The staff is fantastic and always accomodating, whatever my needs may be.  Some of the rooms definitely need some TLC and updating, though.  Also, the rooms near the elevator can be noisy at nighttime and the walls are thin.  You can hear EVERYTHING.  The rooms are always very clean, the beds and linens are comfy and you can't go wrong with the fresh chocolate chip cookies that are left bedside every night at turndown service.  Room service is prompt and the food is wotht the money.  Location is superb and centrally located, within walking distance to many area attractions, shopping and dining.  The location pays for itself.

title: Needs Remodeling - 3 Stars at best
text: This hotel is advertised above 4 stars, but it is 3-stars at best in my opinion. Our room needed remodeling. The wallpaper was old and worn. The rugs were stained. There was no real desk to work from in the room, just a small table. The tile shower was nice and the toilet had plenty of flush power. The bed was firm and comfortable. The hallways ARE dark as others have pointed out. The lobby is very small. The location is terrific two blocks from Times Square and about 5 blocks from Rockefeller Center. The staff is friendly and helpful. They bring you warm cookies each night which is nice. But 4 stars? No way. I was expecting better for the money and the star rating. You are really paying for location with this one.

title: noisy..but not the hotel's fault
text:
I stayed here just one night, traveling for work. Like everyone else says, the location is perfect and the hotel itself looks great and the staff was very friendly.  I booked a queen room and was upgraded to the 2 story king.  Great concept and lovely room.  Only problem with being on 44th was the noise.  Holy cow.  It was loud until 4am and then only quiet for an hour.  This might not bother many other people, but trying to fall asleep when you're two hours ahead of your natural clock is hard when it's loud. So, if quiet is really important to you - be sure to tell the front desk.  They were super nice and helpful. Now, about that couch with the blanket...guys, really?  I love a bed and breakfast, and can appreciate "homeyness" when appropriate - but that couch is old, dirty and uncomfortable.  Might consider this for replacement, and wash the blanket.  Gross.

Turn down cookies and breakfast menu at 7:30 were nice touches, although I didn't get to enjoy breakfast.  Room service was timely and prompt with delivery.  The guy said he'd be back in an hour to pick up the tray, I waited 90 minutes and called for pickup.  30 minutes later I placed the tray outside of my room, put the dnd sign on the door and went to bed.

All in all, I would stay here again.  Loved the concept, the location and free wireless internet.  I'd just ask for a quiet room and go out for dinner.

title: Excellent Location and lovely staff.
text:
Myself and 4 girly friends stayed the first week in december and thought the hotel and staff were great.  Perfect location for times square, 5th ave, central park, bryant park etc.  There were 5 of us sharing the one room, a Luxe double double, and it was not cramped at all.  The room was of a high standard.  However we did have a giggle trying to figure out where the tv was, we eventually realised it was behind the mirror.  Every evening when we came back to our room we found a plate of cookies,VERY delicious, along with the following days weather forecast.  The staff couldnt be more friendly or helpful.  The girls on the desk were great for suggesting great eateries - Panna Notte just after 55th street on 6th ave for those interested and Ricky and Ray were great for getting us taxis.  Overall we had a great stay at the City Club Hotel and we all said we would come back here and recommend it to friends.

5 Nutty Girls from Scotland. :-)

title: Thanksgiving
text: We stayed with our two kids five days for thanksgiving and it is really difficult to get a good size room in Manhattan. This hotel has new modern decorated rooms with plenty of space and good service

title: Thank you City Club
text: Found this gem via web search. Reluctant because priced well below others in area.  What a great surprise!  Simple non-descript front awning, no front desk to speak of but super friendly staff. Queen room was decent size, well decorated, spotlessly clean. Bathroom was beautiful and fully updated.  Knock on door at 7:30 with freshly baked cookies. Great location...easy walk to Times Sq (1 1/2 blocks) and Rock Center (10 minutes). The friendly staff, quality of room and unbeatable location helped make this family trip memorable.  Will absolutley return.

title: overrated
text:
One word. Overpriced.
I had booked a non-smooking, queen luxe room but there was nothing luxurious about it. The room was quite dark. Sure I was not expecting a view of Times Square or the Empire but of the two windows in the room, one was facing a wall and the other one a dirty alley. I had to keep the blinders down at all times. The room itself was small, without carpet on the floor and with mismatched furniture.
Well, at least it was clean!
The bathroom was large and quite comfortable. The only annoying thing was the shower (no bathtub). It had a cheap plastic curtain falling directly on the floor. So, when taking a shower it was quite a challenge to keep the water from spilling out to the center of the room.
Location is great, but I'm sure there are better accommodation options around this area.
This should be a three stars hotel.

title: Quiet jewel in midtown
text: This little jewel is in the perfect spot to enjoy all that midtown Manhattan has to offer. Two blocks to Times Square, two blocks to Grand Central, and two blocks to Bryant Park. They have a few suites that are very nice for that special weekend, but for the quietest stay ask for an inside room. Continental breakfast is served in their "Hot Spot" late night bar or directly to your room. I have staying here for 5 years, and miss it dearly when it get's booked. So book early.

title: gem of a hotel in midtown NYC
text:
Spent two nights in this hotel over a weekend and loved it.  It's a terrific little boutique hotel in a very convenient midtown location.  Close to the the theatre district, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Central Park and a good jumping off point to go anywhere in the city.

The rooms were nicely decorated in neutrals, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious - quite large by NY standards.  Great shower with good water pressure, dark marble and a white pedestal sink.  The only down side to the bathroom was the light above the sink wasn't bright enough for putting on make up.  Even my husband said it was a bit dark for shaving too.  Otherwise the towels were thick and although we didn't use them, there were two nice robes hanging up in the bathroom.

The closet is concealed in one of the walls in the bedroom and unfortunately in our room the only place to mount the flat-screen TV was over the full length mirror in the bedroom.  That made the mirror un-useable unless you wanted to sit on the floor.  There was a nice built in couch/window seat which was a great place to lay out your clothes, etc. since there was no bureau. 

Floors are not carpeted but there were some area rugs next to the bed.  The room was quiet although we did hear other guests come in one night at 4am.  Their door was right next to ours, so you can't blame the hotel for that - more like inconsiderate guests at that hour.

The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful when asked for directions or recommendations on places to eat.  Although we didn't have a chance to eat at DB Bistro Moderne the restaurant on the street level of the hotel, it had come highly recommended by a friend of ours.

We loved the City Club Hotel and would definitely return the next time we're in NYC.

title: Very comfortable
text: Beautifully appointed, modern, luxurious rooms; a spacious bathroom with a great shower, comfortable bed with luxurious duvet and linen, all amenities provided.   Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Wonderful location between 5th and 6th avenues in midtown Manhattan. My only complaint is that the room looked out onto a ventilation shaft, so there was almost no natural light!  Next time I will ask for a room looking over the street.

title: Brilliant wee Hotel
text: Not keen on massive hotels this appealed due to it's smaller stature and location.  We weren't disappointed.  The room was lovely and plenty of room for all our stuff.  Great location, pleasant staff.  Would stay here again.

title: Nice
text: Just finished a three day stay for business.  The rooms were a nice size for NYC and the open shower was great. The location is awesome as is the service.  Going back next week.

title: Great urban bolt hole
text: I spent two nights here last December when, along with family and half the world, I came to Manhattan to see a show and enjoy the town, all decked out for Christmas. The hotel was recommended to me by my brother, who stays here frequently.  Still, I was surprised to step off the street into this sort of large hallway that passes for the lobby.  At the end of the lobby/hallway is the reception desk - stepping up to reception feels more like buying a ticket than checking in to a hotel - but then you get your key and around the corner you go to the elevators and up to where a normal-sized hotel awaits you!  Pretty neat!  The room was nicely appointed, the bathroom marbled to a fare-thee-well.  This is an efficient, high standard urban bolt hole and I liked it a lot.

title: Amazing Experience
text: I recently stayed at the City Club in NYC. We stayed  in one of the 2 story suites and it was absolutely amazing. The amount of space was unlike any other in NYC. The location of the hotel was great. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. They made our stay extra special.

title: Wonderful staff, great location but -
text:
44th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues is a wonderful spot to kick off NYC shopping or theater going, the Sofitel, the Iroquois, the Algonquin and City Club share the block. I've had frequent stays at the Sofitel, which I love, but a great deal on Expedia made me decide to try the City Club. 
The staff is professional, discreet, very pleasant and helpful. They are the hotel's biggest asset. I had opted for a queen room, as a reviewer suggested those rooms faced the street with good daylight.  Mine did not.  Both windows faced brick walls and a small alley. The room is small, ok for one person, two would make it very tight, and the television is small and old fashioned, no flat screens here! The bed linens were a good quality, and the bathroom of  black marble contained an exceptionally large shower (where a wonderful soaking tub could have been!). The bed was not firm, and actually sagged a bit in the middle. Time to replace it!  The free WIFI was a plus, I had not difficulty with it in my location, and my ATT cell phone had decent reception.
The big plus for the City Club is you can  order room service from the menu of DB Bistro Moderne, next door.  Which I did, and was served by the course, as requested.  
And the room was very clean, and small can be cozy. And did I say that the staff is wonderful?
But if you do not like very dark "moody" corridors in hotels, (poor night vision need not stay here), and you want spacious and airy, don't consider City Club. BUT  if service, and location are important, do consider this more than adequate boutique style hotel. I will probably try it again for another stay with a specific request for a front facing room, just because the staff is that  great.

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed at the City Club a week ago for one night.  We wish we could have stayed longer!  Although it was a short stay the hotel exceeded our expectations.  We arrived early and the manager (Hugo) suggested a perfect spot down the street for lunch.  We were pleasantly surprised when went back to check in as we were upgraded to a suite.  It was beautiful, with a two story window looking out onto 44th street, a small balcony, and a spiral staircase up to a loft/bedroom and bath.  We were meeting a friend for drinks and Hugo suggested a great nearby lounge.  The room was incredibly comfortable and quiet and we'll definitely be back!

title: Fair to middling
text: I've stayed at City Club Hotel before, and the location is excellent. Staff is professional and efficient. However, I stayed in a room this time that was dark, small and had an antique, loud air conditioner unit. The free WIFI is clunky and difficult to use. Cell phones don't function well in many of the rooms. I saw a large roach in my room, and when I told the front desk, I found the response fairly non-reactive. Showers have good pressure and heat. Hotel is starting to feel quite dated.

title: Ottimo hotel
text:
Il City Club hotel è in una posizione ottima a Manhattan e precisamente sulla 44° veramente vicinissimo a Times Square.
Consiglio vivamente questo hotel, ideale per visitare New York.
Al nostro arrivo c'era disponibilità e ci hanno dato l'upgrade in una camera spaziosa, bella e molto confortevole, il bagno ampio e bellissimo. 
Il personale è cortese e molto disponibile.
Al mio arrivo l'asciugacapelli non funzionava e me lo hanno subito sostituito.

Nel tardo pomeriggio il personale dell'hotel lascia in ogni camera un piattino con i cookies al cioccolato in camera.

CONSIGLIATISSIMO!

Ottima posizione, vicinissimo a Times Square ed ideale per visitare NYC. Personale molto professionale e gentilissimo. Ottima struttura.

title: City Club Hotel
text: An accomodative friendly staff matched by a good mid town location and well equipped rooms.  I have stayed in many mid town hotels in New York and found City Club Hotel to be one of the best priced high quality small hotels available.

title: City Club 2.0
text:
Almost 5 years ago, I gave this place two huge thumbs up.  I decided to return to see if my experience could be replicated.  It was not, it was exceeded!!!  As usual the doorman was ready with both assistance with luggage and advice about things to do.  I booked late and through a third party site, during a very busy time in NY.  While I was prepared for a broom closet with a bed, I was upgraded without request upon arrival.  Later in my stay I met the manager who seemed genuinely welcoming which seems almost surreal in NY.   I had to come back to the city the following week, and mentioned this to the manager as I was checking out.  I had checked the 3rd party site, but the City Club wasn't showing any availability.  Not only did the manager secure a room for me, but also at an extremely competitive price.  He also gave me his card.  I shot him an email the next week to inform him of my arrival time and BOOM.  Another upgrade, this time to the two story suite.  All I can say is don't die and go to heaven without staying in one of these unique rooms which bring the original crown molding casts into arms reach, boast two story windows, and a spiral staircase that is ultra hip....amazing, and would be well worth the standard suite price.  Let me give 2 more quick asides about this place.  1.  I was running late when i realized that I had forgotten a toiletry item.  A call down to the front desk rendered a knock on my door within 2 minutes - this is the advantage of a truly boutique hotel.  Larger 5 star properties would be hard pressed to match that response time.  2.  The front desk called to tell me that my driver had arrived.  Then a few seconds later called back to inform me that it had begun to rain lightly and I should be sure to bring my courtesy umbrella from the room.  The City Club is still in a great central location, with great design, and amenities, but it continues to shine because of the great service from the staff top to bottom.  My wife wants to see the Yankee's in the playoff's for our Anniversary.  Anybody wanna guess where we'll be staying?  
Cheers

title: Best Staff Ever
text:
Stayed at this hotel last week, long story short, GREAT HOTEL.

i will jump right to the size which was in concern for most. in terms of the room size, mind you this is NY, if you have been to london, paris or amsterdam you know it's more than rightly-sized!
hotel room was clean, room service are efficient and they really do their jobs unlike other hotels where they re-place the beddings and place the shampoo and leave
bed was comfortable enough though i've seen better
the staff were great, from the doorman to the clerk right upto the manager who was helpful and trying to help
we were given an early check in, although it was too busy week "UN general assembly"
you get new york times on your door in the early morning, cookies awaits you when you come back along with a card showing you the weather predictions
free wifi which is a big bonus
time square is just under 3 minutes walk, literally!!!! 
next door restaurant is always packed, seems nice, haven't tried it though
---
again, the room size, bc i read some where you can't find a place to put your luggage. i came in with my wife, along with 4-weeks worth of southern california shopping, that's 6 pieces, 4 of them are the largest pieces you could check in at the airport and two carry on other than our backpacks; we found a place for that... you have a space right infront of the door when you open it like 1.5 sq m, and you have the closet, which is spacious
---
bathroom was clean and well equipped with what would you expect from an upscale hotel

just book this hotel, it's NY, you're here for the time square or the east side of town, which is really close, not like time square though
there's no such thing as the perfect hotel; but this one came close!!!

title: Solid mid-town Manhattan choice
text: You can't judge Manhattan hotels against those anywhere else in the known universe: Prices are absurb, given the so-so quality of rooms in general.  Judged against other mid-town, theater-district hotels, the City Club Hotel is a good, functional choice.  Positives: The excellent location on 44th Street's "club row" right between the venerable Algonquin and Iroquois Hotels; a wonderfully helpful front-desk staff; reasonably spacious rooms (by New York bed-in-a-closet standards); good bedding; excellent, flexible lighting; two glorious chocolate-swirl cookies with the turn-down service (one of the very few times I've been impressed by such "freebie" snacks); thorough cleanliness; and no sign of bedbugs (a serious problem in Manhattan today).  The negatives: Rooms need refreshing (getting just a bit tatty here and there); gloomy, horror-movie-dark hallways; and, despite trading on the location in the former City Club, there's no trace of the old club atmosphere or interior architecture.  The rack-rate can stun out-of-towners, but it's the best deal on this still-distinguished block.  Bottom line: I would stay here again--not least, thanks to the great front-desk staff.

title: CAVEAT EMPTOR!!
text: Nice staff, good location (we had a meeting at the Harvard Club), great restaurant - but be warned - the King Luxe (unless, as we were told, it's on the front of the hotel) is a joke in terms of size, especially for two people (my wife and me) and at damn near $500/night.  I had cancelled at The Mansfield down the street because of poor reviews about the size of the rooms!  Lord knows how small they must be.  For example, the foot of the king bed is TWO feet from the wall.  I literally had to walk sideways in order to get from one side of the bed to the other.  The "separate sitting area" served as the only place to put our luggage.  There is no drawer space for those anticipating a longer stay, and the closet is so small that we ended up hanging most of our clothes from the shelf over the seating area.  Elsewhere you'll read reviews about the TV behind a mirror.  Well, there's a reason.  There isn't enough space in the room to have a TV on a stand or even to hang a flat screen on the wall.  Nice idea for space saving.  Best I can tell from peering through the mirror it also is an excuse for providing nothing more than an antiquated CRT TV instead of the flat screen that is now standard fare in even most Hampton Inns.  Here's my suggestion.  I got a peak at a queen room, and it seemed bigger, but if you want a king size bed either demand (i.e. a request won't do!!) a guaranteed King Luxe on the street side of the hotel (which also presumably includes some light from outside) or stay elsewhere (unless you like accommodations like the cabin on a boat) and come to db Moderne bistro to eat.

title: THE hotel in NYC
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 3 days, went to Philadelfia for one day, and came back to stay for 5 more days. At both stays, our room was upgraded, they kept our bags during our one day trip, and let us check in 7 hours in advance when we came back. 
The staff was really friendly, and was able to help us at every request our doubt. Plus, every night they left us delicious cookies along with the next day´s weather forecast. 
I totally recommend it! We will be back next year for another Labour Day holiday.

title: Best Place to Stay in New York City!!
text:
As a native New Yorker, I can pretty much pick out a winner amongst restaurants and hotels...and I have never experienced hospitality as I did at the City Club.
My husband and I decided to stay at a hotel for a relative's wedding, just to get away from home and join the rest of the wedding party at the City Club. I'm SO glad we stayed here.
The City Club is unlike any other hotel in New York - the staff is genuinely friendly, SUPER accomodating, and very gracious. 
The front desk treated us like royalty, and the manager (Hugo) was spectacular. He made us feel like family and treated us with such courtesy and consideration.
Not to mention the location! Right in the heart of Midtown, we were able to hang out a few blocks away at Rockefeller Center & Times Square! 

I've stayed at other 5-star hotels, but The City Club really went above and beyond. It was clean, the decor was gorgeous, and the shower in the bathroom was amazing!! 
Best stay I've had in a very long time!

Thank you City Club Staff!!

I will continue to recommend you to all my friends & family!

Becca M.
Brooklyn, NY

title: Loved it and will always come back!!!!
text: I stumbled across City Club Hotel on Expedia and decided to give this place a try. I arrived to the hotel very late and as soon as I pulled in front I was greeted with nothing but smiles. My trip was only four days but I had such a great experience I decided to extend! Recently just booked another trip to stay at City Club Hotel. The staff are more than accommodating, on top of that even the Hotel manager, Hugo Yanes, went above and beyond to make sure my stay was amazing! They are professionals at what they do and will go out of their way to make you are taken care of. That's what I call hospitality! I've stayed there long enough to actually notice them greet every single guests that leaves and enters. The rooms are decorated with class. The beds are plush and incredibly comfortable. In some rooms they even have a bidet. Reminds me of Europe:) Also, they have these delicious baked cookies that are delivered to you every single day. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. I'm a traveler and this hotel is BY FAR one of the best. If you are looking for a humble place to stay while in NYC, with chic ambiance, I highly recommend giving them a stay! City Club Hotel has become my home away from home.

title: 大都会のホテル
text:
予約確認のメールには全ての部屋にバスタブ付き、セイフティボックス有りと書いてありましたが、私が泊まった部屋はシャワーだけで、セイフティボックスもありませんでした。
リゾートホテルにしか泊まったことない人は、部屋の狭さに驚くかもしれません。六畳くらいのスペースにクイーンベッドが置いてあり、大きいスーツケースは広げられません。デスクもないので、食事、身支度は全てベッドの上でしました。窓の外はすぐ壁で、全く日が入らず、朝なのか夜なのか分からず閉塞感がありました。そしてミニバーがクローゼットの中にあって、パンツくらいの長さの物を掛けると、グラスやスナック類の上にかかってしまう状態に！大都会のホテルという感じでした。
私は一人旅で、ホテルでゆっくり過ごすことはなかったので、立地と値段を考えれば、満足でした。但し、私がチェックアウトした日からはハイシーズンで値段が3倍（450ドル）になっていたので、その値段であの部屋なら辞めた方がいいと思います
ホテル自体は古いですが、部屋はリフォームしてあり水回りはとても奇麗で、おしゃれ。水圧、お湯の温度は問題なかったです。シーツやタオル、バスローブなども質の良いものを使っていて、とても清潔、客への心遣いが感じられました。なんといっても無料のwi-fiとiPodドッグがあるのが最高で、チョコチップクッキーやアメニティも大満足でした。従業員やハウスキーパーも皆若くて、さわやか、とても親切でしたので好感が持てました。
別の部屋に泊まれるなら、次回も是非ここに泊まりたいです

title: City Club = Comfort, Class, & Cleanliness!!
text:
From the moment we stepped out of our car in front of the CIty Club Hotel, it was apparent that we were in for a once in a lifetime experience. Lucas and Socorro greeted us with a warm and friendly manner and made sure my wife and I were acclimated to our new surroundings. 
For 3 days we felt like we had their direct attention, not to mention the manager, Hugo Yanes, who was not only very professional but extrememly kind and helpful in every way. In short, we can say that we felt comfort beyond any other hotel we have ever stayed at. The building itself is impressive in decor and cleanliness, and the kindness of the staff made it really enjoyable and most relaxing.

Thank you Hugo & the rest of the CIty Club staff!! We love you guys and will be back for the New Year!!!

title: Great hotel, good staff and perfect location
text: Stayed 6 nights in the City Club - great location on 48th street between 5th and 6th Ave - perfect spot to get to the best in Manhattan - the King deluxe rooms were lovely - very clean and staff very helpful. Would return to them when in New York again. Rates were reasonable too for the height of the summer. Overall an excellent stay.

title: unexpected surprise
text:
I visit NYC often (about once a month) to see theater and to shop and I have a set group of hotels I usually stay in....I found this little "gem" by accident because I only needed a room for a night and only for one person so I reserved a petite room that was very affordable for the stay.
I have to say that it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had in any city in any country. I was treated like a queen by the staff and Hugo and Lauren were absolutely hotel class and professionalism at its best.
It is a bit small, but the quality is HUGE!  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great value for money
text:
We were stuck in New York due to the hurricane and had to find a hotel quickly as ours was full.  The hotel looked after our bags the night before as we were due to arrive in the middle of the hurricane.  The room was really nice but a bit small.  It was still amazing value for money.  The bathroom is my perfect bathroom.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Our friend was upgraded to a super room so definitely worth spending a little more for a better room.  The hotel is very conviently located and even though central, it isn't too close to Time Square so not full of tourist attractions.  
The only issue is that the gym pass was not included in the rate if you don't book directly with the hotel.  I would definitely stay there again but next time I would pay for a better room.

title: Quiete, coccole e design...in centro
text: Complimenti...siamo rimasti piacevolmente sorpresi e soddisfatti di questa isola di stile e confort. Personale cortese, educato e sorridente, servizi eccellenti. Camera piccola ma dotata di ogni comodità, dal mega schermo connesso in internet al frigobar a tutti gli accessori di qualità. Menzione d'onore al bagno che da solo merita il costo della camere. Sono curati tutti i dettegli dalla buonanotte con i biscottini al cioccolato al buongiorno con una borsetta di cotone contenente il new york Times. Torneremo

title: fanatstic hotel with great friendly staff
text:
I have just spent an extended five nights at the city club new york due to the so called hurricane Irene... 

This hotel is a real gem close to all the action at times square... the staff are exceptional from the people who service the rooms to the manager Hugo, 
The front desk people always great you with a smile which seems to be hard to find in the big apple... 
I found The rooms where very comfortable for New york standards with a very trendy decor....
 
If you book in at the City Club you will not be dissapointed

title: I love the city club
text:
The city club is a great hotel and Front office manager Hugo was tremendously helpful. I recommend the city club to anyone. Ask for Hugo he the best 

Regards,

Michael Clark

title: Best Staff in City.. Any City!
text:
Staff goes above and beyond all expectations. I pride myself on bouncing around from hotel to hotel, discovering new places and people: NO MORE! 

I will never stay elsewhere in the city, Stay here and know each time will be perfect.

Book it now!
- Enjoy

title: Look and feel of the W with service and attention you would get at a B&B
text: I have stayed at the City Club Hotel 4 times now across the past year and my experience every time has me looking forward to going back. I tend to stay at upscale hotels on my own dime (ritz / W / upscale boutique hotels) and when I travel for work, I am limited by expense restraints. Which is how I first ended up finding this place. Since it's not a 'known' chain, I wasn't sure what I was going to find. What I love best about this place: 1) The service - Kelsey at the front desk person has literally been there every time I arrive - which makes this place feel more B&B, less impersonal chain hotel. Pple that work here start with "yes", do what they can to accomodate, and overall really seem to love what they do 2) warm chocoloate chip cookies on your bed at night: I mean, every hotel should do this. Amazing. 3) decor - sleek, mod decor and unique touches (interesting books) make each room slightly different. If you are not from NY, you may say the rooms are small, which some are, but honestly, you aren't spending that much time in the room so it doesn't really matter that much. 4) DB Bistro Moderne downstairs - super good restaurant which is sister to well known super upsacale Daniel, also in NYC. the salmon tartare is to die for. I don't usually write reviews btw. I just really love this place. I am willing to give up starwood points for thsi place, which is saying a LOT.

title: Best trip ever! We'll absolutely be back!
text: The hotel was beautiful. Very modern and tasteful. The staff was unbelievably accommodating and helpful, especially the manager. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was the best it possibly could be. Very prompt service. The room was gorgeous and very comfortable. It's only a minute's walk from Times Square, the perfect location. It was absolutely a hidden gem in the heart of NYC. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to NYC for any reason.

title: Would stay here again!!!
text: We have never stayed at a hotel like this before,the staff is very friendly,pleasant and very helpful.It's a perfect location if you want to stay close to Times Square.

title: 2nd time and just as good!
text: Following our cruise we opted to stay on New York for our 3rd time. We last stayed at the city club in march 2010 and thought it was a great value for money hotel, like a hidden gem! The staff were very helpful indeed with any matter and always had time for a brief chat. Location is superb, you come out of the hotel and turn left straight on to 5th avenue or go right and to Times square, oh and a few doors away the red flame diner!                     If we return to new york it would be the city club every time......

title: Great stay, great location
text: Stayed here with my wife and it was fantastic. It's so well located! We had a room on the top floor with a small balcony. Not much of a view but it was great place for a coffee in the AM before heading out and a glass of wine in the evening before dinner.

title: una pantofola nella grande mela
text: Se venite la prima volta a N.Y. scegliete un altro hotel.Ma se ci tornate e non avete bisogno di eccessivi accudimenti,scegliete sicuri questo.Avrebbe bisogno di una rinfrescata,non è trendy ma è confortevole.Se vi annoiate troppo, attraversate la strada e troverete il glamour del Royalton.Chiedete una camera sulla strada.le laterali sono silenziose,ma vi ispirano la canzone dei pink floid the wall,cioe' nessuna vista.L'hotel ha un ristorante eccellente x colazioni e cene.Controllate le tariffe sui motori di ricerca:potrebbero essere più vantaggiose

title: Outstanding and We'll be back!
text: We were warmly greeted by Hugo Yanes and staff.  They made us feel welcome and made every effort to make our stay superb.  We loved this modern tucked away hot spot of a hotel...great location, comfy beds, super clean and the staff was full of "tourist" tips.  My husband and two young girls will definitely be back and it was well worth the money. Thanks for making our mini vacation fabulous!!

title: Great rates and service!
text: Found hotel on hotels.com. Price was very good, and the hotel mached it when I came in. it was $30 below the normal rate. They then gave us a free upgrade. The room was amazing. Turn down service was included and came with chocolate chip cookies. The staff its very friendly and helpful.

title: Great hotel, recommended
text:
Lovely hotel with great staff.  The room was a very good size and the queen bed huge.  Great shower, very clean and 2 cookies are left for you evening night - nice touch.  The TV is behind the mirror, so took a while for me to find.  
Great central location - would definitely stay there again. 
The adjoining restaurant was convenient - they supplied breakfast, but I had better dinners elsewhere.

title: A+++ from the moment we arrived until we departed...pleasantly surprised!
text:
We found this hotel on an internet search, selected it due to its location near the theater where we were seeing a show the following day, but would definitely stay here again even if we were not seeing a show.  The rooms, and amenities you can see for yourself on the internet, what the site will not tell you is the personal service the staff gives to their guests.

Upon our arrival, we were upgraded, which just set the tone for our entire visit.  We were traveling with Sam, our Shih Tzu and we cannot thank Hugo, the Front Office Manager, enough he went above and beyond to accommodate our needs.  He personally looked after Sam for us as the show was going to get us back  to the hotel later than Sam's schedule.

Our room was well appointed in addition to having interesting architecture, the bed linens and bath towels were luxurious.

title: fantastic
text: lovely little boutique hotel, choc chip cookies at bedtime to die for! great location right in the middle of everything just two blocks up from times square, little bistro across the street serve the best steaks and apple martinis. staff very friendly and helpful rooms small but immaculate we were given free upgrade, stayed 4 nights wished had of stayed longer

title: Convenient, Clean, Courteous, 'Cozy'
text:
I stayed here for a weekend and was definitely glad with the hotel.

Pros:
1) Location
Located conveniently between Times Square (to the West) and 5th Avenue (to the East), as well as to 42nd Subway station, this was an optimal location for all the sightseeing tourists planning to go to NYC, or even shopping maniacs.
You can get to Times Square in 5 minutes, 5th avenue shopping (for the ladies) in 5 minutes, Empire State Building/Macys about 5-10 minute subway ride away.
If you're worried about noise, don't be. The building next door is super quiet, and the street is not a busy street at nights. You won't hear anything from the outside.

2) Clean
Definitely one of the more modern hotels at this price range. The rooms were clean, and the bathrooms well maintained (except for 1 thing, I'll mention in the cons)

3) Courteous staff
The front desk was nice, usually has a door man there to open the door for you in the mornings, will hold luggage for you if you need them to on day of checkout. They also drop off fresh baked chocolate chip cookies around 5-6pm each day!

4) Size
I list this under pros even though I am writing about it being small. Reason being is that you're not going to find a BIG hotel room in this area at this price range.  True, people can whine and complain that the room is small, but try and find a bigger room that has all the other advantages (listed above) at this price range, you can't.

Cons:
1) Clean: Back on the topic, I did notice that the spout in the shower had some black stuff near the holes. Not a dealbreaker, but a little WD40 would do wonders! City Club Hotel staff, read this!

title: small but stylish=great experience
text: tight quarters sure but the style and service of the place was excellent! down feather beds, pillow and comforters, oh my! the biggest flat screen TV ever and the staff's attentiveness was superior: when I set the AC temp too low and froze the coils, within moments they sent up a megawatt air purifier/fan. I really liked how the staff was attentive but not overbearing, they were just great! and I loved the little "party closet" that's stocked with everything a gal would need!

title: Nightmare
text: We notified the hotel that we would be coming in late.  When we arrived we were given the keys to  our room.  We walked into our room and it was the strongest smell I have ever encountered.  I thought is was fresh paint.  We went down to the desk to change rooms and they gave us another key. That room - even though it was labeled as a non smoking room, wreaked of smoke.  It was shockingly bad.We went back down to the desk only to request yet another room they told us that was all they had.  We went back to the room I thought was wet paint.  I took someone from the hotel desk to ask what it was , they said it smelled like brass polish.  We opened the windows that overlooked a nasty ally with trashcans and went out for an hour or so to let the room air out.  It didn't get much better.   Don't know what it was but it made me really sick to my stomach.  The appearance of the room was fine but I think they had 3/4 beds because I am 5'6" and my feet hung off the bed from ankles down.  Not comfortable.  I did have to catch a cab in the evening when it was raining and a fellow hailed be a cab and held an umbrella over my head when I got in.  That was nice.

title: Great value and fantastically friendly staff
text: Although the rooms are tiny (as they all are in NY) they were clean and refurbished. Big choc chip cookies and morning paper at the door were a surprise bonus. Staff were great, always greeted you when you came in and were helpful with advice on lots of things. More friendly and forthcoming than most NY hotel staff.  Good value especially when we got a free upgrade from a petite room.  Central location with several restaurants nearby. No tea/coffee making in room, but that's something all Australians expect in a hotel and you rarely get in NY.

title: Small but cosy hotel
text:
I´ve stayed for 6 days at City Club Hotel, a small but cosy hotel.
It is located just two blocks from the Time Square, near some cafes where you can have your breakfast or you can choose to have your own breakfast at Restaurant at the hotel.
I chose the Petit Room on the higher floor. The room is small, but it has a small balcony and the bathroom decoration is pretty nice. Amenities from CO Bigelow and free Dean & Delluca´s cookies every night. In the morning the newspaper is hanging at your door in a nice canvas bag.
Very Clean and the staff are nice.

title: Fantastic stay, warm service-oriented staff, and gorgeous chic rooms
text: My girlfriends and I stayed at City Club Hotel for a 40th birthday get together, and it was a wonderful experience.  When we arrived there had been a mistake in my reservation (I had cancelled the first day by phone, but made the original reservation online).  They coudln't find me in the system, but the person at the front desk (Lauren) kept trying different things, and eventually she found it. Unfortuately our Double Double room had already be taken by someone else, so Lauren immediately upgraded us to the 2-floor suite.  We didnt' have to ask or push for anything, she just kept working until she found a good solution for us. The rooms were wonderful and quite "homey" in an urban way.  It felt like we had moved to NYC for a few days.  We are planning on staying there again when we go back this summer.

title: Comfortable, convenient, uniformly excellent staff
text:
Stayed here for the first time, over a long weekend, and was most impressed with both the City Club and its staff.  With about 65 rooms, the hotel itself is small and quite intimate; it does show its past as a men's club in the rather dark hallways and elevators, though my room was light and bright. I was lucky enough to be offered an upgrade so my room, which overlooked 45th St, was luxuriously spacious. It was also nicely laid out, comfortably appointed and immaculately clean. The bathroom was large - no tub, but a huge shower. The wireless internet worked very well and the connection was easy to establish. And yes, the chocolate chip cookies were delicious.

Staff, from the manager to the reception staff to the housekeepers, couldn't have been pleasanter or more helpful. I made a number of requests and each was carried out quickly and cheerfully. When I called down on Sunday morning to ask about a Times, one of the desk people was at my door with the paper in literally two minutes.

The only disappointment was the db Bistro. While the food was certainly acceptable, I'd expected more than that given its reputation. Further, the coffee on the db Bistro room service breakfast, while hot, tasted as if it had been made much earlier in the morning and held over. But the hotel itself was terrific, and it immediately catapulted to  #1 on my fairly extensive list of favored NYC hotels.

title: All in all, average.
text:
I stayed here for one night in April 2011 for a business trip.  I really do like boutique hotels when done right.  However, sometimes there are little flaws and quirks that can ruin a boutique hotel experience.  All in all I would say my stay at City Club was okay.

Pros: (1) The modern decor was refreshing compared to some other sterile hotels; (2) great location - on a no-so busy street but close enough so that I could get everywhere that I was going very quickly; (3) very helpful front desk staff - I had them store my luggage and get it out twice and while they were a little disorganized, they were very accommodating; (4) very comfy beds; (5) delicious room service breakfast; (6) on that note, great restaurant, DB Bistro, attached to the hotel - really good food and great service; (7) turn down service with chocolate chip cookies!; (8) free internet.

Cons: (1) Tiniest room ever!  I mean, it is New York, so I wasn't shocked or disappointed.  I just found it comically small.  Pretty much just enough room for a bed and that was it; (2) on that note, no space to put my luggage.  Like I said before, I didn't really mind the smallness of the room, especially given that I was only staying one night, but there was literally no room to put my suitcase anywhere.  I ended up setting it on top of the air conditioner/windowsill.  This wouldn't fly if it had been hot and I'd needed the AC.  They should really figure out a way to incorporate a luggage rack or something; (3) window that opens to the wall of the next building - why even bother having a window?  Next time I would definitely request a street-facing room and just live with the noise; (4) my room had ants on the floor.  Gross; (5) why have a bidet in such a small room?  What is the point of having THAT when you have so little space for anything else?  Remove that and put a luggage rack in the bathroom; (6) show curtain that did little to prevent water from going onto the floor.
